Policy: Theft of Utilities Services Act of 2006 (P.L. 15-74).
Policy_Content: This Act makes the theft of utility services an offence so as to protect the interests of Commonwealth Utilities Corporation and its duly licensed private contractors. “Utility service” includes the provision of electrical, sewer and water services. Penalties are prescribed for offences as defined in this Act. The Act also grants the power to the Commonwealth Utilities Corporation to establish a system of reward for persons who provide information on the theft of utilities services.
Subject: Energy, Water
Geographical_area: Micronesia, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 1.027/2007 - Reglamento de instalaciones térmicas en los edificios.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto aprueba el Reglamento de instalaciones térmicas en los edificios (RITE), tiene por objeto establecer las exigencias de eficiencia energética y seguridad que deben cumplir las instalaciones térmicas en los edificios destinadas a atender la demanda de bienestar e higiene de las personas, durante su diseño, ejecución, mantenimiento y uso, así como determinar los procedimientos que permitan acreditar su cumplimiento.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Environmental standards,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,EIA,Climate change,Certification,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Authorization/permit
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe

Policy: Order No. 190 validating the Regulation on forest information issued to the persons concerned, and the conditions of issuance of information.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the following types of forest-related information to be issued in a mandatory manner to the persons concerned: (a) information on forested land and forest fund land; (b) information on forest districts, recreational forest, forest plots and forest inventory apportionment; (c) information on protection forests, and categories thereof, commercial forest and reserve forest; (d) information on protected forest areas; (e) information on forest plots under lease; (f) information on quantitative, qualitative and economic characteristics of forests; and (g) information on the authorized forest uses. Access to information shall be granted in the form of issuance of extracts form state forest register.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Act No. 26 amending Regional Act No. 6 of 2001 on the production, breeding, experimentation and marketing of genetically modified organisms (GMOs).
Policy_Content: This Regional Act lays down certain amendments and addenda to Regional Act No. 6 of 2001 in matter of genetically modified organisms. Firstly, it replaces article 1 (which defines the objectives of the Act) and refers to the application of the precautionary principle in the field of genetic resources. Secondly, it amends article 2 by authorizing the use of genetically modified organisms for experimentation purposes, under certain conditions. Further amendments concern surveillance and monitoring.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Regional Act entered into force on 26 July 2007.

Policy: Order No. 189 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on reporting and recording documented information in the state forest register.
Policy_Content: This Order sets out the requirements for recording documented information into the state forest register. Documented information on forests shall be submitted in a mandatory manner free of charge by: (a) persons carrying out forest management, protection, conservation and reproduction in the form of reports; and (b) state forest management agencies.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Electrical Safety Act.
Policy_Content: With the aim of preventing and reducing hazards of electrical origin and electromagnetic disturbances to persons, property and the environment, this Act provides requirements for: (a) electrical equipment and installations, for the placing on the market, putting into service and the use thereof, and for the procedure for the conformity assessment and attestation thereof; (b) owners of electrical installations, notified bodies, electrical contractors, technical inspection bodies, bodies operating certification of persons, persons organizing the operation of electrical installations and managers of electrical work; (c) the registration of undertakings, and for state supervision. Electrical equipment shall be planned, designed, manufactured and reconstructed, and tested, repaired and maintained such that, if installed in conformity with the requirements and used for its intended purposes and in the prescribed manner, the equipment does not present a danger to persons, domestic animals, property or the environment and does not cause any intolerable electromagnetic disturbances and has immunity to electromagnetic disturbances.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 20 July 2007.

Policy: Regulation on Conditions for the Authorized Laboratory for Quality Testing of Fertilizers and Soil Improvers.
Policy_Content: This Regulation provides for the conditions to be met by the laboratories conducting tests on the quality of fertilizers and soil improvers and other tests, in terms of premises, technical equipment and professional staff training, accreditation procedures and the conditions and manner of determining the reference laboratory as well as control over the work of the laboratory.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force eight days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Regulation on the conditions that must be met by laboratories accredited for testing the quality of fertilizers and soil improvers.
Policy_Content: This Regulation provides all necessary standards and conditions which must be met by accredited laboratories for conducting the tests on the quality of fertilizers and soil enhancers and other tests, in terms of premises, technical equipment and professional training, the process of authorization and the conditions and manner of determining the reference laboratories as well as control over the work of the laboratory.
Subject: Land & soil, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force eight days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Regional Law No. 187-OZ “On municipal land-use planning”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of land-use planning of municipal units, the modalities of elaboration and composition of the required documentation. Municipal land-use planning scheme shall include: (a) general map; (b) maps (schemes) of functional areas; (c) mapping of the boundaries of territory and landmarks; (d) scheme of restricted use land areas; and (e) scheme of infrastructure. Boundaries of different land areas (precious agricultural land, forested areas of the first category, protected areas, recreational areas, surface waterbodies and waste disposal and waste processing sites) shall also be mapped.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 200-OZ “On concession of subsoil plots containing widespread minerals for mining”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that subsoil plots can be conceded for the following purposes: (a) mining; (b) exploration of mineral deposits; and (c) for construction of underground works. All the aforesaid activities shall require issuance of licence. In case of combination of the three activities a single general licence can be issued. The aforesaid licence can be issued upon prior consent expressed by the authorized state land institution. The applicant shall submit to the authorized state institution the following documentation: (a) application; (b) copy of state registration certificate (for legal persons and individual entrepreneurs); (c) certificate of indebtedness/absence of indebtedness issued by tax inspection; (d) data certifying financial availability of applicant; (e) prior informed consent by land institution or landowner; and (f) conclusion of state environmental audit.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 145-OZ ““On modalities of procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest resources, edible forest resources and medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens carrying out procurement and harvesting of of non-timber forest resources, edible forest resources and medicinal plants must comply with the following requirements: (a) use methods and technologies preventing exhaustion of available resources; (b) prevent environmental damages; (c) observe forest fire prevention rules; (d) observe forest sanitary requirements; and (e) observe forest regulations. Felling of fruit trees for collection of fruits shall be prohibited. Procurement of birch juice shall be authorized from trees subject to felling in the current year. Extraction of stumps shall be authorized in all types of forests except for protection forests, water conservation areas and young stand.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Forestry
Keyword: Fruits/edible nuts,Forest species,Non-timber products,Protection forest,Forest fires,Protection of species,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Implementation Measures of Shenzhen Special Economic Zone on the Exhaust Pollution Tests and Compulsory Maintenance of Motor Vehicles Currently in Use.
Policy_Content: These Measures are enacted in order to prevent and control the exhaust pollution of motor vehicles currently in use and protect and improve the atmospheric environment.  The Measures contain 46 Articles divided into 5 Chapters: General Provisions; Exhaust Pollution Tests and Compulsory Maintenance; Supervision and Management; Legal Liabilities; Supplementary Provisions.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decreto Nº 490 - Adscribe el Instituto Nacional de Estadísticas y Censos (INEC) a la Secretaría Nacional de Planificación y Desarrollo (SENPLADES).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto dispone que se adscriba el Instituto Nacional de Estadísticas y Censos (INEC), una entidad de derecho público creada mediante la Ley de Estadística de 1976, a la Secretaría Nacional de Planificación y Desarrollo (SENPLADES).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Royal Kram No. 0707-020 Law on Amendment of Article 139 and Article 144 of Labour Law.
Policy_Content: This Law  amends the Article 139 and the Article 144 of Labour Law  promulgated by Royal Kram CS/RKM/0397/01 dated 13 March 1997.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Least Developed Countries, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Resolución Nº 66 - Regulación de precios de suministro de GLP de comercializadores mayoristas a distribuidores.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución establece la metodología para la regulación de los precios de suministro de gas licuado de petróleo (GLP) de comercializadores mayoristas a distribuidores con destino al servicio público domiciliario.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Disposición Nº 119/07 - Modificación del Sistema Federal de Fiscalización de Agroquímicos y Biológicos.
Policy_Content: La presente Disposición modifica la Resolución Nº 500 de 2003, en el sentido de reemplazar el anexo. Las enmiendas se proponen optimizar los recursos del Sistema Federal de Fiscalización de Agroquímicos y Biológicos, evitando la superposición de acciones de las autoridades competentes provinciales y municipales. El Servicio Nacional de Sanidad y Calidad Agroalimentaria (SENASA) es la autoridad responsable de verificar y fiscalizar productos y empresas, coordinando las acciones con los gobiernos provinciales, así como de efectuar la vigilancia, monitorear y certificar las actividades.
Subject: Environment gen., Cultivated plants, Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Order declaring the Knuckles Environmental Protection Area.
Policy_Content: This Order declares that the limits of area of land described in Schedule I shall be an environmental protection area for the purposes of the National Environmental Act, 1980.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, South Asian Seas, Southern Asia

Policy: European Communities (Good Agricultural Practice for Protection of Waters) (Amendment) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 526 of 2007).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the European Communities (Good Agricultural Practice for Protection of Waters) Regulations 2006 by providing for increased penalties and for prosecution on indictment of offences.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Legislative Decree No. 2/2007 regulating land use.
Policy_Content: This Legislative Decree, consisting of 92 articles divided into seven Titles, establishes the land use requirements. It defines principles and rules related to land use of both public and private bodies. Land is considered to have a socio-economic and ecological function and therefore it must be used in a sustainable manner. The Decree rules on public and private domain and provides land classification. Particular attention is paid to regulate land sale, rent and concession. State and Local Authorities should pursue a policy of land use, in accordance with the objectives and principles constitutionally established and in accordance with international standards of the legislation of Cape Verde. The Decree establishes sanctions to any activity undermining the sustainable use of land. In addition, the Legislative Decree provides for a land registration.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Atlantic Ocean Islands, North Atlantic, Sahel, Small Island Developing States, Western Africa
Entry into force notes: This Legislative Decree enters into force 90 days after its publication.

Policy: Resolución Nº 1.021 - Procedimiento para otorgar licencias de construcción y explotación de plantas de generación de energía eléctrica.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba las normas y el procedimiento para otorgar licencias de construcción y explotación de plantas de generación de energía eléctrica, distintas de las hidroeléctricas y geotermoeléctricas.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Consumers, Estate Agents and Redress Act 2007  (Chapter 17).
Policy_Content: This Act creates a National Consumer Council to replace the existing consumer protection bodies and in general makes provision for the protection of customers in relation to utility supply and other specified contracts. The Act also contains a power to dissolve the Consumer Council for Water and transfer its functions to the Council established by the Act.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Land & soil, Water
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Act shall come into force on such day as may be appointed by order of the Secretary of State, except sections 60 to 62, 65 and 67 which come into force on the day this Act is passed.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 147 amending Decree No. 19 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on supervision and control over use, protection, exploration and management of subsoil and mineral resources.
Policy_Content: Item 8 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Compliance with licensing terms and conditions related to subsoil management and in case of concession of the plots of subsoil on condition of product sharing – in accordance with contracts on product sharing”.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Ley Nº 600-2007 : Reconoce la preexistencia étnica y cultural de todas las Comunidades Originarias que han habitado y habitan el territorio de la provincia de San Luis.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley reconoce la preexistencia étnica y cultural de todas las comunidades originarias que han habitado y habitan el territorio de la provincia de San Luis. En este marco, se dispone restituir a las comunidades que originariamente habitaron la Provincia de San Luis las tierras que históricamente les han pertenecido en tanto las mismas pertenezcan al dominio del Estado Provincial. Dichas tierras pertenecerán a perpetuidad a la comunidad a la que se le hayan restituido, y no serán enajenables, ni transmisibles por ningún concepto, ni objeto de arrendamiento, ni susceptibles de embargos.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Common property,Indigenous peoples,Land tenure,Property rights,Public land,Transfer
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Law No. 9786 of 2007 amending and supplementing Law No. 9482 of 2006 on legalization, urbanization and integration of unlawful constructions.
Policy_Content: This Law amends and supplements articles 27, 32, and 41 of Law No. 9482 of 2006 regarding the procedures and documentation required for the legalization of unlawful constructions.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Law enters onto force 15 days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Regulation on the price of natural gas for suppliers of the gas to the tariff customers.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the official gas tariffs for big suppliers (related to the year 2008) intended for further natural gas supply for the Croatian population, including the specifications related to the minimum quality of the natural gas.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force on the day of its adoption.

Policy: Regulation on the manner and procedure of providing access to information related to the environment.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, based on the provisions Macedonian Law on environment, prescribes the manner and procedure of providing access to information related to the environment. The right of access to environmental information belongs to all applicants in the same way and under equal conditions and they are equal in their realization. Entities in order to provide easier access to related information shall: maintain registers or records of environmental information; establish and maintain capacities for searching the requested information with computer assistance; determine information places - points for reviewing information with indications of where such information can be found; gradually ensure that information is available in electronic databases for enabling access to information through telecommunication networks; regularly update environmental information.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This text enters into force on the day after its publication in the Official Gazette (published on 26 July 2007).

Policy: Saxony Expropriation Law.
Policy_Content: The present Law is applicable to expropriation of general property proceedings and related compensation payments in so far as the federal legislation is not applicable. According to the present Law expropriation is authorized only for the purpose of carrying out projects aiming at creating or modifying facilities or institutes for the well-being of the community, such as: a) facilities for sport, health care and other social purposes; b) burial services and undertakers; c) schools, universities and other cultural institutes, as wells as science and research; d) facilities for supply of commodities or waste disposal; e) facilities for the protection of the environment; f) facilities for the maintenance of public security; g) facilities for public and private transport; and h) pipelines conveying unrefined oil or gas in large quantities, or any other hazardous substance. The text consists of 7 articles as follows: Sphere of application (1); Purposes of expropriation (2); Subject matter and authorization  of expropriation (3); Compensation and restitution proceedings (4); Expropriation proceedings (5); Application of the Construction Code ; (6)  Penalties (7).
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Basic legislation,Expropriation,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Liability/compensation,Authorization/permit,Court/tribunal,Land reform,Land tenure,Land valuation,Transfer
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución modifica la que dicta disposiciones para regular el procesamiento de residuos y descartes de especies hidrobiológicas generados por la actividad de procesamiento industrial pesquero orientado al consumo humano directo, en relación al límite máximo de capacidad de instalación por zona.

Policy: Malaysian Biofuel Industry Act, 2007 (Act No. 666).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for activities relating to the mandatory use of biofuel and licensing of activities relating to production, storage and trade and prescribes the type of biofuel and its percentage by volume to be blended in any fuel.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Order No. 221 of the Federal Supervision Service in the sphere of Nature Management validating Recommendations on land tenure within the boundaries of national parks.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that economic activity on land within the boundaries of national parks without expropriation shall not contradict scope and basic objectives of national park. Land management regime shall take into consideration the interests of the population living on the territory of national park. Recultivation of land within the boundaries of national parks shall envisage: (a) afforestation and reforestation; (b) creation of agricultural land; (c) creation of waterbodies to be used for fire prevention, public living needs, recreation, fish farming and fishing; and (d) creation of wetlands for conservation of biological diversity.
Subject: Forestry, Land & soil
Keyword: National parks,Afforestation/reforestation,Forest management/forest conservation,Protected area,Land tenure,Expropriation,Agricultural land
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Additional guidelines on specific emissions are set out in Annexes from II to XI.

Policy: Law No. 19/2007 on Land Use Planning.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 6 Chapters, aims at regulating the territorial planning of Mozambique, in order to guarantee the organization and sustainable use of the environment. It creates a legal framework for territorial planning and materializes, through territorial planning instruments, the Territorial Planning Policy aimed at the rational and sustainable use of natural resources, the preservation of environmental balance, the promotion of national cohesion, valuing the different potentials of each region, promoting the quality of life of citizens, balancing the quality of life in rural and urban areas, improving housing conditions, infrastructure and urban systems and the security of populations vulnerable to disasters. It establishes regulations for the following sectors: General provisions (Chap. I), Territorial Management System (Chap. II), Territorial Planning Tools (Chap. III), Citizen Rights and Obligations (Chap. IV), Evaluation, Monitoring and Inspections (Chap. V).
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Keyword: Land-use planning,Land tenure,Public land,Right of use

Un décret pris en Conseil des Ministres fixe l’organisation et les modalités de fonctionnement des Centres d’Apprentissage Agricole.

Policy: Regional Act No. 22 promoting the use of compostable wastes and soil conditioners to protect soil quality.
Policy_Content: With a view to improving soil quality and preventing desertification, this Regional Act encourages the use of compostable wastes and soil conditioners. To this end, the regional authority grants subsidies for (i) the purchase of compostable wastes and soil conditioners and (ii) the implementation of techniques aimed at the conservation of organic compounds. The Act defines the conditions under which farmers may benefit from those subsidies. Further provisions concern the monitoring of quality of soils in Abruzzo.

Policy: Regional Law No. 50-RZ “On land-use planning”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law sets forth the modalities of urban land-use planning at municipal and regional levels. The scope of this Regional Law shall be consideration of totality of social, economic, ecological and other factors with a view of ensuring sustainable development of territorial land-use planning. Basic land-use planning documentation shall include regional and municipal land-use planning schemes. Regional land-use planning schemes shall include mapping of territorial development plan.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil

Policy: Ley Nº 176-07 - Ley del Distrito Nacional y los Municipios.
Policy_Content: La presente ley tiene por objeto, normar la organización, competencia, funciones y recursos de los ayuntamientos de los municipios y del Distrito Nacional, asegurandoles que puedan ejercer, dentro del marco de la autonomia que los caracteriza, las competencias, atribuciones y los servicios que les son inherentes; promover el desarrollo y la integraciὀn de su territorio, el mejoramiento sociocultural de sus habitantes y la participaciὀn efectiva de las comunidades en el manejo de los asuntos publicos locales, a los fines de obtener como resultado mejorar la calidad de vida, preservando el medio ambiente, los patrimonios histὀricos y culturales, así como la protecciὀn de los espacios de dominio publico. El ayuntamiento constituye la entidad politica administrativa basica del Estado dominicano, que se encuentra asentada en un territorio determinado que le es propio. Como tal es una persona jurídica descentralizada, que goza de autonomía politica, fiscal, administrativa y funcional, gestora de los intereses propios de la colectividad local, con patrimonio propio y con capacidad para realizar todos los actos jurídicos que fueren necesarios y utiles para garantizar el desarrollo sostenible de sus habitantes y el cumplimiento de sus fines en la forma y con las condiciones que la Constituciὀn y las leyes lo determinen.
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Land tenure,Ownership,Cadastre/land registration,Local government,Community management,Public participation,Standards,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Water supply
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States
Entry into force notes: Esta ley entrará en vigor el 16 de agosto de 2007.

Policy: Order No. 182 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating model form of regional forest management plan.
Policy_Content: This Order validates model form of regional forest management plan that contains information on the state of forests and change thereof, purposeful uses of forests by forestries and forest parks, classification of forest crop areas, including: (a) quantitative and qualitative assessment of state of forests for the previous five-year period; (b) forest indices related to forests located on forest land and other categories of land, and also distribution of forest areas in accordance with Annex 1; (c) analysis of forest composition in accordance with the purposeful use thereof, aesthetic and ecological value of landscape; (d) structure of forest species in accordance with timber species and age groups of trees; (e) forest species and age structure thereof in accordance with distribution among forestries and forest parks; (f) indices of exploitable forest; (g) characteristics of forests located on the territory of protected areas; and (h) information on protection and conservation of environment and biological diversity in the forests.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 184 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on timber extraction.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of timber extraction by citizens and legal persons in accordance with lease contracts, regional forest management plans, forestry regulations and timber extraction project on forest plot allotted on lease. Timber extraction without allotment of forest plot shall be carried out by citizens and legal persons in accordance with purchase and sale contract of standing timber, regional forest management plans and forestry regulations. The following types of felling shall be authorized for the purpose of timber extraction: (a) mature and overmature forest; (b) medium age forest, ripening forest, mature and overmature forest in case of felling of damaged forest species (sanitary felling) and intermediate felling; and (c) felling of forest species of any age on forest plots destined for construction, reconstruction and operation forest fire prevention facilities.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 185 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on care of forests.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that care of forests shall be carried out with a view of raising forest productivity and conservation of useful properties of forests by means of selective felling of trees and shrubbery, carrying out agro-forestry and other arrangements. Care of forests shall be carried out by shall be carried out by the authorized persons managing forests in accordance with forest management project, by the regional executive bodies and local self-government within their competence. In the process of care of forests shall be authorized intermediate felling of forest trees of all age groups for the purpose of improvement of forest species composition and quality of forests, rendering them more resistant to negative impact and improvement of ecological functions of forests. Agro-forestry arrangements shall consist in afforestation and creation of protection forests.  Other arrangements shall include regeneration felling, brashing, forest fertilization and removal of unfavourable woody plantations. The purposes of intermediate felling shall be: (a) qualitative improvement of forest species composition; (b) improvement of resistance of forest species; (c) conservation and reinforcement of protective functions of forests; (d) reduction of growing age of mature timber; and (e) rational use of timber.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 183 validating the Regulation on reforestation.
Policy_Content: This Order stipulates that reforestation shall be carried out for the purpose of renewing cut, destroyed and damaged forests and forest plantations, and of conserving the biological diversity and beneficial functions of forests. Such reforestation shall employ natural, artificial and combined methods. Natural reforestation shall be carried out by means of conservation of re-growth of forest tree species, soil mineralization and fencing. Artificial reforestation shall entail the planting of nurslings, seedlings, budwood and seeds. Combined reforestation shall use both natural and artificial reforestation means. Reforestation shall be carried out by leaseholders of forest plots and by state and municipal agencies for all other types of forests.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ley N° 3.232/07 - Ley de asistencia crediticia a las comunidades indígenas.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto la promoción del acceso de los pueblos y comunidades indígenas a programas de crédito y de desarrollo integrado, que les permita lograr la seguridad alimentaria, la promoción económica, social, cultural, el acceso a la salud y a la educación. El Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganadería, a través del Crédito Agrícola de Habilitación, será responsible de garantizar a las comunidades indígenas interesadas y con capacidad de pago, a definirse, el financiamiento de proyectos económicos productivos para el fomento de las actividades agropecuarias o de otra índole
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Subsidy/incentive,Agricultural development,Community management,Indigenous peoples,Food security,Right to food,Human rights
Geographical_area: Americas, Landlocked Developing Countries, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America

Policy: Order No. 181 validating the Regulation on particulars of management, protection, conservation of forests and reforestation in protected areas.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that forests located on the territory of protected areas shall be classified as protection forests. The aforesaid forests shall be managed in accordance with protection regime and purposeful use of land as established by the related legislation. The activities incompatible with purposeful use and useful properties of forests. In the forests located on the territory of protected areas shall be authorized main felling exclusively if select felling does not ensure substitution of forest species. Main felling shall be prohibited on the territory of national parks, biosphere reserves and other natural reserves if not otherwise envisaged by the legal regime of protected areas. Forest clearing in protected areas shall be carried out in accordance with the regulatory provisions related to protected areas. Reforestation in protected areas shall be carried out in the areas destroyed by forest fires, pests and pathogens and subsequently subject to main felling.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Protected area,Forest management/forest conservation,Forestry protection measures,Afforestation/reforestation,Protection forest,Classification/declassification
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 93 - Modifica el Acuerdo Nº 69, sobre comercialización de gas licuado de petróleo (GLP) a través de instalaciones centralizadas.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo concede un plazo de 90 días a fin de que los usuarios finales puedan adquirir a precio industrial cilindros de 15 kg con válvula industrial y pintados con un distintivo particular en el cuerpo del cilindro (franja de color negro), para viabilizar el uso inmediato de GLP por parte de los consumidores industriales y comerciales hasta que dichos usuarios puedan abastecerse con cilindros de 45 kg o habiliten instalaciones o sistemas centralizados para el consumo del producto.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Decree No. 59/07 on Environmental Licensing.
Policy_Content: This Decree, composed of five Chapters divided into 34 articles and two Annexes, regulates environmental licensing of all activities that, because of their nature, location or size, may have a significant environmental and social impact. Particular attention is paid to the regulation of the licensing procedure and of the rights and duties of the licensees. Moreover, the Decree establishes a national registry of environmental consultants to support in the licensing process. The Annexes provide the license models for both operations and installations.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force 90 days after its publication.

Policy: Soil and Groundwater Promotion Guidelines.
Policy_Content: The Free State of Saxony shall grant subsidies for the promotion of: 1) protection and closure of landfills and rehabilitation of soil and groundwater with a view to improve the environment; 2) rehabilitation of polluted areas and re-development of land. The text consists of 9 articles.
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Subsidy/incentive,Soil pollution/quality,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil rehabilitation,Enforcement/compliance,Pollution control,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Groundwater

Policy: Decree No. 58/07 approving the General Regulation for Land Concession.
Policy_Content: This Decree approves the General Regulation for Land Concession. This Regulation, consisting of 10 Chapters, specifies the general basis of the legal regime defined by Law No. 9/04. It establishes the legal framework for the concession of free lands within the Republic of Angola. It does not apply for private property lands, which will be regulated by the Civil Code. This Regulation aims at: defining the process of concession, recognition, transmission, usufruct and the end of rights on such lands. Article 15 establishes that community rural land covers complementary areas for shifting-cultivation, transhumance corridors for access of livestock to water sources, pastures and crossings, used to access water or roads to urban agglomerations. It also aims at guaranteeing the necessary information to the legal facts which determine the creation, recognition, acquisition or amendment of such land rights. The Regulation is divided as follows: General provisions (Chap. I); Lands in general (Chap. II); Land reserves (Chap. III); Land conditions (Chap. IV); Land markings (Chap. V); Land concession process (Chap. VI); Substitution in the Concession process and right transmission (Chap. VII); Terms and conditions for concession (Chap. VIII); Cadastre, register and implementing organs for mediation and negotiation (Chap. IX); Final provisions (Chap. X).
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Concession,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Right of use,Land reform,Land tenure,Registration,Cadastre/land registration,Pastoralism,Range,Servitude,Traditional rights/customary rights
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic

Policy: Regional Law No. 105-OZ “On objects of cultural heritage”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of conservation, protection and promotion of the objects of cultural heritage of regional significance. Regional Government shall carry out the following plenary powers in the sphere of protection of the objects of cultural heritage: (a) implementation of state policy; (b) validation of the list of objects of cultural heritage pertaining to public property and not subject to expropriation; and (c) validation of the boundaries of areas containing objects of cultural heritage. Objects of cultural heritage shall be subject to constant state monitoring.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Loi n° 2007/003 du 13 juillet 2007 instituant le service  civique national de participation au développement.
Policy_Content: La présente loi institue le service civique national de participation au développement dont le but est de contribuer à la mobilisation des énergies pour répondre aux impératifs du développement économique et social du pays.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Loi n° 2007/004 du 13 juillet 2007 régissant l’artisanat au Cameroun.
Policy_Content: La présente loi régit l’artisanat (artisanat d’art; artisanat de production; artisanat de service). En effet, l’artisanat est constitué de l’ensemble des activités d’extraction, de production, de transformation, d’entretien, de réparation ou de prestation de service essentiellement manuelles et exercées à titre principal. Les métiers du secteur de l’artisanat d’art se caractérisent par la fabrication et la commercialisation d’objets ayant essentiellement une valeur esthétique et culturelle, et révélant une bonne utilisation des ressources naturelles ainsi qu’un raffinement dans la présentation des formes et de l’expression de la beauté. Ce texte prévoit les règles de création, d’organisation et de fonctionnement de l’artisanat et de l’entreprise artisanale; des services aux artisans et aux entreprises artisanales.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Forestry
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic

Policy: Resolución Nº 459/07 - Crea el Programa de Energía Total.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución tiene por objeto la creación del Programa de Energía Total, cuyo objetivo consiste en incentivar la sustitución del consumo de gas natural y la energía eléctrica por el uso de combustibles alternativos para las diferentes actividades productivas y la autogeneración eléctrica. El Programa se aplicará a todas aquellas empresas que utilicen gas natural y energía eléctrica por red como insumo necesario para la actividad que desarrollan, y se encuentren interesadas en participar del plan de sustitución.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy_Content: This Decree of the Ministry of Environment establishes a target value for the concentration of arsenic, cadmium, nickel and benzo(a)pyrene in ambient air. The objective of this Decree is to prevent or reduce harmful effects of specified substances on human health and the environment. It determines also methods and criteria for the assessment of concentrations of pollutants in ambient air, originally specified in Annex 6 of the amended Decree.

Policy: Regional Law No. N 104/2007-ОЗ “On forest management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates forest management for hunting purposes, procurement of non-timber (edible and non-edible) forest resources, collection of medicinal plants and exceptional cases of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs. Allotment of forest parcels for hunting management shall be regulated by lease contracts concluded by citizens and legal persons with public administration in accordance the outcome of tenders. Citizens shall be granted the right of free stay in forests for procurement non-timber forest products for individual personal needs. Timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs shall be authorized for heating, housing construction and repairs of residential facilities.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force the day after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 333-64 “On protection of the objects of cultural heritage”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of management, conservation and state protection of the objects of cultural heritage. Regional Government shall be responsible for the protection of the objects of cultural heritage of regional, local (municipal) and federal significance located on the regional territory. It shall establish boundaries of the areas of location of the objects of cultural heritage and shall compensate expenditure of natural and legal persons for conservation and maintenance of the objects of cultural heritage to the owners of the objects of cultural heritage. All the objects of cultural heritage shall be subject to state registration.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Heather and Grass etc. Burning (England) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 2003 of 2007).
Policy_Content: These Regulations concern the control of the burning of heather, rough grass, bracken, gorse and vaccinium. The Regulations prohibit burners from starting burns between sunset and sunrise, and require them to ensure that there are sufficient persons and equipment to control burns and to take all reasonable precautions to prevent injury or damage arising from burns. The Regulations also prohibit burning without a licence outside the “burning season”.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Law of Georgia on Recognition of Property Rights of the Parcels of Land Possessed (Used) by Natural Persons and Legal Entities under Private Law (No. 5274-RS of 2007)
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law is, by recognising the property rights, to use state-owned land resources in lawful possession (use), as well as state-owned land squatted by natural persons, legal entities under private law, or any other organisational structures provided for by law, and to facilitate land market development. This Law determines basic terms and conditions of recognition of property rights to lawfully possessed (used), as well as squatted land and the scope of authority of the bodies which represent the state in the process of recognition of the property rights. In a case, when a competent state body has alienated only a significant component part of a parcel of land and, based on the requirements of this Law, the property right to the parcel of land cannot be recognised, a property manager provided for by the Law of Georgia on the State Property, shall determine the parcel of land with the property right on the significant component part of a parcel of land. The property right to the following squatted state-owned agricultural or non-agricultural lands shall not be subject to recognition: stock routes; land of the state water fund, except for parcels of land, ownership to which may be transferred and which may be used according to the requirements of the Law of Georgia on Water; land of state industrial forest fund, except for parcels of land sqautted by natural persons or legal entities under private law or any other organizational structure provided for by law and ownership to which may be transferred based on the conclusion of a body authorised to manage the state forest fund and which may be excluded from the state forest fund without disturbing the management and protection of the state forest fund; protected areas (territories), except for protected landscapes and multiple use areas (territories); recreational parks, woodland parks, public gardens and other areas, except for areas having the status of resorts of Georgia, resort places, alpine skiing centres, and a Recreation Area of the Black Sea Coast determined by ordinance of the Government of Georgia; historical, cultural, natural and religious monuments; parcels of land of public use (squares, streets, passages, roads, pavements, embankment), recreational places (parks, woodland parks, public gardens, allées), dendrological parks and botanical gardens; lands where a water reservoir, a hydro technical structure, and sanitary protection zones of these facilities are located; special purpose parcels of land (intended for defence and defence mobilisation); parcels of land occupied by state-owned facilities, including parcels of land with state property not subject to privatisation, according to the Law of Georgia on State Property; cemeteries and pantheons; sanitary and protection zones; and lands intended for construction and operation of oil and gas main pipelines and associated underground and aboveground facilities.
Subject: Livestock, Forestry, Land & soil, Mineral resources, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Recreational forest,Private forest,Public forest,Land tenure,Ownership,Public land,Private land,Urban land,Prescription/adverse possession,Property rights,Land reform,Survey/mapping,Common property,Grazing,Oil,Surface water,Recreational water use,Water rights,Waterworks,Water conservation zone,Protected area,Cultural heritage
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy: Regulation on the Supervision and Management of Civil Nuclear Safety Equipment.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Regulation is to strengthen the supervision and management of civil nuclear safety equipment, guarantee the safe operation of civil nuclear facilities, prevent nuclear accidents, protect the health of working staff and the general public, protect the environment, and promote the smooth development of the nuclear power. The Text consists of 62 Articles divided into 8 Chapters: General Provisions (I); Standards (II); Licenses (III); Design, Manufacturing, Installation and Nondestructive Inspection (IV); Import and Export (V); Supervision and Inspection (VI); Legal Labilities (VII); Supplementary Provisions (VIII).

Policy: XIème Plan de Développement 2007-2011.
Policy_Content: Le présent document a pour objet le XIème Plan de Développement 2007-2011, un plan intersectoriel de portée nationale. Le schéma de développement pour la période 2007-2011 vise au développement agricole tout en assurant l’amélioration de la compétitivité du secteur; l’exportation, moteur de la croissance; la protection des ressources naturelles, base fondamentale du développement agricole durable; la sécurité alimentaire, vecteur de souveraineté nationale.

Policy: Air Quality Strategy for England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland (Volume 1).
Policy_Content: This document provides an overview and outline of the UK Government and devolved administrations’ ambient (outdoor) air quality policy. It sets out a way forward for work and planning on air quality issues, details objectives to be achieved, and proposes measures to be considered further to help reach them. The strategy is based on a thorough and detailed analysis of estimating reductions in emissions and concentrations from existing policies and proposed new policy measures, and quantification and valuation of benefits and estimated costs (the analysis is set out in more detail in Volume 2 of the strategy and the updated Third Report by the Interdepartmental Group on Costs and Benefits (IGCB)). It should however be noted that each new policy measure taken forward for further consideration will be subject to the full policy scrutiny process, including formal Impact Assessments. It is not the UK Government and devolved administrations’ intention that the measures assessed in this strategy will receive funding beyond that which has already been or will be provided.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Water

Policy: Land Leases (Amendment) Act, 2007 (No. 5 of 2007).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Land Leases Act [CAP 163] in relation with a premium to be paid by the lessee or the registered proprietor to the lessor prior to the issue of a new lease. This premium shall be based on the full rental value of the unimproved value of the land as determined by the Minister from time to time and the contract rent as agreed to by the lessor and the lessee. The Act also concerns the review of full rental value by the Minister and compensation of a proprietor to a lessor in case of sale of a registered lease.

Policy: Regulation on the environment impact assessment (Environmental Impact Assessment Regulation).
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance enforces the Federal Environmental Impact Assessment Ordinance of 19 October 1988. The environmental impact assessment is aimed at ascertaining whether a project complies with the federal and cantonal provisions. The text – consisting of 8 articles – deals, inter alia, with the following aspects: competent authority, proceedings, valuation of the environmental assessment report, information of the public, repeal and entry into force.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Regulation enters into force on 1 August 2007.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 042-2007-RE ─ Ratifica la medida sobre responsabilidad derivada de emergencias medioambientales en el Antártico.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo ratifica la Medida 1 (2005) Anexo VI del Protocolo al Tratado Antártico sobre Protección del Medio Ambiente: Responsabilidad derivada de emergencias medioambientales, aprobada mediante la Resolución Legislativa Nº 29.055.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea
Keyword: International agreement-implementation,Marine area,Protected area,Biosphere reserves,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Environmental standards,Marine pollution,Fishery management and conservation,Territorial sea
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Decreto Nº 2.629 - Disposiciones para promover el uso de biocombustibles.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto dicta disposiciones para promover el uso de biocombustibles, así como medidas aplicables a los vehículos y demás artefactos a motor que utilicen combustibles para su funcionamiento, promoviendo el cultivo de plantaciones que generen la producción de alcoholes carburantes y biocombustibles para uso en motores diésel.
Subject: Energy, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Fertilizers and Fertilizing Act.
Policy_Content: The present Act is composed of nine Sections. The Sections are: General provisions (sect. 1); Marketing of fertilizers and means supporting cultivation of plants (sect. 2); Application of fertilizers and means supporting cultivation of plants (sect. 3); Transport and storage of fertilizers and means supporting cultivation of plants (sect. 4); Agrochemical service for agriculture (sect. 5); Supervision and control concerning fertilizers, fertilizing and means supporting cultivation of plants (sect. 6); Sanction fees (sect. 7); Penalty fees (sect. 8); Changes in valid provisions, transitional and final provisions (sect. 9). The Act regulates matters concerning: placing on the market of fertilizers excluding matters concerning marketing of fertilizers regulated in the Regulation No. 2003/2003 of the European Parliament and of the Council relating to fertilizers; conditions and methods of marketing means supporting cultivation of plants; tasks of organs and organizational units concerning introduction of fertilizers to trade based on European Union provisions; application of fertilizers and means supporting cultivation of plants; preventing danger for humans, animals and the environment, which may be caused as a result of transport, storage and application of fertilizers and means supporting cultivation of plants; agrochemical service for agriculture.
Subject: Environment gen., Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: The Act enters into force 3 months after publication in the Journal of Laws.

Policy: Regional Law No. 135 “On expropriation of land”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes case of expropriation, including bailout, of public or municipal land, for state or municipal purposes for the following needs: (a) regional or local construction envisaged by land-use planning scheme; (b) conservation and management of the objects of cultural heritage; (c) for security reasons; and (d) for the fulfilment of regional obligations towards Russian Federation.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 871-01-ZMO “On protected areas”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of organization, protection and management of protected areas with a view of conservation of unique and typical ecosystems, genetic fund, study of natural processes in the biosphere and control over changes in the state thereof, and also ecological, historical and cultural education of the population. Regional protected areas shall be classified as follows: (a) state nature reserves; (b) nature monuments; (c) natural parks; and (d) dendrological parks and botanical gardens. Conservation of protected areas shall be based upon the following principles: (a) priority of protection in comparison with management; (b) priority of use of protected areas for research and recreational purposes in comparison with other uses; (c) prohibition of economic activities non-complying with status of protected areas; and (d) involvement of citizens and non-government entities in conservation of protected areas.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy_Content: The text of Article (42) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 122 of 1980 determining the rules and procedures of the internal system of the Assembly concerning the bonuses and rewards for the members of the Board of Directors.

Policy: Regulation on unit charges, corrective coefficients and detailed criteria and standards for determining the fees for emissions of carbon dioxide into the environment.
Policy_Content: This Regulation stipulates the amount of unit charges, corrective coefficients and detailed criteria and standards for determining the fees for emissions of carbon dioxide into the environment (CO2 emissions).
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.

Policy: Règlement sur l’Institut agricole de l’Etat de Fribourg (RIAG).
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement met en exécution, entre autres, la loi du 23 juin 2006 sur l’Institut agricole de l’Etat de Fribourg. Notamment, le présent règlement définit les principes et modalités d’exécution des tâches confiées à l’Institut agricole de l’Etat de Fribourg. Le texte comprend 57 articles répartis en 7 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (1er); Organisation (2); Personnel (3); Exécution des tâches et financement (4); Personnes en formation (5); Voies de droit (6); Dispositions finales (7).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural development,Institution,Financial agricultural measures,Procedural matters,Research,Court/tribunal,Dispute settlement,Enforcement/compliance
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: Le présent règlement entre en vigueur avec effet rétroactif au 1er juillet 2007.

Policy: Regional Law No. 877-01-ZMO “On rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens shall have the right for timber extraction of forest species for individual personal needs in accordance with the following rates: (a) for housing construction – up to 100 cubic metres once in 30 years for an owner of land parcels destined for housing construction; (b) for repairs and reconstruction of housing facilities – up to 20 cubic metres of standing timber once in 5 years; (c) for construction and repairs of fences, sheds etc. – up to 5 cubic metres of wood strips of standing timber once annually per person.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Order No. 174 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on forest pathology monitoring.
Policy_Content: Forest pathology monitoring includes data collection, processing and reporting on the state of forest pathology, including hotbeds of pests and organisms subject to quarantine. Forest pathology monitoring shall be based on the following data: (a) forest management; (b) forest pathology observation; (c) state forest register; (d) hydrometeorological situation; and (e) mapping. Forest monitoring shall be carried out by means of: (a) ground-based observation; (b) distant observation of sanitary and pathological state of forests; (c) forest pathology inventory; and (d) expeditionary inspection.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 175 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the form of reports on forest management, protection, conservation and reproduction and afforestation, and the modalities for their submittal.
Policy_Content: This Order stipulates that reports on forest management, protection, conservation and reproduction, and afforestation shall be submitted by the legal and natural persons that carry out such activities. The reports shall be submitted quarterly to the relevant state institutions and local self-government bodies, and shall contain factual information and data on the forest management activities undertaken.
