Policy: Law No. 9769 of 2007 amending and supplementing Law No. 8977 of 2002 on the tariff system in the Republic of Albania.
Policy_Content: This Law supplements article 10 and amends articles 4, 5 as well as Annex No. 1 of Law 9769 of 2007. The amendment introduces sub-categories of the port tax defined by articles 4/1 while article 5 introduces additional rules of procedure regarding the payment of port taxes. Annex No. 1 ‘The level of port taxes in Republic of Albania’ is replaced with the new Annex.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force 15 days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 129-pa validating the Regulation on state natural biological reserve of regional significance “Unsky”.
Policy_Content: State natural biological reserve of regional significance “Unsky” is formed for the purpose of conservation and reproduction of the valuable fish species (navaga (Eleginus navaga), brook trout (Salmo trutta trutta), Atlantic salmon (Salmo salar)) and maintenance of general ecological balance without expropriation of land plots from owners, tenants and managers thereof. Owners, tenants and managers of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to comply with the regime established in the reserve and bear administrative, criminal and other liability for its violation. Any activity on the territory of the reserve is prohibited if it contradicts the objectives of creating the reserve or causes harm to natural complexes and components, including: (a) entry of all types of transport during a snowless period, with the exception of transport of forestry authorities, ecological officials, law enforcement and life-saving agencies; (b) timber extraction and logging, except for sanitary and selective sanitary felling; (c) hunting for all wild fauna species and birds, ruining nests, holes, hollows, dams and other shelters; (d) stay with hunting gear, hunting dogs, training of hunting dogs; and (e) all types of fisheries with the use of fishing nets for fisheries of salmon the rivers of salmon transit. In the territory of state natural biological reserve of regional significance “Unsky” shall be authorized the following activities: (a) organized tourism; (b) recreational and sport fishing in conformity with acting legislation; (b) industrial fisheries in the coastal area of the White Sea in conformity with acting legislation; and (c) traditional activities (haymaking, grazing, collection of mushrooms and berries).
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries
Keyword: Protected area,Tourism,Fishery management and conservation,Inland fisheries,Marine fisheries,Non-commercial fishing,Fishing gear/fishing method,Stock enhancement/repopulation,Marine fishes,Diadromous fish,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Decree No. 126-pa validating the Regulation on state natural reserve of regional significance “Verkolsky”.
Policy_Content: State natural reserve of regional significance “Verkolsky” is formed for the purpose of conservation of the valuable natural landscape without expropriation of land plots from owners, tenants and managers thereof. Owners, tenants and managers of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to comply with the regime established in the reserve and bear administrative, criminal and other liability for its violation. Any activity on the territory of the reserve is prohibited if it contradicts the objectives of creating the reserve or causes harm to natural complexes and components, including: (a) entry of all types of transport during a snowless period, with the exception of transport of forestry authorities, ecological officials, law enforcement and life-saving agencies; (b) horse-drawn and wheeled transport (with axle load up to 3.5 tons inclusive) of the local population for haymaking, timber extraction and procurement of non-timber forest resources; (c) drainage and land reclamation; and (d) final felling. The following activities shall be authorized on the territory of the reserve: (a) organized tourism; (b) timber extraction of local population by agreement with the administration of the reserve; (c) selective felling; (d) gathering of zoological, botanical and mineralogical collections; (e) scientific research and ecological monitoring; (f) educational activities; (g) traditional activities (haymaking, grazing, collection of mushrooms and berries); (h) hunting in conformity with acting legislation; and (i) recreational and sport fishing in conformity with acting legislation.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Decree No. 127-pa validating the Regulation on state natural landscape reserve of regional significance “Mudyugsky”.
Policy_Content: State natural reserve of regional significance “Mudyugsky” is formed for the purpose of conservation of the valuable natural landscape without expropriation of land plots from owners, tenants and managers thereof. Owners, tenants and managers of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to comply with the regime established in the reserve and bear administrative, criminal and other liability for its violation. Any activity on the territory of the reserve is prohibited if it contradicts the objectives of creating the reserve or causes harm to natural complexes and components, including: (a) entry of all types of transport during a snowless period, with the exception of transport of forestry authorities, ecological officials, law enforcement and life-saving agencies; (b) drainage, land reclamation and mining; (c) timber extraction and logging, except for sanitary and selective sanitary felling; (d) hunting for all wild fauna species and birds, ruining nests, holes, hollows, dams and other shelters; (e) use of pesticides and mineral fertilizers; (f) placement, storage of toxic substances and industrial and domestic waste; and (g) all types of fishing in the coastal zone of Mudyug Island (from the upper high tide boundary to the lower low tide boundary), with the exception of recreational and sport fishing for local residents. The following activities shall be authorized on the territory of state natural reserve: (a) organized tourism; and (b) traditional activities (haymaking, grazing, collection of mushrooms and berries).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Decree No. 130-pa validating the Regulation on state natural landscape reserve of regional significance “Chugsky”.
Policy_Content: State natural reserve of regional significance “Chugsky” is formed for the purpose of conservation of natural landscapes formed on karst rocks, conducting scientific research, stationary study of karst processes and maintaining the overall ecological balance without expropriation of land plots from owners, tenants and managers thereof. Owners, tenants and managers of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to comply with the regime established in the reserve and bear administrative, criminal and other liability for its violation. Any activity on the territory of the reserve is prohibited if it contradicts the objectives of creating the reserve or causes harm to natural complexes and components, including: (a) entry of all types of transport during a snowless period, with the exception of transport of forestry authorities, ecological officials, law enforcement and life-saving agencies; (b) timber extraction and logging, except for sanitary and selective sanitary felling; (c) use of toxic substances and pesticides; (d) allotment of building plots; and (e) drainage, land reclamation and mining. The following activities shall be authorized on the territory of state natural reserve: (a) organized tourism; (b) recreational and sport fishing in conformity with acting legislation; and (c) traditional activities (haymaking, grazing, collection of mushrooms and berries).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Law No. 5.067 creating the Economic Ecological Zoning of the State of Rio de Janeiro and regulating agro-forestry activities.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 5 Chapters, creates the Economic Ecological Zoning of the State of Rio de Janeiro (ZEE/RJ) and regulates agro-forestry activities. ZEE/RJ is an Environmental State Policy Tool, which objectives are to manage plans, programmes, activities and decisions of public and private sectors which are engaged in using natural resources (including silvo-pastoralism activities), in view of the protection of the local ecosystem. It regulates also planning and implementation of public policies and concessions of natural resources use.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 96-ZO “On protected areas”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues related to formation, protection, keeping, functioning and suppression of protected areas, organization and reservation thereof. It classifies protected areas as follows: (a) natural parks; (b) state nature reserves; (c) nature monuments; (d) dendrological parks and botanical gardens; and (e) healthcare resorts, spas and recreational areas. Regulation on protected areas must contain: 9a) name of protected area; (b) location, mapping and boundaries; (c) brief description; (d) data related to organizational and legal form; (e) protection and management modalities; (f) land management; and (g) authorized uses. Validation of the boundaries of protected area shall be the grounds for use restriction or expropriation of land plots.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 218 validating the Regulation on state nature landscape reserve of regional significance “Puchkomsky”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature landscape reserve of regional significance “Puchkomsky” is constituted with a view of conservation and restoration of particularly valuable or typical natural landscapes and parts thereof. The proclamation of the territory reserve shall not entail expropriation of land plots from tenants and owners. All users, owners and owners of land plots are obliged to observe the regime established in the reserve and bear responsibility for its violation administrative, criminal and other liability established by the current legislation. Owners and tenants of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to observe the special protection regime established in the nature reserve. On the territory of nature reserve shall be prohibited any activity contrasting the scope of nature reserve or damaging natural complexes and components, including: (a) entry of all types of motor vehicles outside roads in the snowless period; (b) movement of caterpillar transport during the snowless period outside technological roads except for transport of environmental protection law enforcement bodies and life-saving bodies in the process of fulfilment of their duties; (c) timber extraction and water logging (except for intermediate felling and selective sanitary felling); (d) construction of buildings, facilities, roads and pipelines, power lines and other communications, except for deployment of economic and production facilities related to the activity of natural reserve; (e) application of toxic chemicals and pesticides; and (f) drainage, land reclamation, exploration of subsoil and mining. The following activities shall be authorized on the territory of state nature landscape reserve: (a) organized tourism; (b) deployment of economic and production facilities related to the activity of natural reserve; (c) charged artisanal and industrial fisheries in accordance with permits issued by the competent authority; and (d) traditional activities (haymaking, grazing of cattle, collection of mushrooms and berries).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Décret portant création du Conseil consultatif stratégique pour l'Agriculture et la Pêche (1).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret porte création du Conseil consultatif stratégique pour l'Agriculture et la Pêche. Le Conseil a les missions suivantes: 1) émettre des avis, d'initiative ou sur demande, sur les lignes directrices de la politique concernant tous les aspects économiques, écologiques, sociaux et sociétaux de la politique agricole, horticole, rurale et de la pêche; 2) contribuer à l'élaboration d'une vision politique sur tous les aspects économiques, écologiques, sociaux et sociétaux de la politique agricole, horticole, rurale et de la pêche; 3) suivre et interpréter les développements dans le domaine de tous les aspects économiques, écologiques, sociaux et sociétaux de la politique agricole, horticole, rurale et de la pêche; 4) émettre des avis sur les avant-projets de décret concernant tous les aspects économiques, écologiques, sociaux et sociétaux de la politique agricole, horticole, rurale et de la pêche et les avant-projets de décret d'autres domaines politiques ayant un impact notable sur la politique agricole, horticole, rurale et de la pêche; 5) émettre des avis, d'initiative ou sur demande, sur les propositions de décret concernant tous les aspects économiques, écologiques, sociaux et sociétaux de la politique agricole, horticole, rurale et de la pêche et les propositions de décret concernant des matières relevant d'autres domaines politiques ayant un impact notable sur la politique agricole, horticole, rurale et de la pêche; 6) émettre des avis, d'initiative ou sur demande, sur les projets d'arrêté du Gouvernement flamand concernant tous les aspects économiques, écologiques, sociaux et sociétaux de la politique agricole, horticole, rurale et de la pêche et les projets d'arrêté du Gouvernement flamand concernant des matières relevant d'autres domaines politiques ayant un impact notable sur la politique agricole, horticole, rurale et de la pêche. Le texte comprend 16 articles répartis en 6 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (I); Missions (II); Composition et organisation (III); Transfert (IV); Rapport agricole et de la pêche (V); Dispositions finales (VI).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Décret exécutif nº08-202 complétant le décret exécutif nº 93-186 déterminant les modalités d'application de la loi nº 91-11 fixant les règles relatives à l'expropriation pour cause d'utilité publique.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret exécutif modifie les dispositions de l'article 40 du décret exécutif nº 93-186 déterminant les modalités d'application de la loi nº 91-11 fixant les règles relatives à l'expropriation pour cause d'utilité publique, en ajoutant une disposition relative à la réglementation  concernant les expropriations effectuées dans le cadre d’opérations de réalisation d’infrastructures d’intérêt général et d’envergure nationale et stratégique.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 574 validating the Regulation on licensing land surveys and topographic, geodetic and cartographic activities.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the requirements for licensing land surveys and topographic, geodetic and cartographic activities. Licensing of topography, geodesy and cartography shall be carried out by the central body of the authorized state institution for land resources. Licensing of land surveying shall be carried out by the local self-government branch of the of the authorized state institution for land resources. Licences under this Decree shall be open-ended and non-transferable. Applicants must submit the following documentation: (a) application; (b) notarized copies of the statute and of the state registration certificate (for legal persons); (c) copy of a personal identification document (for natural persons); (d) notarized copy of state registration for individual entrepreneurs; (e) tax inspection registration certificate; (f) receipt of payment of licensing fees; and (g) documentation attesting to the applicant’s qualifications for the licence.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 89 - Delimitación de la sección territorial donde se encuentran las concesiones mineras.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo dicta el instructivo para determinar los lineamientos y criterios de la aplicación de los Acuerdos Nº 61 y 62, ambos de 2007, disponiendo que el responsable del catastro minero establecerá la delimitación de la sección territorial correspondiente a las parroquias rurales y urbanas en donde se encuentren las concesiones mineras otorgadas, para determinar el ámbito territorial de la respectiva Dirección Regional.

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement wallon déterminant les conditions intégrales et sectorielles relatives à la détention de bovins de six mois et plus.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté du Gouvernement wallon détermine les conditions intégrales et sectorielles relatives à la détention de bovins de six mois et plus. La partie initiale contient la définition de certains termes, comme par example, "effluents", "litière", "enclos", "jus d’écoulement", "eaux blanches", "eaux vertes". Le texte comprend 24 articles répartis en 9 chapitres comme suit: Champ d’application et définitions (I); Implantation et construction (II); Exploitation (III); Prévention des accidents et incendies (IV); Eau (V); Air (VI); Gestion des déchets (VII); Contrôle et surveillance (VIII); Dispositions transitoires et finales (IX).

Policy: Decreto Nº 33.889/MINAE - Reglamento para la elaboración de planes de gestión ambiental en el sector público.

Policy: Climate and Energy Fund Act.
Policy_Content: The aim of the present Federal Act is to contribute to the realisation of sustainable energy development and to reduce the CO2 emission. For this purpose the Climate and Energy Fund is established with its headquarters in Vienna. The particular tasks of this Fund is to give financial support to research in sustainable energy technologies and climate conditions; to promote projects in the transportation of persons and in mobility in general; to promote environment and climate-friendly projects. The text consists of 24 articles divided into 4 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Climate and Energy Fund (II); Functions of the Fund (III); Final provisions (IV).

Policy: Regional Law No. 36-ZRH “On protection of the atmospheric air”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the field of protection of the atmospheric airt that are not regulated by federal law. It establishes plenary powers and competence of regional state bodies in the aforesaid sphere. In urban and other residential areas, the regional state executive body and local self-government organize work on regulation (reduction) of emissions of hazardous (polluting) substances into the air during periods of adverse weather conditions. The procedure for the work on the regulation of emissions of harmful (polluting) substances in atmospheric air during periods of adverse meteorological conditions, including preparation and the transfer of relevant forecasts is determined by the regional government upon the recommendation of territorial bodies of the federal executive body in the region competent in the sphere of hydrometeorology and related areas and other territorial bodies of other federal bodies of executive power. The executive body of state power of the Republic of Khakassia competent in the field of the protection of atmospheric air determines the timing of the phased achievement of the maximum permissible emissions at the request of the relevant territorial bodies of the authorized federal executive body in the field of protection of atmospheric of the atmospheric air.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.

Policy: Regional Law No. 140-ZO “On the modalities of procurement and collection of non-timber forest products, including edible resources and medicinal plants, by citizens for individual personal needs".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law determines the modalities of procurement and collection of non-timber forest products, including edible resources and medicinal plants, by citizens for individual personal needs. Citizens shall be granted the right of free stay in forests and to procure, collect and harvest for individual personal needs wild growing fruits, berries, nuts, mushrooms and other edible and non-edible non-timber forestry products free of charge. Citizens must: (a) prevent damages to public health and environment; (b) to procure, harvest and collect non-timber forestry resources so as to avoid soil erosion, negative impact on state of forests, water and natural resources; (c) observe forest fire rules and regulations; and (d) compensate damages caused to forestry in accordance with the acting legislation of the Russian Federation.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Forestry
Keyword: Fruits/edible nuts,Forest management/forest conservation,Non-timber products,Forest fires,Erosion
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 139-ZO “On regulation of forest relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes plenary powers  of state bodies in the sphere of forest relations. Regional Government shall carry out the following plenary powers in the sphere of forest relations: (a) management, ownership and tenancy of public forest; (b) validation of rates of payment for forest resources and rates of payment for lease of forests; (c) validation of competence of forest officers; (d) validation of the modalities of conclusion of purchase and sale contracts of forest species by citizens for individual personal needs; (e) validation of the regional forest management plan; (f) organization of protection of forests against forest fires; and (g) state registration of forests.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Public forest,Forest management/forest conservation,Contract/agreement,Forest species,Forest fires,Forest service/forest officers

Policy: Regional Law No. 19 “On regulation of forest relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates collection and procurement by citizens of non-timber edible and non-edible forest products, and medicinal plants, in accordance with the acting legislation, excluding exhaustion of natural resources and timely reproduction thereof. Collection and procurement of non-timber edible forest resources and , in particular, mushrooms and wild growing plants, recorded in the Red Book of protected plant species, collection of plants and mushrooms containing narcotic substances and recognized as prohibited crops by the federal legislation, and also procurement of non-timber resources on the territory of protected areas, shall be prohibited. Stay of citizens can be restricted for forest fire and sanitary safety reasons. The following exceptional cases of timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species for public and municipal needs shall be considered: (a) timber extraction for the prevention of natural and technological disasters and mitigation of the consequences thereof; (b) timber extraction for maintenance and repairs of public edifices. Forest management for hunting must be carried out with the use of hunting gear and hunting methods prevention exhaustion of wild fauna species subject to hunting and other natural resources.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Forestry, Cultivated plants, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Fruits/edible nuts,Forest management/forest conservation,Timber,Timber extraction/logging,Non-timber products,Prohibited crops,Hunting/capture,Hunting gear/hunting methods,Management/conservation

Policy: Environmentally Sensitive Area (Aripo Savannas Strict Nature Reserve) Notice, 2007 (L.N. No. 152 of 2007).
Policy_Content: This Notice provides for the designation by the Environmental Management Authority the Aripo Savannas Strict Nature Reserve as an environmentally sensitive area (“ESA”) in the sense of section 41 of the Environmental Management Act. The Notice shall not apply to private land in the Area. The purpose of the designation is the achievement of objectives as set out in part II of the Schedule to this Notice. The Schedule also sets out limitations of the use of land and permitted and mitigating measures. The principal objective of the designation is the protection of wildlife and biodiversity and compliance with international agreements in these fields, notably CITES and the UN biodiversity Convention. One of the objectives of the designation is the effective control of the watershed of the area for maintaining the water quality and quantity within the Long Stretch Forest Reserve.
Subject: Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Ecosystem preservation,Pollution control,Water conservation zone,Sustainable development,Biodiversity,Management/conservation,Protected area,International agreement-implementation,Endangered species,Protection of habitats,Protection of species

Policy: Resolution No. 1352 of 2007 of the Ministry of Petroleum on the waste produced by petroleum installations.
Policy_Content: The aim of this Resolution is to regulate the circulation of wastes produced by petroleum installations. It is composed of 6 articles and 1 List. Article 1 considers the wastes listed in the attached List produced by petroleum installations as dangerous wastes, which necessitate a previous licence for their circulation. Article 2 entrusts the General Egyptian Authority for Petroleum to issue licences for the aforementioned wastes. Article 4 prohibits the importation of the aforementioned wastes. Article 5 entrusts the General Egyptian Authority for Petroleum and the Environment Body to revise and modify the List periodically. The List contains the names of the dangerous wastes.

Policy: Act on Danish subsoil exploitation (No. 960 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act sets rules on the appropriate exploitation of the Danish underground and its natural resources in adherence to EU regulations. It applies to Danish EEZ and on the Danish continental shelf area and particularly to the planning of extraction of raw materials of the subsoil which has not been subject to economic exploitation in Denmark prior to 23 February 1932, to the exploitation of underground storage or for any purpose other than extraction of raw materials, and to scientific studies of the subsurface. The Minister of Climate and Energy shall grant permission for a period of max. 3 years to studies for the exploration and production of commodities covered in this Act and/or the exploitation of underground storage or purpose other than recovery. Expropriation activities are subject to licence and companies involved in this sector business shall pay a governmental fee thereof in addition to a tax calculated on the basis of area size covered by the permit (land tax) and a tax calculated on the amount of extracted raw materials (production tax); there may be conditions on the payment to pay the government a share of these activities’ economic revenues. Permit of research and exploration of hydrocarbons shall be notified after the Minister of Climate and Energy decides methods thereof. Permission granted shall be based on two criteria: a) expertise and financial background and b) the research applicants must notify method planned to perform in specific area. Successfully granted permits shall then be given a commencement date when to begin such extraction activities. The Minister of Climate and Energy shall decide on state-owned companies to have the purchase right of max. 50% of a licensee's current production of liquid hydrocarbons. Permits for exploration and production of geothermal energy shall be notified after the public call for applications through gazette. The subsoil suitability for geological storage of CO2, which criteria is determined on the basis of the characterization and assessment of the potential storage and surrounding area, shall be governed by the Minister of Climate and Energy criteria decisions.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Payment of Compensation for Property Situated on Landholdings Expropriated for Public Purposes Council of Ministers Regulations (No 135/2007).

Policy: Décret nº 2007-409/PRES/PM/MECVMAHRH/MID/MCE/MATD du 3 juillet 2007 portant modalités de réalisation de l’audit environnemental.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret détermine les conditions et les modalités de réalisation de l’audit environnemental conformément à l’article 101 de la loi N°005/97/ADP du 30 janvier 1997, portant Code de l’Environnement au Burkina Faso. L’objectif de l’audit environnemental est d’évaluer et de contrôler la conformité et les performances environnementales de l’entreprise. Il permet: d’assurer la conformité aux dispositions légales en vigueur; de déceler et de gérer en connaissance de cause; d’améliorer la communication entre l’administration et les promoteurs; d’évaluer l’impact de l’activité sur l’environnement.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Décret nº 2007-410/PRES/PM/MRA/MFB portant conditions générales d’attribution, d’occupation et d’exploitation des zones pastorales aménagées.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe les conditions générales d’attribution, d’occupation et d’exploitation des zones pastorales aménagées par l’Etat ou les collectivités locales.  Il est mis en place, pour chaque zone pastorale aménagée, une commission d’attribution des parcelles par arrêté du ou des Haut(s) Commissaire(s) concernés. La commission d’attribution des parcelles est chargée de l’examen des dossiers de demande d’attribution ou de proposition de ré-attribution de parcelles qui lui sont soumis.
Subject: Livestock, Land & soil
Keyword: Range,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Institution,Traditional rights/customary rights,Right of use,Grazing,Pastoralism
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Decree No. 14/2007 on the National Strategy on Gender Equity (ENIEG).
Policy_Content: This Decree is composed of five articles and one Annex. It adopts the National Strategy on gender Equity (ENIEG), as te national reference framework for the all development patterns present at national level.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Modifica la Ley General del Equilibrio Ecológico y la Protección al Ambiente.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto reforma y adiciona diversas disposiciones a la Ley General del Equilibrio Ecológico y la Protección al Ambiente. Las enmiendas se refieren en particular a las actividades que quedan prohibidas en las zonas núcleo de las áreas naturales protegidas, así como a las actividades que se consideran prioritarias a efectos del otorgamiento de estímulos fiscales.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Decreto N° 64/07 - Traslado al Consejo Nacional de Planificación Económica Social de funciones en materia de desarrollo sostenible.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto dispone el traslado al Consejo Nacional de Planificación Económica Social (CONPES) de todas las funciones pertenecientes al Consejo Nacional de Desarrollo Sostenible (CONADES). Por lo tanto, el CONPES será el organismo responsable de formular la política nacional de desarrollo sostenible del país. Asimismo, mediante el presente Decreto se ratifican los compromisos de la Alianza Centroamericana para el Desarrollo Sostenible, suscrita el 12 de octubre de 1994, y del Programa 21 de las Naciones Unidas, suscrito en 1992.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Resolución Nº 158 - Incentivos para los productores agropecuarios afectados por la ola invernal.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución crea los programas de apoyo directos para compensar a los productores agropecuarios afectados por el impacto negativo que generó la ola invernal y de incentivo a la reactivación económica de los productores de los cultivos de arroz y maíz tecnificado en situación de desastre por los efectos de la ola invernal.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 261/2008 - Reglamento de Defensa de la Competencia.
Policy_Content: La presente Real Decreto aprueba el Reglamento de Defensa de la Competencia, que tiene por objeto el desarrollo de la Ley Nº 15/2007, que prohíbe todo acuerdo, decisión o práctica concertada que tenga por objeto, produzca o pueda producir el efecto de impedir, restringir o falsear la competencia en todo o parte del mercado nacional.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural development,Institution,Financial agricultural measures,Internal trade,International trade,Agricultural commodities,Subsidy/incentive,Dispute settlement,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Non-governmental entity

Policy: Ley Nº 15/2007 - Ley de Defensa de la Competencia.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de Defensa de la Competencia, prohíbe todo acuerdo, decisión o recomendación colectiva, o práctica concertada o conscientemente paralela, que tenga por objeto, produzca o pueda producir el efecto de impedir, restringir o falsear la competencia en todo o parte del mercado nacional, quedando prohibida la explotación abusiva por una o varias empresas de su posición de dominio en todo o en parte del mercado nacional.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Ley de desarrollo social del Estado de Campeche.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto garantizar ejercicio pleno de los derechos sociales consagrados en la Constitución Política de los Estados Unidos Mexicanos y la propia del Estado de Campeche, cuyo principio fundamental en materia de desarrollo social es la justa distribución del ingreso y la riqueza que permita el pleno ejercicio de la libertad y la dignidad de los individuos. La Ley reconoce como derechos sociales, los relativos a alimentación, salud, educación, vivienda, disfrute de un medio ambiente sano, trabajo y seguridad social, así como los que se refieren a la no discriminación, equidad e igualdad.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition
Keyword: Right to clean/healthy environment,Indigenous peoples,Human rights,Right to food,Public health,Poverty

Policy: Land Transaction Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Land Transaction Act of 9 December 1992. In particular, the Ordinance lays down provisions relating to the correct and efficient enforcement of the afore-mentioned Act. The text consists of 23 articles divided into 5 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Conditions and requirements (II); Land transactions authorities and procedures (III); Fees (IV); Transitional and final provisions (V).
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land tenure,Land reform,Land consolidation,Agricultural land,Transfer,Ownership,Subdivision of land,Foreign land tenure,Authorization/permit,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Royalties/fees,Offences/penalties

Policy: Land Valuation and Taxation Regulations.
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made under section 77 of the Agricultural (Commercial) Land Reform Act, concern the valuation of agricultural land for land tax purposes, the imposition and collection of land tax, and various related matters such as land tax returns and objections and appeal against valuations. There must be paid by every owner of agricultural land for the benefit of the Land Acquisition and Development Fund established under the Agricultural (Commercial) Land Reform Amendment Act, 2000, in respect of each financial year, a land tax based on the land value (also to be known as the unimproved site value) of that land as shown on the main or interim valuation roll and calculated at such rate or progressive rate as may be determined by a notice under section 76 of the Act.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land reform,Agricultural land,Tax/levy,Land valuation,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, South Atlantic, Southern Africa

Policy: Law of Georgia on Free Industrial Zones (No. 5175-RS of 2007)
Policy_Content: This Law sets the procedure for establishing and liquidating free industrial zones, defines the procedure for managing free industrial zones and for establishing and operating the governance bodies and service/supervisory agencies within the zones. It establishes additional conditions and tax concessions for free industrial zone enterprises, as well as regulates other issues related to the zone activities. This Law aims at creating an attractive environment for economic activity, and at facilitating the capital and technology inflow into Georgia. A free industrial zone shall be a type of free zone under the Tax Code of Georgia with additional conditions and tax concessions effective within it. A free industrial zone shall be designated for economic activities for a certain period of time, and persons within the zone shall be governed under special economic and legal regime as determined by this Law. Entry into and exit from a free industrial zone, a customs checkpoint, shall be set up as determined by the tax legislation of Georgia.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural development,Financial agricultural measures,Fiscal and market measures,Tax/levy,Governance,Business/industry/corporations,Internal trade,International trade
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy: Arrêté du 2 juillet 2007 modifiant l'arrêté du 15 février 1952 portant création du Centre technique du bois.
Policy_Content: Le centre technique industriel, dénommé Centre technique du bois et de l'ameublement depuis le 25 février 1983, prend la dénomination d'Institut technologique FCBA (forêt, cellulose, bois-construction, ameublement) à compter du 1er septembre 2007. L'Institut exerce les activités assignées aux centres techniques industriels par l'article L. 342-2 du code de la recherche dans les domaines de la sylviculture, de l'exploitation forestière, et dans ceux de la production, de la transformation, de l'utilisation et de la distribution du bois, et des produits à base de bois, de la pâte à papier et de l'ameublement.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Act No. LXXXVI of 2007 on electricity and Governmental Decree No. 273 of 2007 (X.19.) implementing certain provisions of the Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is: to create an efficient electricity market; to exercise the principles of energy efficiency and conservation in the interest of sustainable development; to ensure the access to electricity; to supply electricity to the consumers in a safe and smooth way, of adequate quality and at a transparent price; to protect efficiently the interests of consumers; to integrate national electricity market into EU markets; to promote the establishment of new generation capacity and new network infrastructures, and the access of new actors on the electricity market; to promote the generation of electricity using renewable energy sources and wastes. The Act must be applied to: (a) the generation, transmission, distribution, trade and consumption of electricity; (b) the operation of the electricity grid and ancillary services thereof; (c) the establishment, operation and decommissioning of electrical installations, customer connection systems, consumer equipment and direct lines; (d) licensing in the electricity sector. The Act consists of 24 Chapters (and of 184 Articles) dealing with the following matters: general provisions (Chapt. 1); electric energy production (Chapt. 2); common rules regarding the transmission system control, the distribution of electricity and the network licensees (Chapt. 3); access to networks (Chapt. 4); direct line, private line (Chapt. 5); measurement and meter reading (Chapt. 6); electricity trading (Chapt. 7); organized electricity market (Chapt. 8); consumers’ right and consumers to be protected (Chapt. 9); terms of business (Chapt. 10); general requisites of electric energy industry activities (Chapt. 11); partition of the activities (Chapt. 12); promotion of competition in the electricity market (Chapt. 13); licensing procedure of the building authority (Chapt. 14); electricity supply malfunction (Chapt. 15); price regulation (Chapt. 16); other financial provisions (Chapt. 17); supplying of data, confidentiality of information, secrecy (Chapt. 18); legal status, duties and competencies of the Hungarian National Energy Agency (Chapt. 19); mandatory provisions (Chapt. 20); transitional provisions (Chapt.21); modified laws (Chapt. 22); repealed laws (Chapt. 24).
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Authorization/permit,Basic legislation,Energy conservation/energy production,Institution,Internal trade,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Renewable energy
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: The consolidated version of the Act entered into force on 17 May 2013.

Policy: Regional Law No. 2366-III “On modalities of procurement and collection of non-timber forest resources by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of procurement and collection of non-timber forest resources for individual personal needs. Places of procurement and collection of non-timber forest resources shall be established by the authorized state regional institution in the sphere of forest relations. Citizens performing procurement and collection on non-timber forest resources must use methods and technologies preventing exhaustion of forest resources, observe forest fire prevention rules and regulations and comply with other requirements of the federal and regional forestry legislation.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Public forest,Forest species,Non-timber products,Forest fires,Enforcement/compliance
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Warehouse Receipt System Regulations, 2007 (S.I. No. 33 of 2007).
Policy_Content: These Regulations provide rules that shall apply to warehouses to which the Warehouse Receipt System Act applies. They shall initially be restricted in application to the warehousing of agricultural commodities and shall be extended to other goods by the Minister by a Statutory Order upon recommendation of the Authority. A warehouse may be licensed either as a public or a private warehouse. The Regulations, among other things: set out rights and obligations of warehouse operators; require the Uganda Commodity Exchange to perform temporarily the function of the Authority under the Act; provide with respect to licensing of warehouse operators and inspectors; provide with respect to warehouse bond, insurance and other securities,  warehouse receipts and care for and delivery of goods in storage. The Court may order the Authority to take possession of warehoused goods related assets. A Warehouse keeper notify the owner of perishable goods to remove the perishable goods and to satisfy the lien if are likely to deteriorate greatly in value or likely to injure other goods are or endanger the life of persons likely to get into contact with the goods.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Regional Law No. 264 “On procurement of non-timber edible forest resources and medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations regarding procurement of non-timber edible forest resources (wild growing fruits, berries, nuts, mushrooms, seeds, birch juice etc.) and medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs. Citizens shall be granted the right to collect non-timber edible forest resources and medicinal plants free of charge and without any authorization. Picking of berries shall be carried out manually, without the use of any mechanical means. Felling of trees for collection of seeds shall be prohibited. Collection of birch juice shall be authorized in mature forest.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 263 “On procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest resources by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens shall have the right of free stay in forests for the purpose of procurement of non-timber forest resources free of charge for individual personal needs. It shall be applicable to non-edible non-timber forest products. Procurement of fuelwood shall be authorized in the process of selective and clear felling. Collection of forest leaf floor in protection forests shall be prohibited. Collection of forest leaf floor in the same area more than once in five years shall be prohibited.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Public forest,Forest management/forest conservation,Non-timber products,Fuelwood,Forest species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 2366-III “On procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest resources by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the rules for procurement of non-timber forest resources, including stumps, birchbark and tanbark, fuelwood, shrubbery, woody forage and spruce, fir trees and other coniferous species for New Year festivities. It shall be applicable to non-edible non-timber forest products. Felling of coniferous species for New Year festivities shall be authorized on special forest plantations and forest areas destined for clearing. Methods of procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest resources by citizens must prevent exhaustion of available resources, soil erosion and negative environmental impact.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Public forest,Forest management/forest conservation,Non-timber products,Fuelwood,Forest species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 262 “On exceptional cases of timber extraction for public and municipal needs, and of fir trees (spruce) and other coniferous forest species for New Year festivities, in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes exceptional cases of timber extraction, including fir trees (spruce and other coniferous forest species) for New Year festivities  in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species for public and municipal needs. Exceptional cases shall be considered: (a) timber extraction for the prevention of natural and technological disasters; (b) timber extraction for construction purposes for repairs of public edifices, heating and construction; and (c) timber extraction for procurement of fir trees (spruces) and other coniferous forest species for New Year festivities annually in the period from 1 October to 31 December.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Ley Nº 618 - Ley General de Higiene y Seguridad del Trabajo. Texto consolidado.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto establecer el conjunto de disposiciones mínimas que, en materia de Higiene y Seguridad del Trabajo, el Estado, los empleadores y los trabajadores deberán desarrollar en los centros de trabajo, mediante la promoción, intervención, vigilancia y establecimiento de acciones para proteger a los trabajadores en el desempeño de sus labores. La presente Ley y su Reglamento son de aplicación obligatoria a todas las personas naturales o jurídicas, nacionales y extranjeras que se encuentran establecidas o se establezcan en Nicaragua, en las que se realicen labores industriales, agrícolas, comerciales, de construcción, de servicio público y privado o de cualquier otra naturaleza. Se crea el Consejo Nacional de Higiene y Seguridad del Trabajo, así como los Consejos Departamentales y Regionales de Higiene y Seguridad del Trabajo.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries, Mineral resources, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Business/industry/corporations,Framework law,Public health,Social protection,Agricultural development,Institution,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Inspection,Extension,Marine fisheries,Risk assessment/management,Mining,Pesticides,Plant production

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 418 validating the Regulation on placement of order for carrying out work concerning conservation, protection, reproduction of forests and making contracts related thereto.
Policy_Content: Placement of state or municipal order for carrying out work concerning conservation, protection, reproduction of forests located on public or municipal land shall be carried out if such responsibilities have not been entrusted to citizens and legal persons. The customers shall be regional executive bodies, local self-government, Federal Forest Agency and Federal Nature Management Supervision Service. Placement of order shall be carried out concurrently with the sale of forest plantations for timber extraction. The contract shall envisage execution of all the activities except for aerial work. In the contract shall be specified: (a) location of forest plantations subject to timber extraction; (b) maximum amount of timber extraction; (c) timber extraction fees.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Décret exécutif nº 07-206 du 30 juin 2007 fixant les conditions et les modalités de construction et d’occupation du sol sur la bande littorale, de l’occupation des parties naturelles bordant les plages et de l’extension de la zone objet de non-ædificandi.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret a pour objet de fixer: les conditions et les modalités de construction et d’occupation du sol liées directement aux fonctions des activités économiques autorisées sur une bande littorale de trois (3) kilomètres; les conditions d’occupation des parties naturelles bordant les plages et participant au maintien de leur dynamique et de leur équilibre sédimentaire, ainsi que celle des dunes bordières et des cordons sableux des parties hautes des plages non atteints par les hautes mers; les conditions et les modalités d’extension de la zone objet de non-ædificandi à trois cents (300) mètres ainsi que les conditions dans lesquelles des autorisations peuvent être accordées pour les activités et les services pour lesquelles la proximité immédiate de la mer est une nécessité.
Subject: Land & soil, Sea
Keyword: Coastal zone management,Protected area,Soil conservation/soil improvement
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 417 validating the Regulation on forest fire safety arrangements.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes common rules for ensuring of forest fire safety in the process of forest management, conservation, protection and reproduction, and also during stay of citizens in the forests. It shall be compulsory for the state executive bodies, local self-government, legal and natural persons. Forest fire safety arrangements shall be carried out in the following forms: (a) construction of forest fire prevention facilities; (b) creation of forest fire extinguishing systems; (c) forest fire monitoring; (d) elaboration of forest fire extinguishment plans; (e) forest fire extinguishment; and (f) other forest fire safety arrangements.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 87-OZ “On modalities and rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens shall have the right for timber extraction of forest species for individual personal needs for payment, except for traditional forest management by indigenous small ethnic communities. The period of timber extraction, including logging, shall not exceed one year (art. 2). Rates of timber extraction shall be established as follows: (a) for housing construction – up to 80 cubic metres once in 50 years; (b) for heating – up to 15 cubic metres annually; and (c) other individual personal needs – up to 25 cubic metres once in 10 years (Annex 1).
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Timber,Timber extraction/logging,Fuelwood,Forest species,Traditional rights/customary rights

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 76 - Estatuto orgánico por procesos de la Secretaría Nacional de Planificación y Desarrollo (SENPLADES).
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo expide el Estatuto orgánico por procesos de la Secretaría Nacional de Planificación y Desarrollo (SENPLADES), mediante el cual los procesos que generan los productos y servicios de la SENPLADES, se ordenan y clasifican en función de su grado de contribución o valor agregado al cumplimiento de la misión institucional.

Policy: Joint Order No. P/0152 of the Ministry of Economic Development and Trade validating technical requirements for state cadastre valuation of urban land.
Policy_Content: These technical requirements contain the technological scheme for the fulfilment of state cadastre valuation of urban land and establish basic requirements for the legalization of the reported data. The Joint Order contains the list of authorized activities on urban land and establishes the modalities of calculating cadastre value of urban land. It also contains the calculation formula for cadastre valuation of different uses of urban land.

Policy: Upper Austria Forestry Rights Law.
Policy_Content: Purpose of the present Law is: 1) the creation, conservation and development of an efficient and sustainable agriculture and forestry ensuring the sound cultivation of land; 2) the timely and sustainable practice of forestry rights. Forestry rights are: to be entitled to draw from other forests wood or other forestry products; pasture right on somebody else’s land and all other related easements or servitudes with the exception of right of way. The text consists of 40 articles divided into 7 Parts as follows: General provisions (1); New regulations (2); Redemption (3); Insurance and compensation (4); Wood required in emergency, wood required for personal needs, wood required for work (5); Competence and proceedings (6); Penalties and final provisions (7).
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 414 validating the Regulation on sanitary safety in forests.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes common rules and regulations regarding the following measures aimed at protecting forests against pests and their negative impacts: (a) forest protection zoning; (b) forest pathology inspection and monitoring; (c) sanitary felling; and (d) establishing sanitary requirements for forest management. In the process of forest pathology monitoring, information on the state of forests, including litter, drying and pollution, shall be collected and processed.

Policy: Assessment and Management of Environmental Noise (Amendment) Law, 2007 (Law No. 75(Ι)/2007).
Policy_Content: This Law may be cited as the Assessment and Management of Environmental Noise (Amendment) Law of 2007 and shall be read as one with the Assessment and Management of Environmental Noise Laws of 2004-2006 (hereinafter referred to as "the principal Law"). The principal Law and the present Law shall be read as one and will be referred to as the Assessment and Management of Environmental Noise Laws of 2004-2007. The present law amends section (2) to article 9 of the basic law as regards the action plans, to be drafted by 18 July 2013 the latest, for extensive infrastructures that may exceed established noise limit values.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia

Policy: Oromia Regional State Forest Enterprises Supervising Agency Establishment Regulation (No. 84/2007).
Policy_Content: This Regulation, based on Article 49(1) of Proclamation No 87/2005, establishes the Oromia Regional State Forest Enterprises Supervision Agency as an autonomous body having its own legal personality. The Agency shall be accountable to the Oromia Regional Government Executive Council. The Agency shall have as its principal objective to oversee and supervise the management of state forest enterprises operating in State forests. It shall also, among other things, provide support to  enterprises and rural development activities in and around the forest areas and shall implement the regional state forest conservation policy. The Regulations also provides with respect to administration of the Agency and utilization of financial resources of the Forest Fund.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Sahel

Policy: Bale Forest Enterprise Establishment Regulation (No. 88/2007).
Policy_Content: This Regulation, based on Article 49(1) of Proclamation No 87/2005 and Proclamation No. 16/1997, establishes the Bale Forest Enterprise as an autonomous public enterprise and defines its objectives, functions and powers. The Enterprise shall be accountable to the Oromia Regional Forest Enterprises Supervising Agency. The Enterprise shall have the following objectives: to sustainable manage and develop forest resources in its concession area; to ensure sustainable management of biodiversity conservation; to contribute to socio-economic conditions of the local community. Among its duties, there are development of a management plan and development of wildlife resources. The Regulation also describes the concession area and provides with respect to the administration of the Enterprise.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Sahel

Policy: Regulation on the ratification of the Annual Financial Statements of the Croatian Bank for Reconstruction and Development for 2006.
Policy_Content: This Regulation officially ratifies the annual financial statement of the Croatian Bank for Reconstruction and Development, including all related Supervisory Board implementations until the year 2007, under the terms and provisions provided by the Law on Croatian Bank for reconstruction and development.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Saxon Contaminated Sites Cadastre Regulation.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation implements the Federal Soil Protection Act of 17 March 1998 (BGBl. I p. 502). In particular, the Regulation lays down provisions relating to the contaminated site cadastre of Saxony. The text consists of 7 articles as follows: Subject matter (I); Content of the database (II); Data collection and updating of data (III); Storage, deleting and archiving of data (IV); Access right (V); Information of interested parties (VI); Entry into force (VII).
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Regional Law No. 312-OZ “On forest management for hunting purposes”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the use of forests for hunting management as a form of entrepreneurial activity. Hunting managers shall have the right: (a) to issue once-only hunting licences within established quotas, rates and limits; (b) to conclude hunting contracts with natural and legal persons. Hunting management shall include the following arrangements: (a) regulation of hunting and establishment of the number of hunters for hunting season; (b) feeding of wild fauna species subject to hunting; (c) selection on forest parcels of protected areas (reproduction grounds, no-take zones, wood grouse mating areas etc.); (c) increase or reduction of wild fauna species; and (d) acclimatization and re-acclimatization of wild fauna species.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 193 - Crea el Centro de Estudios y Políticas para el Agro (CEPA).
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo crea el Centro de Estudios y Políticas para el Agro (CEPA), como un organismo de derecho público, sin fines de lucro, adscrito al Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganadería, con la finalidad de asesorar la implementación, coordinación, evaluación y seguimiento de las políticas de Estado para el sector agropecuario.

Policy_Content: La presente Ley de desarrollo, promoción y fomento de la actividad agropecuaria orgánica, tiene por objeto asegurar el cumplimiento de los objetivos de desarrollo, promoción, fomento y gestión de la actividad agropecuaria orgánica, fortalecer los mecanismos de control y promoción de los productos derivados de la actividad agropecuaria orgánica, así como procurar la competitividad y rentabilidad de dichos productos.

Policy: Council Regulation (EC) No. 834/2007 on organic production and labelling of organic products and repealing Regulation (EEC) No. 2092/91.
Policy_Content: This Regulation lays down the legislative framework relevant to the sustainable development of organic production. It sets forth rules concerning: (a) all stages of production, preparation and distribution of organic products and their control; (b) the use of indications referring to organic production in labelling and advertising. Such rules apply to processed and unprocessed products originating from agriculture and aquaculture, including feedingstuffs, vegetative propagating material and seeds for cultivation.

Policy: Lower Austria Landscape Charge Law 2007.
Policy_Content: Article 1 of the above-mentioned Law establishes that for the care, maintenance and arrangement of landscape the Land shall levy a charge, called “landscape charge”. Article 3 decrees that the said charge has to be paid for the production of minerals. The text – consisting of 13 articles – deals with the following aspects: definition of terms, exemption, calculation, duty to register, duty to notify, competent authorities, penalties and final provisions.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Western Europe

Policy: Law No. X-1231 “On nuclear power plant”.
Policy_Content: The purpose and the scope of this Law shall be projecting of a new nuclear power plant and creation of legal, financial and organizational grounds for realization of this project. The Act consists of 6 Sections divided into 20 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) realization of the project; (3) management; (4) national investor; (5) place of construction; and (6) conclusive provisions. The Parliament has approved construction of a new nuclear power plant. Laws and other legislative acts shall provide for application of special safety requirements for ensuring interests of the national security. The aforesaid special safety requirements shall be introduced by the Government. State supervision and control over the application of safety requirements shall be carried out through licensing of the operator of the new nuclear power plant. In case of nuclear disaster or risk of a nuclear disaster entailing risks for human life, health and environment, the Government or the authorized institution appointed thereby, shall assume management of the nuclear power plant. Plot of land for construction of the new nuclear plant can be expropriated for public needs. The Government shall inform the public of the realization of the project and on safety measures.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regulation on the procedure and criteria for the establishment access right in the forest or on forest land owned by the Croatian Republic, in order to carry out tourism activities.
Policy_Content: This Regulation lays down the procedure and criteria for the establishment of right of access in the forest or on forest land owned by the Croatian Republic, in order to carry out certain tourism activities.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
