Policy: Climate Change and Greenhouse Emissions Reduction Act 2007.
Policy_Content: The object of this Act is to provide for measures to address climate change with a view to assisting to achieve a sustainable future for the State; to set targets to achieve a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions within the State; to promote the use of renewable sources of energy; to promote business and community understanding about issues surrounding climate change; to facilitate the early development of policies and programs to address climate change.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act will come into operation on 3 July 2007.

Policy: Ley Nº 627 - Modifica la Ley Nº 554, Ley de estabilidad energética.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica y adiciona nuevas disposiciones a la Ley de estabilidad energética. En particular, cabe destacar el nuevo párrafo del literal f) del artículo 4, en virtud del cual las distribuidoras de energía deben presentar al Instituto Nicaragüense de Energía un plan de inversiones que reduzca el nivel de pérdidas, técnicas y no técnicas, que el mismo enfrenta. Asimismo, se adiciona el nuevo artículo 13, que establece que las distribuidoras de electricidad que se abastecen de energía del Sistema Interconectado Nacional podrán instalar y operar en el mercado eléctrico nacional nueva capacidad de generación de energía renovable propia que no provenga de hidrocarburos hasta de un veinte por ciento de la demanda total que sirve.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Instruction No. 204-p of the Ministry of Environmental Protection on environmental impact assessment of the projected economic activity.
Policy_Content: This Instruction establishes that environmental impact assessment (EIA) shall be applicable with a view of evaluation of ecological and other consequences of the managing and economic decisions to be made, elaboration of recommendations for the rehabilitation of environment, prevention of the destruction, degradation, damaging or exhaustion of natural ecosystems and natural resources. Environmental impact assessment (EIA) shall be integral part of project documentation to be submitted for validation by the state environmental audit. Environmental impact assessment (EIA) shall be based upon the following principles: (a) obligatoriness; (b) integration – complex evaluation of the projected economic activity upon environment, population, agriculture and industry; (c) alternative options; (d) sufficiency – detailed evaluation; (e) preservation of biological diversity; (f) compatibility with living quality standards of the local population; (g) flexibility in relation to specific projected activity; and (h) public participation. All the projected economic activities shall be classified in four categories in accordance with sanitary and hygienic requirements.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Order No. 207-p of the Ministry of Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on the state environmental audit.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of interaction of the bodies of the state environmental audit subordinated to the Ministry of Environmental Protection, territorial branches thereof and local executive bodies carrying out the state environmental audit, and sets requirements for the composition and contents of the materials submitted to the state environmental audit. The purpose of the state environmental audit shall be to implement environmental legislation and to ensure decision-making as regards the national socio-economic development. The state environmental audit shall establish compatibility of the projected and ongoing economic activity with environmental standards and ecological requirements for the purpose of the prevention of possible negative environmental impact. The purposes of the state environmental audit shall be: (a) determination and limitation of possible negative consequences of the projected economic activity; and (b) maintenance of the balance between economic development and environmental protection.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Resolución Nº 60 - Normas sobre la participación en la actividad de generación de energía eléctrica.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución dicta normas sobre la participación en la actividad de generación de energía eléctrica, con el fin de fomentar la participación de nuevos agentes en el mercado y propiciar la competencia en el sector de energía, asegurando así la disponibilidad de una oferta energética eficiente capaz de abastecer la demanda bajo criterios sociales y económicos.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Transport/storage,Internal trade,Non-governmental entity,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 2-208 "On the modalities of procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest resources by citizens for individual personal needs".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest resources by citizens for individual personal needs within established annual limits per person shall be performed free of charge and without any authorization. Citizens shall procure and collect the aforesaid resources without damaging forest resources, ensuring observance of forest fire safety and forest sanitary requirements, rules and regulations on reforestation and tending of forests. Harvesting of endangered, rare and protected non-timber forest species recorded in the Red Book shall be prohibited. Indigenous peoples shall be granted the right of procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest resources to the amount exceeding established annual limits free of charge. Annual limit of procurement of fuelwood per person free of charge shall be 50 kg.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 2-204 "On the modalities of procurement of edible forest resources and collection of medicinal plants by citizens".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law shall be applicable to edible non-timber forest resources such as wild growing fruits, berries, nuts, mushrooms, birch juice, and also to medicinal plants that can be procured and collected for individual personal needs free of charge and without any specific authorization. Citizens shall procure and collect the aforesaid resources without damaging wild flora species, ensuring timely reproduction of non-timber forest resources and preventing exhaustion thereof. Procurement and collection of the aforesaid resources shall be performed in the period of ripening. Collection and procurement of endangered, rare and protected species recorded in the Red Book shall be prohibited.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Forestry
Keyword: Fruits/edible nuts,Non-timber products,Forest species,Post-harvest treatment,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 108-oz “On modalities and rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes modalities and rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs and, in particular, fuelwood for heating, construction and repairs of residential facilities, and other individual personal needs. Timber extraction and collection and harvesting of non-timber forest products shall be performed in accordance with purchase and trade contract of forest species. Felling shall be performed in accordance with the modalities envisaged by acting legislation.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 103-KZ “On management of deposits of common minerals”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the modalities of concession of the plots of subsoil containing common minerals with a view of ensuring complex rational management and protection of subsoil. Management of subsoil, including exploration and mining, shall be subject to mandatory issuance of licence by the competent public authority. Issuance of the aforesaid licence can be performed either through tender or without tender. The rights and duties of subsoil managers shall begin to originate from the date of state registration of subsoil management licence. This Regional Law sets forth mandatory provisions subject to inclusion into subsoil management licence. Maximum time limit of the period of validity of licence shall be 20 years.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 119-ZSO “On timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations regarding timber extraction and procurement of non-timber edible and non-edible forest resources and medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs, ensuring the right of citizens to timber extraction for housing construction, fuelwood for heating and other individual personal needs in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species without allotment of forest parcels. Procurement of  non-timber edible and non-edible forest resources and medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs shall be granted free of charge without any special authorization or permit. Felling trees and shrubbery in the process of collection of forestry seeds, wild growing fruits, berries, nuts and medicinal plants shall be prohibited. Collection of protected plants and mushrooms recorded in the Red Book of endangered and protected species shall be prohibited.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Forestry

Policy: Regional Law No. 322-OZ “On timber extraction and procurement of non-timber edible and non-edible forest resources and medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations regarding timber extraction and procurement of non-timber edible and non-edible forest resources and medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs, ensuring the right of citizens to timber extraction for housing construction, fuelwood for heating and other individual personal needs in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species without allotment of forest parcels. Annual rate of timber extraction for individual personal needs shall be within the limits of authorized annual timber extraction. A citizen shall submit to the forest district authority application, specifying the amount of requested timber and purposeful use thereof. Procurement of  non-timber edible and non-edible forest resources and medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs shall be granted free of charge without any special authorization or permit.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Forestry

Policy: Law No. X-1241 “On green spaces”.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law shall be to establish the bases for the protection of the greenery and green spaces located outside the forestry land of the Republic of Lithuania, for the development of green areas and the legal regulation of planting of greenery, in order to ensure the stability of the natural and cultural landscape, and the right of the inhabitants to improve the environmental conditions that improve their quality of life. This Law does not apply to grassy vegetation that grows outside green areas. Flora and fauna must be preserved as aesthetically, ecologically, historically and culturally important elements of the countryside. Protection and management of plantations and greenery shall be organized in accordance with the following principles: (b) biodiversity protected in green areas and plantations; (b) the total area of isolated gardens in cities and towns is not reduced; (c) the natural environment is formed on the scale of the country, district, city (or parts thereof), creating a uniformly system of green spaces in cities, towns and rural landscapes; (d) maintain the optimal area of the built-up and open spaces for recreation and health of the inhabitants (determined according to the acting legislative provisions), ecological and aesthetic ties; (e) integrity of the historical green spaces and the ensembles or complexes of buildings located in or alongside them, and their integrity; (f) separate plantations (parks, including historical ones, squares, city and town gardens, dendrological collections) are not divided into parts, except for the formation of parcel of objects in their territory; (g) consideration of reasoned opinion of the public concerned about the transformation of existing greenery and the development of new ones; (h) trees and shrubs shall be designated by the Government of the Republic of Lithuania upon the proposal of the Ministry of Environment. This Law consists of IX Chapters divided into 30 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II regards green spaces system and classification of greenery by grades. Chapter III regards protection and management of gardens. Chapter IV establishes rights and obligations of natural and legal persons. Chapter V regards inventory, accounting, planning and designing of gardens and green spaces. Chapter VI regards protection and management of gardens and green spaces. Chapter VII green spaces and parks of cultural and recreational value. Chapter VIII regards financing of planting and protection of gardens and green spaces. Chapter IX regards legal control and establishes liability for the infringement of this Law.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on 1 January 2008.

Policy: Forestry Marketing and Research and Development Services Act 2007.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 16 sections divided into four Parts and completed by eight Endnotes, establishes the service provision for all the forestry industries concerned with growing, harvesting, processing, importing, exporting and marketing of wood, wood fibre and products made from wood or wood fibre. This Act provides for a company: a) to receive (under a contract) Commonwealth funding for promotion, research and development for the Australian forestry industry; and b) to be declared as the industry services body for the Australian forestry industry. This Act also requires the industry services body to comply with directions given by the Minister in the national interest because of an emergency. Part 2 specifies the Funding contract (including appropriation for payments under funding contract, etc. Part 3 establishes Industry services body (including Declaration and Cessation of declaration of industry services body).
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Timber extraction/logging,Timber,Forest management/forest conservation,Forest service/forest officers,Business/industry/corporations,International trade,Internal trade
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 29 June 2007.

Policy: Emergency Ordinance no. 68 of 28 June 2007 on environmental liability with regard to the prevention and repair of environmental damage.
Policy_Content: This Romanian Emergency Ordinance establishes the regulatory framework for environmental liability, based on the "polluter pays" principle, in order to prevent and repair the environmental damage. Directive 2004/35/CE of the European Parliament and of the Council of 21 April 2004 on environmental liability with regard to the prevention and remedying of environmental damage is indicated as reference legislation.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 534 validating the Regulation on licensing the transport of hazardous substances.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities for issuing licences to transport hazardous substances by rail, marine, river and motor vehicle. Licences shall be classified by subject: (a) natural and legal persons of the Republic of Kazakhstan; or (b) foreigners, stateless persons, foreign legal persons and international organizations; and by the amount of business: (a) general open-ended licences; and (b) fixed-term licences for a determined amount, weight or quantity. Applicants must submit the following documentation: (a) application; (b) notarized copies of the statute and of the state registration certificate (for legal persons); (c) copy of a personal identification document (for natural persons); (d) notarized copy of state registration for individual entrepreneurs; (e) tax inspection registration certificate; (f) receipt for payment of licensing fees; and (g) documentation attesting to the applicant’s qualifications for the licence.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 543 validating the list of environmentally degrading economic activities.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree contains the list of environmentally degrading economic activities classified as follows: (a) land and subsoil management (reclamation of land polluted with toxic, radioactive and other hazardous substances, mining of the area exceeding 25 hectares); (b) use of water resources (waste water treatment calculated for the population of 150 thousand residents); (c) oil operations (extraction, storage, transport, processing and operation of pipelines); (d) use of nuclear and thermal energy (operation of nuclear power plants, spent nuclear fuel recycling and radioactive waste disposal); (e) atmospheric air impact, climate change and ozone layer (emissions, import and export of ozone depleting substances); (f) hazardous waste management (transboundary movement of hazardous waste, hazardous waste management, burial and disposal); and (g) other environmentally degrading economic activities (production of GMO).
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Classification/declassification,Hazardous substances,Hazardous waste,Air quality/air pollution,Recycling/reuse,Ozone layer,GMO,Radiation,Pollution control,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution

Policy: Decreto Legislativo Nº 344 - Reforma la Ley especial para facilitar la cancelación de las deudas agraria y agropecuaria.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto reforma el Decreto Legislativo Nº 263 de 1998 en el sentido de disminuir el porcentaje del saldo de capital e intereses mediante cuyo pago las instituciones acreedoras (como el Instituto Salvadoreño de Transformación Agraria, la extinta Financiera de Tierras Agrícolas y el Banco de Tierras) podrán dar por cancelados los préstamos en el sector agrario y agropecuario. La medida tiene el propósito de sanear en su totalidad la cartera de la deuda agraria de los respectivos beneficiarios.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Seeds (National Lists of Varieties) (Amendment) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 1871 of 2007).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Seeds (National Lists of Varieties) Regulations 2001 so as to give effect to Commission Directive 2006/124/EC which replaces the list of species of vegetable the seed of which are subject to control in relation to marketing in Council Directive 2002/55/EC on the marketing of vegetable seed. They also give effect to Commission Decision 2007/321/EC, which releases the United Kingdom from its obligation to apply some of the provisions of Directive 2002/55/EC relating to the restriction on marketing of seed of four species and one sub-species of vegetable.
Subject: Forestry, Cultivated plants

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 535 validating the Regulation on economic assessment of environmental damages caused by pollution.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of economic assessment of environmental damages caused by pollution. Economic assessment of environmental damages caused by pollution shall be established by the officials in the sphere of environmental protection in case of identification of environmental offences in the process of state environmental audit. Economic assessment of environmental damages shall be established either directly or indirectly depending upon the possibility of total or partial compensation of damages by means of rehabilitation. This Ministerial Decree contains calculation formulae for atmospheric pollution by stationary and non-stationary sources, disposal of radioactive waste and sources of ionizing radiation and marine pollution by oil spills.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy_Content: The Act consists of 20 Articles on promoting the Ecotourism with consideration of preserving natural resources and development of local economies.

Policy: Land Act of Bhutan 2007.
Policy_Content: The present Act provides for the management, regulation and administration of the ownership and use of land for socio-economic development and environmental well-being of the country through efficient and effective land administration, security of land tenure, equal opportunity to land, facilitation of operation of land market, effective use of land resources and conservation of the ecosystem. Section 3 establishes a National Land Commission whose functions are, inter alia, as follows: a) Laying down the policies, programmes, regulations and guidelines in accordance with the provisions of this Act for implementation by the National Land Commission Secretariat; b) Acquisition of registered land and its allotment to Government institutions and Gerab Dratshang; c) Allotment of substitute land to the Thram holder whose land was acquired; d) Approve cash compensation for the land acquired; e) Allotment of the Government land or Government Reserved Forests land to Government institutions and Gerab; f) Recommend to the Government appropriate tax measures to prevent speculation and concentration of land holdings; g) Coordinate with stakeholders on identification and demarcation, and preparation of a detailed report on Thromde, industrial and protected agricultural areas; h) Submission of recommendation for declaration of Thromde, industrial, and protected agricultural areas to the Government; i) Develop format to apply for rehabilitation land; j) Assessment and submission of petition for rehabilitation land to His Majesty the King; k) Approving exchange of rural registered land with Government Reserved Forests land; l) Institute Dzongkhag and Thromde Land Acquisition and Allotment Committees.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Pollution control,Navigation,Indigenous peoples,Basic legislation,Traditional rights/customary rights,Land tenure,Transfer,Ownership,Public land,Tax/levy,Soil rehabilitation,Survey/mapping,Cadastre/land registration,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Offences/penalties,Pastoralism,Water rights

Policy: Regional Law No. 368-19-OZ “On realization by state regional bodies of plenary powers in the sphere of forest relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law delimits plenary powers of regional state bodies in the sphere of forest relations. Citizens shall be granted the right of timber extraction for individual personal needs in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species without allotment of forest parcels and within the limits established by calculated felling rate. The aforesaid timber shall be used for residential housing construction and heating. Timber extraction for individual personal needs may also include logging operations, partial timber processing and storage. Timber extraction shall be carried out in the form of selective cutting and clean cutting. Purchase and sale contracts of forest species shall be concluded by the outcome of forest tenders. Citizens shall be granted the right of free stay in forests for procurement free of charge of non-timber forest products (edible and non-edible) except for coniferous species for New Year celebrations.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Timber,Timber extraction/logging,Fuelwood,Non-timber products,Forest species,Contract/agreement
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 367-19-OZ “On state support of agriculture”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that financing of state support of agriculture shall be carried out from regional budget in the form of subsidies, long-term budgetary credits for agricultural field operations and procurement of fodder. The scope of state support of agriculture shall be provision of the population with foodstuffs and provision of the producers of agricultural commodities with raw materials. Producers of agricultural commodities operating under unfavourable climatic and environmental conditions shall have the right to obtain higher budgetary subsidies.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Law of Georgia on Public Health (No. 5069-RS of 2007)
Policy_Content: This Law provides for public health in Georgia. Its purpose is to promote public health and healthy lifestyle practices, ensure environmental health, promote family reproductive health, and prevent the spread of communicable and non-communicable diseases. Basic principles of this Law shall be: a) to ensure necessary measures to prevent risks related to public health; b) to ensure explicit delineation of the competences of state authorities in the field of public health and their close informative coordination in planning and implementation of health care measures; c) to ensure explicit delineation of powers of state authorities and of local self-government bodies in the field of public health; and d) to protect public health by adherence to human rights and fundamental freedoms, as provided for by the international agreements and treaties of Georgia and the legislation of Georgia.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, General
Keyword: Public health,Biological agents,Biosafety,Protection of environment,Governance,Local government,Human rights,Environmental standards,Food quality control/food safety
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy: Law No. 12/2007 amending Oil Act.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 14 articles, amends Oil Act, approved by Law No. 3/2001. Amendments establish new administrative and fiscal conditions for Mozambican oil production, originated from the development and production area. It specifies taxes and amends previous levy regulation.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Regional Law No. 55-z “On some issues of regulation of forest relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of forest relations pertaining to the competence of regional administration. The following issues shall pertain to the competence of regional administration: (a) establishment of the modalities and rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs; (b) the modalities of conclusion of purchase and sale contracts of forest species for individual personal needs; (c) establishes modalities and rates of procurement by citizens of non-timber forest resources for individual personal needs; (d) establishes the modalities of forest management for hunting purposes; and (e) forest fire control.

Policy: Ordinance on monitoring and control of pests in agriculture.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Introductory Agriculture Law of 29 June 2000. Article 1 establishes that the Ordinance sets out details of monitoring and control of pests organisms in agriculture which are: a)considered to be of particular importance and are subject to montitoring in the whole of Switzerland; b) which are regionally important and thus threatening the health of human beings, animals and nature alike. The text – consisting of 10 articles – deals with the following aspects: sphere of application, specially dangerous pest organisms, duty to notify, ban on certain plants, measures taken by the Agriculure Office, duty of municipalities and privates, compensation, enforcement and final provisions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Federal Law No. 118-FZ amending some legislative acts and conforming them to Land Code.
Policy_Content: Article 25. 1 of the Law No. 2395-I on subsoil shall acquire a new wording: “Article 25.1. Allotment and expropriation of the plots of land in relation to exploration and other uses of subsoil. Plots of land required for exploration and other uses of subsoil shall be allotted in accordance with land legislation. The aforesaid plots of land can be expropriated for state or municipal needs in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation.” Item 4 of the Decree No. 3314-1 of the Supreme Soviet regarding validation and modalities of enactment of the Regulation on the modalities of licensing of the use of subsoil shall acquire a new wording: “4. Plots of land. Plots of land required for exploration and other uses of subsoil shall be allotted in accordance with land legislation”. Article 21 of the Federal Law No. 4-FZ on land reclamation shall acquire a new wording: “Article 21. State monitoring of reclaimed land. State monitoring of reclaimed land shall be integral part of state land monitoring and shall represent the system of observations over the state of reclaimed land. In accordance with such observations changes in the state of reclaimed land shall be identified and assessed. Objects of state monitoring of reclaimed land shall be all reclaimed land of the Russian Federation”. Article 21 of the Federal Law No. 66-FZ on farming, gardening, housing non-profit-making associations shall acquire a new wording: “Article 21. Transactions of the plots of land destined for farming, gardening and summer cottage construction shall be regulated by civil legislation if not otherwise envisaged by land legislation”.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 406 validating the form of purchase and sale contract for forest trees located on land pertaining to state or municipal property.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of elaboration and conclusion of purchase and sale contract for forest trees located on land pertaining to state or municipal property. The aforesaid contract shall be concluded for the purpose of timber extraction with legal or natural persons in the following cases: (a) placement of contracts for protection, conservation and reproduction of forests with simultaneous sale of forest species for timber extraction; and (b) timber extraction by natural persons for their own personal needs. Logging fees shall be established in accordance with Article 75 of the forest Code. Annex 1 contains model form of contract.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 407 on state forest inventory.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree stipulates that the Federal Forest Agency shall be the state institution responsible for carrying out forest inventory consisting of a qualitative and quantitative assessment of the state of forest stock and other forest areas. The Agency shall be authorized to request information from regional authorities, local self-government officials, and legal and natural persons regarding forest management and forest development planning. State forest inventories shall be carried out aerially and from the ground. Aerial methods shall be used to forecast and identify negative impacts on forests in areas of intensive management. Ground methods shall be used to assess the efficacy of forest protection, conservation and reproduction measures.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Town and Country Planning (General Development Procedure) (Amendment) (England) Order 2007 (S.I. 1844 of 2007).
Policy_Content: This Order amends the Town and Country Planning (General Development Procedure) Order 1995 in respect of England by omitting a provision that prohibits the making of a local development order which would grant planning permission for development that is likely to have a significant effect on a European (habitat) site. The revocation is consequential on regulation 5(36) of the Conservation (Natural Habitats, c.) (Amendment) Regulations, which inserts provision to similar effect as the revoked provision in regulation 64A of the 1994 Regulations.

Policy: Resolución Nº 941/07 - Por la cual se establece la definición de bosque para los proyectos de captura y reducción de carbono.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución tiene por objeto la definición de bosque a efectos de la elaboración de proyectos con miras a la captura y reducción de carbono, en el marco del Programa Nacional de Cambio Climático. La definición de bosque se basa en los siguientes tres elementos: 1) área mínima del bosque; 2) cobertura de copa; 3) altura a la edad de madurez.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Forestry
Geographical_area: Americas, Landlocked Developing Countries, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 406 validating the Regulation on purchase and sale of forest species located on land pertaining to state or municipal property.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of elaboration and conclusion of contracts of purchase and sale of forest species located on land pertaining to state or municipal property and validates the form of such contracts. The following authorities and bodies shall be responsible for elaboration and conclusion of the aforesaid contracts: (a) state executive bodies for forest species located on public land pertaining to regional ownership and on land of forest fund governed by the regional executive bodies; (b) local self-government for forest species located on municipal land; (c) Federal Forest Agency for forest species located on the land forest fund and governed by the Agency; (d) Federal Supervision Service on Nature Management for forest species located on protected areas of federal significance; and (f) federal executive bodies responsible for defence and security for forest species located on land of defence and security and pertaining to federal property.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Electricity Plants Grid Access Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Energy Industry Act (BGBl. I p. 2730). In particular, the Ordinance lays down provisions relating to grid access of plants generating electricity. The text consists of 11 articles as follows: Sphere of application (1); Definition of terms (2); Procedures (3); Connection approval and grid connection agreement (4); Information duties of the network operator (5); Grid connection (6); Access to networks in difficult situations (7); Payment of costs (8); Power Plant Register (9); Establishment of the regulatory authority (10); Entry into force (11). The 11 articles are divided into 3 Parts as follows: General provisions (1); Other provisions (2); Final provisions (3).

Policy: Decree No. 437 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on exemption from payment of environmental fees for recycling of hazardous waste.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes the modalities of exemption from payment in case of recycling of hazardous substances and commodities. It also establishes the modalities of submittal of request for the Ministry of Environmental Protection for exemption of payment of environmental fees and sets forth requirements for application of the system of exemption from payment of environmental fees in case of recycling of hazardous substances and commodities. Recycler must ensure regeneration (acceptance, collection, storage, reuse and re-processing) of hazardous waste and information at involvement of public participation in recycling of hazardous waste.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Intervention Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Ordinance is to transpose the following EU Council Directives into national law: EU Council Directive 96/29/Euratom of 13 May 1996; EU Council Directive 89/618/Euratom of 27 November 1989 on informing the general public about health protection measures to be applied and steps to be taken in the event of a radiological emergency (OJ No. L 357/31 of 7 December 1989). The Ordinance contains regulations in connection with interventions in case of radiological emergencies and in case of lasting exposure from a past radiological emergency or a past practice. These include inter alia significant releases of radioactive material due to accidents involving facilities or practices, accidents during the transport of radioactive material or terrorist acts using radioactive material. The text consists of 17 articles divided into 3 Parts as follows: General provisions (1); Interventions in case of radiological emergencies (2); Interventions with lasting radiation exposure (3).
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Pollution control,Clean development mechanism,Air quality/air pollution,Radiation,Environmental audit,Early warning system/emergency intervention system
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Ordinance enters into force on 26 June 2007.

Policy: Regional Law No. 39-rz “On protection of the population and the territory against natural and technological disasters”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law ensures realization of organizational and legal norms in the sphere of protection of the population, soil, waterbodies, air and industrial and social infrastructure, and also natural environment against natural and technological disasters. The scope of this Regional Law shall be as follows: (a) prevention of the outbreak of natural and technological disasters; (b) reduction of damages and losses caused by natural and technological disasters; (c) mitigation of the consequences of natural and technological disasters; and (d) delimitation of plenary powers between regional authorities and local government in the sphere of protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Loi n° 1-07 du 26 juin 2007 portant adhésion par la République du Burundi au Traité portant création d’un Observatoire Economique et Statistique d’Afrique Subsaharienne (AFRISTAT), signé à Abidjan le 21 Septembre 1993.
Policy_Content: La présente loi autorise l’adhésion de la République du Burundi au Traité portant création d’un Observatoire Economique et Statistique d’Afrique Subsaharienne, signé à Abidjan le 21 Septembre 1993. AFRISTAT est une organisation internationale créée par un traité signé le 21 septembre 1993 à Abidjan par les 14 pays africains membres de la Zone Franc suivants: Bénin, Burkina Faso, Cameroun, Centrafrique, Comores, Congo, Côte d’Ivoire, Gabon, Guinée Equatoriale, Mali, Niger, Sénégal, Tchad et Togo.

Policy: Decreto Nº 225/07 - Reglamenta la Ley Nº 18.092 , que declara de interés general que los titulares del derecho de propiedad sobre los inmuebles rurales y las explotaciones agropecuarias sean los que se determinan.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto tiene por objeto la reglamentación de la Ley Nº 18.092, la cual establece un conjunto de disposiciones tendientes a identificar a las personas físicas que por sí o a través de diversas formas societarias o asociativas, son titulares de inmuebles rurales y explotaciones agropecuarias, limitando a tales efectos el elenco de entidades que pueden ejercer la referida titularidad. El Decreto especifica que podrán ser titulares del derecho de propiedad sobre inmuebles rurales y de explotaciones agropecuarias exclusivamente los siguientes sujetos: a) las personas físicas, las personas públicas estatales y las personas públicas no estatales; b) las asociaciones agrarias y sociedades agrarias; c) las cooperativas agrarias; d) las sociedades de fomento rural; e) las sociedades personales; f) las sociedades en comandita y las sociedades anónimas con acciones nominativas.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Water Pollution Control (Code of Good Agricultural Practice) Order, 2007 (P.I. 263/2007).
Policy_Content: This Ordinance sets forth the updated version of the Code of Good Agricultural Practice. The creation of this Code comes along with the implementation of Council Directive 91/676/EEC on the protection of waters against pollution caused by nitrates from agricultural sources. The Code has the aim of promoting guidelines able to assist farmers to reduce water pollution caused by fertilizers from agricultural sources and to prevent further such pollution and to set the acceptable environmental conditions for the use of urban waste water for irrigation purposes. It mainly deals with land application of fertilizers, waste water treatment, waste water recycling and sewerage disposal.

Policy: Loi sur l’Inspection fédérale de la sécurité nucléaire (LIFSN).
Policy_Content: L’Inspection fédérale de la sécurité nucléaire (IFSN) est un établissement fédéral de droit public doté de sa propre personnalité juridique. Elle règle elle-même son organisation et tient sa propre comptabilité. L’IFSN accomplit les tâches qui lui sont assignées conformément à la législation sur l’énergie nucléaire, à la législation sur la radioprotection, à la législation sur la protection de la population et la protection civile et conformément aux dispositions concernant le transport de marchandises dangereuses. Elle participe à l’élaboration des textes législatifs et représente la Suisse auprès des institutions internationales. Elle peut soutenir des projets de recherche concernant la sécurité nucléaire. Elle peut faire appel à des tiers pour accomplir certaines tâches. Le texte comprend 26 articles répartis en 7 sections comme suit: Organisation et tâches (1); Organes (2); Personnel (3); Financement et budget (4); Indépendance et surveillance (5); Procédure et voies de droit (6); Dispositions finales (7).
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 394 validating the Regulation on the state forest control and supervision.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of the state control and supervision over forest management, conservation, protection and reproduction of forests for the purpose of enforcement of forest legislation. The state control and supervision shall be carried out by the Federal Nature Management Service and by the regional executive bodies. The state forest inspectors shall have the right: (a) to suppress and prevent the infringement of forest legislation; (b) to supervise over the observance of forest legislation; (c) to draw reports on forest management; (d) to inspect means of transport and detain them in case of necessity; and (e) to inform citizens of the results of supervision over the observance of forest legislation. The state forest control and supervision shall be carried out in the form of inspections.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Regional Law No.68-ZAO “On regulation of forest relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law grants the right of timber extraction to citizens for individual personal needs for heating, housing construction and other personal purposes in forest fund. Damaged, dry and overmature standing timber of forest species shall be primarily destined for felling. Timber extraction by citizens shall be carried out in accordance with purchase and sale contracts of forest species. Small ethnic communities of the North the aforesaid communities shall be granted the right of timber extraction for free as traditional rights. Upon completion of timber extraction operations citizens must provide for land clearing. Citizens shall have the right of procurement non-timber edible and non-edible products free of charge and without any authorization. Non-timber forest products procured by citizens for individual personal needs shall become their property.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Estrategia de Lucha contra la Desertificación, la Degradación de la Tierra y los Efectos de la Sequía.
Policy_Content: La presente Estrategia MERCOSUR de Lucha contra la Desertificación, la Degradación de la Tierra y los Efectos de la Sequía se inscribe en el marco de la Convención de las Naciones Unidas de Lucha contra la Desertificación y la Sequía y, en particular, en su Anexo III de Aplicación Regional para América Latina y el Caribe. El documento fue elaborado por el Grupo Ad hoc de Lucha contra la Desertificación y la Sequía que fuera creado en 2005 durante la IV Reunión de Ministros de Medio de Ambiente del MERCOSUR. La visión de esta Estrategia es que el MERCOSUR habrá consolidado un modelo de lucha contra la desertificación, rehabilitación de tierras degradadas y la mitigación de los efectos de la sequía contribuyendo, de este modo, al desarrollo regional sostenible y se habrá proyectado como bloque en el debate regional e internacional sobre estas materias. El objetivo superior es el de contribuir al desarrollo sostenible de los Estados Parte y Asociados del MERCOSUR a través de la lucha contra la desertificación, la degradación de la tierra y los efectos de la sequía, así como contribuir al logro de los Objetivos de Desarrollo del Milenio y los objetivos de otras estrategias relacionadas y de interés para los Estados Parte y Asociados, específicamente las estrategias de reducción de la pobreza y de seguridad alimentaria. Se establecen los siguientes objetivos específicos: 1) Manejo sostenible de la tierra; 2) Fortalecimiento institucional; 3) Gestión del conocimiento; 4) Comercio de Productos generados en zonas afectadas o susceptibles.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Land & soil
Keyword: Biodiversity,Desertification,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Food security,Erosion,Poverty

Policy: Law of Georgia on Legalising Property (No. 5014–IS of 2007)
Policy_Content: This Law aims to provide additional guarantees for ensuring protection of the private property rights recognised by Article 21 of the Constitution of Georgia, the international agreements of Georgia and other Legislations. All government bodies and officials shall be obliged to ensure guaranteed protection and inviolability of the private property rights. This Law shall apply to any property of the State or a self-government unit, the right of ownership of which was acquired or the grounds for acquiring the right of ownership was originated from a legal act or a transaction occurring before entry into force of this Law, except for property defined under paragraph 2 of Article 4. This Law shall not apply to: (a) property that is prohibited to be privatised under Article 4 of the Law of Georgia on State Property; (b) property, that by the time of entry into force of this Law, is subject of a court dispute (one of the parties to which is the State or a self-government unit) or administrative proceeding on the right of ownership or annulment of the grounds for acquiring the right of ownership; (c) property, that by the time of entry into force of this Law is under investigation in order to establish the legality of the ownership of the property (the grounds for acquiring the right of ownership); (d) property defined under Chapter XLIV of the Civil Procedure Code and Chapter VII of the Administrative Procedure Code of Georgia; (e) property acquired by submitting a fraudulent document; and (f) a parcel of land designated for the construction and operation of oil and gas pipelines and related facilities under- and aboveground.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Private land,Property rights,Ownership,Local government,Public land,Transfer,Court/tribunal,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Foreign land tenure

Policy: Order No. 156 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on the procurement of soft resin.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of procuring soft resin by citizens and legal persons in accordance with regional forest plans, forestry or forest park development plans and forest management plans in accordance with forest plot leases. Resin boxing shall consist of three stages: the preparatory stage, which shall include forest clearing, branch cutting and selection of trees for resin boxing; the main stage, which shall include periodical scoring of trees and collecting and packaging soft resin; and. the final stage, which shall include dismantling equipment and cleaning the land. Mature and overly mature forests shall be designated for the procurement of soft resin. Resin boxing shall be prohibited for the following categories of forest species: (a) forests with any outbreak of pests or diseases until their eradication; (b) forest plantations damaged by forest fires; (c) forests where clear cutting or selective cutting of mature forests and forests for timber extraction is prohibited; and (d) seed plantations.
Subject: Forestry

The text consists of 12 sections divided into 3 Parts as follows: Definitions (1); Soil amendment storage (2); Application of soil amendments to land (3). One Schedule is enclosed.

Policy: Environment and Genetic Engineering Act (No. 9 of 2017).
Policy_Content: This Act helps promulgate safeguard of the environment and applies to the production and use of genetically modified organisms in plants, animals, micro-organisms, cell cultures and virus. The Act also applies to territorial waters and the fishing territory, to the processing, storage, bottling, packaging, repackaging and to waste management. Genetically modified organisms may only be manufactured, used, imported, transported, exposed, sold or marketed following laboratory research and approval by the Danish Ministry of Environment and Food. Medical substances or preparations produced for human consumption consisting of or containing manufactured genetically modified organisms do not require approval if their release is approved under other EU legislation meeting the requirements for approval under Directive 2001/18 / EC of 12 March 2001, article 5. The validity of the first approval for marketing may not exceed 10 years. Other approvals (part or whole of authorization) may be time-limited (art. 16.2). Approval may change the terms of licenses and issue an Order if it is justified on grounds of environment, nature or health, cleaner technologies, production methods or improved treatment forms have been developed (art. 17).
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries

Policy: Estonian National Strategic Reference Framework 2007-2013

Its main objective is fast and sustainable development, which entails rise of competitiveness of the economy; increased social cohesion; and more sustainable use of environment.

Policy: Decision No. 714/2007/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council repealing Council Directive 68/89/EEC on the approximation of the laws of the Member States concerning the classification of wood in the rough.
Policy_Content: By this Decision, the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union state that the methods of measurement and classification provided for by Directive 68/89/EEC are no longer necessary for the purposes of the internal market. Therefore those provisions are repealed as from 31 December 2008.

Policy: Arrêté sur les feux de déchets en plein air.
Policy_Content: Dans l'objectif de protéger la santé de la population contre les polluants dégagés lors de l'incinération de déchets en plein air (poussières fines, oxydes d'azote, composés organiques volatils et dioxines), le présent arrêté vise à une application harmonisée et simplifiée de la part des autorités communales en précisant le cadre de l'interdiction des feux de déchets en plein air, ainsi que les modalités de l'octroi de dérogations dans des situations exceptionnelles. Le texte comprend 6 articles.

Policy: Ley Nº 7.722 - Prohíbe el uso de sustancias químicas en los procesos mineros metalíferos.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley prohíbe en todo el territorio de la Provincia de Mendoza el uso de sustancias químicas como cianuro, mercurio, ácido sulfúrico y otras sustancias tóxicas similares en los procesos mineros metalíferos de cateo, prospección, exploración, explotación o industrialización de minerales metalíferos obtenidos a través de cualquier método extractivo. La prohibición tiene por objetivo garantizar la protección de los recursos naturales, con especial atención a los recursos hídricos.

Policy_Content: This Law stipulates that methods of water management shall be based on national legislation and international agreements. The Government shall validate methods of water management of Kambarata and Toktogul water reservoirs taking into account their specific value. The methods of water management validated by the Government shall be reflected in all contracts for the construction, operation and management of waterworks. Contracts and agreements without clauses requiring the observance of methods of water management shall be considered invalid.

Policy: Arrêté nº 5053 définissant les directives nationales d'aménagement durable des concessions forestières.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté définit les directives nationales d'aménagement durable des concessions forestières, qui constituent le cadre référentiel national pour l'élaboration des plans d'aménagement des concessions forestières dans l'objectif d'une gestion et d'une conservation durables des ressources forestières. Les séries d'aménagement, qui varient selon les spécificités de chaque concession forestière, sont: la série de production;la série de conservation; la série de protection; la série de développement communautaire; la série de recherche scientifique.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 385 validating the Regulation on aerial protection of forests.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities for aerial protection of forests against fires, pests and insects, and for ensuring the sanitary safety of forests. Aerial protection shall be carried out in regard to: (a) forests pertaining to regional property; (b) forest plots within forest stock managed by regional executive bodies in accordance with article 83 of the Forest Code; (c) forest plots within forest stock managed by the Federal Forest Agency in accordance with article 83 of the Forest Code; (d) forest plots within federally administered protected areas. Aerial protection against forest fires shall be carried out if and when identification and extinguishment of forest fires on the ground is impeded or impossible. Aerial protection shall include: (a) aerial patrol; (b) forest fire prevention; (c) use of technical means; (d) prevention of natural disasters caused by forest fires; and (d) forest pathology monitoring.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Presidential Decree No. UP-3886 amending Presidential Decree No. UP-2086 on single land tax.
Policy_Content: Item 6 shall be amended to add the following wording: “In case of voluntary liquidation of economic entities having status of legal persons, calculation and application of single land tax shall stop from the moment of notification of registration authority on liquidation. In case on incompleteness of the liquidation procedure within time period established by law and also in case of cessation of the voluntary liquidation procedure and renewal of activity of economic entity having status of legal persons single land tax shall be collected for the whole period of applied preferential terms.”
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

It also sets forth calculation formula and establishes the modalities of calculation of environmental fees for natural resources. Annex contains model form of declaration containing calculated environmental fees for the use of natural resources.

Policy: Law on civil protection.
Policy_Content: The present Law implements the Federal Civil and Population Protection Act of 4 October 2002 and the Federal Act of 6 October 1966 on protection of cultural heritage in case of armed conflict, disasters or emergency situation. In particular, the present Law lays down provisions relating to the correct and efficient implementation of the afore-mentioned Federal Act. The text consists of 19 articles divided in 9 Parts as follows: Tasks (I); Organization (II); Vocational training (III); Competences (IV); Schutzbauten (V); Cultural heritage protection (VI); Financing (VII); Data retrieval (VIII); Final provisions (IX).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Law enters into force on 1 January 2008.

Policy: Law on population protection.
Policy_Content: The present Law implements the Federal Population and Civil Protection Act of 4 October 2002. In particular, the Law lays down provisions relating to the correct and efficient implementation of the afore-mentioned Federal Act in the Canton Luzern. The Law regulates the protection of the population in case of disasters, emergencies and armed conflicts. Moreover, it establishes the responsibilities of municipalities and Canton and defines the guidance and cooperation with partner organizations. The text consists of 19 articles divided into 5Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Responsibilities and alert (II); Property and procedural law (III); Penalties (IV); Final provisions (V).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Law enters into force on 1 January 2008.

Policy: Regional Law No. 152-ZO “On procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest resources by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens shall have the right of free stay in forests for the purpose of procurement of non-timber forest resources free of charge for individual personal needs without re-sale thereof. It shall be applicable to non-edible non-timber forest products for construction, reconstruction, repairs of residential facilities and heating of residential facilities. During their stay in forests citizens must comply with forest fire safety requirements, sanitary, afforestation and reforestation requirements. Felling of trees for the procurement of birchbark and tanbark shall be prohibited. Collection of birchbark shall be performed from dry stand, wind fallen trees and felled trees on felling sites all the year round. Fuelwood collection with diameter up to 8 cm shall be carried out all the year round. Stay of citizens on forests for procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest products can be restricted or prohibited in accordance with Forest Code.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 377 validating the Regulation on forest management.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree regulates forest management of the forest estate, urban forests and forested protected areas. Forest management shall include: (a) projecting of forestry and forest parks; (b) projecting of commercial forests, protection forest, unexploited forest, protection forest and protected forest plots; (c) projecting of the forest plots; (d) mapping; and (e) forest protection arrangements. Classification of forests shall be carried out as follows: (a) commercial forest for timber extraction; (b) protection forests where timber extraction can be authorized if it complies with protection functions thereof; and (c) unexploited forest where timber extraction shall be prohibited for the period of 20 years. Forest management shall be carried out in accordance with forest organization instruction validated by the Ministry of Natural Resources.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Public forest,Forest management/forest conservation,Protected area,Protection forest,Inventory
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Las presentes disposiciones son de observancia obligatoria para los distribuidores y las empresas que se dediquen a las actividades mencionadas.

Policy: Order No. 169 of the Federal Supervision Service in the Sphere of Nature Management validating Methodical Instructions on research on the territory of state nature reserves and national parks.
Policy_Content: State nature reserves and national parks have the status of scientific research institutions carrying out scientific and technical activity. Scientific research includes: (a) fundamental scientific research related to acquisition of new data on regularities of natural and anthropogenic processes and environment as a whole; and (b) applied research aimed at elaboration of scientific methods of environmental protection and ecological monitoring. Scientific and technical activity includes: (a) complex ecological monitoring; (b) inventory of natural, historical and cultural complexes and objects; and (c) creation of geoinformation systems and related databases. Scientific research and technical activity shall be in line with priorities elaborated with the consideration of the specifics of each protected area and the requested information by the federal and regional executive bodies.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 170 of the Federal Supervision Service in the Sphere of Nature Management validating Methodical Instructions on ecological educational activity on the territory of state nature reserves and national parks.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the objectives and targets of ecological educational activity on the territory of state nature reserves and national parks with a view of ensuring support of the functioning of state nature reserves and national parks by wide sections of the population, assistance to the solution of regional ecological problems and formation of ecological consciousness and promotion of ecological culture among the population. State nature reserves and national parks have the status of environmental protection, scientific research and ecological educational institutions. Ecological education shall be carried out by specialized units of state nature reserves and national parks.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regulation concerning method of making available information on environment.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of 12 paragraphs and one Annex, lays down: (1) method of making available information on the environment, specified in art.30 of the Environment Protection Act; (2) minimal scope of information made available; (3) form of the information; (3) frequency of making information available. Information on the environment is made available via public telecommunication network in the form of: processed results of measurements; annual evaluation of quality or classification prepared for the last year; long-term evaluation of quality or classifications concerning directions and dynamics of changes; comments, including methods applied for examination and measurement. Minimum scope of information is defined for: air quality (paragraph 5); soil or land quality (paragraph 6); prevention from noise pollution (paragraph 7); prevention from electro-magnetic fields (paragraph 8); quality of surface waters (paragraph 9); generation and management of wastes (paragraph 10); quality of underground waters (paragraph 11). Information on environment can be also made available via mass media.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Land & soil, Water
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: The Regulation enters into force 14 days after publication in the Journal of Laws.

Policy: Regulation establishing the form of publicly available index of documents containing information on the environment and its protection.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of five paragraphs and one Annex, establishes the form (specified in the Annex) of publicly available index of documents containing information on the environment and its protection. This index is composed of information cards containing data enabling searching and making documents available. The index is prepared for each category of documents.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 508 validating the Regulation on issuance of authorization for work with ozone depleting substances.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of issuance of authorization for work with ozone depleting substances. Natural and legal persons shall submit to the issuing authority the following documentation: (a) application in accordance with the form contained in the Annex 1; (b) copy of registration as legal person or individual entrepreneur; and (c) data contained in the Annex 2. The period of validity of the authorization for work with ozone depleting substances shall be one calendar year.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 232/2007 on the assessment of the effects of certain plans and programmes on the environment.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law is composed of 14 articles and one Annex. It introduces in the national legal order Directive 2001/42/EC on the assessment of the effects of certain plans and programmes on the environment and Directive 2003/35/EC providing for public participation in respect of the drawing up of certain plans and programmes relating to the environment. In particular, it defines the contents of environmental assessment, regulates the Environmental Declaration and consultation process with relevant stakeholders. Finally, it rules on control procedures. The Annex provides the criteria for defining the probability of significant environmental effects.

Policy: Enforcement Code (Act No. 705 of 2007).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for procedures and conditions of enforcement of obligations or injunctions in private law including an obligation to transfer real estate or specific chattels to another and an obligation to transfer into the possession of another real estate, a building, accommodations, other premises or a part thereof or an obligation to move there from. The Act, among other things, defines jurisdiction of court in matters affecting real estate and provides for the legal confirmation of the possession of real estate.

Policy: Clean Coal Technology Special Agreement Act 2007.
Policy_Content: The object of this Act is to accelerate the development, demonstration and widespread implementation and use of clean coal technology by encouraging collaborative investment, by the State and the coal industry, in research, development and demonstration.

Policy: Act No. 40 of 2007 on reindeer herding.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Act is to promote the ecologically-sustainable reindeer husbandry based on Sami culture, traditions and customs. The Act provides for rights and duties of reindeer herders; regulates the relationship with other economic activities having regard to the general interest; regulates the relationship between reindeer herders as far as necessary; and lays the foundation for administration and organization of reindeer husbandry. The Act  provides for the establishment of reindeer  districts which shall be administered by a district council. There shall also be a reindeer management fund for each district. Other provisions of the Act concern, among other things, marking of reindeer, expropriation for reindeer grazing purposes and the establishment of a Reindeer Council.
Subject: Livestock, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Regional Law No. 265-49 “On land control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes general principles for exercising state control over land tenure and land management on the regional territory with a view of enforcement of land legislation. Land control shall be carried out by the authorized state regional institution. The scope of state land control shall be to ensure compliance with land legislation by all natural and legal persons, officials, prevention and identification of land offences. The main directions of land control shall be as follows: (a) observance of land tenure in accordance with zoning and land-use planning; (b) identification of illegally occupied land parcels; and (c) prevention of soil pollution, littering and other damage to land plots.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ley general de los pueblos y comunidades indígenas del Estado de Durango.
Policy_Content: Esta Ley establece disposiciones para el desarrollo, reconocimiento,  preservación y defensa de los derechos y cultura de los pueblos y comunidades indígenas. A tal fin la Ley establece que el Estado y los Municipios deban incluir dentro de sus planes y programas de desarrollo a las comunidades indígenas de los pueblos asentados en el territorio estatal. La Ley prevé la participación de los pueblos y comunidades indígenas en la planeación del desarrollo económico.  Cabe destacar el Título Cuarto en materia de tierra, territorio y recursos naturales (arts. 74-84). Estas disposiciones reconocen a los pueblos y comunidades indígenas como los legítimos propietarios y poseedores de las tierras que integran su territorio, además de beneficiarios preferentes en la explotación de los recursos naturales localizados en dichos territorios.  Por otro lado, el capítulo V del Título Segundo (dedicado a la familia, las mujeres y los niños indígenas) reconoce entre otros el derecho de las mujeres indígenas de adquirir bienes por transmisión hereditaria o por cualquier otro medio legal.
Subject: Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Agricultural land,Urban land,Indigenous peoples,Gender,Inheritance,Common property,Land tenure,Traditional rights/customary rights
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Ley para la prevención y gestión integral de residuos del Estado de Durango.
Policy_Content: Sobre la base del derecho de toda persona al medio ambiente adecuado y en el contexto del desarrollo sustentable, la presente Ley establece el marco normativo para la prevención y gestión integral de residuos del Estado de Durango. En especial sus disposiciones tienen por objeto la prevención, la generación, la valorización y la gestión integral de los residuos sólidos urbanos y de manejo especial; la prestación del servicio público de limpieza; prevenir la contaminación de sitios y llevar a cabo su remediación, así como aplicar los principios de valorización, responsabilidad compartida y manejo integral de residuos, bajo criterios de eficiencia ambiental, tecnológica, económica y social. Para ello la Ley formula una clasificación básica y general de los residuos, determina los criterios que deberán de ser considerados en la generación y gestión integral de los residuos, para prevenir y controlar la contaminación del medio ambiente y la protección de la salud humana. Asimismo se identifican las responsabilidades de los productores, comerciantes, consumidores y autoridades de los diferentes niveles de gobierno, así como de los prestadores de servicios en el manejo integral de los residuos. Por otro lado se crea un sistema de información relativa a la generación y gestión integral de los residuos peligrosos, sólidos urbanos y de manejo especial, así como de sitios contaminados y remediados. Por último la Ley dispone en tema de reparación de daños (arts. 100-104) e introduce el régimen sancionatorio aplicable (arts. 92-99).
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Right to clean/healthy environment,Pollution control,Waste management,Hazardous substances,Soil rehabilitation,Solid waste,Waste disposal,Waste domestic sources,Waste prevention,Hazardous waste,Liability/compensation,Access-to-information,Offences/penalties,Human rights
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 90-Z “On modalities and rates of timber extraction, procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest resources, edible forest resources and medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that regional residents shall have the right to procure fuelwood and timber for housing construction in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species. Application for obtaining the right of procurement of fuelwood and timber must be submitted to the authorized regional forest institution and must contain the following data: (a) full name of the applicant; (b) personal identity document data; (c) residence address (as reported in the personal identity document); (d) purposeful use of timber; and (e) requested amount of timber (art. 1). The period of timber extraction and logging shall not exceed 12 months from the date of conclusion of purchase and sale contract (art. 2).
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 148-ZO “On procurement by citizens of non-timber edible forest resources and medicinal plants for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens shall have the right of free stay in forests for the purpose of procurement of edible non-timber forest resources (wild growing fruits, berries, mushrooms, seeds, wood juices etc.)  and medicinal plants free of charge for individual personal needs without re-sale. Collection and harvesting of non-timber edible products shall be carried out manually, without use of various mechanical tools. Collection of non-timber edible products shall be carried out in the period of complete ripeness thereof. Felling of fruit bearing trees for the purpose of collection of fruits shall be prohibited. Collection of plants shall be carried out in the period of florification. Stay of citizens on forests for procurement and harvesting of non-timber forest products can be restricted or prohibited in accordance with Forest Code.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Forestry, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Fruits/edible nuts,Forest species,Planting material/seeds,Early warning system/emergency intervention system
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
