Policy: Regional Decree No. 236-p validating the Regulation on state nature complex reserve of regional significance “Gagul hollow”.
Policy_Content: The scope of constituting protected area - state nature biological reserve of regional significance “Gagul hollow” shall be conservation and reproduction of wild fauna species in the high-mountainous water-marsh complex (waterfowl, semiaquatic birds, mammals), rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species, protection and reproduction of game subject to commercial hunting, protection of unified landscape complex as habitat for wildlife species, tourism for the purpose of watching wild animals in nature. he reserve shall perform the following functions: (a) conservation of biodiversity of the unique natural landscape of the high-mountain zone of the Western Sayan; (b) maintaining optimal conditions for reproduction and migration of wild fauna species, including species listed in the national and regional Red Books of protected and endangered species; and (c) monitoring of the natural environment, wildlife, performance of scientific research. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature complex reserve: (a) hunting and hunting management; (b) clear cutting and selective cutting with a view of timber extraction, except for timber extraction by local residents for individual personal needs; (c) procurement of soft resin; (d) blasting operations; (e) hydro amelioration, irrigation, exploration of subsoil and mining; (f) blasting operations; (g) water logging; (h) procurement of edible and non-edible non-timber forest products and medicinal plants, except for procurement thereof for individual personal needs by local residents; (i) burning of vegetation; (j) storage and application of toxic chemicals and other hazardous substances; (l) movement and parking of motor vehicles outside roads of common access (except for service vehicles); (m) littering with household waste and garbage; and (n) destruction or damaging of barriers, boards and other information displays and indication signs.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Wetlands,Mountain area,Protection of habitats,Tourism,Research,Management/conservation,Wild fauna,Game,Wild flora,Biodiversity,Endangered species,Birds,Monitoring,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Decree enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Sustainable Development Act (S.N.L. 2007, c. S-34).
Policy_Content: The present Act lays down provisions relating to the sustainable development of natural resources in the province of Newfoundland. Section 5 establishes a Newfoundland and Labrador Sustainable Development Round Table. The Round Trable shall: a) promote the sustainable development of the natural resources of the province; b) provide advice and make recommendations and report to the Lieutenant-Governor in Council and the Minister Act; c) consider the use of and access to natural resources by residents of the province; d) create awareness and understanding of the sustainable development of natural resources in the province; e) cooperate in the sharing of knowledge and experience with respect to the sustainable development of natural resources among public bodies, private industry, non-governmental organizations and residents of the province; f) advise the Minister on the development of a natural resource sustainable development strategy for the province; g) advise the minister on the development of sustainability indicators for natural resources in the province; h) at request review legislation, policy, and programs for consistency with natural resource sustainable development principles and guidelines; and i) carry out another direction that the minister may require with respect to natural resource sustainable development. The text consists of 15 sections divided into 4 Parts as follows: Round Table on Sustainable Development (I); Sustainable development strategies (II); Implementation (III); Regulations and commencement (IV).
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Basic legislation,Pollution control,Institution,Education,Data collection/reporting,Environmental planning,Environmental standards,Enforcement/compliance,Sustainable development

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 153 validating the Regulation on the use of area-specific forestry seeds of common tree species.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree stipulates that the use of forestry seeds shall be carried out in accordance with specific forest areas and envisages the subdivision of the territory of the Russian Federation to such areas. Area of the origin of forestry seeds shall be specified in the certificate attesting variety and sowing quality of forestry seeds. The aims of area-specific forestry seeds of common tree species shall be to: (a) grow planting material; (b) effect artificial or combined reforestation; (c) create tree and shrub plantations; (d) establish federal seed stock of forest species; and (e) plant greenery.

Policy: Order No. 605 on subsidy for maintenance and conservation of wetlands.
Policy_Content: The Danish AgriFish Agency shall establish regulations concerning the grant of subsidies for the maintenance of wetlands in agricultural and natural areas, as part of the Agency's projects for the construction of wetlands; and  in agricultural and natural areas included in the Agency's projects referred to in the EU-Directive on the criteria for awarding funds for wetland restorations. If applications for subsidy include areas which are part of a project for the maintenance and care given to owners and tenants, priorities shall be set in collaboration with the Danish Forest and Nature Agency within the project framework. Agreements for funding shall begin from 1 September following the date in which the project is completed and ending on 31 August of the following 20 years. Areas shall not be targeted for forestry. These areas are not subject to imposed forest reserve obligations. Pledge year begins on 1 September ending on 31 August of the following year. Criteria for subsidy in this Order does not apply to areas covered by easements pursuant to Order No. 892 of 22 September 2005, Order No. 893 of 22 September 2005, or by easements related to subsidy agreement for the establishment of wetlands pursuant to Order No. 187 of 20 March 2003 and Order No. 84 of 12 February 2004. Areas should be designated as pasture or natural. If commitment areas are classified as grassland, heath vegetation or other vegetation suitable for grazing and cutting, the existing vegetation shall be maintained. Forest areas where drainage conditions do not hinder plant cover must be planted with more than 25% nitrogen-fixing plants. The Danish AgriFish may grant exemptions to plant and vegetation cover, and may be amended to the benefit of the environment.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Energy Corporation Act (S.N.L. 2007, c. E-11.01).
Policy_Content: The present Act lays down provisions relating to the establishment of an Energy Corporation for the Province and sets out the mandate, powers and management structure of the Energy Corporation of Newfoundland and Labrador as a Crown Agency. Section 5 establishes that the objects of the corporation are to invest in, engage in, and carry out activities in all areas of the energy sector in the province and elsewhere, including, a) the development, generation, production, transmission, distribution, delivery, supply, sale, export, purchase and use of power from wind, water, steam, gas, coal, oil, hydrogen or other products used or useful in the production of power; b) the exploration for, development, production, refining, marketing and transportation of hydrocarbons and products from hydrocarbons; c) the manufacture, production, distribution and sale of energy related products and services; and d) research and development. The text consists of 37 sections.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Regional Law No. 68-OZ “On delimitation of authority of government bodies in the sphere of forest relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes delimitation of plenary powers of regional administration between the regional government authorities. Regional Legislative Assembly shall have the following competence: (a) validates regional laws in the sphere of forest management; (b) establishment of the modalities and rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs; (c) establishment of the modalities of procurement and collection of edible non-timber forest resources and medicinal plant for individual personal needs; (d) establishment procurement of non-timber forest products for individual personal needs; (e) establishment of the rules of forest management for hunting purposes; and (f) establishment of exceptional cases of timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contracts of forest species.  Governor validates regional forest plan. Regional Government shall have the following plenary powers: (a) ownership and management of public forest parcels; (b) forest fees and charges; (c) timber extraction tariffs; and (d) modalities of conclusion of purchase and sale contracts of forest species.

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución reglamenta el Incentivo a la productividad para la fortalecimiento de la asistencia técnica (IAT), que es un apoyo económico destinado a financiar una parte del monto total de los gastos en que un productor incurra con ocasión de la contratación del servicio de asistencia técnica para el desarrollo de proyectos productivos que comprendan una actividad agrícola, pecuaria, acuícola o forestal.

Policy: Law No. 5685 on geothermal resources and natural mineral waters.
Policy_Content: This Law sets forth the rules and principles for exploring, producing and protecting geothermal and natural mineral water resources. Geothermal and natural mineral waters belong to the State. A special licence is required to carry out exploration activities. The licence may be issued according to the procedure regulated by these provisions and shall be valid for three years. An operational licence is necessary to exploit the resources above-mentioned. Operational licences are valid for 30 years and may be extended for 10 years. Exploration and operational licences are transferable. Site activities are subject to annual inspections by the General Directorate of Minerals Research and Exploration.
Subject: Energy, Land & soil, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 29.165 - Crea el Servicio Nacional de Registro y Control de la Comercialización de Minerales y Metales.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto tiene por objeto la creación del Servicio Nacional de Registro y Control de la Comercialización de Minerales y Metales (SENARECOM), como entidad pública que, bajo tuición del Ministerio de Minería y Metalurgia, se encargará de regular y controlar las actividades de comercialización interna y externa de minerales y metales. Además de las tareas de registro, el SENARECOM será responsable de administrar el sistema nacional de información sobre comercialización y exportaciones de minerales y metales.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Regional Law No. 50-ZS "On protection of the population and the territory against natural and technological disasters".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters within the plenary powers of regional authorities established by the acting legislation of the Russian Federation. Regional early warning system shall be integral part of the national early warning system. Information of the population of natural and technological disasters shall be done with a view of risk assessment and reduction of damages from the outbreak of natural and technological disasters. Authorized state environmental institution shall be responsible for timely supply of reliable information, related to disasters, to the population.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 75-OZ “On delimitation of plenary powers between state bodies in the sphere of forest relations”.
Policy_Content: Regional Administration shall be invested with the following plenary powers in the sphere of forest relations: (a) establishment of timber extraction and public forest lease fees; (b) validation of forestry development plans of forest districts; (c) validation of the list of forestry officials authorized to perform forest inspection; and (d) establishment of rates of payment of fees by citizens in accordance with purchase and sale contracts of forest species for individual personal needs.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decisión Nº 668 - Plan Andino de Lucha contra la Corrupción.
Policy_Content: La presente Decisión aprueba el Plan Andino de Lucha contra la Corrupción y se crea el Comité  Ejecutivo Andino del Plan de Lucha contra la Corrupción. La Secretaría General de la Comunidad Andina ejercerá las funciones  de Secretaría Técnica del Comité Ejecutivo Andino del Plan de Lucha contra la  Corrupción. El Objetivo general del Plan es promover el establecimiento de políticas, estrategias, metas y mecanismos para aumentar  la eficacia y eficiencia en la lucha contra la corrupción que realizan los Países Miembros de  la Comunidad Andina, a través de acciones de cooperación, en el marco de las  legislaciones nacionales y de las convenciones internacionales sobre la materia, con el fin  de compatibilizar la normativa de los Países Miembros, en aquellos casos que su  ordenamiento jurídico interno lo permita, y adoptar estrategias comunes para coadyuvar a la  erradicación de prácticas y delitos de corrupción en el ámbito comunitario, mediante la  prevención, investigación, sanción de éstos y, cuando proceda, la recuperación de activos.

Policy: Act No LX of 2007 providing the framework for the implementation of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change and of the Kyoto Protocol.
Policy_Content: This Act applies to natural and legal entities operating in the field of reduction and/or absorption of greenhouse gas emissions. In accordance with Article 3, the National Assembly adopts the National Climate Change Strategy for the period of 2008-2025, for the first time, in compliance with international commitments. The National Assembly adopts also a National Climate Change Program for every two-year period. The minister in charge of energy policy prepares the National Emissions Inventory and he establishes and operates the National Registry System as well. Article 5 provides for the national emission trading registry which is kept by the environmental protection authority and its data is publicly accessible. The national reporting is to be fulfilled by the minister in compliance with EU regulations and international commitments. Articles 8-10 provide rules for the creation, termination and management of carbon units under the Kyoto Protocol. Articles 11-13/E concern the participation of Hungary in the international flexibility mechanisms.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Access-to-information,Air quality/air pollution,Climate change,Data collection/reporting,International agreement-implementation,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Act entered into force on 27 July 2007. The last consolidated version of the Act entered into force on 15 January 2015.

Policy: Loi sur l'appui au développement économique (LADE).
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour but de soutenir la promotion et le développement économique du canton et des régions propres à maintenir ou créer de la valeur ajoutée. L’article 2 établit que l’Etat: a) s’assure que les principes du développement durable sont respectés; b) privilégie un développement économique équilibré en veillant à réduire les disparités; c) contribue à renforcer la vitalité et la compétitivité économique; d) favorise la diversité des activités, la préservation et la création d’emplois; d) favorise la collaboration, la coordination et l’échange d’expérience entre les milieux privés et publics au niveau régional, cantonal et supra cantonal. Le texte comprend 44 articles répartis en 7 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Promotion économique du canton (II); Valorisation des potentiels économiques et territoriaux du canton et des régions (III); Encouragement de l'innovation et de la diversification de l'économie privée (IV); Procédure (V); Dispositions financières (VI); Dispositions finales et transitoires (VII).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Ley de fomento al uso racional de la energía para el Estado de Coahuila.
Policy_Content: Por la presente Ley se establecen las bases generales para fomentar el uso racional de energía y promover el aprovechamiento de la energía renovable en el Estado de Coahuila.  En primer lugar la Ley define las competencias del Ejecutivo del Estado en materia de uso racional de la energía. Entre sus cometidos cabe destacar el diseño y la ejecución del Plan Estatal de Ahorro de Energía. Además la Ley crea el Consejo Consultivo para el Ahorro de Energía en el Estado. En el Capítulo Quinto se definen las acciones que las autoridades competentes llevarán a cabo a fin de promover el uso de las fuentes de energía renovables. Entre dichas acciones se incluyen las siguientes: la introducción de tecnologías limpias en el Estado y la sustitución de combustibles altamente contaminantes, incentivando así la protección del medio ambiente; fomentar el uso de energía renovable en el desarrollo de viviendas, fraccionamientos, edificaciones y demás obras de infraestructura en el Estado; fomentar el uso de energía renovable en la instalación de nuevas empresas e industrias en el Estado, así como en aquéllas ya instaladas que pudieran disminuir sus consumos de energía y generar un ahorro de energía; coadyuvar en la creación de una educación y cultura ambiental en torno al uso y al aprovechamiento de fuentes de energía renovables.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: National Agricultural and Rural Development Strategy (NARDS).
Policy_Content: The National Agricultural and Rural Development Strategy (NARDS) is a cross-sectoral strategy addressing agricultural and rural development of the country. The national strategy covers the period 2007-2013. Its main objective is to strengthen the ability of Macedonian agriculture to compete in the integrated regional markets of the European Union and south-eastern Europe through measures to increase the efficiency of agricultural production, processing and marketing, and to build appropriate, effective public and private institutions; to improve farm incomes; to ensure that consumers have access to safe, healthy food; to optimize the use of scarce land, forest and water resources, in an environmentally sustainable manner; and to build viable rural communities through sustainable rural development.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Land & soil, Water

Policy: Land Use Planning Act, 2007 (Act No. 6 of 2007).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision with respect to the procedures and processes in accordance with which land use in a planning area or zone are prescribed, managed, monitored and evaluated. The Act sets out the fundamental principles of land use, establishes land use planning authorities and provides with respect to land planing procedures and authorizations. The Act sets out matters to be included in all land use plans (also relating to water and forest resources) and sets out requirements of environmental protection.

Policy: China’s National Climate Change Programme.
Policy_Content: This China's National Climate Change Program, as the country's first global warming policy initiative, is a cross-sectoral policy document for the period of 2007-2010.   The strategic goal of China to respond to climate change is to make significant achievements in controlling greenhouse gas emissions, to enhance the capability of continuous adaptation to climate change, to promote climate change related science, technology and R&D to a new level, to remarkably raise public awareness on climate change, and to further strengthen the institutions and mechanisms on climate change.

Policy: Agricultural Science and Technology Development Plan (2006-2020).

Policy: Regional Law No. 52-ZKO “On state support and stimulation of rural consumer cooperation”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of state support and stimulation of rural consumer cooperation, establishes forms and methods thereof. The main tasks of this Regional Law shall be as follows: (a) involvement of rural consumer cooperation in rendering social services to rural population; (b) raising level of welfare of the rural population by guaranteed supply of commodities and services; (c) stimulation of purchase of agricultural commodities from regional rural population; and (d) raising employment level of the rural population. State support of rural consumer cooperation shall be regulated by contracts concluded with the Regional Administration.

Policy: Regla Nº  1/07 – Regla para la regularización de la tenencia de la tierra.
Policy_Content: La presente Regla tiene por objeto el procedimiento de regularización de la tenencia de la tierra de lotes urbanos de origen ejidal, comunal, federal, estatal, municipal o de propiedad privada a favor de los avecindados, tanto para uso habitacional como para el desarrollo de opciones productivas sociales.  Dicho procedimiento, que será llevado a cabo por la Comisión para la Regularización de la Tenencia de la Tierra, se propone otorgar certeza jurídica a los avecindados en lo que se refiere a la tenencia de la tierra y los correspondientes derechos. El procedimiento de regularización consta de las siguientes etapas: a) preparación e integración del expediente; b) tramitación de la expropiación o adquisición de derechos de los inmuebles a ser regularizados; c) contratación y escrituración de lotes.

Policy: Regla Nº 2/07 - Regla para la enajenación de superficies desocupadas.
Policy_Content: La presente Regla fue adoptada por la Comisión para la Regularización de la Tenencia de la Tierra  (Corett) con el objeto de establecer los procedimientos a seguir para la enajenación de las superficies del Fondo de Tierra de la Corett, es decir aquellas tierras que han sido clasificadas como desocupadas y sin reclamante que pretenda tener derechos sobre las mismas.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 155 - Crea el Programa de Competitividad Agropecuaria y Desarrollo Rural Sostenible (PROCADERS).
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo crea el Programa de Competitividad Agropecuaria y Desarrollo Rural Sostenible (PROCADERS), como parte de la estructura orgánica del Ministerio de Agricultura, Ganadería, Acuacultura y Pesca, con el objeto de apoyar a la competitividad del sector agropecuario para que enfrente exitosa y equitativamente las nuevas condiciones de mercado y a los pequeños productores en el establecimiento, formación y fortalecimiento de alianzas estratégicas con los actores del sector.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Order No. 148 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on calculation of estimated woodcutting area.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of calculation of estimated woodcutting area. Estimated woodcutting area determines annual allowable amount of timber extraction in commercial forest and protection forest ensuring multipurposeful, rational, continual and inexhaustible forest management based upon the established cutting age, conservation of biological diversity, water protection and other protective functions of forests. Estimated woodcutting area shall be calculated for each forestry with the distribution of annual allowable amount of timber extraction among forestries with the consideration of predominant forest species. Trees and shrubbery recorded in the list of protected and endangered species, mature and overmature forest accounting for 50 cubic metres per hectare (in the European regions) and 70 cubic metres per hectare (in the Asian regions) shall not be taken into consideration in the process of calculation of estimated woodcutting area.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ordonnance sur la taxe sur le CO2 (Ordonnance sur le CO2).
Policy_Content: L’article 1er de l’ordonnance susvisée établit que la Confédération prélève une taxe sur le CO2 sur les combustibles fossiles (taxe) conformément aux articles 7 à 11 de la loi sur le CO2. Le texte comprend 34 articles répartis en 8 sections comme suit: Dispositions generals (1er); Exemption des entreprises qui ont pris un engagement formel (2); Exemption des combustibles fossils (3); Perception de la taxe sur le charbon fabriqué ou extrait en Suisse (4); Redistribution de la part du produit de la taxe revenant à la population (5); Redistribution de la part du produit de la taxe revenant aux enterprises (6); Aides financières globales pour des mesures visant à réduire les émissions de CO2 dans les bâtiments (6a); Exécution (7); Dispositions finales (8). Une annexe est jointe.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: La présente ordonnance entre en vigueur le 1er juillet 2007.

Policy: Decree of the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry amending the Decree on basic and additional measures related to environmental support and environmental special support to agriculture (No. 662 of 2007).
Policy_Content: This Decree amends the Decree of the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry on basic and additional measures related to environmental support and environmental special support to agriculture in provisions relating to, among other things: use of fertilizers near waters; management of nutrient balance; accurate nitrogen fertilization of agricultural crops; establishment and maintenance of protection zones; land cover and reduced farming in winter; combating of pests; and application of manure during the growing season.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants, Water
Keyword: Agricultural development,Farming,Subsidy/incentive,Plant production,Plant protection,Ecological production/organic production,Fertilizers/nutrients,Pests/diseases,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Pollution control

Policy: Order No. 149 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on afforestation.
Policy_Content: This Order stipulates that afforestation shall be carried out on land with forest stock and on other categories of land without previous forest growing with a view to prevent water, wind and soil erosion and to create forest protection. Afforestation shall entail the creation of artificial forest plantations by planting nurslings, seedlings, budwood and seeds. The main types of protection forests planted on arable land shall be forest belts. The afforestation process shall include: (a) determination of the location and area of the plots of land destined for afforestation; (b) preparatory arrangements; (c) soil cultivation; (d) determination of the optimal composition of tree and shrub species; (e) planting; and (f) care.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 57-OZ "On state regulation and state support of reindeer breeding".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal basis for state regulation and state support for reindeer breeding with a view of conservation of traditional nature management and traditional economic activities of small indigenous population of the North of the Russian Federation. Basic directions of state regulation of reindeer breeding shall be as follows: (a) formation and functioning of civilized market of agricultural commodities of animal products of proper production; (b) formation of market infrastructure for transportation and trade of agricultural commodities originating from reindeer breeding; (c) scientific research; and (d) economic stimulation of reindeer breeding. State support shall be granted in the form of annual subsidies, compensation of purchase of animal feedstuffs for domestic reindeer and financing of veterinary service of reindeer.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Decree No. 44 of 2007 (VI. 8.) FVM of the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development concerning certain rules to be applied in case of force majeure and amending certain decrees of agricultural interest.
Policy_Content: This Decree shall apply to agricultural, rural development and fishery measures financed by national budgetary funds and by EU funds. Events of force majeure shall be communicated to the Agricultural and Rural Development Agency who will recognize as force majeure event the events listed in Article 3.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: The consolidated text of the Decree entered into force on 19 April  2014.

Policy: Order no. 591 on subsidies for fallow buffer zones along rivers and lakes.
Policy_Content: The Ministry of Food, Agriculture and Fisheries of Denmark may grant to owners and tenants of farms to open streams and lakes over 100 m² in order to establish and maintain buffer zones in agricultural farming. Request for such subsidies shall be controlled and administered by the Ministry. The subsidy commitment period goes from 1 September in the year of application and ends on 31 August five years later.  The application applies to areas located along open streams or lakes over 100 m², to areas beginning throughout a length of less than 10 and not more than 20 meters wide, running from the river or the lake's upper edge, to areas that have been classified for non-agricultural exploitation, including small biotopes. Agricultural exploited areas do not however include forests and production of evergreen conifers or areas implementing subsidy grants in accordance to Order No. 140 of 10 March 2005, Order No. 85 of 27 January 2005, Order No. 883 of 31 October 2002 and Order no. 893 of 22 September 2005. During the committed period, these areas must not be converted, fertilized, treated with plant protection and fertilizing substances, as well as not being irrigated, used for agricultural production, exploited by incompatibility of vegetation nor used for lucrative purposes incompatible with the cultivation of crops. The Minister shall grant subsidies if the conversion is of significant benefit to the environment and if the existing commitments are significantly improved by them. The yearly subsidy shall be equivalent to 1 200 DKK/hectare; if the total amount exceeds such value, it may be co-financed be EU funding.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: Entry into force on 11 June 2007. This Order shall not apply to applications for exemptions related to agreements made pursuant to regulations under the rural development programs from before 2007.

Policy: Order No. 589 on subsidies for conversion to organic farming.
Policy_Content: The Danish AgriFish Agency may grant subsidies to owners and tenants of farms in order to convert agricultural land into organic farming  under the authorization of the Danish AgriFish Agency.  Conditions to operate organic agricultural products include that these farming areas are not afforested, that they are not eligible for forestry or buffer zones subsidy, for the conservation of wetlands which have been driven with organic agricultural production for at least 5 years prior to application, that they are not forest reserves, except for non-vegetated protected forest areas.  The period of the agreement shall begin on 1 September in the year of application and shall terminate on 31 August five years afterwards. The purpose of the conversion include the utilization of areas for agricultural purposes as land-rotation, as permanent grass, for fruit or berry production, and for non-food production or fallow. Calculation of subsidy is equivalent to 1 050 DKK/hectar.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Order No. 592 on subsidy for the care of grass and natural areas.
Policy_Content: The Danish AgriFish Agency shall grant subsidies to owners and tenants of farms and agricultural businesses, for the conversion of areas into grassland for grazing purposes. The Agency regulates the authorization of these areas’ inspection to be in line with this Order’s rules for being eligible to applications of such grants. The agreement period begins 1 September of the year of application, and ending 31 August five years later. Approval of a subsidy for an area is subject to the fact that it is not committed for grants in adherence to Order No. 140 of 10 March 2005 or earlier regulations on subsidies for agri-environmental measures, Order No. 84 of 27 January 2005, or earlier publication on environment-related grants, Order No. 883 of 31 October 2002 or earlier regulations on subsidies for organic farming, or to Order No. 893 of 22 September 2005 on subsidies for environmentally friendly management of wetlands.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Constitución de la Provincia de Corrientes.
Policy_Content: La presente Constitución provincial es la ley suprema de la Provincia de Corrientes, que forma parte inseparable de la Nación Argentina. Su autonomía es de la esencia de su gobierno y necesaria a la vez a un régimen federal indisoluble. En este contexto, la Provincia, organiza su gobierno bajo la forma representativa republicana y mantiene en su integridad todo el poder no delegado expresamente al gobierno de la Nación. La Parte Primera del texto constitucional se compone de los siguientes Títulos: I) Declaraciones, derechos y garantías; II) Nuevos derechos, declaraciones y garantías. La Parte Segunda incluye los siguientes Títulos: I) Régimen electoral; II) Gobierno provincial; III) Gobierno municipal; IV) Reforma de la Constitución.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems, Waste & hazardous substances, General
Keyword: Codified constitution,Constitutional law,Civil and political rights,Economic/social/cultural rights,Right to clean/healthy environment,Pollution control,Ecosystem preservation,Access-to-justice,Liability/compensation,Local government,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Public health,Human rights,Agricultural land,Urban land,Hazardous substances,Hazardous waste,Waste management,Water supply,Potable water,Right to water,Biodiversity,Protected area
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Lower Saxony Space and Land Use Planning Law.
Policy_Content: The present Law lays down provisions relating to space and land use planning. The land and its partition has to be developed, ordered and secured through efficient land use plans with a view to a sustainable use of natural resources. The text consists of 30 articles divided into 5 Parts as follows: General provisions relating to tasks and principles of land use planning and definition of terms (I); Special plans for use of land (II); Proceedings on land use planning (III); Further instruments to carry out planning, and co-operation (IV); Competent authorities, final provisions (V). Tow Annexes are enclosed: Contents of the Environmental Report (1); Criteria for the assessment of environmental impact (2).

Policy: Presidential Decree No. PP-649 concerning improvement of the issuance of licences for subsoil management.
Policy_Content: The President decrees to entrust State Committee on Geology and Mineral Resources with the function of issuance of licences for subsoil management, including exploration, prospecting of mineral deposits, mining and extraction of hydrocarbons. Licences shall be issued separately for each type of activity. Subsoil management shall be carried out on contractual basis on condition of product-sharing agreement. The period of validity of licence shall be specified in the licence and the date of issuance shall be the beginning date of validity. Annex 4 contains the form of licence.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy_Content: The Act amends 16 points of the Air Protection Act. The amendments concern obligations of legal persons and individuals as regards the release of polluting substances into the air. The Act also establishes obligations applicable to persons who place on the market petrol or diesel fuels.

Policy: Berlin Environmental Impact Assessment Law.
Policy_Content: The present Law lays down provisions relating to environmental impact assessment in the Land Berlin. The purpose of the Law is to ensure that assessment of environmental impact shall be carried out efficiently so that an early intervention shall be effective. The text consists of 11 sections as follows: Purpose of the Law (1); Defintioin of terms (2); Obligation of environmental impact assessment for projects, conditions and implementation (3); Obligation of strategic environmental impact assessment for plans and programmes, conditions, implementation and survey (4); Provisions on implementation (5); Participation of experts (6); Transitional provisions (7); Entry into force (11). Two Annexes are enclosed.

Policy: Regional Law No. 66-OZ “On agricultural development”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal grounds for agricultural development related to production of agricultural commodities and provision of the population with foodstuffs of the Russian origin and, in particular, produced on the regional territory. The main directions of state agrarian policy shall be: (a) ensuring food quality control; (b) conservation and reproduction of natural resources used for agricultural production; (c) formation of agricultural commodities and food market; and (d) subsidies to the producers of agricultural commodities (art. 5). State support of the producers of agricultural commodities shall be carried out in the following forms: (a) credits; (b) insurance of agricultural risks; (c) promotion of pedigree stockbreeding; (d) promotion of elite seed-growing; (e) animal production; (f) soil improvement; and (g) extension (art. 7).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 86 “On regulation of land relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that plots of public land can be allotted to natural and legal persons in ownership or in lease, in case of availability of free land areas, for use for specific purposes in accordance with purposeful classification of land. Transfer of land ownership right or transfer in lease of public land plots shall be legalized in the form of decision issued by the Regional Government. Public or municipal agricultural land can be allotted on lease to citizens on condition of short-term lease (up to three years) without the right of buyout for grazing and haymaking. Privatization of public agricultural land plots shall be performed beginning from 9 January 2050.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Act on the Energy Technology Development and Demonstration Program (EUDP) (No. 555 of 2007).
Policy_Content: This Act aims to support energy policy objectives for security, climate protection and cost effectiveness. It encourages the development of commercial potential within the energy sector. In order to set guidance within these objectivces, the European Energy Technology Development and Demonstration Programme (EDDP) is created in order to develop and approve the introduction of new energy technologies. The EUDP is managed by an independent board consisting of a chairman and six members. They are appointed by the Ministry for Tansport and Energy and have the role of decision-making, prioritization and planning. The institution may grant subsidies towards projects approved for energy production and its members are replaced every 4 years.

GEUS is an autonomous research institute governed by the Ministry of Environment and which is responsible for the scientific exploration of geology in Denmark and Greenland.

Policy: Regional Law No. 314-OZ “On delineation of responsibilities of governmental bodies in the sphere of forest relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that Regional Government shall have the following plenary powers: (a) setting charges and fees for timber extraction and purchase and trade of forest species; (b) establishment of the modalities of conclusion of purchase and trade contract related to trade of forest species. Authorized regional institution in the sphere of forest relations shall have the following plenary powers: (a) ownership and management of public forest; (b) forest management planning; and (c) forest inventory.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Regional Decree No. 218-p validating the Regulation on state nature biological reserve of regional significance “Tohtay”.
Policy_Content: The scope of constituting protected area - state nature biological reserve of regional significance “Tohtay” shall be protection of the places of mass reproduction of important from economic point of view mammals: elk, Siberian stag, roe deer, wintering grounds of elk and Siberian stag, and also spawning grounds of precious salmonid fishes. The reserve shall perform the following tasks: (a) maintenance of optimal conditions for reproduction and migration of wild fauna species, conservation and reproduction of wild fauna species, including wild fauna and wild flora species listed in the Red Book of the Russian Federation and the Red Book of the Krasnoyarsk Territory, as well as those who need special attention to their condition in the natural environment; (b) protection of spawning grounds of coreopsis (Coreopsis) and salmon trout; (c) environmental monitoring of wildlife and scientific research. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature biological reserve: (a) industrial fisheries; (b) clear and selective cutting of forest species for the purpose of timber extraction; (c) procurement of soft resin; (d) irrigation and drainage works; (e) geological exploration of subsoil and mining; (f) blasting operations; (g) water logging; (h) procurement of edible non-timber products and medicinal plants except for procurement thereof by citizens for individual personal needs); (i) burning of forest vegetation; (j) littering with household, construction, industrial and other waste and garbage; (k) storage and application of toxic chemicals and other hazardous substances; (l) movement and parking of motor vehicles outside roads of common access (except for service vehicles); (m) construction of buildings and facilities (including linear), road laying; (n) destruction or damaging of barriers, boards and other information displays and indication signs; and (o) any activity contrasting the scope of nature reserve or damaging natural complexes and components.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Protection of habitats,Monitoring,Research,Fishery management and conservation,Diadromous fish,Management/conservation,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Endangered species,Protection of species

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 69 - Comercialización de gas licuado de petróleo (GLP) a través de instalaciones centralizadas.

Policy: Regional Legislative Decree No. 12/2007/A on mining resources.
Policy_Content: This Regional Legislative Decree is composed of 11 Chapters divided in 69 articles and six Annexes. It provides the legal regime applicable to the exploration and exploitation of mining resources in Azores. The Decree classifies the types of mining areas and explorations, regulating extraction and expropriation in terms of standards and procedures. Particular attention is paid to licensing conditions and to applicable sanctions. Annexes provide standard procedures, templates and model plans.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Law No. 3.135 creating the State Policy on climate change, environment conservation and sustainable development.
Policy_Content: This Law is composed of 11 Chapters divided in 31 articles. It approves the State Policy on climate change, environment conservation and sustainable development. The Law sets the Policy’s main objectives and guidelines and institutes seven thematic programmes, respectively addressed to: education on climate change, forestry, environmental monitoring, environmental protection, clean technologies’ exchange, capacity-building for public bodies, alternative energies and greenhouse gas reduction. Particular attention is paid to financial instruments and to the creation of a dedicated State Fund. Moreover, the law regulates certification and environmental licensing procedures. Finally, it rules on a special inventory regarding all types of gas emissions’ sources and carbon stocks.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 457 validating the Regulation on licensing of activities in the sphere of environmental protection.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes that the Ministry of Environmental Protection shall be the authorized state institution entrusted with the issuance of licences for the following activities: (a) environmental protection projecting and rate setting; (b) Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA); and (c) environmental audit. The applicant shall submit the following documentation: (a) application; (b) notarized copy and certificate of state registration of the applicant as legal person (for legal persons); (c) copy of personal identification document (for natural persons); (d) certified copy of registration at tax authority; (e) certificate attesting payment of licensing fees and dues; (f) accreditation certificate attesting also availability of required equipment; and (g) qualification certificate of staff members.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

This Ecological and Economic Zone aims at orienting the planning, management, activities and decisions made by the public, private power and civil society, related to land use and settlement, considering the potentialities and limitations of natural, biotic and socio-economic sectors, and at the practical implementation of sustainable development.

Además, establece las obligaciones de los contribuyentes y agentes de retención, así como la reglamentación de los aspectos vinculados con la implementación y administración del Fondo.

Policy: Loi n° 2007-34 sur la qualité de l’air.
Policy_Content: La présente loi vise à prévenir, limiter et réduire la pollution de l’air et ses impacts négatifs sur la santé de l’Homme et sur l’environnement ainsi qu’à fixer les procédures de contrôle de la qualité de l’air, afin de rendre effectif le droit du citoyen à un environnement sain et assurer un développement durable. Des mesures de conservation de la qualités de l'air sont prévues, ainsi que des mesures de prévention de la polution de l'air de sources mobiles et de sources fixes.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Décret nº 2007-1355 portant création et fixant les conditions et les modalités d'attribution de l'"écolabel tunisien".
Policy_Content: Ce décret porte création et fixant les conditions et les modalités d'attribution de l'"écolabel tunisien", accordé aux produits qui justifient des plus hauts niveaux de qualification du point de vue de la protection de l’environnement, et font preuve d’efforts remarquables dans l’utilisation des technologies propres et qui présentent, le cas échéant, les plus larges opportunités de durée dans leur cycle de vie, et ce, sous réserve de la réglementation en vigueur en matière de normalisation et de qualité.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Regulation establishing formula for calculating value of noise index.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of four paragraph, lays down the formula for calculating value of noise index. Protection from noise consists in assuring as good as possible acoustic state of the environment, in particular by keeping the level of noise below acceptable or at least on this level. When calculating the value of noise index one should take into consideration changeability of noise sources over a year and changeability of atmospheric conditions and factors affecting spreading of noise in the environment.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: The Regulation enters into force 14 days after publication in the Journal of Laws.

Policy: Ley de Desarrollo Forestal Sustentable para el Estado de Tamaulipas.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto regular y fomentar la conservación, protección, restauración, producción, ordenación, cultivo, manejo y aprovechamiento de los ecosistemas forestales del Estado y sus municipios, así como determinar el ejercicio de las atribuciones que en materia forestal les correspondan. Son objetivos específicos de estas disposiciones: a) definir los criterios de la política forestal del Estado; b) promover la protección, conservación y restauración de los ecosistemas y recursos forestales estatales y municipales, así como la ordenación y el manejo forestal; c) rehabilitar y desarrollar los bosques en terrenos preferentemente forestales, que propicien la conservación de suelos y aguas, y fortalezcan el desarrollo rural; d) promover el aprovechamiento y uso de los recursos forestales maderables y no maderables, para su eficiente manejo; e) fomentar y consolidar las áreas forestales permanentes, mediante su delimitación y manejo sustentable, procurándose que el cambio de uso de suelo con fines agropecuarios o de cualquier otra índole no afecte su permanencia y potencialidad; f) contribuir en la adopción y difusión de las medidas de prevención, combate y control de incendios forestales, plagas y enfermedades forestales; g) promover acciones de conservación y restauración de suelos forestales; h) impulsar la cultura, educación, investigación, capacitación y desarrollo tecnológico para el manejo sustentable de los recursos forestales; i) la ventanilla única de atención institucional para usuarios del sector forestal, en forma coordinada con las autoridades federales competentes en la materia; j) impulsar el desarrollo de la empresa forestal social y privada con responsabilidad por el desarrollo sustentable de la silvicultura en el Estado; l) promover que los productos forestales procedan de bosques manejados sustentablemente a través de la certificación forestal; m) fortalecer y mejorar los servicios técnicos forestales en el Estado.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Forestry, Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 448 validating the Regulation on assessment of target environmental quality indicators.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of setting target environmental quality indicators that shall be set on regional basis for achievement of the required environmental quality within determined time period. Target environmental quality indicators shall be set for the following components: (a) atmospheric air pollution; (b) soil pollution; (c) water pollution; and (d) environmental physical indicators. Target environmental quality indicators shall be set for maximum time period of 10 years. Elaboration of target environmental quality indicators shall include the following steps: (a) analysis of ecological situation; (b) study of the possibilities for the achievement of environmental standards; (c) setting criteria for the establishment of target environmental quality indicators; and (d) formation of the list and indices of target indicators.
Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy: Ordinance on promotion of private forests and related rates.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance lays down provisions relating to the promotion of private forests. The aim of the general promotion of private forests is that the forest owners should be in a position to use for themselves the economic potential of their forests. Moreover, they should be encouraged to form forestry associations in order to improve the cultivation of forestry land. The general promotion is rendered by the forestry service of Hessen and consists of: 1) advisory service concerning forestry issues through conferences and courses; 2) vocational training of forest officers; information on the state of the wood market; 3) making available necessary financial means; 4) giving general information on forestry proceedings; 5) giving continuous help to associations concerned. The text consists of 9 articles.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Inter-Sectoral Rural Development Strategy of Albania (ISRDA).

Policy: Decree of the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development No. 43 of 2007 (VI. 1.) FVM concerning the publication of nitrate vulnerable areas at block level as per the Land Parcel Identification System.
Policy_Content: This Decree regulates the publication of nitrate vulnerable areas at block level as per the Land Parcel Identification System. On the basis of block changes in the annual review of the Agricultural Parcel Identification System the block identification changes provided by the State Administration for Surveying and GIS are published in the Official Journal of the Ministry headed by the Minister responsible for Agricultural Policy and the Ministry of Water Protection. In order to identify nitrate sensitive areas, the soil, water and the environmental protection and nature conservation authorities have access to the MePAR Browser's work format for free. This Regulation is intended to comply with Article 3 of Council Directive 91/676/EEC of 12 December 1991 concerning the protection of waters against pollution caused by nitrates from agricultural sources.

Policy: Décret relatif à la participation du public en matière d'environnement.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret transpose partiellement la directive 2003/35/CE du 26 mai 2003 prévoyant la participation du public lors de l'élaboration de certains plans et programmes relatifs à l'environnement et modifiant, en ce qui concerne la participation du public et l'accès à la justice, les directives 85/337/CEE et 96/61/CE du Conseil, en ce qui concerne la détermination de règles communes de participation du public à l'élaboration de plans et programmes relatifs à l'environnement et au processus décisionnel d'activités particulières. Le texte ajoute un article D.5-1 dans le titre Ier de la partie Ire du Livre Ier du Code de l'Environnement. Cet article établit qu’une ou plusieurs communes peuvent engager un conseiller en environnement. Celui-ci est une personne de contact et d'information pour la population sur toutes les questions relatives à la protection de l'environnement. Dans le cadre des mécanismes de participation du public à l'élaboration de plans et programmes relatifs à l'environnement et au processus décisionnel concernant des projets, le conseiller en environnement assume les tâches qui lui sont confiées par le présent Code. Le texte comprend 64 articles répartis en 3 chapitres.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Control concerns, among other things: monitoring of pollution of groundwater; use of sewage sludge in agriculture; emissions of nitrates in the waters; agricultural land in Natura 2000 areas; requirements for good agricultural and environmental condition; protection of habitats and protected species.

Policy: Regional Law No. 26-Z “On delimitation of plenary powers of state bodies in the sphere of forest relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law delimits plenary powers between the Regional Government, regional state executive bodies and local government in the sphere of forest management, protection, conservation of forests, and also related to afforestation and reforestation. Regional Government shall have the following competence: (a) establishment of the modalities and rates of timber extraction for individual personal needs; (b) collection and harvesting on non-timber forest products by citizens; (c) use of forests for hunting; (d) establishment of exceptional cases for timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species; and (e) legislative regulation in the sphere of forest relations.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 169-п of 31 May 2007 validating the Classifier of waste.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree provides classification of different types of waste. Waste from production of pharmaceutical products and products of veterinary medicine are listed as hazardous waste of the second category for which according to the Ecological Code a waste certificate must be obtained. The classifier is designed for use in the waste management system including accounting, control, waste management rationing, licensing of relevant activities, issuance of permits for transboundary waste transportation and disposal, design of environmental protection facilities and implementation of environmental protection measures, assessment of social and economic, resource and material risk and damage in case of accidents and catastrophes. The classifier is designed to determine the level of danger (hazard) and coding of waste. In case of absence of this type of waste in the classifier, the level of hazards and the coding are substantiated on a case-by-case basis and are coordinated with the authorized body in the field of environmental protection. Waste coding takes into account the area of formation, the way of storage (burial, disposal), and method of recycling or regeneration process, potentially hazardous components, level of hazard and industry sector of the economy generating waste. The waste shall be assigned to a certain encoding by the nature manager independently or with the involvement of physical and (or) legal entities licensed to perform works and provide services in the field of environmental protection.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 708 validating the Regulation on formulation of tariffs for main forest species sold as standing timber.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree regulates tariffs for main forest species sold as standing timber. Tariffs shall mean the amounts paid by authorized forest managers to extract timber. This Decree establishes the formula for calculating the tariffs applied to one cubic metre of timber. Standing timber shall be registered in cubic metres by categories of industrial timber and fuel wood. Tariffs shall be set according to the average annual quotation for timber on the stock exchange for the period preceding 1 November of each year.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Ministerial Decree enters into force on 1 June 2007.

Art. 3 specifies emission limits, art. 4 - conditions of operating combustion sources using alternative fuel, art. 5 ¾ conditions of operating small combustion sources.

Policy: Petroleum Act, S.N.B. 2007 (c. P-8.03).
Policy_Content: Section 3 establishes that no person shall explore for, develop, drill for or produce petroleum: a) unless that person holds a petroleum right granted under this Act, b) without the consent of the Crown if the exploration, development, drilling or production is undertaken on Crown Lands. The text consists of 172 sections divided into 22 Parts as follows: Definitions (1); Ownership (2); Petroleum rights, call for postings and call for tenders (3); Geophysical licence (4); Well drilling, development, production and well abandonment (5); Disputes and judicial review (6); Right of entry (7); Utilization (8); Appointment or designation of representative (9); Registrar (10); Petroleum register (11); Security notice, registration and transfer (12); Royalties (13); Collection of rent or fee (14); Failure to comply (15); General (16); Miscellaneous (17); Directives, orders, special authorization and special exemption (18); Administrative penalties and offences (19); Regulations (20); Savings (21); Transitional provisions, consequential amendments, repeal and commencement (22). One Schedule is enclosed.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources

Policy: Basic Act on the Advancement of Utilizing Geospatial Information (Act No. 63 of 2007).
Policy_Content: In view of the fact that promoting the advancement of utilization of geospatial information is essential in establishing an economy and society in which the people can live enriching lives with peace of mind both at present and in the future, the purpose of this Act is to promote policies for the advancement of utilizing geospatial information in a comprehensive and well-planned manner by establishing basic principles and clarifying the responsibilities of the state and local governments for policies on the advancement of utilizing geospatial information as well as defining the basic elements of policies on the advancement of utilizing geospatial information. Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté crée une unité environnementale et sociale au sein du ministère de l’équipement et du désenclavement ayant pour mission l’application de la législation environnementale en conformité avec les procédures et directives de la prise en compte de l’environnement élaborés en collaboration avec les partenaires au développement, visant particulièrement à minimiser les impacts négatifs y relatifs de manière globale et à toutes les stratifications du projet.

Policy: Regional Law No. 78-KZ “On agricultural development”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the relations arising between citizens and legal entities recognized in accordance with the current legislation as agricultural producers, other citizens, legal entities, regional government bodies in the field of agricultural development, including commercial aquaculture (commercial fishfarming), and development of rural areas. It establishes the directions and conditions for the provision of state support for the development of agriculture in order to form and regulate food market and provide the population with high-quality local food. Basic principles of the regional state policy in the field of agricultural development shall be: (a) consistency in the implementation of measures of state support in the field of agricultural development, sustainable rural development; (b) availability and targeted state support for agricultural producers; (c) ensuring equal conditions of competition in the market of agricultural products, raw materials and food; (d) participation of unions (associations) of agricultural producers in the formation and implementation of the regional policy in the field of agricultural development; and (e) access to information of the state of agriculture. The main objectives of the regional state policy in the field of agricultural development shall be as follows: (a) development of competitive and sustainable agricultural production; (b) creation of conditions for the formation of the raw material base of enterprises of the food and processing industry in order to provide the population with affordable and high-quality food products; (c) ensuring sustainable development of rural areas, rural employment, raising the standard of living of the population in rural areas; (d) increase in the production of agricultural commodities, raw materials and food, an increase in the share in the structure of consumption of local food products; and (e) filling the consumer market with fish products.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. HP 22306/1075/E103 establishing objectives, target values and assessments thresholds regarding the concentrations of arsenic, cadmium, mercury, nickel and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons in ambient air, in compliance with Directive 2004/107/EC.
Policy_Content: The Decree aims at implementing the provisions of articles 7 and 8 of Law No. 1650/86 “on the protection for the environment”. It also aims at harmonizing the Greek legislative frame with the provisions of Directive 2004/107/EC and also certain provisions of Council Directive 96/62/EC on ambient air quality assessment and management, so as to ensure that appropriate measures are taken in order to avoid adverse effects on human health and the environment, which might arise from the ambient concentrations of arsenic, cadmium, mercury, nickel and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons in ambient air. The Decree is composed as follows: objectives (art. 1); definitions (target value, polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons, upper assessment threshold, etc.) (art. 2); target values – measures for achieving them (art. 3); assessment of ambient air concentrations and deposition rates (art. 4); public information (art. 5); transmission of information and reports to the Commission (art. 6); sanctions (art. 7). Five Annexes included in the text constitute integral part of this Decree.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Hazardous substances,Data collection/reporting,Environmental standards
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Decree shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Ley Nº 8/2007 - Ley de suelo.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley regula las condiciones básicas que garantizan la igualdad en el ejercicio de los derechos y en el cumplimiento de los deberes constitucionales relacionados con el suelo; asimismo establece las bases económicas y medioambientales de su régimen jurídico, su valoración y la responsabilidad patrimonial de la administraciones pública en la materia. La Ley establece que las políticas públicas relativas a la regulación, ordenación, ocupación, transformación y uso del suelo tienen como fin común la utilización de este recurso conforme al interés general y según el principio de desarrollo sostenible.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 324 validating lease contract for the plots of forestland pertaining to the state of municipal property.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of the conclusion of lease contracts for the plots of forestland pertaining to the state of municipal property. Only the plot of forest registered in the state cadastre can be conceded on lease. A plot o forest can be conceded on lease for the following purposes: (a) timber extraction; (b) procurement of soft resin; (c) procurement of non-timber products; (d) procurement of medicinal herbs and plants; (e) hunting; (f) agriculture; (g) research and education; (h) recreation; (j) afforestation and reforestation; (k) cultivation of wild fruit, decorative and medicinal plants; (l) exploration of subsoil; (m) construction and operation of waterbodies and waterworks; and (n) timber and non-timber resources processing. The contract shall contain the following terms and conditions: (a) data on cadastre registration of the plot of forest; (b) period of validity of the contract; (c) types of forest management; (d) amount of rent and conditions of payment thereof; and (e) amount of timber extraction. The period of validity of contract shall be from 10 to 49 years.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 137 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on forest management for scientific research and educational purposes.
Policy_Content: This Order stipulates that forest management for scientific research purposes shall include experimental and theoretical activities with a view to obtaining knowledge and information of forest ecosystems, while forest management for educational purposes shall include creation of experimental forest plots for teaching inventory, timber extraction, reforestation and forest reproduction methods and arrangements. The following activities shall be authorized in forest areas destined for scientific research and educational purposes: (a) delimitation of territory; (b) timber extraction; (c) experimental activity; and (d) testing of chemicals and biological agents.

La Mancomunidad Municipal es el acuerdo voluntario de dos o más municipalidades, colindantes o no, que se unen para la prestación conjunta de servicios y la ejecución de obras, promoviendo el desarrollo local, la participación ciudadana y el mejoramiento de la calidad de los servicios a los ciudadanos.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 146 validating the Regulation on state nature biological reserve of regional significance on the territory of Solets district.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature biological reserve of regional significance on the territory of Solets district shall be constituted with a view of conservation and restoration of the population of roe deer and black grouse. The territory of the reserve shall not be withdrawn from land use and forest use. Land users and forest users of this territory are obliged to observe the regime established in the reserve. The reserve shall be indicated on the ground by warning and information signs along the perimeter of its boundaries. state nature biological reserve of regional significance on the territory of Solets district shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes; (b) maintenance of ecological balance; (c) protection and restoration of numbers of roe deer and black grouse, rare and endangered wild fauna species, including valuable species from economic, scientific and cultural point of view; (d) protection against poaching; (e) improvement of natural habitats of wild fauna species; (f) conservation of nesting and mating grounds of wild fauna species; (g) prevention of the outbreak of animal diseases; and (h) registration of rare and endangered game. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) hunting of roe deer and black grouse; (b) littering of the territory; (c) water logging; (d) haymaking; (e) burning of vegetation; (f) storage of petroleum products and other hazardous substances; (g) installation of continuous, without open spaces, fences on migratory routes of wild fauna species; (h) installation of traps and fishing gear in rivers; and (i) removal of young growth of trees and shrubbery under communication and power lines, along pipelines.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Protection of habitats,Wild fauna,Birds,Endangered species,Protection of species

Policy: Regional Decree No. 475-PP validating the Regulation on regional state nature biological reserve in Soletsk district.
Policy_Content: Regional state nature biological (zoological) reserve in Soletsk district shall be constituted without expropriation of land and forestland from owners and tenants. It shall perform the following functions: (a) conservation of natural ecosystem; (b) maintenance of ecological balance; (c) conservation and reproduction of roe deer (Capreolus capreolus) and black grouse (Lyrurus tetrix), and also other rare and endangered wild fauna species; (d) protection and improvement of natural habitats of wild fauna species; (e) protection of nesting grounds; (f) registration of rare and endangered wild fauna species and game; and (g) regulation of the number of harmful animals. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) hunting of roe deer (Capreolus capreolus) and black grouse (Lyrurus tetrix); (b) logging; (c) littering of the territory; (d) burning of the vegetation; and (e) storage of hazardous substances and combustibles and lubricants.

Policy: Décret nº 2007-993 relatif aux attributions du ministre de l'agriculture et de la pêche.
Policy_Content: Le ministre de l'agriculture, de l'alimentation, de la pêche et des affaires rurales prépare et met en oeuvre la politique du Gouvernement dans le domaine de l'agriculture, des affaires rurales, de la pêche maritime et des cultures marines, de la forêt et du bois. Il prépare et met en oeuvre la politique de l'alimentation en liaison avec les ministres chargés de la consommation et de la santé. A ce titre, il exerce en particulier les attributions suivantes: 1) Il définit et met en oeuvre la politique d'enseignement agricole et de formation continue. Il participe à la définition et à l'animation de la politique de recherche agronomique, biotechnologique et vétérinaire; 2) Il définit et met en oeuvre la politique en matière de santé des plantes et des animaux et de promotion de la qualité des produits agricoles et alimentaires; 3) Il définit et met en oeuvre la politique sociale en ce qui concerne les exploitants et salariés agricoles; 4) Il définit et met en oeuvre la politique dans le domaine des industries agroalimentaires; 5) Il définit et met en oeuvre, avec les ministres chargés de la consommation et de la santé, la politique relative au contrôle de la qualité et de la sécurité sanitaire des produits agricoles et alimentaire; 6) Il définit et met en oeuvre la politique en faveur du monde rural; 7) Il participe aux négociations européennes et internationales.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Forestry
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 665/2007 - Modifica el Real Decreto Nº 1.128/2003, que regula el Catálogo Nacional de Cualificaciones Profesionales.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto tiene por objeto establecer determinadas cualificaciones profesionales que se incluyen en el Catálogo Nacional de Cualificaciones Profesionales y sus correspondientes módulos formativos, relativas a actividades auxiliares en ganadería, agricultura ecológica, cuidados y manejo del caballo y gestión de repoblaciones forestales.

Subject: Energy

Policy: Limitation of Emissions of Volatile Organic Compounds due to the Use of Organic Solvents in Certain Paints, Varnishes, Vehicle Refinishing Products and Other Paints Products (Amendment) Law, 2007 (Law No. 54(Ι)/2007).
Policy_Content: This Law may be cited as the Limitation of Emissions of Volatile Organic Compounds due to the Use of Organic Solvents in Certain Paints, Varnishes, Vehicle Refinishing Products and Other Paints Products (Amendment) Law of 2007 and shall be read as one with the Limitation of Emissions of Volatile Organic Compounds due to the Use of Organic Solvents in Certain Paints, Varnishes, Vehicle Refinishing Products and Other Paints Products Law of 2006 (hereinafter referred to as “the principal Law”). The principal Law and the present Law shall be read as one and will be referred to as the Limitation of Emissions of Volatile Organic Compounds due to the Use of Organic Solvents in Certain Paints, Varnishes, Vehicle Refinishing Products and Other Paints Products Laws of 2006-2007.  For a better compliance with Council Directive 1999/13/EC on the limitation of emissions of volatile organic compounds due to the use of organic solvents in certain activities and installations, the present Law, carries forward amendments to the first Annex (I) of the principal Law, Part B, forth column.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Emissions,Hazardous substances,Inspection,Environmental standards
