Policy: Nigerian Maritime Administration and Safety Agency Act, 2007.
Policy_Content: This Act provides among other things, for the establishment of Nigerian Maritime Administration and Safety Agency, the administration of maritime safety and security maritime labour, pollution of the marine environment, shipping registration and commercial shipping. The Act also establishes the Maritime Fund for the support of objectives and functions of the Agency.
Subject: Fisheries, Sea, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Decree No. 84/2007/ND-CP additionally stipulating the grant of land use right certificates, recovery of land, exercise of land use rights, order and procedures for compensation, support and resettlement upon land recovery by the State, and settlement of land related complaints.
Policy_Content: This Decree makes provision for the grant of land use right certificates, house ownership and residential land use right certificates; exercise of land user rights; recovery of land and land related compensation and support; procedures for land recovery, compensation, support and resettlement upon land recovery by the State for defence and security purposes, economic development, etc.; and for the settlement of land-related complaints. This Decree shall apply to all agencies, organizations and individuals involved in land administration and land use, and to agencies performing the function of state management of land.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, East Asian Seas, South-Eastern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Decision enters into force 15 days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Law No. 71 on state regulation of emission and absorption of greenhouse gases.
Policy_Content: This Law determines state regulation in the sphere of emission and absorption of greenhouse gases. State policy in the sphere of emission and absorption of greenhouse gases shall be carried out through the following arrangements: (a) state regulation; (b) compliance with environmental standards and international obligations: (c) stabilization and reduction of emissions as national priority; (d) state monitoring and registration of emissions; and (e) access to information on emissions. Nature managers shall be authorized to carry out emissions of greenhouse gases exclusively in the presence of available emission quotas. State monitoring of emission and absorption of greenhouse gases shall be integral part of environmental monitoring.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Décret n°2007-342 PRES/PM/MFB/MJE du 25 mai 2007 portant création du Fonds d’Appui aux Initiatives des Jeunes.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée le Fonds d’Appui aux Initiatives des Jeunes dont la mission est de contribuer à la mise en œuvre de la politique du Gouvernement en matière de jeunesse, notamment l’insertion sociale des jeunes par des activités économiques.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Resolución Nº 103/07/INRENA - Permisos de aprovechamiento forestal en bosques de comunidades nativas y campesinas de selva y ceja de selva.

Policy_Content: This Regulation provides full standards and necessary conditions for the correct and required evidence of registration in the Register of fertilizers.

Policy: Regulation on mineral fertilizers.
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the standards and necessary requirements for the correct classification of mineral (inorganic) fertilizers, quality requirements for fertilizers, the data contained in the declaration of fertilizers, tolerances on the declared nutrient contents, marking, packaging, storage and handling of fertilizers and the methods for sampling, and methods for determining the quality and control quality of mineral fertilizers.

Policy: Aboriginal Heritage Regulations 2007.
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement the Aboriginal Heritage Act 2006 by specifying the circumstances in which a cultural heritage management plan is required for an activity or class of activity; prescribing standards for the preparation of a cultural heritage management plan including the carrying out of assessments; prescribing standards for the preparation of a map included in a cultural heritage agreement; and by prescribing fees for evaluating a cultural heritage management plan, for an application for a cultural heritage permit, and for an application to the Secretary for advice as to whether a record exists on the Register in relation to a nominated area of land.

Policy_Content: This Law prescribes the provisions granting the concrete financial support to primary agricultural production on the territory of the Tuzla Canton (part of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Regulation of Protection and Utilization of Pistachio Forest
Policy_Content: The Regulation sets provisions to govern the pistachio forests in Afghanistan. The main objectives of this Regulation are to preserve the pistachio forests and to collect pistachios in proper time by appropriate methods. To preserve the forests and the pistachios, all the pistachio forests should be closed to the public in the duration of fruiting. The exact time should be determined for any specific pistachio forest based on the climatic condition of the region. Collecting pistachios only possible when pistachios are ripened completely. The Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation, and Livestock is the authority responsible to implement this Regulation.
Subject: Forestry, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Agricultural development,Authorization/permit,Collecting/harvesting,Forest management/forest conservation,Forest fires,Forest service/forest officers,Forest species,Forestry protection measures,Governance,Inspection,Plant protection,Protected area,Protection forest,Protection of species,Zoning

Policy: Industrial Standardization Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to improve the quality, production efficiency and technology for mining and manufacturing industrial products and services related to industrial activities by establishing and disseminating appropriate and rational industrial standards and supporting quality management and to promote simple and fair transaction and rationalized consumption, thereby enhancing industrial competitiveness and developing the national economy. An Industrial Standards Council shall be established within the Ministry of Trade, Industry, and Energy. The Council shall deliberate on the following matters and provide advice to the Minister of Trade, Industry and Energy: Matters necessary for the formulation, amendment, and abolition of industrial standards under Article 5; Matters necessary for confirmation as to whether industrial standardization is appropriate under Article 10; Matters concerning designation of mining and manufacturing products under Article 15; Matters concerning designation of services under Article 16; Other matters related to industrial standardization determined by Presidential Decree.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Law No. 1.089 providing for the the revision of the State Planning for Coastal Management.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 26 articles divided into seven Chapters, provides for the the revision of the State Planning for Coastal Management (PEGC/AP). The Law, in compliance with the provisions of article 5 of Federal Law No. 7661 of 16 May 1988, Title V of Complementary Law No. 005 of 18 August 1994, establishes the revision of the above mentioned State Plan. It establishes its objectives and guidelines and disciplines the instruments of its elaboration, approval and execution. PEGC has as general objective to guide, discipline and rationalize the occupation process and the use of the natural resources of the Coastal Zone, aiming to improve the quality of life of local populations and the protection of coastal ecosystems, under conditions that ensure environmental quality, with the following specific objectives: compatibility of human uses and activities with the guarantee of environmental quality, by harmonizing the socio-economic interests of external or local agents; exercise effective control over the use and occupation of the soil and the exploitation of natural resources throughout the Coastal Zone [with the purpose of: a) eradicating the predatory exploitation of natural resources; b) prevent degradation of coastal ecosystems; c) minimize conflicts and competition between uses and activities; and d) optimize the productive processes of the economic activities, observing the environmental limitations of the region]; guarantee the settlement and development of local populations through land regularization, procedures allowing access to sustainable exploitation of natural resources and technical advice for the implementation of new economic activities; ensure the utilization of the coastal natural resources, with a view a permanent sustainability, through the evaluation of the capacity of environmental support against the social needs to improve the quality of life and the objective of the sustainable development of the region; conservation and restoration of representative areas of coastal ecosystems, as well as rehabilitation of those that are degraded; and integrated, decentralized and participatory planning and management of anthropogenic activities in the Coastal Zone.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Coastal zone management,Basic legislation,Environmental planning,Classification/declassification,Ecosystem preservation,EIA,Institution,Land-use planning,Monitoring,Pollution control,Research,Soil pollution/quality
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Ministerial Decree No.318 regarding the state forest register.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of keeping the state forest register containing information and data on forests, management, conservation, protection and reproduction thereof, and also on forestries and forest parks. The Register consists of three sections: (a) forests and forest resources containing data on forestland, protection forest, reserve forest, plots of land and qualitative and quantitative characteristics thereof; (b) forest management containing data on the authorized forest uses and plots of forests conceded in use to legal and natural persons; and (c) protection, conservation and reproduction of forests containing information on the arrangements for the protection, conservation and reproduction of forests.

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement wallon concernant les aides à l'agriculture.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté du Gouvernement wallon concerne les aides à l'agriculture. La partie initiale contient la définition de certains termes comme, par exemple,  "activité agricule", "agriculteur", "association agricole", "activité à titre non principal", "activité à titre principal", "association de producteurs latiers ou A.P.L.", "exploitation", "FEADER ou fond euopéen agricole pour développement rural", etc.Le texte comprend 101 articles répartis en 12 chapitres comme suit: Définitions générales (I); Qualification professionnelle et aptitudes (II); Aides aux investissements dans les exploitations agricoles: le plan d' investissements  (III); Aides à l'installation de jeunes exploitants agricoles : plan de développement (IV); Encadrement pour la préparation et l'exécution des plans d'investissements et des plans de développement (V); Aide régionale en faveur du démarrage des groupements (VI); Aides aux coopératives de transformation et de commercialisation (VII); Contrôles et sanctions (VIII); Mesures régionales en faveur des agriculteurs en difficultés financières (IX); Mesures régionales à la lutte contre les maladies infectieuses (X); Dispositions transitoires et dérogatoires (XI); Dispositions générales et finales (XII).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock

Policy: Mineral resources and Mining Development Act, 2007.
Policy_Content: This Act provides rules relative to mining rights and the exploitation of mineral materials in Sudan. As a general principle, Article 4 states that  all the mining materials on the surface or underneath the earth, in the regional waters, or in its continental shelf shall be the property of the State. The Act defines mining contracts that may be concluded and mining licenses that may be issued by the Committee established by this Act. Other provisions concern conditions of license - including  adhere to the general policies of the State in the field of environmental protection (art.11) - reporting on discovery of mining materials, compensation of land owners by license holders, establishment of the Committee, functions and powers of the Committee and its Chairman, appeal with the Minister against decisions of the Committee and offences and penalties.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa, Red Sea  Gulf of Aden, Sahel

Policy: Order No. 160-p of the Minister of Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on supervision over officials of local self-government in the sphere of state environmental audit.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of supervision by the authorized state central environmental audit body and its territorial branches over the activity of the officials of local self-government in the sphere of state environmental audit. The Ministry of Environmental Protection and its territorial bodies shall be the authorized state institution carrying out coordination of all environmental audit and ecological expertise on the national territory. The purpose of supervision and inspection shall be to verify compliance of the officials of the local self-government carrying out state environmental audit with ecological legislation, ecological norms and environmental standards, and the provisions of this Order. All the ecological expertise activity and state environmental audit carried out by the local self-government officials in the period since the previous inspection shall be subject to supervision and inspection.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Orden ITC/1522/2007 - Regulación de la garantía del origen de la electricidad procedente de fuentes de energía renovables y de cogeneración de alta eficiencia.
Policy_Content: La presente Orden tiene por objeto regular la garantía de origen de la electricidad generada a partir de fuentes de energía renovables y de cogeneración de alta eficiencia, con objeto de fomentar su contribución a la producción de electricidad así como facilitar el comercio de electricidad producida a partir de fuentes de energía renovables y de cogeneración de alta eficiencia.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Renewable energy,Certification,Internal trade,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Access-to-information

Policy: Ministerial Joint Decree No. 295610/ΑΑ 687 establishing additional measures for the implementation of European Community arrangements with regard to aid for the improvement of production and marketing of apiculture products in the smaller Aegean islands, in compliance with Council Regulation (EC) No. 1405/2006 and Commission Regulation (EC) No. 1914/2006.
Policy_Content: With the present Decree are determined the additional measures for the implementation of Community arrangements with regard to specific measures for the improvement of production and marketing of apiculture products (honey, pollen, propolis, wax, etc.) in the smaller Aegean islands, in compliance with Council Regulation (EC) No. 1405/2006 and Commission Regulation (EC) No. 1914/2006. The Decree establishes also the additional measures for the implementation of the Support Programme of apiculture for the smaller islands (except the islands of Crete and Evia) aiming at strengthening this traditional employment and improving the income of the residents in these islands, decreasing the costs of production and compensating the disadvantage deriving from the exceptional geographical nature of the Aegean islands in relation to supply of food and agricultural products. More specifically, the Decree establishes the requirements and administrative procedures for the implementation of the Support Programme. The aid, which amounts to 1.194.180 Euro (up to 12 Euro per hive) and will be covered entirely by EU funds, will be paid on the basis of the number of registered hives in production to cooperatives of beekeepers recognised by the competent authorities, which undertake to implement annual Programmes of Initiatives designed to improve the conditions under which quality honey is produced. The Decree contains in the Annexes ten sample application forms to be used for the administrative procedures of the Programme.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Decree shall enter into force upon its signature.

Policy: Regulations of Yanbian Korean Autonomous Prefecture on management of urban and rural planning.
Policy_Content: These Regulations  are enacted in order to  protect the drinking water source environment in Yanbian Korean Autonomous Prefecture, prevent pollution of water, ensure the safety of urban drinking water source  and public health, and promote the sustainable development of economy and society. The Text consists of 38 Articles divided into 8 Chapters: General Provisions;  Urban and Rural Planning Committee; Urban and Rural  Planning; Review and Approval of Urban and Rural Planning; Implementation of Urban and Rural Planning; Supervision and Inspection;   Liabilities; Supplementary Provisions.

Policy: Regulation (EC) No. 614/2007 of the European Parliament and of the Council concerning the Financial Instrument for the Environment (LIFE+).
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets forth the Financial Instrument for the Environment (LIFE+) in order to provide specific support for developing and implementing Community environmental policy and legislation, taking into particular account the objectives of the Sixth Community Environment Action Programme laid down by Decision No. 1600/2002/EC. The Regulation defines eligibility criteria for projects to be financed by LIFE+. Further provisions concern specific objectives to be attained by the three components of LIFE+, namely: (a) Nature and biodiversity; (b) Environment policy and governance; (c) Information and communication.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Provincial Act No. 11 on management of forest and mountain areas, water courses and protected areas.
Policy_Content: This Act sets forth the legislative framework relating to the preservation of biodiversity and the protection of the environment in the Autonomous Province of Trento. It pursues the ecological balance of the provincial territory and its mountain ecosystems. These provisions deal with: (a) plans and programmes to be adopted by the Province in the field of management of forests and mountain areas; (b) setting up of a monitoring and information system for forests and mountain areas; (c) waterworks and interventions in the field of water courses management; (d) hydrogeological restrictions; (e) measures and rules to prevent forest fires; (f) protection of forests against pests; (g) protection of flora and wildlife products such as truffles and mushrooms; (h) protected areas; (i) promotion and improvement of forest resources; (j) incentives and subsidies for the interventions covered by these provisions; (k) forest surveillance system; (l) penalties. The Act sets up the Forest Technical Committee (art. 20) and the Provincial Forest Fund (art. 93). Article 115 lays down the list of provincial acts amended or repealed by these provisions.
Subject: Forestry, Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Energy Efficiency Evidence Act.
Policy_Content: The objective of the present Act is to promote the improvement of the energy performance of buildings in Liechtenstein, taking into account outdoor climatic and local conditions, as well as indoor climate requirements and cost-effectiveness. Furthermore, the Act enforces the Directive 2002/91/EC of the European Parliament and the Council of 16 December 2002 on the energy performance of buildings. The text consists of 11 articles as follows: Object and purpose (1); Sphere of application (2); Terms and designations (3); Submission of energy pass (4); Obligatory publication of energy pass (5); Content and exhibition of the energy pass (6); Calculation of the total energy performance (7); Penalties (8); Implementing provisions (9); Transitional provisions (10); Entry into force (11).

Policy: Emergency Ordinance No. 43 on the deliberate release into the environment of genetically modified organisms.
Policy_Content: This Emergency Ordinance, consisting of 76 articles divided into five Chapters and completed by eight Annexes, given the urgent need a of national legislation with the European Union in the field of genetically modified organisms, taking into account that changes at European level of biosecurity, and the entry into force of Directive 2001/18/EC on the deliberate release into the environment of genetically modified organisms establishes the following. The purpose of this Ordinance is to ensure the necessary legislative and institutional framework harmonized with the EU, such as GMO activities to be conducted in respect of the precautionary principle to ensure the protection of human health and the environment. The activities covered by this emergency ordinance are: a) the deliberate release into the environment of genetically modified organisms for purposes other than placing on the market; b) placing on the market of GMOs as or components of products; c) the transboundary movement of genetically modified organisms in relation to the activities referred to in subparagraph a) and b). Activities relate to GMOs as defined in the text. The provisions of this ordinance shall be supplemented by: a) the provisions of the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety to the Convention on Biological Diversity (signed on 5 June 1992 in Rio de Janeiro), adopted in Montreal on 29 January 2000, ratified by Law No. 59/2003; b) the provisions of European Parliament and of the Council (EC) No. 1946/2003 of 15 July 2003 on transboundary movement of genetically modified organisms, published in the Official Journal of the European Union No. L 287 of 5 November 2003; c) the provisions of the Emergency Government Ordinance No. 195/2005 on environmental protection, approved with amendments by Law No. 265/2006; d) legislation on plant protection products; e) legislation on the registration of plant varieties and hybrids GM coexistence of genetically modified higher plants with organic and conventional growers authorization of genetically modified higher plants; etc.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Black Sea, Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries

Policy: Règlement sur les émoluments du service de toxicologie de l’environnement bâti.
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement met en exécution la loi fédérale sur la protection de l'environnement du 7 octobre 1983. Le règlement régit les émoluments relatifs aux prestations du service de toxicologie de l’environnement bâti  dans le cadre de la toxicologie industrielle et de la pollution intérieure, ainsi que du contrôle du marché des substances dangereuses pour l’environnement selon l’ordonnance sur la réduction des risques liés à l’utilisation de substances, de préparations et d’objets particulièrement dangereux du 18 mai 2005. Le texte comprend 17 articles répartis en 4 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Montant des émoluments (II); Voies de recours (III); Dispositions finales et transitoires (IV).
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Règlement sur les émoluments du service de l'air, du bruit et des rayonnements non ionisants en matière de protection de l'air.
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement met en exécution, entre autres, le règlement sur la protection de l'air, du 22 février 2012 et la loi fédérale sur la protection de l'environnement, du 7 octobre 1983. L’article 1er établit que le présent règlement régit les émoluments relatifs aux prestations du service de protection de l’air, soit la mesure, l’analyse ou l’évaluation des immissions et des émissions de polluants atmosphériques, notamment la fumée, la suie, la poussière, les gaz, les aérosols, les vapeurs, les odeurs et les rejets thermiques. Le texte comprend 19 articles répartis en 4 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Montant des émoluments (II); Voies de recours (III); Dispositions finales et transitoires (IV).
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: Le présent règlement entre en vigueur le 31 mai 2007.

Policy: Règlement sur les émoluments du service de protection contre le bruit et les rayonnements non ionisants (1) (REmBruit).
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement met en exécution le règlement cantonal sur la protection contre le bruit et les vibrations, du 12 février 2003, et la loi fédérale sur la protection de l'environnement, du 7 octobre 1983. L’article 1er établit que le présent règlement régit les émoluments relatifs aux prestations du service de protection contre le bruit et les rayonnements non ionisants concernant les immissions sonores, les vibrations et les rayonnements non ionisants. Le texte comprend 17 articles répartis en 4 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Montant des émoluments (II); Voies de recours (III); Dispositions finales et transitoires (IV).
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Le texte comprend 16 articles répartis en 6 sections comme suit: Dispositions générales (1); Mise sur le marché (2); Expositions et présentations (3); Contrôle ultérieur (surveillance du marché) (4); Surveillance, compte rendu et information (5); Dispositions finales (6). Trois annexes sont jointes.

Policy: Styria Street Environmental Noise Protection Law 2007.
Policy_Content: The present Act lays down provisions relating to the assessment and control of environmental noise. Its purpose is to prevent or reduce harmful effects resulting from the exposure to environmental noise. “Environmental noise” is defined by article 2 as the unwanted or harmful outdoor sound created by human activities, including noise emitted by means of transport, road traffic, rail traffic, air traffic and from sites of industrial activity. Different noise indicators are established as per different periods, namely day, evening and night. The text consists of 12 articles as follows: Definition of terms (1); Assessment methods (2); Strategic noise maps (3); Actions plans (4); Deadlines (5); Information of the public (6); Reports (7); Power to issue ordinances (8); Administrative proceedings (9); Reference to other provisions (10) Community Law (11); Entry into force (12).
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Western Europe

Policy: Cross River State Female Person's Inheritance of Property Law 2007 (No. 10 of 2007).
Policy_Content: This Law stipulates that notwithstanding any native law or custom to the contrary a female person has the right to acquire and own property and shall share in the intestate estate of her deceased father, mother or husband in accordance with the provisions of this Law. Females may be the administrator or one of the administrators of her fathers, mothers or husbands estate. The Law also grants other rights to women and provides protection of women from degrading treatment and provides with respect to alienation of property.  or interest in the matrimonial home. Subject to the provision of any other written law, where a man has two or more wives married under native law or custom, they shall enjoy equal rights, and have equal status in law.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Décret n° 488/PR/MEFEPPN du 22 mai 2007 abrogeant certaines dispositions du décret n° 664/PR/MEFE du 22 juillet 1994 portant réglementations de la commercialisation des bois en Republique gabonaise.

Policy: Ley Nº 14 de 2007 - Código Penal de la República de Panamá. Texto actualizado.
Policy_Content: El presente Código Penal de la República de Panamá, tiene como fundamento el respeto a la dignidad humana (Artículo 1º), y en él solo se tipifican aquellas conductas y comportamientos cuya incriminación resulte indispensable para la protección de los bienes jurídicos tutelados y los valores significativos de la sociedad y de acuerdo con la política criminal del Estado (Artículo 2º). Las normas y los postulados sobre derechos humanos que se encuentren consignados en la Constitución Política y en los convenios internacionales vigentes en la República de Panamá son parte integral de este Código (Artículo 5º) y la pena cumplirá las funciones de prevención general, retribución justa, prevención especial, reinserción social y protección al sentenciado (Artículo 7).
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Forestry, Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement wallon modifiant l'arrêté du Gouvernement wallon du 23 juin 2000 relatif à l'évaluation et la gestion de la qualité de l'air ambiant.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté modifie l’arrêté du Gouvernement wallon susvisé. En particulier, on ajoute un deuxième alinéa au point 6 de l’article 2, rédigé comme suit: "En ce qui concerne l'arsenic, le cadmium, le benzo(a)pyrène et le nickel, la valeur cible signifie une concentration dans l'air ambiant fixée dans le but d'éviter, de prévenir ou de réduire les effets nocifs pour la santé des personnes et l'environnement dans son ensemble qu'il convient d'atteindre, si possible, dans un délai donné."

Policy: Regulation No. 3 on the procedures for lending undivided agricultural lands.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the Board for Lending Undivided Agricultural Lands and lays down its composition and rules of procedure. The Board’s activities are subjected to the Civil Code and to Law No. 8312 of 1998 on non-divided lands. Its tasks include the duty to continuously inform about the availability of the undivided agricultural lands; to guarantee the observation of competition rules in the land auctions; and to award the auction contracts. Undivided agricultural lands are lend to physical and legal entities, local or international, to be used and exploited for agricultural and livestock activities. If more than two requests are submitted for the same land, the contractor will be chosen through auction procedures. The lending can go up to 99 years for planting of vineyards, fruit plants and olive trees.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Arrêté du 15 mai 2007 relatif aux subventions de l'Etat accordées en matière de nettoyage, de reconstitution et de lutte phytosanitaire dans les peuplements forestiers sinistrés par des phénomènes naturels exceptionnels.

Policy: Décret n° 2007-978 relatif aux eaux closes.
Policy_Content: Constitue une eau close au sens de l'article L. 431-4 du code de l'environnement le fossé, canal, étang, réservoir ou autre plan d'eau dont la configuration, qu'elle résulte de la disposition des lieux ou d'un aménagement permanent de ceux-ci, fait obstacle au passage naturel du poisson, hors événement hydrologique exceptionnel. Un dispositif d'interception du poisson ne peut, à lui seul, être regardé comme un élément de la configuration des lieux.

Policy: Décret n° 2007-951 relatif aux subventions de l'Etat accordées en matière d'investissement forestier.
Policy_Content: Les dispositions du présent décret régissent les subventions en matière d'investissement forestier que l'Etat peut accorder sur le budget général pour permettre la réalisation des opérations suivantes :1) les travaux de boisement, reboisement, et régénération de peuplement;2) Les travaux d'amélioration des forêts; 3) Les travaux de desserte forestière; 4) Les travaux de protection de la forêt y compris les travaux de restauration des terrains en montagne, les opérations d'investissement de prévention et de défense des forêts contre les incendies et de fixation des dunes côtières; 5) Les travaux de nettoyage, reconstitution et lutte phytosanitaire dans les peuplements forestiers sinistrés par des phénomènes naturels exceptionnels; 6) Les travaux de protection ou restauration de la biodiversité. Les subventions sont accordées sur la base d'un devis estimatif et descriptif, conformément aux règles générales applicables aux subventions de l'Etat pour des projets d'investissement. Toutefois, les montants des subventions pour les opérations mentionnées au 5° peuvent être établis sur la base de barèmes régionaux arrêtés par les préfets de région, dans les conditions prévues à l'annexe 1 du présent décret.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Décret n° 2007-942 relatif aux modalités d'application de l'article L. 11 du code forestier et modifiant le code forestier.
Policy_Content: Il est créé au livre préliminaire du code forestier (partie réglementaire) un chapitre III intitulé: "Formalités simplifiées applicables aux opérations d'exploitation et travaux prévus dans les documents de gestion". Le bénéfice des procédures spéciales d'approbation ou d'agrément d'un document de gestion prévues aux premier et deuxième alinéas de l'article L. 11 est subordonné à une demande écrite du propriétaire ou du gestionnaire d'une forêt, adressée, accompagnée du projet de document de gestion, à l'autorité chargée de l'approuver ou de l'agréer. Elle tend à obtenir soit la déclaration de la conformité de ce projet à une annexe aux directives ou aux schémas régionaux d'aménagement et aux schémas régionaux de gestion sylvicole mentionnés à l'article L. 4, soit à son approbation au regard d'autres législations.

Policy: Land Compensation Act Amendment (P.L. No. 15-92).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Land Compensation Act of 2002 so as to restore the priority given to certain claims in relation with infrastructural improvements (i.e. the acquisition of private lands for rights of way purposes and road construction). Compensation of such claims shall be carried out to the full by the Department of Public Lands and only then claims relating to wetlands and ponding basins will be accepted.

Policy: Ley Nº 620 - Ley General de Aguas Nacionales.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece el marco jurídico e institucional relativo a la administración, conservación, desarrollo, uso y aprovechamiento sostenible de todos los recursos hídricos existentes en el país, con el fin último de garantizar la preservación de la calidad y cantidad de los mismos, asegurando al mismo tiempo la protección de los demás recursos naturales, de los ecosistemas y del ambiente en general. El régimen establecido por las presentes disposiciones se aplica a las aguas subterráneas, superficiales, termales, medicinales y a aquellas que se utilicen para la generación de energía geotérmica. Entre las disposiciones generales, cabe destacar el artículo 4º, en virtud del cual el servicio de agua potable no podrá constituir en ningún caso objeto de privatización y será considerado siempre servicio de carácter público. Las normas regulan los diferentes usos de las aguas nacionales, a saber el consumo humano, el servicio de agua potable, el uso agropecuario y la generación de energía eléctrica. La Ley crea el Consejo Nacional de los Recursos Hídricos como máxima instancia, mientras que el órgano superior con funciones técnicas y normativas descentralizadas en materia de gestión de las aguas nacionales es la Autoridad Nacional del Agua (arts. 21-30).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Energy, Water
Keyword: Irrigation,Indigenous peoples,Hydropower generation,Concession,Framework law,Basic legislation,Freshwater resources management,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Effluent waste water/discharge,Groundwater,Surface water,Water abstraction,Thermal and medicinal waters,Water supply,Potable water,Priorities,Industrial water use,Water charges,Institution,Offences/penalties,Right to water,EIA,Pollution control,Human rights

Policy: Decreto N° 26-2007: Ley de adjudicación, venta o usufructo de bienes inmuebles propiedad del Estado de Guatemala, o de sus entidades autonómas, descentralizadas y de las municipalidades, con fines habitacionales para familias carentes de vivienda.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley introduce el marco normativo relativo a los procedimientos de adjudicación para compraventa o usufructo de bienes inmuebles propiedad del Estado o de otras entidades públicas, con fines habitacionales a favor de las familias en situación de pobreza que los ocupen. La Ley indica las distintas autoridades competentes para gestionar los procedimientos de adjudicación, según se trate de inmuebles del Estado, de las municipalidades o de otras entidades públicas. Asimismo, la Ley regula el procedimiento de adjudicación de las fincas de propiedad del Estado, tanto en zonas rurales como en zonas urbanas.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Public land,Transfer,Agricultural land,Urban land,Land tenure,Lease,Land valuation

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 325 of 2007 on Labour Protection Requirements when Coming in Contact with Chemical Substances at Workplaces
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes labour protection requirements for employees when coming in contact with chemical substances (including mixtures) at workplaces if a risk is caused or may be caused from the effect of chemical substances present in the work environment or related to the working process, as well as special restrictions and prohibitions in relation to individual dangerous chemical substances or mixtures. This Regulation applies to workplaces where an employee is or may be exposed to the effect of such chemical substances and mixtures: (1) which conforms to the criteria laid down in Annex 1 to Regulation (EC) No 1272/2008 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 December 2008 on classification, labelling and packaging of substances and mixtures, amending and repealing Directives 67/548/EEC and 1999/45/EC, and amending Regulation (EC) No 1907/2006 for classification of substances in any of physical or health hazard classes irrespective of whether this chemical substance is classified in accordance with Regulation No 1272/2008; (2) which are present in the working environment or utilised at work and due to the physical, chemical and toxic properties thereof endanger the safety and health of an employee; (3) to which an occupational exposure limit value (OEV) has been determined - such concentration of chemical substances or mixtures in the air of the work environment which for the whole duration of the life of an employee does not cause the contraction of a disease or deterioration of health which can be determined by modern investigative methods if the relevant chemical substances and mixtures affect an employee not longer than 8 hours during a working day or not longer than 40 hours a week (Annex 1, 2); and to which a biological limit value (BLV) has been determined - indicators of concentration of chemical substances and metabolites thereof received by the organism of the employee and the biological effects caused by chemical substances in the biological environment of the employee, which values shall be determined for healthy employees who are exposed to chemical substances and mixtures on the level of the occupational exposure limit value (OEV) (Annex 3).
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Hazardous substances,Public health,Classification/declassification,Air quality/air pollution,Biological agents,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Arrêté n°2523/PM/MAEDR du 15 mai 2007 portant création, attributions, organisation et fonctionnement d'un Comité National de Pilotage et de Suivi des Projets de Développement Agricole et Rural (PDAR).
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté, pris en application des dispositions de l’article 29 de la Constitution, crée le Comité National de Pilotage et de Suivi des Projets de Développement Agricole, et fixe ses attributions, son organisation, et son fonctionnement.  Le Comité National de Pilotage et de Suivi des Projets de Développement Agricole et Rural (PDAR) est notamment chargé de : valider les décisions et les recommandations du Comité de Coordination Technique Provincial prévu par le présent arrêté; approuver les orientations et les budgets annuels des Projets de Développement Agricole et Rural; vérifier la conformité des actions proposées avec les stratégies et les politiques nationales; d'assurer le suivi des risques, des hypothèses et des conditions préalables à la mise en œuvre du projet ; maintenir la coordination intersectorielle et de s'assurer de la prise en compte des préoccupations des bénéficiaires et de l'Etat.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic, South Atlantic

Policy: Loi du 15 mai 2007 relative à la sécurité civile.
Policy_Content: La présente loi, consistant de 224 articles divisés par 16 Titres, règle la sécurité civile, visée à l’article 78 de la Constitution et comprenant l’ensemble des mesures et des moyens civils nécessaires pour accomplir les missions visées par la présente loi afin de secourir et de protéger en tous temps les personnes, leurs biens et leur espace de vie. Les services de la sécurité civile, à l’exception de ce qui concerne les missions des secours médicaux, sanitaires et psychosociaux, sont organisés et structurés conformément aux articles 4 à 6. Pour l’exercice de ses missions en matière de sécurité civile, l’autorité fédérale dispose notamment d’unités opérationnelles de la Protection Civile, du Centre fédéral de formation pour les services de secours, du Centre fédéral de connaissances pour la sécurité civile et d’une inspection générale des services. La zone de secours assure la création et l’organisation des postes sur son territoire et remplit les missions qui lui sont confiées par la présente loi de manière autonome. La zone de secours est composée d’un réseau de postes dont le nombre et l’implantation sont déterminés en fonction de l’analyse des risques en particulier par rapport à l’assainissement des sols pollués et aux sites d’activités économiques à réhabiliter.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Environmental planning,Disasters,Forest fires,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil pollution/quality,Soil rehabilitation,Polluter pays principle,Pollution control,Sustainable use,Public health

Policy: Order No. 125 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on state and municipal assessment of forest management projects.
Policy_Content: This Order provides that state and municipal self-government bodies shall undertake state and municipal assessments of forest management projects in order to determine their compliance with forestry operations, regional forest management plans and national forest legislation. Leaseholders managing forests in accordance with permanent (open-ended) lease contracts shall file an application for state and municipal assessment specifying: (a) full data of leaseholder; (b) data, number and registration reference of lease contract; and (c) location, forest area, type and terms of forest management. Assessments shall be carried out within 30 days of receipt of the application. If the assessment reaches a negative conclusion, forest management shall be prohibited. If the assessment reaches a positive conclusion, forest management shall be authorized for the duration of the forest management project.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 24-RZ “On environmental protection”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Regional Law shall be to ensure the right of the regional population to clean and healthy environment for the benefit of the present and the future generations and to safeguard environmental security. Objects of environmental protection shall be components of the natural environment, natural objects and complexes. Regional Government shall have the following competence in the sphere of environmental protection: (a) definition of the main guidelines of environmental protection; (b) organization of continuing ecological education; (c) supply of information related to the current state of natural environment; (d) organization of regional environmental audit; and (e) constitution of regional protected areas.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Right to clean/healthy environment,Environmental security,Education,Environmental audit,Protected area,Access-to-information,Sustainable development,Human rights
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decree No. 60 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on operation of gas-cleaning installations.
Policy_Content: This Decree sets forth the rules of operation of gas-cleaning installations establishing environmental standards for construction, assemblage, adjustment, maintenance, technical overhaul, testing, putting in and out of operation thereof. It shall not be applicable to motor vehicles and industrial facilities that do not emit pollutants directly to the atmospheric air. It classifies gas-cleaning installations by type and mode of functioning and establishes mandatory registration thereof.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on 1 June 2007.

Policy: Decree No. 58 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on reporting related to geological exploration of subsoil.
Policy_Content: This Decree sets forth the procedure for reporting related to geological exploration of subsoil, composition and contents of reports. The aforesaid reports shall be compiled by organizations performing geological surveying, pilot-scale work, field geological prospecting, assessment and survey, geophysical, hydrogeological and other geological operations upon completion of one of the phases. Report must composed of no more than 300 printed sheets and must contain  description of geological composition, mineral deposits assessment and geological mapping of explored and prospected area.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the first day of the month following the month of its approval.

Policy: Decree No. 65 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on phases and stages of exploration of groundwater.
Policy_Content: This Decree lists phases and stages of exploration of groundwater for all subsoil managers performing exploration, prospecting and study of perspective of all types of groundwater deposits. The scope of geological exploration shall be efficient and complex hydrogeological study of subsoil with a view of well sinking and mining operations for extraction of groundwater. Geological exploration shall be conducted in compliance with programs and projects approved in accordance with the established modalities.
Subject: Mineral resources, Water
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the first day of the month following the month of its approval.

Policy: Decree No. 56 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on establishment of criteria of quality assessment and efficiency assessment of geological exploration and geological report on assessment of minerals and (or) geothermal groundwater resources.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes the procedure for establishment of criteria of quality assessment and efficiency assessment of geological exploration and geological report on assessment of minerals and (or) geothermal groundwater resources on the basis of data contained in reports submitted by subsoil managers. Quality and efficiency assessment shall establish preparedness of mineral deposit for mining operations, compliance with fulfillment of planned amount of explored mineral deposits and quality of performed exploration work.
Subject: Mineral resources, Water
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the first day of the month following the month of its approval.

Policy: Regulation No. 11 of 14 May 2007 on the norms for arsenic, cadmium, nickel and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons in the ambient air.
Policy_Content: This Regulation defines the concrete target values for maximum levels of concentration as regards the arsenic, cadmium, nickel and benzo (a) pyrene in ambient air; uniform methods and criteria for assessing the levels of arsenic, cadmium, mercury, nickel and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in the ambient air and their deposition in atmospheric air; methods for improvement of the ambient air quality in target areas; public information approach.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Black Sea, Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force on 1 January 2008.

Policy: Loi nº 07-06 relative à la gestion, à la protection et au développement des espaces verts.
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour objet de définir les règles de gestion, de protection et de développement des espaces verts dans le cadre du développement durable, pour atteindre les objectifs suivants: améliorer le cadre de vie urbain; d’entretenir et d’améliorer la qualité des espaces verts urbains existants; de promouvoir la création d’espaces verts de toute nature; de promouvoir l’extension des espaces verts par rapport aux espaces bâtis; de faire de l’introduction des espaces verts, dans tout projet de construction, une obligation prise en charge par les études urbanistiques et architecturales publiques et privées.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 29.130 - Reglamento de áreas reservadas a favor de Yacimientos Petrolíferos Fiscales Bolivianos.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo tiene por objeto reservar y adjudicar áreas de interés hidrocarburífero en Zonas Tradicionales y No Tradicionales a favor de Yacimientos Petrolíferos Fiscales Bolivianos (YPFB). Asimismo, el Decreto establece los mecanismos de asociación a ser aplicados para que YPBF desarrolle actividades de exploración y explotación por sí o en asociación.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Landlocked Developing Countries, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America

Policy: Ley Nº 18.126 - Crea el Consejo Agropecuario.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto la creación del Consejo Agropecuario, cuya responsabilidad será contribuir al desarrollo de una política de descentralización de la gestión del Ministerio de Ganadería, Agricultura y Pesca, así como promover una mayor participación de la sociedad agropecuaria en la definición de las políticas del sector. El Consejo está integrado por el Consejo Agropecuario Nacional, los Consejos Agropecuarios Departamentales y las Mesas de Desarrollo Rural.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 616/2007 - Fomento de la cogeneración.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto tiene por objeto la creación de un marco para el fomento de la cogeneración de alta eficiencia de calor y electricidad basado en la demanda de calor útil y en el ahorro de energía primaria, incrementando la eficiencia energética y mejorando la seguridad del abastecimiento.

Policy: Loi modifiant la loi du 21 décembre 1998 relative aux normes de produits ayant pour but la promotion de modes de production et de consommation durables et la protection de l'environnement et de la santé (1).
Policy_Content: La présente loi modifie la loi du 21 décembre 1998 relative aux normes de produits ayant pour but la promotion de modes de production et de consommation durables et la protection de l'environnement et de la santé. En particulier, on ajoute un nouveau chapitre Vbis sur les Dispositions spéciales établissant un cadre pour la fixation d'exigences en matière. En outre, on ajoute les annexes suivantes: Marquage CE (II); Déclaration de conformité (III); Contrôle interne de la conception (IV); Système de management pour l'évaluation de la conformité (V).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Délibération de l’assemblée de la province Nord  n° 2007-49/APN du 11 mai 2007  relative à la limitation des bruits émis dans l'environnement par les installations classées pour la protection de l'environnement.
Policy_Content: La présente délibération fixe les dispositions relatives aux émissions sonores des installations classées pour la protection de l'environnement, à l'exclusion des élevages de veaux de boucherie et/ou de bovins, des élevages de vaches laitières et/ou mixtes, des porcheries, des élevages de volailles et/ou de gibiers à plumes.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, European Union Countries, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Amhara National Regional State Rural Land Administration and Use System Implementation, Council of Regional Government Regulation (No. 51/2007).
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the council of the Amhara Regional Government, made  in accordance with the powers vested in it under the provisions of Art. 58 sub-art.7 of the revised Regional constitution and Art. 33 sub-art. 1 of the revised Rural Land Administration and use Determination Proclamation No. 133/2006, concerns, among other things: acquisition of land for agricultural use and relative rights; redistribution of land; land size ceilings; exchange of land; land utilization; land consolidation; transfer of land-related rights; obligations of persons who have acquired rural land holding or use rights; duties and responsibilities of hierarchical lower rural land administration and use bodies; conditions of expropriating rural land holding for public service and disbursing of compensation for property; public participation. The Regulation shall have specific objectives, including: a) to create favorable conditions enabling the land administration system to promote long-lasting agricultural product and productivity of the regional state by causing the full implementation of the rights and obligations pertaining to the rural land holders as are stipulated under the Proclamation; b) to put in place a land use system instrumental for the preservation of the soil fertility as well as environment safety; c) to realize an equitable land administration system in the regional state by devising a mechanism of documentation incorporating each and every land holder and the overall nature of the holding so occupied.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Agricultural development,Farming,Basic legislation,Land reform,Land tenure,Agricultural land,Ownership,Land-use planning,Dispute settlement,Institution,Smallholders/peasants,Land consolidation,Lease,Water rights

Policy: National Strategic Development Plan.
Policy_Content: The National Strategic Development Plan is a multi-sectoral national planning instrument that addresses a comprehensive range of issues, goals, strategies, objectives and actions that are strategic in charting the course towards the social and economic advancement of Grenada. The vision of the Plan is for Grenada to embrace a rich heritage that nurtures community and family values, with a united, educated, spiritual and hospitable people, thriving in a peaceful democratic environment, transformed by innovation, creativity, enterprise and equal opportunity for a better quality of life. To pursue this vision, the Plan outlines 12 goals related with: 1) economy and eradication of poverty; 2) social capital; 3) cultural capital; 4) governance, democracy, peace and security; 5) youth development; 6) gender;  7) sustainable environment and physical development; 8) tourism; 9) agriculture; 10) agro-processing; 11) construction; and 12) economic infrastructure.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Cultivated plants

Policy: Tuvalu’s National Adaptation Programme of Action.
Policy_Content: Tuvalu’s National Adaptation Programme of Action (NAPA) is a cross-sectoral national plan whose main objectives are:  1) to develop a country-wide programme that encompasses urgent and immediate needs of communities; 2) to implement immediate and urgent adaptation activities to climate change and variability; 3) to enhance communities awareness and livelihood; and 4) to mainstream adaptation measures into national and sectoral planning.

Policy: Ley Nº 6/2007 - Ley de Medidas urgentes en materia de ordenación del territorio y del litoral de Galicia.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto la adopción de medidas urgentes en materia de ordenación del territorio y del litoral de Galicia, con la finalidad de: 1) Garantizar la preservación del litoral en tanto no sea aprobado el Plan de ordenación del litoral o el planeamiento urbanístico adaptado a la legislación vigente y a los criterios de sostenibilidad económica, social y ambiental; 2) Integrar los procedimientos de aprobación de los instrumentos de ordenación del territorio y del planeamiento urbanístico con el proceso de evaluación ambiental estratégica; 3) Crear el Instituto de Estudios del Territorio; 4) Fomentar la creación de suelo destinado a viviendas protegidas.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil

Policy: Sector Strategy of Agriculture and Food.
Policy_Content: The Sector Strategy of Agriculture and Food is a national strategy with a cross-sectoral approach. The timeframe of the Strategy is 7 years between 2007-2013. It adopts a twin- track approach by identifying thefollowing  strategic priorities a) to increase the financial support for farms, agricultural and agro-processing businesses, b) to improve the management, irrigation, and drainage of agricultural land, c) to improve the marketing of agricultural and agro-processing products, d) to increase the level and quality of technologies, information, and knowledge of farmers and agro-processors, e) to increase the quality and food safety of agricultural and agro-processing products. The Strategy sees the agricultural and agro-The long-term Strategic goals are: a) Sustained management of land, as a basic component for the sound agricultural development and completely in compliance with that; b) Increase of employment, incomes, and farmers’ and their families’ life level ;c) Increase of agricultural and agro-processing sector’s economic efficiency that is expressed through productivity enhancement and a higher quality of their products; d). Guaranteeing a higher food safety standard for all the population; e) Improvement of the agricultural marketing processing development in the perspective of European integration. The strategic sectors will be developed based on the studies identifying the most favorable areas and adequate support policies from the economic, social, and environment points of view; so that, the economic efficiency and productivity get higher, employment increases, environment be protected and production resources be well-used.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Agricultural commodities,Agricultural development,Agricultural land,Capacity building,Consumer protection,Erosion,Extension,Farming,Financial agricultural measures,Fiscal and market measures,Food security,Governance,Institution,Internal trade,International trade,Irrigation,Rural employment,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Food quality control/food safety,HACCP,Public health

Policy: Decree No. 12.312 approving the basic and operational structure of the Agency for Agrarian Development and Rural Extension (AGRAER).
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 28 articles divided into eight Chapters, approves the basic and operational structure of the Agency for Agrarian Development and Rural Extension (AGRAER). AGRAER, results from the transformation of the Institute for Rural Development and Rural Extension of Mato Grosso do Sul (IDATERRA), as a state autarchy with legal personality created by Law No. 3.345 of 22 December 2006, reorganizing the Basic Structure of the Executive Branch of the State of Mato Grosso do Sul, amending Law No. 2.152 of 26 October 2000. AGRAER is a co-responsible body for the promotion of development, linked to the Secretary of State Environment, Economic Development, Production and Family Agriculture (SEMAGRO). AGRAER will operate throughout the territory of the State of Mato Grosso do Sul, and may install and maintain Regional and Local Agencies and Advanced Stations. This Decree establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Agency as well as its Internal Regulations and the legislation applicable to local authorities.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: National Land Policy.
Policy_Content: Land is and will remain a primary asset for national development, performing multiple social, economic, ecological and cultural functions. In our vision, land, including both terrestrial and marine areas, will contribute to economic development in agriculture, fisheries, tourism, trade, manufacturing and other sectors. It will also provide the space for all Saint Lucians to live and shelter, it will contribute to food security for the nation and good nutrition for all its citizens. Additionally, it will play a full role in poverty reduction and elimination, and will be a factor of social cohesion and cultural identity. Ultimately, land will support biological diversity, environmental quality and natural biophysical processes, and it will be used in conformity with its capability and conservation requirements. In this vision, people will show respect for the land as a national resource and together with people and organisations will understand fully the value and importance of land and the extent to which they depend on it. All social actors will assume full responsibility in land management, thanks to a strong political will and a deep popular commitment to tackle all land management issues, however complex or sensitive they may be. Goal The National Land Policy is to guide the use, management, development and administration of land resources in Saint Lucia in order to optimise the contribution of land to sustainable development. Guiding principles The principles that guide Saint Lucia’s National Land Policy are as follows: Equity; Right to land ownership; all stakeholders must recognise that land ownership also comes with the responsibility to keep the land in adequate and productive condition; Leadership role in formulating and facilitating implementation by all actors; Accountability; Collaboration and participation; Enforcement; Efficiency; Capacity building; Coordination and integration; Protection of common property; Precaution; Provision of incentives; Diversity in land rights and management regimes are recognised.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Land & soil, Sea, Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Decree No. 52 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on exploration of solid minerals by phases and stages.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes general provisions for geological exploration of solid minerals by phases and stages, contents, results and completeness of geological exploration and it shall be mandatory for all subsoil managers performing geological exploration of solid minerals. The scope of work performance by phases and stages permits optimization of project scope and geological exploration technology with a view of unification of exploration, operational registration of results and analysis of geological studies with a view of correct assessment of solid mineral deposits and developing new directions of geological exploration and prospecting.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Norwegian Strategy on Invasive Alien Species.
Policy_Content: The Norwegian Strategy on Invasive Alien Species is a cross-sectoral strategy prepared with the objective to manage the environment in a way that maintains the diversity of habitats and landscape types and ensures that there are viable populations of naturally-occurring species, thus ensuring that biological diversity can continue to evolve. In addition, Norway aims to halt the loss of biodiversity by 2010.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Rural Land Administration and Use System Implementation, Council of Regional Government Regulation No. 51/2007.
Policy_Content: This Regulation concerns rural land management and rights and use of rural land in Amhara National Region. It seeks to create favourable conditions enabling the land administration system to promote long-lasting agricultural development and productivity in the regional state by causing the full implementation of the rights and obligations pertaining to the rural land holders as are stipulated under the Revised Rural Land Administration and Use Determination Proclamation. It also provides for the preservation of the soil fertility, devises a land documentation mechanism, provides special protection accorded to women, incapables and orphans, and provides with respect to investment in rural land. Rural residents engaging or wishing to engage in an agricultural activity have a right to freely acquire a land holding in the regional state. Non-commercial organizations may acquire land if this does not affect rights of farmers. Private investors who desire to engage in an agricultural business may lease land from the Government or obtain a rental agreement from private holders.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Land & soil, Water

Policy: Plan National Protection Nature (PNPN 2007–2011).
Policy_Content: Le Plan national concernant la protection de la nature est un document à portée nationale qui vise l’atteinte de deux objectifs stratégiques: a) enrayer la perte de la biodiversité, en particulier par le maintien et le rétablissement d’un état de conservation favorable des espèces et des habitats menacés, d’intérêt national ou communautaire; b) préserver et rétablir les services et processus écosystémiques à l’échelle paysagère et nationale. L’atteinte des objectifs stratégiques est tributaire d’un agencement et d’une coordination étroite entre les domaines suivants: (i) la mise en oeuvre de mesures concrètes de protection et de gestion; (ii) un cadre légal favorable; (iii) le monitoring des actions menées; (iv) la recherche scientifique; (v) la sensibilisation du public. Les mesures proposées par le plan national visent particulièrement cinq secteurs où l’intégration d’approches favorisant la diversité biologique est prioritaire: l’agriculture, la sylviculture, la gestion de l’eau, l’urbanisme et l’aménagement du territoire. Le plan d’action national pour la protection de la nature pour la période 2007 à 2011 comprend 41 mesures ou actions à réaliser ou à entamer endéans les 5 années à venir, dont 15 hautement prioritaires. Le PNPN se compose des Parties suivantes: 1) Plan d’Action National pour la protection de la nature; 2) Cadre global du PNPN; 3) Etat de la situation; 4) Stratégie du PNPN; 5) Catalogue des mesures proposées. L’Annexe A établit la liste des sites prioritaires ; l’Annexe B établit la Carte des sites prioritaires.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Forestry, Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Federal Law No. 69-FZ amending some legislative acts related to public land.
Policy_Content: In the item 5 of the Article 2 of the Federal Law No. 33-FZ on protected areas the wording “plots of land” shall be substituted with the wording “land”. Article 22 of Land Code shall be supplemented with item 3.1 of the following wording: "3.1. Lease contract for a plot of land pertaining to public or municipal property and located within land boundaries reserved for public or municipal needs shall be concluded for the period of time not exceeding the period of reservation of the aforesaid land.”; Article 23 shall be supplemented with item 4.1 of the following wording: "4.1. The period of public servitude of a plot of land located within land boundaries reserved for public or municipal needs shall be concluded for the period of time not exceeding the period of reservation of the aforesaid land.” Article 11 of the Law No. 172-FZ on transfer of land or plots of land from one category into another shall be supplemented with the following wording: “1. Except for forestland on which are located greenbelts or plots of land pertaining to forestland.”
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Order No. 124 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on the use of forests for agro-forestry.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of the management public forest for agro-forestry. Agro-forestry shall be prohibited in the greenbelts and forest parks. Agro-forestry shall not impede free access and stay of citizens in the forests. Forests can be used for mowing, grazing, deer-raising, cultivation of crops and other agricultural activities.

Policy: Environment Damage Act.
Policy_Content: Article 1 of the present Act is contained in the Act of 10 May 2007 (BGBl. I 666) implementing Directive 2004/35/CE of the European Parliament and of the Council on environmental liability with regard to the prevention and remedying of environmental damage. This European Directive establishes a framework of environmental liability based on the “polluter-pays”principle. For the purpose of the present Act “environmental damage” includes damage to protected species and natural habitats, water damage and land damage. The text – consisting of 13 articles – deals with the following matters: relations to other provisions, definition of terms, sphere of application, duty to inform, duty to avert dangers, liability in case of damage, general duties and authorizations of the competent authority, fixing of remedying measures, costs, legal protection, cooperation with other member states of the European Union. Three Annexes are enclosed.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Act enters into force on 14 November 2007.

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución fija las variables y parámetros, indica la información mínima que debe ser suministrada y adopta la metodología que deberá ser aplicada en el establecimiento de los volúmenes máximos de combustibles líquidos derivados del petróleo para los grandes consumidores en zonas de frontera.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Energy
Keyword: Agricultural development,Financial agricultural measures,Less favoured areas,Subsidy/incentive,Equipment,Transport/storage,Internal trade,Oil
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Governmental Resolution No. 96 on the inclusion and exclusion of certain areas within the State Forest Fund.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Resolution determines the rules and conditions applying to the inclusion or exclusion of certain areas in or from the State Forest Fund. The following bodies are entitled to claim the inclusion or exclusion of forest areas in or from the State Forest Fund: (a) state bodies; (b) local bodies of self-government; and (c) natural or legal persons. The applicants shall apply to the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources of Georgia and justify their proposal for the inclusion or exclusion of forest areas in or from the State Forest Fund. The applicants must submit the following documentation: (a) application; (b) in the case of legal persons and bodies corporate an excerpt of the public register; in the case of natural persons proof of identity as provided by law; bodies corporate under public law shall provide authenticated documentation on the property in question; (c) site-plans of the area in question; (d) a detailed justification for the applied for inclusion or exclusion of forest areas in or from the State Forest Fund.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy: Order No. 123 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on forest management for processing timber and other forest resources.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the requirements for processing timber and other forest resources. Public and municipal forest plots shall be leased to citizens and legal persons for processing timber and other forest resources, and shall be managed in accordance with regional forest plans and forestry regulations. Timber processing facilities shall be located on non-forested plots of land or, if no such plots exist, on non-renewable cutting areas, fire-sites, wasteland or glades. The following shall be prohibited on land leased: (a) work or construction that damages or swamps forest areas; (b) littering up; (c) emission of chemical or radioactive pollution; and (d) passage of vehicles or other machines through unauthorized routes.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decree No. 18 of 2007 (V. 10.) KvVM of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Water concerning data provision to the environmental protection registration system of groundwaters and geological resources.
Policy_Content: This Decree provides rules regarding the obligation of notification to the national environmental protection registration system of activities which may have an impact on groundwaters and geological resources and which are subject to authorization according to the provisions of the Decree regarding the protection of groundwaters. Further provisions of this Decree address data provision concerning contaminated areas, sources of pollution and mitigation of damages, monitoring of environmental use and damage mitigation. Annexes contain model notification and reporting documents.
Subject: Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil pollution/quality,Data collection/reporting,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Freshwater resources management,Groundwater,Pollution control,Registration,Monitoring
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto tiene por objeto disposiciones que modifican y complementan el Decreto Supremo Nº 29.033, que establece los procedimientos de consulta y participación para actividades hidrocarburíferas de los pueblos indígenas, originarios y comunidades campesinas. Las modificaciones se refieren en particular al financiamiento del proceso de consulta y la planificación de las acciones a desarrollar en el ámbito de la participación de los pueblos indígenas, originarios y comunidades campesinas.

Policy: Regulation on values of climatic water balance for individual species of cultivated plants and soil.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development, which is composed of two paragraphs and one Annex, establishes values of climatic water balance for individual species of cultivated plants and soil (specified in the Annex). These values are used to evaluate results of drought due to the Act on financial support to insurance of agricultural cultivation and livestock.The values for all provinces are the same.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
