Policy: Regulation No. 72 of the Minister of Agriculture establishing the Procedure for application for authorization and grant of authorization and criteria for authorization of reference laboratories.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for application for and grant of authorisation to operate as a reference laboratory. An applicant for authorisation shall submit a written application to the Minister of Agriculture n which the following information shall be set out: (a) the name, registry code or personal identification code and telecommunication numbers of the applicant and the representative thereof; (b) address of the seat and place of business of the applicant; (c) the description of the scope of the applied authorisation and the list of methods of analysis for the use of which the laboratory is accredited; (d) the name and position of the person responsible for the organisation of the activities of the laboratory. The following documents shall be annexed to a application: (a) copies of the accreditation certificate issued by the accreditation agency and its appendix; and (b) an action plan within the scope of the applied authorisation for compliance with the requirements provided for in Article 33.2 of Regulation (EC) No 882/2004 of the European Parliament and of the Council. Authorization is granted or denied by a directive of the Minister of Agriculture within twenty days of the receipt of a written application. Authorization shall be granted for an unspecified term.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force on 19 May 2007.

Policy: Ordinance on authorization and control charges in waste management.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements various articles of the Environment Protection Law Basel-Landschaft of 27 February 1991. In particular, article 1 lists charges levied on the occasion of the authorization of running small, medium and big waste disposal plants. Article 2 lays down charges concerning the control of such waste disposal plants. The Ordinance deals also with the increase and reduction of charges, rejected applications, lack of inspection and repeal of existing legislation. The text consists of 11 articles.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Ordinance enters into force on 1 July 2007.

Policy: Resolución Nº 613/07 - Programa Social de Bosques.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el reglamento y la organización del Programa Social de Bosques, el cual constituye una actividad permanente de la Secretaría de Ambiente y Desarrollo Sustentable con la finalidad de brindar asistencia técnica y financiera para la realización de obras de restauración y aprovechamiento sustentable de las masas forestales nativas. Otro de los objetivos del Programa es el de incrementar el área forestada nacional, en particular favoreciendo a comunidades rurales y facilitando la autogestión de los bosques y tierras dentro de los territorios indígenas.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 273 regarding calculation of damage caused to forest by the infringement of forest legislation.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree validates the rates of compensation for the damage caused by the infringement of forest legislation to forest trees, shrubbery and liana authorized for timber extraction (Annex 1), the rates of compensation for the damage caused by the infringement of forest legislation to protected forest trees and shrubbery (Annex 2) and the modalities of calculation of the aforesaid rates (Annex 3). The modalities of calculation of rates include the direct damage caused by the infringement of forest legislation and loss of profit. In case of the destruction of trees, shrubbery and liana by effluent wastewater, chemicals, radioactive, toxic and hazardous substances, forest fires and arson the damage shall be calculated with the consideration of soil improvement and shall include the cost of fire extinguishing.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Offences/penalties,Forest fires,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Protection of species

Policy: Law of Georgia on Cultural Heritage (No. 4708-IS of 2007)
Policy_Content: This Law provides for the protection of the cultural heritage of Georgia. The purpose of this Law is to protect the cultural heritage of Georgia and to regulate legal relations originating in this field. This Law applies to cultural heritage in the whole territory of Georgia. It also provides that Georgia cares for the protection of the cultural heritage of Georgia located abroad. The procedures for the export and import of objects of cultural heritage and cultural value from and into Georgia, as well as the procedures for the regulation of professional activities in the field of cultural heritage, shall be defined by individual legislative acts.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Forestry, Land & soil, Wild species & ecosystems, General

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 214 on forest conservation measures.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree charges the Ministry of Forests and its officials and state organizations with the responsibility to protect forests. Direct protection and conservation of forests shall be carried by forest officers. Forest officers shall be directly responsible for implementing protection and conservation measures, including, afforestation and reforestation, and for maintaining a favourable environment for wildlife species. The Decree requires that the sale of standing timber shall entail the allocation and transfer of woodcutting areas and the registration of timber extraction and logging. Main use, intermediate and secondary cutting of standing timber may be authorized for sale. It does not apply to trees and shrubbery located in the inhabited areas except for urban forests. Only secondary cutting shall be authorized in protected areas in accordance with the relevant regulation on their management. Woodcutting areas shall consist of mature and overly mature forests. Final harvesting of acutifoliate elm, linden, beech, Karelian birch, cedar and red fir shall be prohibited. Felling licences shall be issued annually to forest managers for each woodcutting area separately, and shall specify the amount of timber that may be extracted and set a deadline for its transport.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Presidential Decree enters into force on 1 June 2007, except for items 11 and 11.2, which enter into force on the date of the Decree’s official publication.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 215 on environmental charges.
Policy_Content: The President decree to apply environmental charges to national and imported products containing 50 percent and over of volatile organic compounds and exclude from payment of environmental charges produce confiscated by customs authorities and subject to destruction and also waste materials originating from the destruction of the aforesaid produce. Environmental charges shall not be applicable also to the following categories: (a) oil well gas; (b) drainage groundwater extracted in the process of mining; (c) water abstraction for fire water supply; (d) radioactive waste disposal related to Chernobyl nuclear disaster; and (e) emissions to the atmospheric air from stationary and non-stationary sources for which maximum emission limits have not been set.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Presidential Decree enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Order No. 135-o of the Minister of Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on public hearing on ecological issues.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of organization and carrying out public hearing for discussion of environmental impact assessment (EIA). It is based upon the constitutional rights of citizens to timely access to reliable and complete information on the state of environment and public participation in decision-making on ecological issues. Public hearing shall be held on projects that may have direct impact on environment and human health. Participant of public hearing shall be: (a) public concerned; (b) social and non-governmental organizations and associations; and (c) local self-government and state bodies under which supervision fall debated issues.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Décret exécutif nº07-127 du 5 mai 2007 relatif à la délimitation et à la classification du domaine minier en zones et à la définition des périmètres de prospection, de recherche et d’exploitation.
Policy_Content: En application des dispositions de l’article 19 de la loi nº 05-07 relative aux hydrocarbures, le présent décret a pour objet de déterminer: - la subdivision du domaine minier national en quatre (4) zones:Zone A, Zone B, Zone C et Zone D; - le nombre de parcelles composant chaque périmètre et la géométrie de ce périmètre, - les tailles maxima des périmètres de chaque zone et les programmes minima de travaux. La délimitation de ces zones est définie en annexe du présent décret comportant également la liste des périmètres relevant de chacune de ces zones.

Policy: Law No. 5648 on the establishment and functions of Agriculture and Rural Development Support Institution.
Policy_Content: This Law sets forth the establishment, functions, duties, powers and responsibilities of the Agriculture and Rural Development Support Institution under the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs. The Law defines the main function and responsibility of the Institution as: the implementation of rural development programs using the resources provided by the European Union and other international organizations. Article. 4 of the Law defines other duties and responsibilities of the Institution as: Evaluation the applications and project proposals, designation projects to be supported, management and control of financial matters concerning the implementation of the projects, preparing project reports and establishing a database on the functions of the Institution and on the projects. The Law states that organization chart of the Institution is divided into central and provincial. The central organization consists of the main service units, the consultation and audit units and the auxiliary service units, and the provincial organization consist of the provincial coordinators.

Policy: Regional Law No. 105-ZO “On objects of cultural heritage”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of conservation, management, promotion and state protection of the objects of cultural heritage. Regional Government shall carry out the following plenary powers: (a) implementation of state policy; (b) conservation and protection of the objects of cultural heritage; (c) determination of the authorized regional state institution in the sphere of protection of the objects of cultural heritage; (d) validation of the list of the objects of cultural heritage that cannot be either expropriated or transferred; (e) validation of the boundaries of protection areas of the objects of cultural heritage; and (f) classification of the objects of cultural heritage.

Policy: Regional Law No. 245 “On modalities and rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens shall have the right for timber extraction of forest species for individual personal needs in accordance with felling authorization and purchase and sale contract of forest species growing in public forest. Rates of timber extraction shall be established as follows: (a) for individual housing construction – up to 100 cubic metres once in fifty years; (b) for repairs and reconstruction of housing facilities – up to 20 cubic metres once in ten years per family; (c) fuelwood for heating – up to 20 cubic metres annually. Regional authorities shall establish annually total allowable standing timber for timber extraction in accordance with forest organization and management plans.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional law No. 244 “On allotment of agricultural land to citizens for haying and grazing”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the conditions for allotment of parcels of public or municipal agricultural land on lease to citizens for haying and grazing. Agricultural land parcels shall be allotted to citizens on condition of ownership of agricultural animals thereby. Minimum land area shall be 5 ha. Common access land areas, waterbodies and parks shall not be allotted for haying and grazing. Planting of perennial timber species and shrubbery, and also timber extraction shall be prohibited on land areas allotted for haying and grazing.
Subject: Livestock, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Law No. 877-V “On basic principles of state supervision (control) in the sphere of economic activity.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal and organizational basic principles for performance of state supervision (control) in the sphere of economic activity, plenary powers of state bodies and public officials, and also liability of the subjects of economic activity in the process of performance of the aforesaid state control (supervision). State supervision (control) shall be performance of proceedings within the limits established by acting legislation with a view of prevention of the infringement of legislation by the subjects of economic activity and insuring protection of the interests of society, in particular ensuring adequate quality of produce and services, acceptable risk level for the population and environment. State supervision and control shall be performed by the authorized state institutions, bodies and officials.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition
Keyword: Business/industry/corporations,Jurisdictional competence,Risk assessment/management,Offences/penalties,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Human rights,Food quality control/food safety

Policy_Content: This Decree lists veterinary supervision officials entitled with plenary powers of drafting reports on administrative offences, related to technical state of agricultural machinery and equipment, and validates form sheets of report on administrative offences (Annex 1), resolution on application of disciplinary action (administrative penalty) (Annex 2) and injunction order of technical supervision body subordinated to the Ministry of Agriculture and Food (Annex 3).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Law No. 8.598 creating the Forestry Registry, composed of the Registry of Exploiters and Consumers of Forestry Products of the State of Maranhão (CEPROF-MA) and the System of Marketing and Transportation of Forestry Products (SISFLORAMA).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 25 articles and one Annex, creates the Forestry Registry, composed of the Registry of Exploiters and Consumers of Forestry Products of the State of Maranhão (CEPROF-MA) and the System of Marketing and Transportation of Forestry Products (SISFLORAMA). CEPROF-MA is the instrument used by the State Environmental Agency for the registration of individuals and companies responsible for extracting, collecting, benefiting, processing, industrializing, marketing, storing or consuming forestry products, by-products or raw material within the State, including plantations and reforestation. SISFLORA-MA is the computerized instrument used by the State Environmental Agency necessary for the operation of registration, licensing, commercialization and transportation of forestry products, producing their effects throughout the national territory, as established in this Law. Included in the activities of mandatory registration in CEPROF-MA, among the enterprises above described are those identified here and their equivalents: I - Sustainable Forestry Management Plan PMFS-MA; II - PEF-MA Forestry Exploitation Plan; III - Request for Simplified Forestry Exploitation PEFS-MA; IV - PCS-MA Selective Logging Plan; V - Suppression of Authorized Vegetation in SALI-MA Installation Licenses; VI - Suppression of Authorized Vegetation in Smallholding or Rural Family Possession SAPP-MA; VII - Forestry Exploitation in Small Properties EFPPMA; VIII - PFLP-MA Pasture Cleaning Forest Product; IX - PFDE-MA Stock Declaration Forest Product; X - Reforestation with Native Species REN-MA; XI - Reforestation with Exotic Species REE-MA; XII - Eradication or Pruning of Culture or Fruit Species EPCF-MA.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Registration,Forest management/forest conservation,Forestry protection measures,Ecosystem preservation,Research,Environmental planning,Authorization/permit,Transport/storage,International trade
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Noise Maps Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance lays down provisions relating to strategic noise maps. The text deals with the following matters: general provisions, definition of terms, calculation and assessment method, and issue of maps for particularly noisy areas. The text consists of 4 articles.

Policy: Décret n° 2007-682 du 3 mai 2007 modifiant le décret nº 94-1212 pris pour l'application du code de la consommation en ce qui concerne le mode de production biologique des produits agricoles et sa mention sur les produits agricoles et les denrées alimentaires.
Policy_Content: Les opérateurs mentionnés à l'article 8 du règlement du 24 juin 1991 qui achètent préemballés et revendent en l'état les produits mentionnés à l'article 1er de ce règlement, directement au consommateur final ou à l'utilisateur final, ne sont pas soumis aux dispositions du paragraphe 1 de l'article 8 du règlement. Les mêmes opérateurs, qui revendent, non préemballés, directement au consommateur final, les produits mentionnés à l'article 1er du règlement ne sont pas soumis aux dispositions du point b du paragraphe 1 de l'article 8 du règlement, si le montant annuel d'achat de ces produits est inférieur à un montant fixé par arrêté des ministres chargés de l'agriculture et de la consommation. Ils demeurent tenus de notifier leur activité à l'Agence française pour le développement et la promotion de l'agriculture biologique (Agence BIO) dans les conditions prévues au point a du paragraphe 1 de l'article 8 du même règlement.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Financial agricultural measures,Subsidy/incentive,Ecological production/organic production,Farming,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Animal production,Plant production
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Décret n° 2007-700 du 3 mai 2007 relatif aux études de dangers des ouvrages d'infrastructures de stationnement, chargement ou déchargement de matières dangereuses portant application de l'article L. 551-2 du code de l'environnement.
Policy_Content: Le contenu de l'étude de dangers, à laquelle sont soumis les ouvrages d'infrastructures routières, ferroviaires, portuaires ou de navigation intérieure et les installations multimodales en application du présent décret, doit être en relation avec l'importance des risques engendrés par l'installation. En tant que de besoin, cette étude donne lieu à une analyse de risques qui prend en compte la probabilité d'occurrence, la cinétique et la gravité des accidents potentiels, que leur cause soit interne ou externe, selon une méthodologie qu'elle explicite. Elle définit et justifie les mesures propres à réduire la probabilité et les effets de ces accidents.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

The text – consisting of 208 sections – deals with the following matters: oil, noxious liquid substances and dangerous chemicals, pollutant substances, sewage; garbage, air and anti -fouling systems. Policy: Limitation of Emissions of Volatile Organic Compounds due to the use of Organic Solvents in Certain Paints, Varnishes and Vehicle Refinishing Products Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 199 of 2007).
Policy_Content: The purposes of these Regulations are to control the placing on the market of products listed in the First Schedule and to regulate use by vehicle refinishing installations of vehicle refinishing products containing volatile organic compounds. They implement Directive 2004/42/CE on the limitation of emissions of volatile organic compounds due to the use of organic solvents in certain paints and varnishes and vehicle refinishing products which includes an amendment to Directive 1999/13/EC. These Regulations include a corresponding amendment to the Emissions of Volatile Organic Compounds for Organic Solvents Regulations 2002.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Decree No. 18-163 of the Regional Legislative Assembly "On municipal land control
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate. Annexes contain inspection order, compliance certificate, mapping and measurement schemes of land area.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Decree enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 331-OZ “On timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates timber extraction by citizens for individual persona needs and exceptional case of timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contracts of forest species. It establishes the following rates of timber extraction: (a) for individual housing construction – 70 cubic metres once in 10 years; (b) for repairs and reconstruction of housing facilities – 25 cubic metres once in 10 years; and (c) fuelwood for heating of individual residential facilities – 20 cubic metres annually. Timber extraction must not exceed calculated felling rate (maximum allowable timber extraction amount).
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 22-RZ “On seed growing”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating in the process of production, procurement, processing, storage, transportation and trade of seeds of agricultural and forest species, and also organization and performance of plant variety and seed control. It shall be applicable seeds of agricultural plant varieties recorded in the State register of selection achievements and, in particular, to the following seed categories: (a) originators; (b) elite seeds; and reproduction seeds, including hybrids. As regards forestry seeds it shall be applicable to the following categories: (a) normal; (b) improved; and (c) varietal (graded). Seed production shall be authorized exclusively with the adherence to the rights of patent holders.
Subject: Forestry, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Planting material/seeds,Registration,Plant variety,Intellectual property rights/patents,Basic legislation,Plant production

Policy: Regional Law No. 21-rz “On turnover of agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues related to ownership, tenure and disposal of agricultural land. It establishes the modalities of allotment of plots of agricultural land pertaining to state and municipal property. Turnover of agricultural land shall be based upon the following principles: (a) conservation of specific purposeful use of agricultural land; (b) preferential right of purchase of agricultural land by regional and local government except for cases of public auction sale; (c) establishment of maximum agricultural land area within the boundaries of a single municipal unit that can be owned by a single natural or legal person; and (d) establishment of particular modalities of allotment of agricultural land to foreign citizens, foreign legal persons and stateless persons.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Keyword: Agricultural land,Public land,Private land,Property rights,Land tenure,Ownership

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 29.117 - Declara reserva fiscal minera a todo el territorio nacional.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo declara reserva fiscal minera a todo el territorio nacional, comprendiendo los recursos mineralógicos metálicos, no metálicos, evaporíticos, piedras preciosas, semipreciosas y salmueras. Asimismo, prohíbe en todo el territorio nacional el otorgamiento de nuevas concesiones y dispone que las que estuvieren en trámite quedan sin efecto.

Policy: Order No. 408 on the management of international environment protection areas and on the protection of certain species.
Policy_Content: The Order sets regulations on the management of international environment conservation areas, particularly the international habitat conservation areas reserved for wild birds and wetlands, in compliance with the Natura 2000 objectives. Its goal is to maintain and restore conservation status of national bird species and the habitat. For this purpose, the Order sets regulations for the establishment of new land for urban areas, for the planning of roads, the planning of extension of airports, airfields, railways, ports, landfills in the territorial sea, wind turbine clusters and parks, landfills and for the establishment of new areas for mining.
Subject: Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Air Quality Standards Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2007 (S.R. 265 of 2007).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement Community legislation on ambient air quality assessment and management, air pollution and air quality standards. They require the attainment of air quality standards in respect of the concentration of various pollutants in ambient air and designate the Department of the Environment as the competent authority for purposes of ambient air quality assessment and management. They define functions of the Department in relation to the attainment of standards and make provision for the assessment of concentrations of pollution, the monitoring and measurement of pollution, the information of the public and the production of an annual report for ozone.

Policy: Mineral Exploration Standards Regulations (N.L.R. 39/07).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations enact the Labrador Inuit Land Claims Agreement Act. Section 2 of the Regulation establishes that the standards for mineral exploration in Labrador Inuit Lands agreed to by the province and the Nunatsiavut Government under section 4.11.6 of the Labrador Inuit Land Claims Agreement and set out in the Schedule shall apply to mineral exploration in Labrador Inuit Lands. The text consists of 31 sections as follows: General (1); Application for exploration approval (2); Implementation/enforcement (3); Notification and reporting (4); Community liaison (5); Employment and business for Labrador Inuit (6); Environmental protection plan (7); Historic resources (8); Environmental baseline data collection (9); Wildlife and habitat protection (10); Reclamation and closure of exploration site (11); Financial security (12); Airborne survey work (13); Exploration camps works (14); Water use and water quality protection (15); Water crossings (16);Vehicle use (17); Fuel storage handling and transport (18); Waste management (19); Emergency response (20); Line cutting and survey work (21); Clearing of vegetation(22); Clearing of work areas (stripping and stockpiling) (23); Blasting (24); Trenching (25); Drilling (26); Equipment and maintenance (27); Air quality protection (28); Noise suppression (29); Roads and trails (30); Uranium exploration (31).
Subject: Environment gen., Mineral resources, Water
Keyword: Pollution control,Cultural heritage,Waste management,Air quality/air pollution,Enforcement/compliance,Mining,Exploration,Data collection/reporting,Court/tribunal,Transport/storage,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution

APA is a public national body aiming at developing and supporting policies in the field of environment and sustainable development, with particular regards to the following fields:  fight against climate change, air pollution, environmental impact assessment, waste, risk prevention, pollution prevention  control. Policy: Act on Resource Circulation of Electrical and Electronic Equipment and Vehicles.

The text – consisting of 46 articles – provides, amongst other things, for the following: responsibilities of state and local governments; responsibilities of business operators; submission of plan to recycle or collect; collection of recycling charges; establishment of mutual aid association; revocation of authorization; formation of business association; cancellation of registration; reporting; inspection; hearing; penalty provisions.

Policy: Regulation on detailed scope and directions of activities of the Agency for Restructuring and Modernization of Agriculture and ways of their execution.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Council of Ministers, which is composed of 15 paragraphs and one Annex, establishes detailed scope and directions of activities of the Agency for Restructuring and Modernization of Agriculture and ways of their execution. In particular the Agency provides financial support to: (1) investments in agricultural farms, branches of special agricultural production or processing of agricultural products; (2) resume of production in farms placed on areas where there were harms caused by drought, hailstorm, heavy rains or snows, freezing, flood, hurricane, fire caused by lightning, or land slides; (3) high education of rural inhabitants; (4) collection, transport and neutralization of died livestock – cattle, sheep, goats, pigs or horses.

Policy: Decree No. 90 of 2009 (IV.26.) of the Government laying down rules of prevention and remedy of environmental damage.
Policy_Content: Provisions of this Decree shall be applied to surface and underground waters, to geological media, to species and their habitats falling under EU Directive No. 79/409 and EU directive No. 92/43, to protected and intensively protected species, to Natura 2000 areas and to national protected areas. This Decree lays down provisions regarding measures aimed at the prevention of damages to the environment and for the restoration of the environment, response planning, exploration and classification of the environmental damage. The competent authorities are the local water management offices and territorial water management directorates with regard to water pollution, the environmental protection and nature conservation inspectorates and national park directorates for what regard damages caused to the environment and nature.

Policy: Government Decree No. 90 of 2007 (IV. 26.) on prevention and mitigation of environmental damage.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Decree is to regulate the following sectors: (a) surface waters; (b) groundwater and geological medium; (c) species, habitats, breeding sites and resting places as defined in Article 4 (2) and Annex I of Council Directive 79/409/EEC on the conservation of wild birds; (d) Council Directive 92/43/EEC on the conservation of natural habitats and of wild fauna and flora; and IV. the species and habitats specified in Annex II, their breeding sites, resting places and natural habitats as defined in Annex I; (e) protected and highly protected species; f) Natura 2000 sites; (g) protected natural areas of national importance. In order to eliminate environmental damage, measures shall be taken to prevent environmental damage and to remedy environmental damage. Remediation or remediation must be carried out within the framework of the remedial action. In the case of environmental hazards, the user of the environment shall take all measures to prevent damage to the environment and to prevent further damage to the environment, and in particular to immediately control, intercept, remove or otherwise treat the substances causing harm to the environment or other harmful factors. In the event of environmental damage requiring immediate intervention, the user of the environment shall be obliged to perform remediation in all other cases. The rules for remediation are contained in a separate law. Immediate intervention is required if environmental damage endangers public health, public safety or, if the immediate elimination of environmental damage is more effective, efficient, economically feasible and future environmental damage can be prevented.
Subject: Environment gen., Water, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Groundwater,Surface water,Protected area,Protection of habitats,Ecosystem preservation,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Data collection/reporting,Environmental fees/charges,Environmental planning,Public health,Hazardous waste,Inspection,Monitoring,Polluter pays principle,Pollution control,Precautionary principle,Waste management

Policy: Law of the Republic of Indonesia No. 26 of 2007 concerning Spatial Planning.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 80 articles divided into XIII Chapters, provides for the spatial management within Republic of Indonesia, based on the following principles: a) integrity; b) compatibility, harmony and balance; c) sustainability; d) productivity and profitability; e) openness; f) togetherness and partnership; g) protection of public interest; h) legality and justice; and i) accountability. Spatial management aims to realize safe, comfort, productive and sustainable national space based on Archipelagic Point of View and National Defense with the realization of harmony between natural and artificial environment; the realization of integrity in utilizing natural and artificial resources with respect to human resources; and realization of protection of space function and prevention from the negative impact to the environment due to space utilization.

This Regulation, consisting of 9 Chapters and 2 Tables, aims to regulate import/export, transport, production, manipulation and use of GMO and their products originated by biotechnology in order to guarantee the protection of environment, biological diversity and human health. It is divided as follows: General provisions (Chap. I), Import of GMO for Human and Animal consumption  (Chap. II), Research and Production  (Chaps. III and IV), Export and Transport (Chaps. V and VI), Common prescriptions (Chap. VII), Controls, inspections, sanctions and penalties (Chaps. VIII and IX). The two attached Tables deal with penalties and fines.

Policy_Content: This Decree on the organization, competence and functioning of the State Council for Environment (CONEMA) within the State of Rio de Janeiro. It consists of 17 articles establishing composition, competencies and duties of the above mentioned environmental Institution, entitled to give advice on the guidelines of the Environmental State Policy and its implementation and the management of the environmental sector within the State of Rio de Janeiro.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 246 validating the Regulation on regional forest planning.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the composition and the modalities of elaboration of regional forest plans that determine the scope and the tasks of forest planning, arrangements for the forest development within the boundaries of forestry of forest park. Forest plan shall be elaborated for the period of 10 years. Forest plan shall be elaborated in accordance with forest management, forest inventory, the state forest register and statistics regarding forest management, conservation, protection and reproduction.

Policy: Ordinance on Methods and Requirements for Thermal Treatment of Waste.
Policy_Content: This Ordinance prescribes the requirements for start-up of operations, operating conditions, requirements for shut-down of operations, method of entry control of waste, method of air, soil and water protection and management of residues in the process of thermal treatment of waste.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Water, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Soil pollution/quality,Standards,Waste disposal,Waste management,Groundwater,Surface water

Policy: Order No. 108 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on recreational forest use.
Policy_Content: Plots of forest shall be conceded for permanent management to state and municipal institutions and on lease to other persons for the purpose of recreational activities. In calculating forest areas for recreational use, optimal recreational pressure upon forest ecosystem shall be taken into consideration so as not to damage forest plantations and environment. Natural landscape, wildlife species, plants and water bodies shall be subject to protection on forest plots conceded for recreational uses. Recreational activities shall not be harmful to the environment or human health. Recreational forest use shall not impede the right of all citizens to use forests.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 109 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on forest management for the exploration of subsoil and management of mineral deposits.
Policy_Content: This Order sets out modalities and requirements of forest management for the exploration of subsoil and management of mineral deposits.  Plots of forests pertaining to state and municipal property shall be allotted for the exploration of subsoil and management of mineral deposits in accordance with articles 43 and 74 of the Forest Code. The exploration of forest stock subsoil may be carried out without allotting plots of land; in such cases the applicant must file an application with the local self-government unit specifying: (a) complete data of the applicant; (b) location and area of the forest stock requested for exploration activity; (c) extract from the State register of legal persons; (d) copy of the registration certificate issued by the state tax inspector; (e) copy of the exploration licence; and (f) map of the forest stock area in which the exploration activity is requested. In the process of exploring subsoil and managing mineral resources, the following activities shall be prohibited: (a) woodcutting and forest clearing with the use of bulldozers; (b) flooding of forest plantations; (c) littering up; (c) those resulting in emissions of chemical or radioactive pollution; and (d) passing with vehicles and other mechanisms through unauthorized routes.
Subject: Forestry, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decree No. 78 of 2007 (IV. 24.) Korm. of the Government concerning the basic environmental database.
Policy_Content: This Decree sets out provisions for the creation and utilization of the individual identification data for enviromental protection purposes. It shall be used for the identification of clients interested by environmental protection procedures and concerned by environmental protection data reporting to the National Environmental Protection Information System.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries

Policy: Resolución Nº 198-2007 (COMIECO-XLIV) ─ Aprueba el Reglamento Técnico Centroamericano RTCA 75.02.43:07 Biocombustible. Biodiesel (B100) y sus Mezclas con Aceite Combustible Diésel. Especificaciones.
Policy_Content: El Consejo de Ministros de Integración Económica (COMIECO) de Centroamérica, mediante Resolución Nº 198-2007 (COMIECO-XLIV) aprobó, en el marco del proceso de conformación de una Unión Aduanera, el Reglamento Técnico Centroamericano RTCA 75.02.43:07, que tiene por objeto especificar las características físico químicas que debe cumplir el Biodiesel (B100) para ser utilizado o comercializado como carburante en los países miembros de la Región Centroamericana. El RTCA se aplica al Biodiesel (B1OO) para ser utilizado como combustible en motores diésel diseñados o adaptados para utilizarlo en forma pura, o como componente de mezcla con el Aceite Combustible Diésel especificado en el Reglamento.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 281 of 2007 on Preventative and Rehabilitation Measures and the Procedures for Evaluation of Environmental Damage and Calculation of Costs of Preventative, Emergency and Rehabilitation Measures
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the cases of imminent threat of damage, in which the State Environmental Service shall organise preventive measures; the procedures by which the State Environmental Service shall organise preventive measures in case of imminent threat of damage; the objectives and methods of rehabilitation to be used in case of the environmental damage; the procedures for determination and performance of rehabilitation measures in case of the environmental damage; the procedures for evaluation of the environmental damage and calculation of the costs of preventive, emergency and rehabilitation measures; the procedures by which the State Environmental Service and operators shall provide information to the Latvian Environment, Geology and Meteorology Agency regarding cases when imminent threat of damage has occurred or environmental damage has occurred; and remediation of losses for the destruction or deterioration of individuals of specially protected species and natural habitats.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Resource/damage valuation,Environmental standards,Disasters,Governance,Procedural matters,Protection of habitats
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Resolución Nº 199-2007 (COMIECO-XLIV) ─ Modifica el Reglamento Técnico Centroamericano RTCA 75.01.19:06: Especificaciones de gasolina regular y el Reglamento Técnico Centroamericano RTCA 75.01.20:04: Especificaciones de gasolina superior.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución COMIECO modifica los Reglamentos Técnicos Centroamericanos relativos a las especificaciones para la gasolina regular y superior, en aspectos relacionados con su transporte y los métodos de ensayo.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 29.103 - Reglamento de monitoreo socio-ambiental en actividades hidrocarburíferas dentro del territorio de los pueblos indígenas originarios y comunidades campesinas.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto tiene por objeto establecer las atribuciones, los procedimientos y los mecanismos del monitoreo socio-ambiental relativos a todas las actividades hidrocarburíferas que tengan influencia en los territorios de los pueblos indígenas originarios y comunidades campesinas. Asimismo, el Decreto define el marco institucional para las actividades de monitoreo socio-ambiental, cuya autoridad principal estará constituida por el Comité de Monitoreo Socio-Ambiental Nacional.
Subject: Land & soil, Mineral resources

Policy: Law amending the Law on Forests.

Policy_Content: This Regional Act lays down the legislative framework for the management and protection of forest resources in Friuli Venezia Giulia. The Act aims at the preservation of forest areas, wildlife species and biodiversity of ecosystems. To attain these objectives the Act envisages cooperation at the national and international level. The Act further regulates administrative procedures related to interventions having an impact on forest territories, including Environmental Impact Assessment.

Policy: Decree No. 37 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on submittal of information to database on genetic engineering organisms.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes that the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection within its sphere of competence must submit to database on genetic engineering organisms the following information: (a) officials of the Ministry responsible for biosecurity (Annex 1); (b) normative legislative acts on biosecurity (Annex 2); (c) risk assessment of possible negative impact of non-pathogenic GMO on environment (Annex 3); (d) issued permits for release GMO to environment for testing (Annex 4); and (e) notification of the Ministry by transporter of non-pathogenic GMO in case of transit on the national territory (Annex 5).

Policy: Regulation amending the Regulation on licensing of mining activities.
Policy_Content: This Regulation lays down certain amendments to the Regulation on licensing of mining activities. The new provisions establish that individuals and companies holding a pre-mining licence must apply to the competent authorities to obtain the operational licence. Such licence will be granted if the Environmental Impact Assessment is positive or if the Environmental Impact Assessment is not necessary. Licensing is not required in forests and afforestation areas for activities not implying any excavation, such as prospecting, geologic mapping, sampling and geophysical research. However, notification of such activities must be made to the Provincial Administration and to the competent forestry regional office. Activities requiring excavation work must be licensed. The Regulation prohibits the use of farm lands, specified crop lands, cultivated farm lands and irrigated farm lands for purposes other than agricultural. If non-agricultural use is deemed essential, a special licence must be granted by the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs, based on the consent of the Soil Protection Board.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia

Policy: Arrêté royal concernant la réduction de la teneur en soufre de certains combustibles marins utilisés par des bateaux de navigation intérieure.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté met en exécution la Directive 2005/33/CE du Parlement européen et du Conseil du 6 juillet 2005 modifiant la Directive 1999/32/CE en ce qui concerne la teneur en soufre des combustibles marins. L’article 3 établit que des bateaux de navigation intérieure ne peuvent pas utiliser sur le territoire du gas-oil marin dont la teneur en soufre dépasse 0,20 % en masse et à partir du 1er janvier 2008 0,10 % en masse. Le texte comprend 9 articles.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Sea, Environment gen.
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Emissions,Marine pollution,EEZ-Exclusive Economic Zone,Territorial sea

Policy: Law No. 101-XVI amending Land Code of the Republic of Moldova.
Policy_Content: Article 15 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Article 15. Allotment of land for non-agricultural and non-forestry purposes. State and municipal enterprises, institutions and organizations shall be allotted public land and municipal land. For industrial and residential construction and for other non-agricultural and non-forestry purposes shall be allotted poor quality and unforested land. Procedure for allotment of land for non-agricultural and non-forestry purposes and also for change of purposeful use of land shall be established by the Government.”

Policy: Decree No. 35 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on performance of work in protection zones of stationary monitoring points of state hydrometeorological observations.

Policy: Decree No. 53 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on phases and stages of exploration of hydrocarbons.
Policy_Content: This Decree lists phases and stages of exploration of hydrocarbons for all subsoil managers performing exploration, prospecting and study of perspective oilfields and oil and coal deposits. The scope of geological exploration shall be efficient and complex study of subsoil with a view of qualitative improvement and extension of network of hydrocarbon deposits as a basis for the development of mining industry and identification of new deposits of hydrocarbons. Geological exploration shall be conducted in compliance with programs and projects approved in accordance with the established modalities.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Ley Orgánica Nº 5/2007 - Reforma el Estatuto de Autonomía de Aragón. Texto consolidado.

Los poderes de la Comunidad Autónoma de Aragón emanan del pueblo aragonés y de la Constitución (Título Preliminar).

Policy: Order No. 106 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating forestry operations.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities for elaborating and validating forestry operations regarding: (a) authorized forest management; (b) cutting age, calculated felling rate and terms of forest management; (c) restrictions on forest management and bans on timber extraction; and (d) forest protection, conservation and reproduction requirements. It also establishes a classification system for forests in accordance with their use. Forestry operations shall be planned for a period of ten years.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Fort McKay First Nation Oil Sands Regulations (SOR/2007-79).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations are made under the First Nations Commercial and Industrial Development Act. In particular, section 1 establishes that the purpose of these Regulations is to implement with respect to the project lands a legal regime that is harmonized with the legal regime of Alberta that governs oil sands mining and related activities. The text consists of 9 sections and 2 Annexes.
Subject: Energy, Land & soil
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Natural gas,Enforcement/compliance,Land tenure,Land reform,Indigenous peoples

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 021-2007-EM ─ Reglamento para la comercialización de biocombustibles.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto modifica el que crea la Corporación de Desarrollo Afroecuatoriano (CODAE), respecto a los deberes y atribuciones del Secretario Ejecutivo de la CODAE, que será de libre nombramiento y remoción del Presidente de la República.

Policy: Ministerial Order No. 28/2007 regulating the Ministry for Environmental Coordination and Action.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Order approves the Regulation of the Ministry for Environmental Coordination and Action. This Regulation, composed of 3 Chapters, specifies composition, functions, duties and structure of the aforementioned institution entitled to manage and carry out controls over the environmental sector.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Regional Law No. 31-oz “On some issues of nature management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some issues of environmental protection on the regional territory establishing the following competence and plenary powers of the Regional Government: (a) establishing the guidelines for environmental protection; (b) environmental development; (c) performance of environmental audit at the regional level; (d) validation of environmental standards; (e) lawsuits and legal proceedings for compensation of environmental damages caused by environmental offences; (f) registration of sources of negative environmental impact; and (g) provision of the population with information on the state of environment.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Energy efficiency Law No. 5627.
Policy_Content: The aim of this Act is to ensure and increase the efficient use of energy and energy resources and to minimize energy costs. To reach this aim countrywhide  the Act establishes an Energy Coordination Board. This Board is consisted of sixteen members from different ministries. The duty of the Board is to make policies and projects to increase energy efficency. The policies of the board are implemented by the Directorate General of Sustainable Energy. The Act furteher covers provisions on education and raising awareness on energy efficiency, government supports for energy efficiency projects. The Act finally provides for administrative sanctions. The Act is consisted of five Chapters, twenty articles and seven provisional clauses.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day it is published in the Official Journal. Clause (a) of Article. 10 of this Law enters into force two yeras after its publication in the Official Journal.

Policy: Reglamento general de servicios portuarios del Instituto Costarricense de Puertos del Pacífico (INCOP).
Policy_Content: El presente Reglamento general de servicios portuarios del Instituto Costarricense de Puertos del Pacífico (INCOP), norma las funciones de la autoridad portuaria del litoral Pacífico de Costa Rica.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Arrêté de la ministre de l'équipement, de l'habitat et de l'aménagement du territoire du 17 avril 2007, portant définition des pièces constitutives du dossier de permis de bâtir, des délais de validité et prorogation et des conditions de son renouvellement.
Policy_Content: Le présente arrêté porte définition des pièces constitutives du dossier de permis de bâtir, des délais de validité et prorogation et des conditions de son renouvellement.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Ordonnance n° 2007-037 relative au littoral.
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance a pour objet de définir les règles relatives à l’aménagement, à la protection, à la gestion et à la valorisation du littoral, dans le cadre d’une approche de gestion intégrée des ressources côtières. Les instruments d’aménagement et d’urbanisme littoral doivent viser à freiner la pression urbaine et foncière sur l’espace littoral, instituer, s’il y a lieu, les sites présentant un caractère écologique, paysager, culturel ou touristique en zones protégées inconstructibles, veiller au transfert vers des sites plus adaptés des installations industrielles existantes, dont l’activité serait considérée comme portant atteinte à l’environnement côtier, et prendre les mesures incitatives appropriées, préserver le cordon dunaire côtier en tant que protection naturelle.
Subject: Land & soil, Sea
Geographical_area: Africa, Least Developed Countries, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, North Atlantic, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Décret nº 2007-170 portant attributions, organisation et fonctionnement du Ministère Délégué,chargé de l'urbanisme, des logements, de la réforme foncière et de la lutte contre l'érosion côtière auprès du Président de la République.
Policy_Content: Ce décret fixe attributions, organisation et fonctionnement du Ministère Délégué,chargé de l'urbanisme, des logements, de la réforme foncière et de la lutte contre l'érosion côtière auprès du Président de la République.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 418 validating the Regulation on reporting on subsoil management.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of reporting on the state and management of mineral resources (the list of minerals is supplied in the Annex 1) by subsoil managers with a view of registration of mineral deposits and keeping state balance of minerals. The modalities of reporting shall be compulsory for all subsoil managers. Reports must contain the following information: (a) quantity and quality of extracted minerals; (b) annual projected and actual mining indices; (c) type of deposit and modalities of mining; (d) hydrological and other conditions of mine development; and (e) data on primary extraction of minerals. Reports must be documented and must comply with classification of mineral deposits and conclusion of state expertise related to assessment of mineral deposits.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries

Policy: Regulation of the Minister of Industry of the Republic of Indonesia No. 33/M-IND/PER/4/2007 on prohibition from producing ozone depleting substances and from producing materials that use ozone depleting substances.
Policy_Content: This Regulation provides for the prohibition of producing ozone depleting substances and materials that use these substances.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Ozone layer,Hazardous substances,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Asia, East Asian Seas, South-Eastern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force on 17 April 2007.

Policy: Order No. 101 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on protective, preventive and rehabilitative measures in areas of forests affected by radioactive pollution.
Policy_Content: This Order stipulates that, for the purpose of carrying out preventive, protective and rehabilitative measures, forests polluted by radionuclides shall be classified according to: (a) soil pollution density of Caesium-137; (b) soil pollution density of Strontium-90; and (c) other types of dangerous radioactive pollution. Preventive and rehabilitation measures shall ensure: (a) radiation inspection of forests; (b) radiation monitoring of forests; (c) radionuclides content control of forest resources; (d) radiation content control of all forest products; and (e) regulation of forestry operations in accordance with radioactive pollution levels. Forests polluted with radionuclides shall be classified as category one for forest fire protection purposes.
Subject: Forestry, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 99 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on the use of forests for the construction, re-construction and operation of electric lines, communication lines, pipelines and other lines.
Policy_Content: This Order stipulates that plots of public or municipal forests that are normally allotted to natural and legal persons in accordance with article 9 of the Forest Code may be allotted for the construction, re-construction and operation of electric lines, communication lines, pipelines and other lines. Unforested land within forest areas shall be allotted for such purposes, and in the absence of such land forested areas with less precious forest species shall be allotted.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regulation on the emission of substances into the air from from foundries of aluminium and magnesium.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Government of the Republic of Slovenia, which is composed of nine articles and two Annexes, establishes, in relation to the emission of substances into the air, from foundries of aluminium and magnesium: specific limits of emissions of certain substances in waste gases (specified in art. 3); measures relating to the reduction of emissions into the air (art. 4); conditions of the adaptation of existing facilities to produce aluminium and magnesium (art. 7).
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation entered into force on 2 May 2007.

Policy: NTON 05 022-07: Norma Técnica Obligatoria Nicaragüense para el control ambiental de los establecimientos de las plantas procesadoras de pescados y mariscos.
Policy_Content: La presente Norma Técnica Obligatoria Nicaragüense para el control ambiental de los establecimientos de las plantas procesadoras de pescados y mariscos, tiene por objeto establecer los criterios técnicos y ambientales para la ubicación, prácticas de conservación de agua, manejo de desechos sólidos y líquidos en los establecimientos de plantas procesadoras de mariscos y pescados.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Sea, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Decree No. 23 of 2007 (IV. 17.) FVM of the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development laying down general rules of supports co-financed by the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development.
Policy_Content: This Decree applies to the utilization of resources available for supports and other measures aimed to the implementation of the objectives determined by the New Hungary Rural Development Program and co-financed by the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development. Article 2 lists the objectives which may be supported. Chapter II contains general provisions concerning the support. Chapter III foresees special rules of area payment and headage payment, while Chapter IV concerns non-area and animal related payments. Chapter V lays down sanctions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: The consolidated version of the Decree entered into force on 1 August 2013.

Policy: Decree No.35 of the State Environmental Protection Administration promulgating the Measures for the Disclosure of Environmental Information (for Trial Implementation).
Policy_Content: These Measures provide for the scope, procedures and responsibilities of environmental information disclosure, aiming at promoting and regulating the disclosure of environmental information, maintaining the rights and interests of citizens, legal persons and other organizations to access environmental information, and promoting the participation into environmental protection by the general public. Environmental information herein referred to includes environmental information released by the government and enterprises.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: These Measures entered into force on 1 May 2008.

Policy: Dahir n°1-07-79du 28 rabii i1428 (17avril 2007) Portant promulgation de la Loi n°43-05 relative a la lutte contre le blanchiment de capitaux.
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour objet complémenter las dispositions du Code Penal en ce qui concerne la lutte contre le blanchiment d'argent. De même, il porte mesures pour la prévention du blanchiment de capitaux. Sont assujetties aux dispositions du présent chapitre les personnes physiques et les personnes morales de droit public ou de droit privé, et notamment les personnes membres d'une profession juridique indépendante, lorsqu'elles participent, au nom de leur client et pour le compte de celui-ci, à une transaction financière ou immobilière ou lorsqu'elles assistent leur client dans la préparation ou l'exécution d'opérations relatives à: l'achat et la vente de biens immeubles ou entreprises commerciales; b)la gestion de fonds, de titres ou d'autres actifs appartenant au client; l'ouverture ou la gestion de comptes bancaires, d'épargne ou de titres; ou l'organisation des apports nécessaires à la constitution, à la gestion ou à l'exploitation de sociétés ou de structures similaires.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, North Atlantic, Northern Africa

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 019-2007-AG ─ Reglamenta la Ley Nº 28841, sobre adjudicación de terrenos eriazos a favor de agricultores afectados por obras hidroenergéticas o de irrigación.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo reglamenta la Ley Nº 28.841 sobre adjudicación de terrenos eriazos, por parte de proyectos especiales hidroenergéticos y/o irrigación, a favor de agricultores afectados por la ejecución de obras.

Policy: Arrêté du 16 avril 2007 pris en application de l'article 5 de l'arrêté du 13 avril 2007 autorisant des opérations de prélèvement de loups (Canis lupus) pour la période 2007-2008.
Policy_Content: En application de l'article 5 de l'arrêté du 13 avril 2007 susvisé, le présent arrêté fixe des modalités particulières pour le déclenchement et la mise en oeuvre des opérations de tirs de défense autorisées par l'arrêté du 13 avril 2007 autorisant des opérations de prélèvement de loups (Canis lupus) pour la période 2007-2008. Ces modalités particulières s'appliquent aux éleveurs et aux groupements pastoraux dont le troupeau répond aux deux conditions suivantes: 1° Il s'agit d'un troupeau pour lequel la récurrence des attaques de loups d'une année à l'autre confirme une forte probabilité de dommages importants malgré la mise en oeuvre de mesures de protection et le recours à l'effarouchement; 2° Ce troupeau évolue dans les territoires définis en annexe au présent arrêté.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Financial agricultural measures,Animal production,Dangerous animal/harmful animal
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Décret n° 277/PR/PM/MFI/2007 du 16 avril 2007, portant modification du Décret n° 240/PR/PM/MFI/2003, portant organisation, fonctionnement et conditions de contrôle et de surveillance du Collège de Contrôle et de Surveillance des Ressources Pétrolières (CCSRP).

Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 3 articles, approves the Statute of the Centre for Research of Marine and Coastal areas (CEPAM). This Statute establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the aforementioned institution entitled to carry out scientific research in the field of marine and coastal management and preserve their ecosystem.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea

Policy: State Law No. 6.963 creating the Institute for Forestry Development and Biodiversity of the State of Pará (IDEFLOR-Bio) and the State Fund for Forestry Development (FUNDEFLOR).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 25 articles divided into three Titles and two Annexes (approved by Law No. 8.633 of 19 June 2018), creates the Institute for Forestry Development and Biodiversity of the State of Pará (IDEFLOR-Bio) and the State Fund for Forestry Development (FUNDEFLOR). The Law aims at managing the public forests for sustainable production and biodiversity, as well as the state policy for the production and development of the forestry products, the execution of policies for the preservation, conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity, fauna and flora terrestrial and aquatic ecosystems in the State of Pará. Annex I provides for the Environmental Compensation Chamber of the State of Pará (CCA) aimed at defining the Conservation Units (CUs) to be benefited, considering the studies presented and new CUs. Annex II establishes the Environmental Compensation Fund and the Environmental Performance Bonus aimed at financing activities for the creation, management, implementation, monitoring, investment, protection and regularization of Conservation Units and their buffer zones, according to Federal Law No. 9.985 of 18 July 2000.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Institution,Special fund,Research,Biodiversity,Protected area,Protection forest,Forest management/forest conservation,Forestry protection measures,Sustainable use,Afforestation/reforestation,Plant protection,Protection of habitats,Wild flora,Management/conservation,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Ley de Desarrollo Social y Humano para el Estado de Chihuahua.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto garantizar el disfrute de los derechos sociales de la población del Estado de Chihuahua, asegurándole el acceso al desarrollo social y humano, conforme a lo establecido en la Constitución Política de los Estados Unidos Mexicanos. Se reconocen explícitamente y se protegen, entre otros, los derechos a la alimentación y nutrición, a la seguridad social, a la salud y a un medio ambiente sano. En cuanto a los sujetos de derecho, se establece que las personas o grupos sociales en situación de pobreza, desigualdad, marginación, vulnerabilidad, discriminación o exclusión tienen acceso preferencial a los programas y proyectos tendentes a elevar la calidad de vida.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition
Keyword: Right to clean/healthy environment,Indigenous peoples,Human rights,Right to food,Public health,Social protection,Poverty
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Resolution No. 159 of 2007 re-establishing the Technical Committee for Ionizing Radiation Affairs.
Policy_Content: This Resolution consists of 6 articles. Articles 1 and 2 provide for the establishment and composition of the Committee as well as define its competencies which are to: (a) issue licences for the creation of S-Rays equipment and use of ionizing radiations in therapy, treatment and diagnosis; (b) issue of licences for qualified specialists in radiations; (c) issue licences for technician-assistants in S-Rays; and (d) issue licences for the use of ionizing radiations. Articles 3-5 deal with the management and internal organization of the Committee.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa, Red Sea  Gulf of Aden
Entry into force notes: This Resolution enters into force on the day after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Decree No. 71 of 2007 (IV. 14.) Korm. of the Government concerning woody energy plantations.
Policy_Content: This Decree provides rules regarding planting and elimination of woody energy plantations. The competent authority for this matter is the county level governmental office of forestry. These plantations can be composed of tree species determined in a separate decree and its area shall be more than 1500sqm. Planting of woody energy plantations is subject to authorization. Planting or elimination of plantations must be notified to the competent authority which may carry out controls on the spot.
Subject: Energy, Forestry
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: The consolidated version of the Decree entered into force on 15 March 2014.

Policy: Arrêté du 13 avril 2007 autorisant des opérations de prélèvement de loups (Canis lupus) pour la période 2007-2008.
Policy_Content: En application du 4° de l'article L. 411-2 du code de l'environnement, dans les départements mentionnés à l'article 2 et selon les modalités fixées par le présent arrêté, il peut être procédé à des prélèvements de spécimens de l'espèce loup (Canis lupus) dans la mesure où, du fait de sa prédation:  des dommages importants ont été causés aux élevages; - il n'existe pas d'autre solution satisfaisante. A cet effet, les opérations de destruction ne peuvent intervenir que si la mise en oeuvre de mesures de protection et l'effarouchement ne constituent pas une solution satisfaisante pour prévenir ces dommages. Ces prélèvements ne doivent pas nuire au maintien, dans un état de conservation favorable, des populations de loups dans leur aire de répartition naturelle. A cet effet, le nombre maximum de spécimens de loups (mâles ou femelles) dont la destruction est autorisée en application du présent arrêté est fixé à 6 pour l'ensemble des départements mentionnés à l'article 2. Le respect de ces conditions est assuré selon les modalités fixées par le protocole technique d'intervention annexé au présent arrêté.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Financial agricultural measures,Animal production,Dangerous animal/harmful animal
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Décret nº 2007-105 modifiant et complétant le décret n° 2004-94 relatif à l'étude d'impact environnemental.

Les directives et termes de référence visés à l'article 11 déterminent le contenu et les conditions minimales devant être respectées par le rédacteur de l'étude.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, Least Developed Countries, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, North Atlantic, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Integrated Pollution Prevention and Control Notification, 2007 (P.I. 194/2007).
Policy_Content: In exercise of the powers granted by article 11, section 2 of the Integrated Pollution Prevention and Control Laws of 2003-2006, the Minister of Labour and Social Insurance establishes the list, as set forth in the Table attached herewith, of industrial plants emitting pollutants into the atmosphere and have obtained a permit to operate under the Control of Atmospheric Pollution Law, 2002 (Law No. 187(Ι)/2002).
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Resolución SEAM Nº 374/07 - Crea el Certificado de No Peligrosidad para el Ambiente, el Registro para Exportadores e Importadores, el Registro de Empresas Certificadoras, Recicladoras y Consultoras de Material Reciclable No Peligroso.
Policy_Content: Por la presente Resolución, la Secretaría del Ambiente crea el Certificado de No Peligrosidad para el Ambiente, el Registro de Exportadores e Importadores de material reciclable y el Registro de Empresas Certificadoras, Recicladoras y Consultoras de Material Reciclable no peligrosos para el ambiente. Asimismo, establece las tasas correspondientes y reglamenta los procedimientos para la emisión del mencionado certificado.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Americas, Landlocked Developing Countries, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America

Policy: Act on the prevention and remedying of environmental damage.
Policy_Content: Provisions of this Act apply to direct danger of the environmental damage or environmental damage: caused by the activity of an entity using the environment with the risk of environmental damage; caused by an entity using the environment if applies to protected species or protected natural places. Provisions of the Act apply to direct environmental damage caused by distracted energy coming from many sources, if it is possible to establish relations between danger of direct environmental damage and the activity of the entity using the environment. The following activities cause danger of environmental damage: receiving municipal wastes; exploitation of installations requiring integrated permission or permission for emitting gas or dust into the air; recycling or neutralizing of wastes; receiving or transport of wastes; release of sewage into the water or ground; piping away of surface or underground waters; retention of inland surface waters; closed usage of GMO or release of GMO to the environment, including marketing of GMO products; international trade in wastes; production, use, storage, processing, release to the environment and transport of hazardous substances and preparations, plant protection agents and biocide products; transport of hazardous materials.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Liability/compensation,Polluter pays principle,Protection of habitats,Data collection/reporting,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Sustainable use,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: The Act entered into force on 30 April 2007.

The text consists of 2 articles and 1 Annex with the text of the Agreement in German and Polish.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Decreto Nº 310 - Ley de Expropiación del Estado de Aguascalientes.
