Policy: Foreign Financed Special Investments Proclamation, No. 159 of 2007
Policy_Content: This Proclamation applies to all Foreign Financed Special Investments (FFSI) of more than 20,000,000.00 USD or its equivalent in other convertible currency. The objectives of this Proclamation include; to achieve self-sustaining economic growth and thereby ensure steady improvement in the standard of living of the population of Eritrea; to facilitate the rapid expansion of Eritrea’s export potential and acceleration of social development; to create and expand employment opportunities; and to promote, encourage, safeguard and protect FFSIs. The Proclamation makes all investment areas available, with the exception of the financial sector, domestic wholesale and retail trade and commission agencies. Investors shall require a license and the Business Licensing Office of the Ministry of Trade and Industry shall coordinate with relevant institutions to issue the relevant license. The Proclamation provides for instances where an FFSI located outside the Eritrean Free Zone area can benefit from customs duty and sales tax relief, including; its initial foreign capital investment or expansion is more than 20,000,000.00 USD or its equivalent in a convertible currency; it is engaged in sectors or activities that have already been recommended or approved by the government; it has bank accounts in foreign exchange in an Eritrean bank; it is a source of employment, directly or indirectly, for Eritreans, among others. Similarly, the are provisions for draw-back reliefs and rebate options for FFSIs in certain specified circumstances. Investors may also remit foreign exchange out of Eritrea, this can be done in the following ways; through net profits and dividends accrued from investment capital; debt-servicing payment for a foreign loan, provided that the debt was contracted with prior knowledge of the Bank of Eritrea and in accordance with regulations issued; proceeds received from liquidation of investment; and payments received from the sale or transfer of shares. The Proclamations lays down certain investment guarantees for FFSIs; an investment shall not be nationalized or confiscated; an investment shall not be attached, seized, frozen, expropriated or put under custody by the government except for public purposes and with the due process of law; and where there is expropriation, prompt, full and fair compensation shall be paid by the government in a convertible currency.

Policy: Safety Control and Business of Liquefied Petroleum Gas Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to ensure public safety by prescribing matters concerning the export and import, filling, storage, sale, and use of liquefied petroleum gas and the safety control of gas appliances, and to ensure the proper supply and use of liquefied petroleum gas by rationally regulating liquefied petroleum gas business. For the purpose of the present Act the term "liquefied petroleum gas" means liquefied gas (including vaporized gas), primarily composed of propane or butane. The text – consisting of 73 articles – addresses, inter alia, the following aspects: Permission to Conduct Business (art. 5); Criteria for Permission (art. 6); Registration of Business Entities Entrusted with Transporting Liquefied Petroleum Gas (art. 9); Reporting on Commencement of Business (art. 11); Maintenance of Quality of Liquefied Petroleum Gas (art. 26); Safety Supervisors (art. 34).

Policy: National Adaptation Programme of Action (NAPA) of the Ministry of Land, Water and Environment.
Policy_Content: This National Adaptation Programme of Action is a nationwide sectoral document developed by the Government of Eritrea to present the highest priority actions needed by the country to adapt to climate change. The document follows a twin-track approach, considering that adaptation to climate change possess great potential of affecting other topics as poverty reduction, improving food security, and disaster preparedness and prevention. The NAPA identifies the most vulnerable groups to climate risks together with the area most directly affected. As for the former, they are (i) subsistence farmers; (ii) rural dwellers; (iii) pastoralists; (iv) urban poor; (v) fishermen; and (vi) island residents. The concerned areas are the following (i) agriculture; (ii) livestock; (iii) forestry; (iv) water resources; (v) marine and coastal zones; and (vi) public health. The adaptation projects are listed by urgency in each sector and, in the list of priorities, the most important among them are selected.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Forestry, Land & soil, Cultivated plants, Sea, Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Climate change,Poverty,Crops/grasses,Irrigation,Agro-forestry,Water shortage/drought,Biodiversity,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Food security,Afforestation/reforestation,Forest management/forest conservation,Protected area,Timber,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Pests/diseases,Animal health,Plant protection,Research,Water supply,Well sinking/boreholes,Basin/catchment/watershed

Policy: Decree No. 41/2007 regulating the Regional Forestry Plan of Tâmega (PROF T).
Policy_Content: This Decree, composed of four articles and one Annex, approves the Regional Forestry Plan of Tâmega (PROF T), to be in force for 20 years. The annexed Forestry Plan is composed of four Titles divided in 52 articles and two Annexes. The plan covers forests use, occupation and forestry order. In particular, it rules on protected species and defines forestry zoning criteria according to homogeneous areas. Moreover, it regulates local forestry planning activities and defines intervention measures, including defence measures against forest fires. The annexes to the Forestry Plan provide general intervention rules to be applied in forest areas and priorities for each homogeneous area classified in the Plan.

Policy: Order No. 85 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on forest management for the purpose of growing forest fruits, berries, and ornamental and medicinal species.
Policy_Content: This Order stipulates that growing forest fruits, berries, and ornamental and medicinal species shall be considered entrepreneurial activities to be carried out by citizens and legal persons in accordance with forest plot lease contracts. Failure of any leaseholder to fulfil the forest management and organization arrangements shall be grounds for early termination of the lease contract. This Order applies to all forest areas of the Russian Federation. Leaseholders must elaborate forest management plans, carry out forest management in accordance therewith, fulfil contractual arrangements, observe forest fire safety and sanitary arrangements and present annual reports on forest conservation and protection. The use of protected forests to grow forest fruits, berries or ornamental or medicinal species shall be prohibited.
Subject: Forestry, Cultivated plants

Policy: Order No. 83 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on the procurement of edible forest resources and the collection of medicinal plants.
Policy_Content: This Order regulates the procurement of edible forest resources and the collection of medicinal plants, except by citizens for their personal needs. It applies to all forests in the Russian Federation. The procurement of edible forest resources and harvesting of medicinal plants shall be considered entrepreneurial activities involving the removal, storage and transportation of the such resources from forests, and shall be subject to forest plot lease contracts and. with forestry and forest park regulations. Procurement of edible forest resources and harvesting of medicinal plants may be restricted or prohibited in areas affected by radioactive pollution.

These activities may be restricted or prohibited in areas affected by radioactive pollution.

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución modifica la que ordena y sistematiza el universo de hechos u omisiones, bajo el ámbito de supervisión y fiscalización institucional de OSINERG, que se configuran como infracciones administrativas debidamente tipificadas, respecto al no cumplimiento de las normas de seguridad contra explosiones.

Policy: Legislative Decree No. 25 of 9 April 2007 on forests.
Policy_Content: This Legislative Decree is composed of 13 Chapters divided into 65 articles. Chapter I gives terms and definitions. Chapters II to VII deal with the State forests in particular; exploitation of forests and sale of their products; transportation and storage of products; inspection on exploitation sites; utilization rights; issuance of utilization’s licences; and protection. Chapter VIII pertains to the establishment of protected forests, zones and parks. Chapter IX concerns with the exploitation of forests for environmental tourism; Chapter X addresses the sustainable management of forests; Chapter XI provides for the exploitation and management of private forests. Chapters XII and XIII contain general provisions and offences and penalties.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Public forest,Protection forest,Forest management/forest conservation,Forestry protection measures,Inspection,Right of use,Transport/storage,Offences/penalties,Authorization/permit

Policy: Ley Nº 1133 - Crea e implementa el Programa Agro, Ingreso Seguro (AIS).
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene como objeto la creación e implementación del programa Agro, Ingreso Seguro (AIS), destinado a proteger los ingresos de los productores que resulten afectados ante las distorsiones derivadas de los mercados externos y a mejorar la competitividad de todo el sector agropecuario nacional, con ocasión de la internacionalización de la economía.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Acuerdo Ministerial Nº 240-2007: Acuérdase crear la Unidad de Coordinación para el Manejo Ambientalmente Racional de Productos Químicos y Desechos Peligrosos en Guatemala.
Policy_Content: En virtud del presente Acuerdo se establece la Unidad de Coordinación para el Manejo Ambientalmente Racional de Productos Químicos y Desechos Peligrosos en Guatemala, la que funcionará adscrita a la Dirección General de Gestión Ambiental y Recursos Naturales. La Unidad se encargará de coordinar las iniciativas a nivel nacional, regional e internacional para el manejo racional de productos químicos y desechos peligrosos.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific

Policy: Decision No. 47/QD-TTg approving the plan on organization of the implementation of the Kyoto Protocol under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change in the 2007-2010 period.
Policy_Content: This Decision approves the plan on organization of the implementation of the Kyoto Protocol under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Order No. 77 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the composition and modalities of forest management projects.
Policy_Content: This Order stipulates that the purpose of forest management projects shall be to ensure the rational, continuous and sustainable forest management in accordance with multiple authorized forest uses. Non-fulfilment of the provisions of forest management projects by natural or legal persons shall lead to early termination of the relevant forest plot lease contracts and mandatory termination of the right of open-ended management of forest plots. Forest management projects shall contain the following sections: (a) general data; (b) data on the particular forest plot; (c) organization of forest management; (d) measures for the protection, conservation and reproduction of forests; (e) measures for the protection of wildlife and water bodies; and (f) other data and arrangements.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 34-OZ “On land-use planning”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes composition, the modalities of preparation of land-use planning scheme, and also amendments thereto. Territorial land-use planning scheme shall contain mapping of territory, containing designs of environmental protection, recreation, tourism and objects of cultural heritage.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Règlement n°06/2007/CM/UEMOA du 06 avril 2007 portant adoption du plan directeur des filières agricoles prioritaires dans l’espace UEMOA .
Policy_Content: Le présent Règlement adopte le Plan directeur des filières agricoles prioritaires de la zone UEMOA. Ce présent Plan directeur concerne les cinq (5) filières agricoles prioritaires suivantes : riz, maïs, bétail/viande, aviculture, coton. Les Etats membres et la Commission de l’UEMOA sont chargés de l’opérationnalisation de ce Plan directeur.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Cultivated plants

Policy: Règlement n°03/2007/CM/UEMOA du 06 avril 2007 relatif à la mise en place du programme régional de biosécurité de l’UEMOA (PRB/UEMOA).
Policy_Content: Le présent Règlement adopte le Programme Régional de Biosécurité de l’UEMOA (PRB/UEMOA).  L’objectif en matière d’environnement du PRB/UEMOA est de protéger la biodiversité régionale contre les risques potentiels associés à l’introduction des Organismes Vivants Modifiés (OVMS) et des produits dérivés dans l’espace UEMOA. L’objectif de développement est d’élaborer et de mettre en œuvre un cadre juridique communautaire de biosécurité en vue de permettre aux Etats membres de l’UEMOA de faire face à leurs obligations vis-à-vis du Protocole de Cartagena, sur la prévention des risques biotechnologiques, relatif à la Convention sur la Diversité Biologique.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Environment gen., Fisheries, Forestry, Cultivated plants, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Decree No. 39/2007 regulating the Regional Forestry Plan of Alentejo Litoral (PROF AL).
Policy_Content: This Decree, composed of four articles and one Annex, approves the Regional Forestry Plan of Alentejo Litoral (PROF AL), to be in force for 20 years. The annexed Forestry Plan is composed of four titles divided in 51 articles and two annexes. The plan covers forests use, occupation and forestry order. In particular, it rules on protected species and defines forestry zoning criteria according to homogeneous areas. Moreover, it regulates local forestry planning activities and defines intervention measures, including defence measures against forest fires. The annexes to the Forestry Plan provide general intervention rules to be applied in forest areas and agro-forestry models.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Policy/planning,Forest management/forest conservation,Forest species,Forestry protection measures,Zoning,Classification/declassification,Agro-forestry,Forest fires
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Decree enters into force on the day after its publication.

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 47 - Condiciones para el licenciamiento ambiental de proyectos hidrocarburiferos y mineros.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo establece las condiciones para el licenciamiento ambiental de proyectos hidrocarburiferos y mineros, disponiendo que las compañías que realicen actividades y/o proyectos hidrocarburíferos y/o mineros, previo a la solicitud de licenciamiento ambiental, contratarán una póliza de seguro de responsabilidad civil que garantizará sus bienes, los de terceros y los impactos al medio ambiente, y que se mantendrá vigente durante todas las fases de la actividad o proyecto sujeto de licenciamiento ambiental y hasta un año después del cierre y abandono del mismo.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Exemption of organs of state from certain provisions of the Mineral and Petroleum Resources Development Act, 2002 (No. 288 of 2007).
Policy_Content: With this Notice the Minister of Minerals and Energy, acting in terms of section 106(1) of the Minerals and Petroleum Resources Development Act, 2002 exempts a specified authority from the provisions of sections 16, 20, 22 and 27 of the said Act in respect of any activity to remove any mineral within the area of jurisdiction of the authority for specified purposes.

Policy: Environmental Impact Assessment of Certain Works (Amendment) Law, 2007 (Law No. 42(Ι)/2007).
Policy_Content: This Law may be cited as the Environmental Impact Assessment of Certain Works (Amendment) Law of 2007 and shall be read as one with the Environmental Impact Assessment of Certain Works Law of  2005 (hereinafter referred to as "the principal Law"). The principal Law and the present Law shall be read as one and will be referred to as the Environmental Impact Assessment of Certain Works Laws of 2005 and 2007. The present law carry forward amendments to certain sections of the principal Law. Articles 3, 5, 15, 17 and 24 and 8 of the principal Law are hereby amended.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia

Policy: Law No. 91-XVI “On public land and delimitation thereof”.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates delimitation of public land and land pertaining to local self-government. The Act consists of 5 Sections divided into 11 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) public land; (3) land of local self-government; (4) transfer of the right of land ownership; (5) conclusive and transitional provisions.  Public land shall be inalienable property, it shall not be subject to levy execution and time limitation of prescription, nor can it be used as property bond or purchased by third party. Public land can be only conceded in use, concession or lease. Public land shall be delimited for the purpose of protection and efficient use of land in the interests of the state and local self-government.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Provincial Act No. 2 on environmental assessment of plans and projects.
Policy_Content: This Provincial Act regulates the environmental assessment to be carried out prior to the authorization and implementation of plans and projects which are likely to have significant effects on the environment. The aim is to provide for a high level of protection of the environment and to contribute to the integration of environmental considerations into the preparation and adoption of plans and programmes with a view to promoting sustainable development. All plans and projects specified in Annexes C and D, as well as those already subject to assessment as per articles 6 and 7 of Council Directive 92/43/EEC, are subject to environmental assessment. The Act sets up the Environmental Committee, which is the responsible institution in matter of environmental assessment.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy: Regulation on the emission of substances into the air from stationary gas turbines with a rated thermal input below 50 MW and from stationary combustion engines.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Government of the Republic of Slovenia, which is composed of 13 articles, establishes provisions for stationary gas turbines with a rated thermal input below 50 MW and stationary combustion engines: specific limits of emissions of substances; measures relating to the reduction of emissions into the air; conditions of the adaptation of existing stationary gas turbines with a rated thermal input below 50 MW and existing stationary combustion engines. This Regulation is divided into the following Sections: General provisions (Sec. 1); Limits of emissions of substances in waste gases (Sec. 2); Operational monitoring of emissions (Sec. 3); Control (Sec. 4); Penalty provisions (Sec. 5); Transitional and final provisions (Sec. 6).
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 270 validating criteria and characteristics for assessment of negative environmental impact.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes criteria and characteristics for assessment of negative environmental impact. Negative natural phenomena shall be considered meteorological, agrometeorological and hydrological phenomena causing destruction or damage of crops. natural disasters having negative impact on agriculture shall be classified as follows: (a) air drought and soil drought; (b) winterkilling; (c) excessive soil moistening; (d) flood; (e) dry hotwind; (f) hailstorm; (g) rainstorm; (h) chill; and (i) mud flow. The aforesaid natural disaster shall be subdivided into long-term and short-term phenomena.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Regional Law No. 47-OZ “On delimitation of plenary powers in the sphere of subsoil management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of prospecting, exploration, conservation of subsoil and mining with a view of extraction of minerals. Regional Government shall perform the following plenary powers: (a) realization of state policy in the sphere of subsoil management; (b) validation of normative legal acts in the sphere of subsoil management; (c) validation of the modalities of concession of plots of subsoil for exploration, prospecting and mining; (d) setting up and keeping state geological database; and (e) validation of the modalities of issuance, registration, renewal of exploration and mining licences.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 47-OZ “On delimitation of plenary powers of regional state bodies in the sphere of subsoil management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating from geological exploration of subsoil with a view of identification of mineral deposits and mining. Regional Government shall carry out the following plenary powers: (a) implementation of state policy in the sphere of subsoil management; (b) setting up regional executive body in the sphere of subsoil management; (c) management of regional state stock (fund) of subsoil; (d) validation of long-term specific purposeful programs of geological exploration and rational subsoil management; (e) establishes the modalities of allotment of subsoil for prospecting, exploration and mining; and (f) establishes the modalities of state registration and issuance of exploration and mining licences.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Ordonnance concernant les prescriptions de sécurité pour les installations de transport par conduites (OSITC).
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance met en exécution l’article 52, alinéa 2, de la loi fédérale du 4 octobre 1963 sur les installations de transport par conduites. Notamment, l’ordonnance s’applique à l’élaboration des projets touchant les installations de transport par conduites soumises à la LITC ainsi qu’à la construction, l’exploitation et à l’entretien de celles-ci. Le texte comprend 65 articles répartis en 12 sections comme suit: Dispositions générales (1er); Tracé (2); Distances de s sécurité (3); Conduites (4); Mesures de protection et de sécurité (5); Vannes et dispositifs de décharge (6); Mesures de surveillance (7); Construction (8); Exploitation, entretien et contrôle (9); Mesures préventives (10); Dispositions pénales (11); Dispositions finales (12).
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: La présente ordonnance entre en vigueur le 1er mai 2007.

Policy: Regional Law No. 35-OZ “On maximum dimensions of land plots for allotment”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes minimum and maximum dimensions of land plots, out of stock of public, including municipal, land allotted to citizens for fees and free of charge for gardening, subsidiary farming, stockbreeding and individual housing construction on condition of ownership and other tenancy conditions.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 172 validating the Regulation on licenses.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree regulates mandatory licenses. A separate licence shall be issued for each activity. Decisions on licence applications shall contain the following information: (a) licensing authority; (b) denomination and organizational and legal form (for legal persons); full name, residence and passport data (for individual entrepreneurs); (c) licensed activity, registration reference number, date of issuance and the period of validity; (d) identification number of taxpayer; (e) licence number; and (f) date of the decision. Mandatory licensing terms and conditions shall require compliance with relevant national legislation and meet the requirements set by this Ministerial Decree. Applicants must submit the following documentation: (a) application; (b) type of activity; (c) tax inspection registration certificate; (d)  receipt of payment of licensing fees; and (e) documentation attesting to the qualifications of the applicant. The following activities shall be subject to mandatory licensing: (a) exploration, mining, extraction, storage and trade of oil, natural gas, coal and minerals; (b) geodetic activity and mapping; (c) environmental monitoring; (d) waste management and disposal, including hazardous waste; (e) management of radiation sources, including ionizing radiation and radioactive substances; (f) trade, management, disposal and recycling of ozone depleting substances; (g) manufacture and trade of ethyl alcohol and spirits; (h) management of endangered and protected animal and plant species; and (i) nuclear energy.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Authorization/permit,Waste disposal,Waste management,Radiation,Nuclear energy,Recycling/reuse,Ozone layer,Monitoring,Hazardous waste,Viticulture/oenological practices,Endangered species,Protection of species

Policy: Décret n° 2007-509 relatif aux comités économiques agricoles dans le secteur des fruits et légumes et modifiant le livre V du code rural.
Policy_Content: Les comités économiques agricoles agréés en application de l'article L. 552-2 dans le secteur des fruits et légumes sont considérés comme des associations d'organisations de producteurs au sens du 1 de l'article 18 du règlement (CE) n° 2200/96 du 28 octobre 1996 portant organisation commune des marchés dans le secteur des fruits et légumes.  Les organisations de producteurs de fruits et légumes transmettent chaque année au comité économique agricole et au préfet du département du siège de l'organisation de producteurs les informations suivantes : les superficies plantées, les rendements, les stocks, les ventes directes, les productions récoltées, les productions dont le retrait a donné lieu à une indemnité au titre du retrait de fruits et légumes (régime des retraits ou des fonds opérationnels communautaires) et la valeur de la production commercialisée.

Policy_Content: L'engagement de gestion prévu à l'article 1395 D du code général des impôts porte sur la conservation du caractère humide des parcelles ainsi que sur leur maintien en nature de prés et prairies naturels, d'herbages, de pâturages, de landes, de marais, de pâtis, de bruyères et de terres vaines et vagues. Il porte en outre sur le respect des mesures définies en vue de la conservation des zones humides dans les chartes et documents de gestion ou d'objectifs approuvés.

Policy: Provincial Act No. 9 laying down provisions on land reclamation and preservation of farms, and amending certain provicial acts on agriculture.
Policy_Content: This Act sets out rules and principles governing the planning and management of land reclamation in the Autonomous Province of Trento, for purposes of ensuring the rational exploitation of natural resources and the environmental protection of rural areas. The Act provides for the subdivision of the provincial territory into delimited areas for purposes of land reclamation and soil rehabilitation. The Act also provides for the setting up of consortia engaged in the implementation of such interventions. Further provisions lay down some amendments to Provincial Act No. 16 of 1984 regulating animal reproduction and to Provincial Act No. 4 of 2003 setting out  measures to to support the agricultural economy.

Policy: Law No.1 of 2007 establishing Ministry of Agriculture in Iraqi Kurdistan.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 10 articles aims at establishing the Ministry of Agriculture in the Kurdistan region with the goal of developing and improving agricultural production and achieving the optimal use of local natural, material and human resources. This development involves: an infrastructure rebuilding in the agricultural sector to achieve self-sufficiency and food security and to encourage reverse migration (from the city to the countryside) in order to reach a better life in the villages and rural areas of Kurdistan and its neighborhoods.

Policy: Poverty Reduction Strategy of the Republic of Tajikistan for 2007-2009.
Policy_Content: This Poverty Reduction Strategy of the Republic of Tajikistan for 2007-2009 (PRS), is a medium-range socio-economic development programme for the country. It outlines concrete actions to implement institutional and economic reforms that will promote sustainable economic growth and quality of social services aimed at easing the burden of poverty in the country. The long-term socio-economic development goals are set forth in the National Development Strategy (NDS). The goal of the PRS is to improve the standard of living, particularly among socially vulnerable segments of the population, through economic growth and an increase in human potential. The goal of the PRS is reflected in the targets that describe the development of all the main aspects of the people’s welfare during the PRS implementation period. These poverty reduction targets are shown in Table 2.5.2. Food security and agricultural development will be achieved by providing a reliable, stable and balanced food supply through a dynamic and steady increase in agricultural output, higher incomes and employment levels among the rural population, as well as the conservation of natural resources for expanded reproduction.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Poverty,Sustainable use,Community management,Cooperative/producer organization,Extension,Research,Financial agricultural measures,Fiscal and market measures,Rural employment,Rural youth,Equity,Gender,Food security,Nutrition,Food quality control/food safety,Animal health,Animal production

Policy: Regional Law No. 40-OZ “On delimitation of plenary powers between state bodies in the sphere of environmental audit”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law delimits plenary powers between state bodies in relation to regional environmental audit. Authorized regional executive body in the sphere of environmental audit shall be invested with the following plenary powers: (a) performance of regional environmental audit; (b) law enforcement in the sphere of environmental audit; (c) reception and dissemination of information related to objects of environmental audit that can have environmental impact; and (d) delegation of experts for supervising over performance of environmental audit.

Policy: Order No. 74 validating the form and the modalities of filing the forest declaration.
Policy_Content: Forest declaration shall be submitted annually a month before the beginning of a calendar year subject to declaration to the state executive bodies or to the local self-government by the forest managers who have been allotted plots of forest for permanent (open-ended) management or on lease. Forest declaration must contain data on all types of forest management envisaged by lease contract and forest management project. Data on types and amount of timber extraction and harvest of soft resin shall be specified in the Annex1 while all the other types of forest management not related to timber extraction and harvest of soft resin shall be specified in the Annex 2.

Policy: Decree No. 36/2007 regulating the Regional Forestry Plan of Central Alentejo (PROF AC).
Policy_Content: This Decree, composed of four articles and one Annex, approves the Regional Forestry Plan of Central Alentejo (PROF AC), to be in force for 20 years. The annexed Forestry Plan is composed of four titles divided in 55 articles and two annexes. The plan covers forests use, occupation and forestry order. In particular, it rules on protected species and defines forestry zoning criteria according to homogeneous areas. Moreover, it regulates local forestry planning activities and defines intervention measures, including defence measures against forest fires. The annexes to the Forestry Plan provide general intervention rules to be applied in forest areas and agro-forestry models.

Policy: Law No. 1.077 creating the State Forestry Institute of Amapá (IEF/AP).

Policy: Decreto Nº 422 - Ley de Equilibrio Ecológico y la Protección al Ambiente del Estado de Zacatecas.
Policy_Content: Sobre la base del derecho de toda persona a vivir en un ambiente sano para su desarrollo, salud y bienestar, la presente Ley establece el marco normativo para la protección del medio ambiente y el equilibrio ecológico en el Estado de Zacatecas. La Ley define los principios de la política ambiental y los instrumentos para su implementación, que contemplan En este contexto la Ley establece normas específicas para: a) la protección y preservación de las áreas naturales, así como la restauración y reconstrucción de su entorno ecológico mediante el establecimiento de las áreas naturales protegidas; b) la participación con el Gobierno Federal en la formulación y ejecución de acciones de protección y preservación de la biodiversidad del territorio, así como en el aprovechamiento de material genético; c) la participación social orientada al desarrollo sustentable del Estado; d) la planeación y ejecución de acciones que fomenten la educación ambiental y el fortalecimiento de una cultura ecológica, así como el desarrollo de tecnologías apegadas a criterios ambientales. En cuanto a la política ambiental, entre los principios establecidos por la Ley cabe destacar el principio en virtud del cual quien realice obras o actividades que afecten o puedan afectar el ambiente, está obligado a prevenir, minimizar o reparar los daños que cause, así como a asumir los costos que dicha afectación implique, reinvirtiendo los recursos en la propia restauración del daño.  La Ley se compone de los siguientes Títulos: I) Disposiciones generales; II) De la distribución de competencias y su coordinación; III) De la Política Ambiental; IV) De la participación social e información ambiental; V) Del aprovechamiento sustentable de los recursos naturales; VI) De la protección de la biodiversidad; VII) De la protección al ambiente; VIII) De la inspección, vigilancia, medidas de seguridad y sanciones.
Subject: Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Sustainable development,Pollution control,Biodiversity,Ecosystem preservation,Environmental planning,Education,Protected area,Public participation,Right to clean/healthy environment,Polluter pays principle,Offences/penalties,Human rights,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Effluent waste water/discharge,Sustainable use,Access and benefit-sharing

Policy_Content: Lorsque le ministre chargé de l'agriculture estime qu'un événement présente le caractère de catastrophe naturelle grave au sens des dispositions de l'article 40, paragraphe 4, point c, du règlement 1782/2003 du Conseil du 29 septembre 2003, il prend un arrêté reconnaissant ce caractère et déterminant les zones et périodes concernées. Cet arrêté permet aux producteurs concernés d'utiliser les terres gelées à des fins d'alimentation animale sans que cela puisse être l'occasion d'une activité lucrative.

Policy: Arrêté du 30 mars 2007 fixant les conditions et modalités d'application de l'utilisation, à des fins d'alimentation animale, des terres mises en jachère en cas de circonstances naturelles graves.
Policy_Content: En cas de reconnaissance d'un caractère de catastrophe naturelle grave, les terres gelées pourront être utilisées à des fins d'alimentation animale sous forme de pâturage ou de fauchage. Cette utilisation ne doit pas être faite dans un but lucratif et ne doit pas remettre en cause le respect des bonnes conditions agricoles et environnementale.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock

Policy: Order No. 355/2007 approving the Statute of the Institute for Financing Agriculture and Fisheries (IFAP).
Policy_Content: This Order is composed of two articles and one Annex. It approves the Statute of the Institute for Financing Agriculture and Fisheries (IFAP). The annexed Stature defines the Structure and competences of each body composing the Institutes.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Decree-Law enters into force the first day of the month following its publication.

Policy: Law No. 112-III “On daihan farm”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes that daihan farm shall be labour association of family members engaged in agricultural production. Head of daihan farm shall be in charge of property of daihan farm and shall dispose of it by consent of other members of daihan farm. Each citizen of Turkmenistan beginning from 18 years of age shall have the right to set up daihan farm (Art. 4). Plots of agricultural land can be allotted to daihan farm in tenancy or in lease (Art. 7). Daihan farm shall have the following duties: (a) increase soil fertility and prevent deterioration of ecological situation as a result of activity of daihan farm; (b) carry out arrangements for the prevention of water and wind erosion, carry out land reclamation arrangements; (c) respect interests of other landowners, land tenants and leaseholders; (d) manage land exclusively in accordance with the purposeful use thereof; and (e) observe veterinary regulations in the process of stockbreeding (Art. 14). The Act consists of 4 Sections divided into 23 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) organization of daihan farm; (3) rights and duties of daihan farm; and (4) basis for the functioning of daihan farm.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Farming,Agricultural development,Agricultural land,Drainage/land reclamation,Erosion,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Family farming
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Law No. 113-III “On daihan associations”.
Policy_Content: This Law determines economic, legal and social grounds for the creation and functioning of daihan associations. Daihan association shall be legal person created for carrying out agricultural production and based on mixed ownership (Art. 1). Daihan association shall have the following purposes: (a) production, processing and trade of agricultural commodities; (b) agricultural development; (c) fulfilment of contractual arrangements related to supply of agricultural commodities; (d) rational use of allotted agricultural land and natural resources; and (e) improvement of social conditions of the rural population (Art. 2). The Act consists of 5 Sections divided into 20 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) basis for economic activity of daihan association; (3) organizational and legal basis for the functioning of daihan association; (4) basis for social development of daihan association; and (5) conclusive provisions. Economic bases of daihan associations shall be: (a) agricultural land allotted in tenancy; and (b) agricultural commodities produced by daihan associations (Art. 5).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Ley Nº 3.163/07 - Modifica el artículo 7º de la Ley Nº 2.748/05, Ley de fomento de los biocombustibles.
Policy_Content: Las presentes disposiciones reemplazan el texto del artículo 7º de la Ley de fomento de los biocomustibles, el cual se refiere al procedimiento a través del cual el Ministerio de Industria y Comercio podrá otorgar los beneficios previstos por la Ley y solicitados por los sujetos interesados.

Geographical_area: Americas, Landlocked Developing Countries, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America

Policy: Act No. XVII of 2007 on certain issues of procedures in relation to support for agricultural, rural development and fisheries and to other measures.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down the principles and the framework of institutions, information systems and proceedings in connection to national implementation of agricultural, rural development and fishery subsidies to be granted from European (European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development, European Agricultural Guarantee Fund and European Fisheries Fund) and from national financial resources. The purpose of this Act is, in the interest of legality, efficiency and transparency of proceedings, to prescribe uniform rules of utilization of agricultural, rural development or fisheries support from EU or national resources and of participation in other non-financial market regulatory measures of the Common Agricultural Policy, and to determine the rights and obligations of beneficiaries and of governing and implementing organs. The Act is composed of nine chapters and divided in 84 articles. Chapter I contains general provisions. Chapter 2 rules the institutions of governance and implementation. Chapter 3 provides for data treatment and records. Chapter 4 lays down the rules of administrative proceedings. Chapter 5 contains the rules of the invitation-to-tender procedure. Offences and sanctions are governed by Chapter 6. Chapter 8 contains miscellaneous provisions and Chapter 9 gives entry-into force and transitory provisions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries, Land & soil
Keyword: Agricultural land,Data collection/reporting,Financial agricultural measures,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Offences/penalties,Subsidy/incentive,Agricultural development,Special fund,Inland fisheries,Aquaculture,Cadastre/land registration,Survey/mapping

Policy: Regional Law No. 318-OZ “On rates of payment for forest management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes rates of fees for forest management. Forest management fees shall be calculated on the basis of forest parcel area, owned by regional administration and allotted for timber extraction on lease to citizens in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species. It envisages forest management, including timber extraction for small ethnic communities of the North, free of charge as part of traditional rights.

Policy: Law on railway safety.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the conditions, standards and manner for safe, orderly and free performance of the railway traffic and functioning of the railway system as an important part of the Croatian infrastructure and economy, with a particular regard for the environment impact and possible damage to the ecosystem caused by the performance of railway related activities.

Policy: Prevention of Squatting on Crown Lands Rules (SRO No. 5 of 2007).
Policy_Content: These Rules prohibit the taking possession of, encroaching upon, cultivating or putting up any building or structure on any part of any Crown Land without the express authorization in writing of the Minister. A person who occupies Crown Land without any right or authority shall be deemed to be a squatter. The Minister may serve a notice on a squatter ordering evacuation of the occupied land and, if such notice is ignored, may order removal of a squatter from the occupied Crown Land. Unlawful occupation or ignoring a notice shall be an offence.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Law on gas market.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes all necessary rules and measures for performing in a correct and sustainable, environmentally safe energy-related activities in the natural gas sector, including liquefied natural gas (LNG), rights and obligations of the gas market participants, unbundling of activities of the system operators, the third party access to the natural gas system and the natural gas market opening.

Policy: Decreto Nº 33797-MJ-MOPT ─ Declara como proyección oficial para la representación cartográfica la Proyección Transversal de Mercator para Costa Rica (CRTM05).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto declara como datum horizontal oficial para Costa Rica, el CR05, enlazado al Marco Internacional de Referencia Terrestre (ITRF2000) del Servicio Internacional de Rotación de la Tierra (IERS) para la época de medición 2005.83, asociado al elipsoide del Sistema Geodésico Mundial (WGS84). Este datum está materializado a través de la denominada Red Geodésica Nacional de Referencia Horizontal CR05 de Primer Orden y su densificación al Segundo Orden, consistente en un conjunto de vértices geodésicos situados sobre el terreno, dentro del ámbito del territorio nacional, establecidos físicamente mediante monumentos permanentes, sobre los cuales se han hecho medidas directas mediante el Sistema de Posicionamiento Global, estableciendo su interconexión y la determinación de su posición, y que permitirá referenciar todos los levantamientos y actividades cartográficas y geodésicas que se efectúen en el territorio nacional.

Furthermore, such entities shall also ensure the dissemination of such information. Policy: Regulation on the emission of substances into the atmosphere from stationary sources.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Government of the Republic of Slovenia, which is composed of 52 articles and ten Annexes, establishes measures and procedures designed to prevent or reduce air pollution from industrial plants, measures relating to the protection of human health around the installations of stationary sources of pollution, and measures related to ensuring the security of people and the environment from harmful effects of pollution due to emissions from these devices. In particular, This Regulation sets out: requirements for the operation of industrial plants; requirements for obtaining an environmental permit to operate the industrial plant; requirements related to preventing and reducing adverse effects on human health and living in the area of stationery sources of pollution; methods of assessment of air quality; limits of emissions; requirements related to limitation of emissions and on the use of best available techniques; methods of evaluation of atmospheric emissions; measures to prevent and reduce atmospheric emissions; conditions of the adaptation of existing industrial plants causing the pollution of the air.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation entered into force on 21 May 2007.

Policy: Disposición Nº 45 - Normas sobre perforaciones de pozos para la extracción de petróleo y/o gas.
Policy_Content: Por medio de esta Disposición, el Secretario de Medio Ambiente de la Provincia de Santa Cruz establece que las perforaciones de pozos para la extracción de petróleo, gas o ambos en conjunto en el ámbito de la Provincia de Santa Cruz deben adoptar un sistema cerrado de procesamiento de fluidos que utilice el concepto de locación seca. El objetivo es garantizar un sistema seguro y eficiente para el control de sólidos y manejo de desechos generados en operaciones vinculadas con la actividad petrolífera y gasífera que respete la preservación del medio ambiente y el desarrollo sustentable de los recursos.

Policy: Overseas Emergency Relief Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to contribute to providing rapid rescue of human lives and relief to disaster affected countries when overseas disasters occur, by prescribing the matters necessary for overseas emergency relief, such as dispatch of emergency relief teams, provision of emergency relief supplies, and support for interim recovery from disasters to affected countries. Article 8 establishes that the Government shall establish and operate a public-private joint council for overseas emergency relief with respect to large-scale overseas disasters prescribed by Presidential Decree in order to deliberate and decide on basic matters necessary to facilitate overseas emergency relief operations. The text consists of 17 articles.

Policy: Decree No. 17/2007 regulating the Regional Forestry Plan of Baixo Minho (PROF BM).
Policy_Content: This Decree, composed of 4 articles and one Annex, approves the Regional Forestry Plan of Baixo Minho (PROF BM), to be inforced for at least 20 years. The Decree implements the forestry guidelines contained in the Forestry Act of 1996. The Annex, composed of four Titles divided in 46 articles and two Annexes, contains the Forestry Plan. In particular, it provides forest management and conservation principles and defines limits to forestry practices. Moreover, it defines sub-regions providing, for each of them, tailored forestry systems. Finally, it provides intervention measures and rules on forest fires prevention measures.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 386 validating the Regulation on land monitoring.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree stipulates that land monitoring shall be part of the national environmental monitoring system. Land monitoring refers to a system for observing the state of land, changes in the structure and state of land resources and distribution of land by categories. It shall facilitate the collection, reporting, processing and analyzing of information in order to prevent negative processes and assess soil fertility conservation measures. Land monitoring shall focus on: (a) land degradation; (b) soil composition, structure and properties; (c) quantitative and qualitative characteristics of land and soil; and (d) forecasting changes to soil.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 384 on valuation of land under forest stock.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes that the cadastre value of land under forest stock shall be established according to the forest group, protection category and type of management, and shall be adjusted according to the annual index adjusted for inflation. Cadastre value of land under forest stock shall be used to calculate land charges for plots of forestland allotted for the construction and servicing of gas pipelines, oil pipelines and power supply lines.

Policy: Resolution No. 14/07 approving the Kyoto Protocol to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change.
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the Kyoto Protocol to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change which aims to limit or reduce greenhouse gas emissions adopted in Kyoto on 11 December 1997. This Protocol consists of 28 articles one Annex and the text of the Protocol in its original Portuguese translation. The Kyoto Protocol implements the objective of the UNFCCC to fight global warming by reducing greenhouse gas emission in the atmosphere to a level that would prevent dangerous anthropogenic interference with the climate system. Annex lays down a Table regarding carbon dioxide emissions of Parties in 1990 for the purposes of Article 25 of the Kyoto Protocol, as well as commitment of quantified reduction or limitation of emissions (percentage of base year or period).
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Resolution enters into force on the day after its publication.

Policy: Resolution No. 62 of 2007 of Georgian Government on Construction Safety Rules
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the construction safety rules. It consists of 18 articles: Scope of application and general provisions (1); Organization of the construction area (2); Use of technical equipment and instruments (3); Use of construction vehicles/devices (4); Loading and unloading (5); Soil oeprations (6); Drilling (7); Laying foundation (8); Concrete and metal-concrete operations (9); Installment operations (10); Roofing (11); Insulation (12); surface work (13); electric work (14); electric melding and air melding work (15); Underground work (16); Demolition of buildings (17); and Liability (18). The rules, among others, provide for special rules for construction near surface water bodies, groundwater bodies, sewerage and gas pipelines.
Subject: Energy, Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Natural gas,Land-use planning,Urban land,Environmental planning,Policy/planning,Public health,Sustainable development,Soil pollution/quality,Well sinking/boreholes,Surface water,Groundwater,Sewerage

Policy: Act No. 60 on Vatnajökull National Park.
Policy_Content: This Act concerns the Establishment of Vatnajökull National Park. It applies to the protected status, the board of directors, field of competence and operation of Vatnajökull National Park and the conservation of nature within the National Park. The Act is divided into eight chapters: I.The Establishment of Vatnajökull National Park and its Objectives; II. The Board of Directors of Vatnajökull National Park; III. The Management and Conservation Plan for Vatnajökull National Park; IV. General Principles; IV A. Activities within Vatnajökull National Park; V. Services within Vatnajökull National Park; VI. Monitoring and Settlement of Disputes; VII. Miscellaneous Provisions. According to article 1, the protected status of Vatnajökull National Park shall enter into force through the establishment of a Regulation on Vatnajökull National Park. The overall objectives of establishing the National Park are set to: 1. Conserve nature within the area, such as topographies, biota, geological formations and cultural property; 2. Give the public an opportunity to get to know and enjoy the nature and history of the area; 3. Advance research of the area, promote education about it and boost increased public understanding of the area’s natural resources and its uniqueness; and 4. Seek to support inhabited areas and economic activities in the area around the National Park, inter alia by encouraging sustainable use of the area’s resources.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Act entered into force on 1 May 2007.

Policy: On-site Sewage Disposal Systems Regulations (N.S. Reg. 194/2007)
Policy_Content: The present Regulations enact the Environment Act. For the purpose of the present Regulations “on-site sewage disposal system” means a system for disposing of sewage that is not directly connected to a central sewage collection and treatment system or a municipal system. The Regulations apply to any lot shown on a plan or instrument of subdivision that must be submitted to a development officer for approval by a municipality and is proposed to be serviced by a system. The text – consisting of 40 sections – deals with the following aspects: activities designated as requiring approval, systems on lots being subdivided, minimum lot size requirements, system application and approval, review of application for approval, reason for refusal of approval, installing a system, certificate of installation, auditing and inspecting systems, holding tanks, cluster systems, certificates of qualification and list of installers.

Policy: Regional Law No. 101-ZO “On modalities and rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities and rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs. Timber extraction by citizens shall be carried out in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species without auction sale. Citizens shall be granted the right to procure timber (fuelwood) for heating, for construction purposes and for other personal needs. Rates of timber extraction shall set forth as follows: (a) for individual housing construction – 150 cubic metres once in 30 years; (b) for construction, repairs and maintenance of household outbuildings – 20 cubic metres once in 10 years; (c) for repairs of residential housing facilities – 20 cubic metres once in 10 years; (d) for heating – 15 cubic metres annually; and (e) for other individual personal needs – 3 metres per family once in 10 years.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: The Renewable Energy Policy for Uganda.
Policy_Content: The vision of the policy is to make modern energy a substantial part of the national energy consumption and the overall goal is to increase the use of modern renewable energy from 4% to 61% of the total energy consumption by the year 2017. The need to create a framework for renewable energy is reinforced by the challenges faced by the government in meeting the energy needs of the people including the unprecedented electricity supply deficit on the national grid due to the fall in Lake Victoria levels, the escalating oil prices in the international market, the need to make electricity accessible to the rural population and the fulfillment of the Government’s commitment on greenhouse gas emissions reductions. The plan provides that the major strategies to be relied on by the Government in achieving the goals and vision includes improving the legal and institutional framework to facilitate energy investments, establishing an appropriate financing and fiscal policy to attract more investments, promoting mechanisms that enhance the capacity of public and private energy service providers to develop and deploy appropriate gender responsive renewable energy technologies, especially those that help to ease the household burden on women, among other things. The plan is implemented with programmes hinged towards power generation, rural and urban electrification access, promoting renewable energy based technology for households, institutions, commercial buildings and small scale industries, production of biofuels, programmes which would encourage the conversion of wastes to energy and programmes on energy efficiency. The plan further evaluates the impacts of the proposed actions and provides details findings. As its institutional framework, the plan gives responsibility for its overall implementation on the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Development and mentions other main stakeholders to include the Electricity Regulatory Authority (ERA), the Rural Electrification Agency (REA), among others.
Subject: Energy
Keyword: Bioenergy,Biofuel,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Energy conservation/energy production,Hydropower generation,Renewable energy

Policy: Order No. 335 on the creation of Natura 2000 forest planning.
Policy_Content: The national Forest and Nature Agency establishes the Natura 2000 forest action plan to implement forest conservation in internationally protected areas (see article 14 of the Forest Act). This action plan is prepared on the basis of survey applied to three geographic locations in need of habitat and species conservation (forestry, lake/ponds, wild fauna), and its objective is the creation of environmental measures. Internationally protected areas are subject to the Forest and Nature Agency’s planned management of such measures, and during a specific planning period, its goal is to produce expected results which shall be referred to as the “Blueprint” of environmental protection. The Forest and Nature Agency publishes its planning proposals in order to ensure the information is publicly accessible. The Natura 2000 forest plan of action shall be revised and updated every 12 years.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Regional Law No. 17-RZ “On soil fertility of agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal grounds of the relations between landowners, landlords, land tenants and state bodies in the sphere of ensuring soil fertility of agricultural land, and also establishes rights and duties of natural and legal persons performing agricultural production in relation to efficient use of soil fertility. Agricultural land shall be intended land located outside inhabited area and allotted for agricultural purposes, as well as land plots intended for such purposes. Regional Government and local government which have made the decision on land conservation shall inform on the adopted decision bodies which are carrying out functions on management of the state property and rendering of the state services in the field of conducting state cadastral account of real estate, performance of state cadastral registration of real estate, state cadastral estimation of the land structure and the state monitoring of the land.Particularly precious fertile agricultural land categories shall be classified as follows: (a) agricultural land with cadastre valuation exceeding by 50 percent and over average cadastre valuation in a given municipal district; (b) experimental agricultural areas of scientific research institutions; (c) land under perennial crops and grasses; and (d) land with waterworks and protection forests ensuring soil fertility reproduction. Soil fertility of all types of agricultural land must ensure sufficient conditions for crop growing without oppression of soil organisms. Use of particularly fertile agricultural land for non-agricultural purposes shall be prohibited except for cases envisaged by acting legislation.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Keyword: Agricultural land,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Crops/grasses,Soil pollution/quality,Local government,Monitoring

Policy: Order No. 79 of the President of Forest and Hunting Committee validating the Regulation on authorization of artisanal fishing in specially allotted fishing areas for local population living on the territory of protected areas.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of the organization of artisanal fishing in specially allotted fishing areas for local population living on the territory of protected areas. Administration of protected areas shall be responsible for the organization of non-commercial artisanal fishing. The list of the authorized fishing areas on the territory of protected areas and also the authorized fishing periods shall be validated by the provincial body of the authorized state institution in the sphere of protected areas. Fishing quotas shall be validated by the Government at the proposal of the authorized state fisheries institution in accordance with biological substantiation and positive conclusion of the state environmental audit.

Establece que los Planes Generales de Manejo Forestal en bosques de coníferas autorizados antes de la entrada en vigencia de la Ley Nº 585 podrán seguir siendo aprovechados a condición de que resulten conformes a la legislación forestal, condición que debe verificarse mediante inspección técnica. La Resolución indica los objetivos de dicha inspección técnica (art. 3º).

Policy: Business Licenses Regulations 2007.
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement provisions of the  Business Licences Act 2002 with respect to, among other things: the application for a business licence, the renewal or cancellation of a business licence, the Business Licence Register and appeal to the Minister from decisions of the Business Licensing Officer with the Minister. They also require a person who engages in more than one business activity, to obtain a business licence for each business activity and list activities that require a licence. One of such activities is the retail sale of food.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition

Policy: Regulation on the issue of permits related to forest areas.
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets forth the procedures and rules regarding the issue of permits in accordance with the Forestry Law No. 6831. Mining and exploration activities are allowed on forest lands upon notification to the regional forestry administration and as long as excavation works are not envisaged. Mining and exploration activities that require excavation work are subject to prior issue of a permit by the Ministry of Environment and Forestry. Procedural details are given in the Regulation. Treasure search, archaeological excavation and quarry extraction activities on forest lands are subject to consent by the forestry administration. Individuals and companies who wish to set up wood processing facilities on forestry lands must obtain a permit from the Ministry. Individuals and companies who wish to set up fish farms in forest areas must obtain a permit from the Ministry as well. If deemed essential for public benefit, government entities and public agencies are allowed to set up defense, transportation, energy, communication, health, educational and sports facilities, water wells, cistern, waste water facilities, oil and natural gas plants, solid waste disposal facilities, sanatoriums, dams and ponds. The Ministry of Environment and Forestry is empowered to accept or reject such requests. Private entities may also benefit from such opportunity, but subject to consent by the Ministry.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Public forest,Forestry protection measures,Authorization/permit,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia

Policy: Ley Nº 3.180 - Ley de Minería.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto el marco regulatorio relativo al dominio de los recursos minerales y a la ejecución de actividades mineras en sus distintas fases, a saber: prospección, exploración y explotación. Todos los recursos minerales en estado natural pertenecen al dominio del Estado. El derecho de propiedad del Estado sobre dichos recursos es imprescriptible, inalienable e inembargable, y puede constituir objeto de permisos y concesiones por tiempo limitado, de acuerdo a las condiciones y según los procedimientos previstos por esta Ley. Asimismo, las presentes disposiciones regulan la transmisión de los derechos mineros y establecen los cánones que deben pagar los titulares de los derechos mineros. Cabe también destacar las normas que rigen las relaciones entre los titulares de los derechos mineros y los propietarios de los suelos afectados por las actividades mineras (expropiación, servidumbres mineras). Por último, la Ley regula los recursos administrativos relativos a conflictos sobre derechos mineros y crea el Registro de Minas.
Subject: Land & soil, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Americas, Landlocked Developing Countries, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America

Policy: Regional Law No. 106 “On assignment of authority to local government on support of agricultural production”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law assigns authority to local government as regards support of agricultural production as follows: (a) accessibility of credits for the producers of agricultural commodities; (b) pedigree stockbreeding and animal production; (c) renewal of agricultural machinery; (d) insurance of agricultural risks; and (e) ensuring crop processing and crop output. Regional executive bodies must ensure transfer of finances to local government for realization of state plenary powers and exercise control over local government as regards realization of plenary powers. Local government must ensure transfer of finances to the producers of agricultural commodities and ensure purposeful use thereof.

Policy: Ley Orgánica Nº 3/2007 - Ley para la igualdad efectiva de mujeres y hombres.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley Orgánica para la igualdad efectiva de mujeres y hombres, tiene por objeto hacer efectivo el derecho de igualdad de trato y de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres, en particular mediante la eliminación de la discriminación de la mujer, sea cual fuere su circunstancia o condición, en cualesquiera de los ámbitos de la vida y, singularmente, en las esferas política, civil, laboral, económica, social y cultural para, en el desarrollo de los Artículos 9.2 y 14 de la Constitución, alcanzar una sociedad más democrática, más justa y más solidaria. La Ley establece principios de actuación de los Poderes Públicos, regula derechos y deberes de las personas físicas y jurídicas, tanto públicas como privadas, y prevé medidas destinadas a eliminar y corregir en los sectores público y privado, toda forma de discriminación por razón de sexo.

Policy: Regional Law No. 2-RZ “On regulation of relations in the sphere of environmental protection”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law defines jurisdictional competence of the Regional Government and the regional authorized institutions in the sphere of environmental protection. Regional Government shall have the following competence: (a) implementation of the federal policy in the sphere of ecological development with the consideration of geographic, natural and socio/economic particulars of the territory; (b) participation of the main directions of environmental protection; (c) performance of environmental audit; (d) collection of environmental fees and charges; (d) supply of reliable environmental information to the population; (e) participation in state ecological monitoring; (f) environmental rate setting; and (g) environmental impact assessment (EIA).
Subject: Environment gen.

La classification des peroxydes organiques et des préparations en contenant entre les différents groupes de risque définis à la rubrique 1210 de la nomenclature des installations classées est déterminée à partir de la procédure de classement des peroxydes organiques définie dans l’arrêté ADR en vigueur et d’une épreuve complémentaire de détermination de la vitesse de combustion, prenant en compte le risque sur l’environnement, telle que définie en annexe du présent arrêté.

Policy: Regulation of Importing Chemical Fertilizer
Policy_Content: The Regulation, which consists of 14 articles, set provisions on importation of chemical fertilizers. All imported fertilizer should contain a label containing the ingredients information, the chemical composition, name of the manufacturing company and name of importer. The importer companies should guarantee the quality of the imported fertilizers. Before importation, the sample of fertilizer should be examined and approved by the Department of Quality Control of Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livestock. To prevent importation of low-quality fertilizers, eight well-equipped laboratories shall be established in eight provinces of the country. The Department of Quality Control should provide comprehensive advertising program to facilitate the access of farmers to necessary information, including the specifications, quality, technical and economic features of the allowed fertilizers.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Southern Asia

Policy: Ley Orgánica Nº 2/2007 - Reforma el Estatuto de Autonomía para Andalucía. Texto consolidado.
Policy_Content: Mediante el presente Estatuto de Autonomía, Andalucía, como nacionalidad histórica y en el ejercicio del derecho de autogobierno que reconoce la Constitución, se constituye en Comunidad Autónoma en el marco de la unidad de la nación española y conforme a la Constitución. El Estatuto de Autonomía propugna como valores superiores la libertad, la justicia, la igualdad y el pluralismo político para todos los andaluces, en un marco de igualdad y solidaridad con las demás Comunidades Autónomas de España. Los poderes de la Comunidad Autónoma de Andalucía emanan de la Constitución y del pueblo andaluz, en los términos del presente Estatuto de Autonomía, que es su norma institucional básica. La Unión Europea es ámbito de referencia de la Comunidad Autónoma, que asume sus valores y vela por el cumplimiento de sus objetivos y por el respeto de los derechos de los ciudadanos europeos (Título I, Artículo 1º).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Energy, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Forestry, Land & soil, Mineral resources, Sea, Water, General

Policy: Act No. 152 of 2007 amending the Soil Protection Act and various other Acts in relation to new rules for the application of construction materials, soil and dredging mud.
Policy_Content: This Act amends: (a) the Soil Protection Act in various provisions in relation with the making of Orders and by inserting new sections 12A and 12B concerning the regulation by Order of the use of construction materials and dredging mud in the subsoil and a certain discretionary power of competent authorities to decide to grant exemptions from certain restrictions; (b) the Environment Protection by amending in section 1 the definition of “useful application”; and (c) the Act on Pollution of Surface Waters in section 2A in relation with the making of Orders and in section 2C concerning the applicability of section 12A of the Soil Protection Act to an Order made under section 2A. The Act also amends the Economic Offences Act.

Policy: Property Law of the People's Republic of China.

The Law consists of 247 articles divided into 5 Parts: General Provisions (I); Ownership (II); Usufructuary Rights (III); Real Rights for Security (IV); Possession (V).

Policy: Environmental Offences (Use of Fixed Penalty Receipts) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 901 of 2007).
Policy_Content: These Regulations contain rules relative to the use of funds generated by fixed penalties and received by local authorities in relation to litter offences of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 and for other specified reasons. It provides that, where, and for as long as, an authority, in relation to which section 96 of the Clean Neighbourhoods and Environment Act 2005 applies, is categorized in one of the categories specified by these Regulations, certain functions of that authority are specified as "qualifying functions" of the authority. The authority may use its fixed penalty receipts for such qualifying functions. The Regulations also provide for use of amounts that a Parish Council  receives in pursuance of notices issued under specified legislation.

The Navigation Act 1912 is amended so as to provide for air pollution prevention certificates to be issued. The amendments of the Protection of the Sea (Prevention of Pollution from Ships) Act 1983 concern (control of) fuel oil quality requirements.

Policy: Regional Law No. 321-16-OZ “On support of gardening, horticulture and subsidiary smallholding non-commercial associations of citizens”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Regional Law shall be to ensure promotion of gardening, horticulture and subsidiary smallholding with a view of meeting demand of the population for vegetables, fruits and berries at the expense of personal production of the aforesaid agricultural products. State support of gardening, horticulture and subsidiary smallholding non-commercial associations of citizens shall be carried out in the following forms: (a) campaigning for the promotion of gardening, horticulture and subsidiary smallholding; (b) supply of elite seeds, pesticides and fertilizers through the network of state agrotechnical services; (c) compensation of expenditure for engineering structure; (d) participation in crediting to the amount of 50 percent of total crediting; and (e) setting preferential tariffs for water, electricity, gas supply and telephone lines.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
