Policy: Décret n° 2007-28 PR du 14 mars 2007 portant application de la loi n°2006-008 du 14 novembre2006 portant création d'un fonds d'appui aux initiatives économiques des jeunes (FAIEJ).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret définit les modalités d’application de la loi n° 2006-008 du 14 novembre 2006 portant création d'un fonds d'appui aux initiatives économiques des jeunes (FAIEJ) Le FAIEJ J pour attributions de : garantir les prêts consentis aux jeunes par les institutions financières ; exercer une surveillance rapprochée des bénéficiaires de garantie de financement et des autres prestations du FAIE] en relation avec tout autre organisme public ou prive habilite à cet effet. Dans ce cadre, le FAIEJ reçoit états financiers des bénéficiaires de garantie de financement en liaison avec l’organisme financier ayant mis en place le crédit ; rechercher et de mobiliser des fonds au profit des projets et des microprojets initiés par de jeunes Togolais ; fournir une assistance technique aux jeunes Togolais dans le cadre de l'élaboration de dossiers de demande de financement auprès des institutions financières; assurer à un accompagnement institutionnel des jeunes Togolais porteurs de projets et des créateurs de micro entreprises. A ce titre, il apporte son assistance aux jeunes qui désirent créer une micro entreprise suite à leur formation à l’entreprenariat ; mener des études globales ou sectorielles pour évaluer les opportunités dans certains secteurs économiques; contribuer de manière significative à la résolution des problèmes de financement des projets et microprojets générateurs de revenus inities par les jeunes.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Regional Decree No. 8/2007/A regulating production of electric energy use for self-consumption in Azores islands.
Policy_Content: This Decree, composed of eight articles and one Annex, regulates private production of electric energy use for self-consumption in Azores islands. The Decree also envisages the possibility to sell the exceeding produced energy to the public network. In particular, the Decree regulates technical conditions for energy production, transport and distribution to the public network. Moreover, it defines authorization procedures and pricing criteria. The Annex provides the above mentioned technical requirements.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the day after its publication.

Policy: Acuerdo que establece las reglas de operación para el otorgamiento de subsidios del Programa de Desarrollo Institucional Ambiental.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo tiene por objeto las reglas de operación a que deberá sujetarse el otorgamiento de los subsidios contemplados por el Programa de Desarrollo Institucional Ambiental (PDIA), cuya finalidad es apoyar a los gobiernos estatales en lo que se refiere al equipamiento y al desarrollo de estudios y cursos de capacitación en materia de protección ambiental. El PDIA opera en el marco de la descentralización de la gestión ambiental. Las materias ambientales que podrán contar con dichos subsidios incluyen: legislación ambiental; ordenamiento ecológico; administración de la vida silvestre; inspección y vigilancia; sistemas de información ambiental; educación ambiental.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, North Pacific, North-East Pacific

Policy: Acuerdo mediante el cual se informa al público el calendario de reducción en el consumo y en los inventarios de cloroflourocarbonos en los Estados Unidos Mexicanos.
Policy_Content: Al fin de dar cumplimiento al compromiso asumido mediante la aprobación del Protocolo de Montreal relativo a las Sustancias que Agotan la Capa de Ozono, el presente Acuerdo da a conocer el calendario de reducción en el consumo y en los inventarios de clorofourocarbonos en los Estados Unidos Mexicanos. Además, dispone que la Secretaría de Ambiente podrá autorizar la importación de clorofourocarbonos a condición de que no rebasen los límites establecidos por el calendario.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Climate change,Ozone layer,Pollution control

Policy: Farmyard Manure Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Water Protection Act of 15 May 2003 and Air Pollution Act of 18 December 2003. The present Ordinance regulates the requirements for livestock farms when storing manure. The text consists of 11 articles as follows: Object (1); Construction and operation of storage facilities (2); Storage of manure in stables (3); Storage of manure in the open field (4); Storage capacity (5); Calculation of storage capacity (6); Eligible storage capacity (7); Tolerance for existing farms (8); Remediation obligation (9); Remediation time limit (10); Entry into force (11).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, Western Europe

Policy: Ordinance on fees for the issue of data on official survey.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance enforces the Law on official survey of 8 November 2005. Article 1 establishes that the Ordinance applies to all issuing of extracts and elaboration of data on official land survey on behalf of competent authorities. The text consists of 18 articles divided into 5 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Dissemination of data, control (II); Tariffs (III); Collection of fees (IV); Final provisions (V).
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Loi n° 2007-011 du 13 mars 2007 relative à la décentralisation et aux libertés locales.
Policy_Content: La présente loi régit la décentralisation et aux libertés locales. Elle précise que dans le respect de l’équité nationale et de l’intégrité du territoire, l'Etat et les collectivités territoriales concourent à l'administration territoriale de la République Togolaise, conformément aux dispositions de la Constitution.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Environment gen., Forestry, Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Arrêté du 12 mars 2007 portant dissolution du centre technique interprofessionnel de la vigne et du vin et intégration à l'Etablissement national technique pour l'amélioration de la viticulture.
Policy_Content: L'Etablissement national technique pour l'amélioration de la viticulture (ENTAV) est dénommé, à compter de la dissolution du centre technique interprofessionnel de la vigne et du vin (ITV France) et de la reprise de ses activités et après modification de ses statuts, ENTAV-ITV France, communément appelé Institut français de la vigne et du vin. L'ENTAV-ITV France, centre technique industriel régi par le code de la recherche, a pour mission de conduire des études de portée générale pour l'ensemble de la filière vitivinicole dans les domaines de la sélection végétale, de la viticulture, de la vinification et de la mise en marche des produits.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants

Policy: Modificaciones a las Reglas de operación del Programa del Fondo de Riesgo Compartido para el Fomento de Agronegocios (FOMAGRO).
Policy_Content: Las presentes disposiciones aportan adecuaciones al marco normativo general del Programa del Fondo de Riesgo Compartido para el Fomento de Agronegocios (FOMAGRO). Las enmiendas a las Reglas de operación del FOMAGRO se refieren fundamentalmente a: clasificación de los tipos de apoyo; beneficiarios y requisitos de elegibilidad; mecanismos de concertación entre las entidades federativas u organizaciones de productores y los agentes técnicos; objetivos y tipos de apoyo del subprograma de agronegocios y del subprograma de apoyo a la cadena productiva de maíz o frijol.

En primer lugar, las modificaciones se refieren a las definiciones previstas por el artículo 2º. Las restantes modificaciones se refieren a la población objetivo que podrá participar en el programa, a los tipos de apoyo así como a los montos máximos a otorgar.

Policy: Resolution No. 346 of 2007 on the estimation of reimbursements and compensations for cultivated lands, plants and trees located in lands confiscated for public utilities or included in land improvement projects.
Policy_Content: The aim of this Resolution is to define and estimate compensations and reimbursements for damages caused to cultivated lands, plants and trees, produced by land improvement projects and public utilities. It is composed of 3 articles. The estimation of the aforementioned compensations and reimbursements shall be valuated by the specialist committees established by Prefects according to land quality, kind of crops, age and the like (art. 1). Article 2 abrogates all resolutions, rules, regulations and the like, which are incompatible with the present Resolution.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy_Content: This Decree is composed of two articles. It regulates administrative aspects of Imbiriba indigenous land, located in the municipality of Porto Seguo, Bahia State. In particular, it provides geographical coordinates of the protected area.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Decreto Nº 26/07 - Modifica el Decreto Nº 1/07,  Reglamento de Áreas Protegidas de Nicaragua.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto modifica el Reglamento de Áreas Protegidas de Nicaragua en lo que se refiere específicamente a las áreas protegidas de la Costa Atlántica de Nicaragua y los Ríos Bocay, Coco, Indio y Maíz, las cuales se regirán conforme a lo dispuesto en la Ley Nº 445, Ley del Régimen de Propiedad Comunal de los Pueblos Indígenas y Comunidades Étnicas.

Policy: Regional Law No. 12-PK “On protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of protection of population and territory against local and regional natural and technological disasters. Natural and technological disasters shall be considered situation that takes place as a result of an accident, catastrophe, natural phenomena or calamity that could cause human losses or environmental damages. The scope of this Regional Law shall be prevention of the outbreak and propagation of natural and technological disasters, reduction of damages and losses caused thereby and mitigation of the consequences thereof. Basic principles of protection of the population and territory shall be legality and transparency, planning and application of the protective arrangements. Regional early warning system shall be integral part of the unified national early warning system.  Monitoring system shall be operative on the regional territory.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 19-OZ “On turnover of agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of turnover of agricultural land within the plenary powers of the regional authorities, including ownership, disposal, tenancy and purchase of agricultural land. Privatization of agricultural land, pertaining to regional of municipal property, shall be authorized beginning from 1 January 2004. Maximum agricultural land plot area that can be owned by a single household or by a single legal person within a single administrative unit shall not exceed ten percent of total available agricultural land area. It also establishes that minimum agricultural land plot authorized for allotment for agricultural production shall be established within average allotment rate set forth for each municipal district. Regional administration shall have preferential terms for purchase of agricultural land in case of sale thereof, except for public sale through auction or tender, with land area of fifty hectares and over, and local government shall have preferential terms for purchase of agricultural land in case of sale thereof, except for public sale through auction or tender, with land area under fifty hectares.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Keyword: Agricultural land,Land consolidation,Local government,Public land,Private land,Property rights,Land tenure,Common property,Ownership
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 1205-KZ “On environmental audit”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates legal relations in the sphere of environmental audit, delimits plenary powers between state bodies and has as its scope realization of the constitutional rights of citizens to environmental security. The following shall be subject to mandatory environmental audit: (a) normative, technical documentation and methodological instructions related to environmental impact; (b) projected economic activities having environmental impact; (c) licensing of activities having environmental impact; and (d) ecological inspection of territory with a view of attributing protected area status thereto. This Regional Law guarantees the right of public participation in public hearing, discussions and proposal related to projected economic activities having impact on residential regional areas.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Agricultural Societies Recognition Regulation (Man. Reg. 47/2007).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation is enacted under the Agricultural Societies Act. In particular, the corporations listed in section 1 are prescribed as agricultural societies for the purposes of clause 4(3)(d) of the afore-mentioned Act.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic

Policy: Regional Law No. 653-OZ “On modalities and rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens, registered residents on the regional territory, shall have the right for timber extraction of forest species for individual personal needs, including fuelwood for heating, building timber for housing construction and repairs, in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species with the period of validity no longer than one year and without allotment of forest parcels . Rates of timber extraction shall be established as follows: (a) fuelwood for heating – up to 15 cubic metres annually; (b) for housing construction once in twenty-five years – up to 76 cubic metres for residential building, country house on a plot of agricultural land used for subsidiary small-holding – up to 20 cubic metres, for household outbuildings – up to 20 cubic metres;  and (c) for repairs and reconstruction of housing facilities and household outbuildings – up to 10 cubic metres once in ten years.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Joint Order No. 89/132 of the State Committee of Forest Resources and the Ministry of Emergency Situations and Protection of the Population against the Consequences of Chornobyl Disaster validating the Regulation on inter-departmental interaction in the process of extinguishing forest fires.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of inter-departmental interaction in the process of extinguishing forest fires between fire department of the State Committee of Forest Resources and fire and rescue units of the Ministry of Emergency Situations. State enterprises and establishments subordinated to the State Committee of Forest Resources shall control the compliance with the requirements of fire safety in forests that are in their permanent use, implementation of measures to increase the fire resistance of forest areas, prevent the outbreak and spreading of forest fires and their extinguishment. Fire and rescue units of the Ministry of Emergency Situations shall be called for the extinguishment of forest fires in accordance with the procedure established by the Instructions on the procedure for interaction between the units of the Service and enterprises, the timetable for the departure of the fire and rescue units, as well as in the manner prescribed by the mobilization and operational plans for the elimination of forest fires.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Forestry protection measures,Forest service/forest officers,Forest fires
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy_Content: Le présent décret a pour objet de fixer les modalités d’établissement du plan d’aménagement touristique des zones d’expansion et sites touristiques, et notamment les modalités de son élaboration, instruction, contenu et approbation.

Policy: Cantonal Environment Law.
Policy_Content: The present Law enforces the Federal Environment Act of 7 October 1983. The Environment Office is the competent authority in the Canton. Furthermore, the Cantonal Council shall inform the public of issues related to the environment, whereas local townships shall do the same in regard of their jurisdiction.  The text deals, inter alia, with air pollution, water pollution, protection against noise, hazardous substances, waste prevention and waste disposal. The text consists of 93 articles divided into 10 chapters as follows: General provisions (1); Division of tasks and competences (2); Waters (3); Municipal drainage and sewage facilities (4); Waste and landfills (5); Municipal waste (6); Execution of federal legislation in the sphere of the environment (7); Financial provisions (8); Proceedings and enforcement (9); Final provisions (10).
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Protection of environment,Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil pollution/quality,Noise pollution,Hazardous substances,Disasters,EIA,Drainage/land reclamation,Offences/penalties,Enforcement/compliance

Policy: National Social Protection Strategy: Investing in People.
Policy_Content: The National Social Protection Strategy is a national strategy for Ghana developed by the Ministry of Manpower, Youth and Employment that will be implemented as a pilot project for a period of five years from 2007 to 2012. The vision of the Strategy is to create a society in which citizens are duly empowered with the capacity to realize their rights and responsibilities to manage social, economic, political and cultural shocks. Particularly, the Strategy will seek to empower the extreme poor and other vulnerable populations through the implementation of social grants, the Livelihood Empowerment Against Poverty Social Grants Programme.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Africa, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: National Disaster Risk Management Framework Pakistan March 2007.
Policy_Content: The Objectives of Disaster Risk Management (DRM) planning are to minimize adverse effects of hazards through effective disaster risk reduction, preparedness and adequate, timely and coordinated response. The plans would include strategies for disaster risk reduction and measures for disaster preparedness. Disaster risk reduction actions may include; dykes, dams, safer construction, retrofitting, rainwater harvesting, relocation, community organizing, training, awareness raising, and provision of safer sources of livelihoods etc. In order to materialize goals and objectives of the National ordinance and the present Framework, community and local level risk reduction projects and programmes will be designed and implemented in selected areas. These may include local level programming on drought and flood mitigation or earthquake vulnerability reduction in priority regions. Considering the fact that historical focus of disaster mitigation in Pakistan has mainly remained on structural mitigation- e.g. embankments, dykes, dams etc- the current strategy would emphasize more upon non-structural aspects of mitigation along with structural mitigation.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Disasters,Risk assessment/management,Capacity building,Sustainable development,Governance,Local government,Community management,Equity,Erosion,Gender,Hazardous waste,Land-use planning,Poverty,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Water shortage/drought,Flood

Policy: Air Quality (Arsenic, Cadmium, Mercury, Nickel and Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbons in Ambient Air) Regulations, 2007 (P.I. 111/2007).
Policy_Content: The objectives of this Directive shall be to: (a) establish a target value for the concentration of arsenic, cadmium, nickel and benzo(a)pyrene in ambient air so as to avoid, prevent or reduce harmful effects of arsenic, cadmium, nickel and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons on human health and the environment as a whole; (b) ensure, with respect to arsenic, cadmium, nickel and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons, that ambient air quality is maintained where it is good and that it is improved in other cases; (c) determine common methods and criteria for the assessment of concentrations of arsenic, cadmium, mercury, nickel and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons in ambient air as well as of the deposition of arsenic, cadmium, mercury, nickel and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons; (d) ensure that adequate information on concentrations of arsenic, cadmium, mercury, nickel and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons in ambient air as well as on the deposition of arsenic, cadmium, mercury, nickel and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons is obtained and ensure that it is made available to the public.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Pollution control,Hazardous substances,Data collection/reporting,Access-to-information,Monitoring,Environmental standards

Policy: Ley Nº 9.759 - Prohíbe la venta o salida de rollizos y chips destinada a la exportación como materia prima para empresas fabricantes de pasta celulósica que generan residuos contaminantes.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley declara que la venta o salida de rollizos (madera sin procesos industriales proveniente de bosques implantados) y chips (madera fraccionada para facilitar y abaratar el transporte) destinada a la exportación como materia prima para empresas fabricantes de pasta celulósica que generan residuos contaminantes, lesiona el derecho de los ciudadanos a un ambiente sano consagrado tanto por la Constitución Nacional como por la Constitución Provincial. En consecuencia, dicha venta y salida quedan prohibidas. Asimismo, queda prohibido el ingreso a la jurisdicción provincial de los rollizos y chips. En caso de contravención, se aplicarán las sanciones establecidas por el artículo 4º.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Regional Law No. 120-4-ZKO “On procurement of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes rates and modalities of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs, and also rates of payment for timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species. Timber extraction for individual personal needs shall be authorized for the following purposes: (a) construction and reconstruction of edifices; (b) repairs of edifices damaged by natural disasters and fires; and (c) fuelwood for heating. Citizens shall carry out timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contracts of forest species without auction. Fuelwood for heating shall be collected among damaged trees by fires, pests and diseases, dry and overmature stand.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Resolución Nº 58/2007 - Apruébanse las aperturas inferiores del primer nivel operativo de la Secretaría de Ambiente y Desarrollo Sustentable de la Jefatura de Gabinete de Ministros.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución regula la organización y el funcionamiento del primer nivel operativo de la Secretaría de Ambiente y Desarrollo Sustentable de la Jefatura de Gabinete de Ministros, de acuerdo al organigrama, las acciones y la dotación que se detallan en los Anexos I, II y III. Por otro lado, los Anexos IV y V regulan las acciones y organizacón de las coordinaciones de dicha Secretaría. El organigrama contempla: la Dirección de Infracciones Ambientales, la Dirección de Residuos Peligrosos, la Dirección de Prevención y Recomposición Ambiental, la Dirección de Bosques, la Dirección de Conservación del Suelo y Lucha Contra la Desertificación, la Dirección de Fauna Silvestre, la Dirección de Ordenamiento Ambiental del Territorio, la Dirección de Cambio Climático, la Dirección de Impacto Ambiental y Social, la Dirección de Producción Limpia y Consumo Sustentable, la Dirección de Instrumentos para el Desarrollo Sustentable, la Dirección de Normativa Ambiental, la Dirección de Pueblos Originarios y Recursos Naturales y la Dirección de Gestión Ambiental de los Recursos Hídricos.

Policy: Decreto Nº 17 - Reformas al Reglamento general de la Ley del Medio Ambiente.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto introduce algunas reformas el Reglamento general de la Ley de Medio Ambiente, referidas al proceso de Evaluación de Impacto Ambiental requerido para la realización de determinadas actividades. Policy_Content: This Regional Act aims at updating the legislative framework concerning environmental protection in Emilia Romagna. Policy: Environmental Offences (Fixed Penalties) (Miscellaneous Provisions) (Wales) Regulations 2007 (W.S.I. No. 739 (W. 67) of 2007).
Policy_Content: These Regulations prescribe the ranges for and method of calculation of fixed penalties that may be specified by competent authorities under  environment protection legislation, including: the Environmental Protection Act 1990, the Clean Neighbourhoods and Environment Act 2005, the Noise Act 1996 and the Control of Pollution (Amendment) Act 1989. These penalties shall be imposed in place of the amount prescribed in the relevant Statute. The Regulations also prescribe the minimum amount of fixed penalty that a local authority may treat as full payment of the fixed penalty where that penalty is paid within a specified period and prescribe the condition that must be satisfied before a person may be an authorized officer of a community council for the purposes of giving a notice of a fixed penalty.

Policy: Order No. 193 of the Minister of Environmental Protection and Natural Resources regarding the procedure for carrying out state environmental audits.
Policy_Content: This Order regulates the procedure for carrying out state environmental audits when evaluating a request to carry out any activity that may have an impact on the environment. This state environmental audit shall be based on the following principles: (a) evaluation of the potential risk of ecological danger; (b) Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA); (c) consideration of environmental requirements and norms for the preservation of the environment; (d) independence of the experts and unrestricted realization of their competence; (e) legal validity of the outcome of the state environmental audit; and (f) publicity of its conduct. The object of the state environmental audit shall be the documentation in support of the proposed activity at the different stages of its processing, and the evaluation of its environmental impact. The state environmental audit shall have a minimum duration of 10 days and not more than 15 days. Annexes 1 and 2 contain the forms of the conclusion of the state environmental audit.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

These types of activities are: power industry, steel and metallurgical industry, mineral industry, and other. Installations included in the emission allowance trading system on the basis of earlier provisions, are automatically included in this system on the basis of this Regulation.

Policy: Ley Nº 18.104 - Igualdad de derechos y oportunidades entre hombres y mujeres en la República.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley declara de interés general las actividades orientadas a la igualdad de derechos y oportunidades entre hombres y mujeres en la República Oriental del Uruguay. En este marco se encomienda al Instituto Nacional de las Mujeres el diseño del Plan Nacional de Igualdad de Oportunidades y Derechos que dé cumplimiento a los compromisos contraídos por el país en los instrumentos ratificados o firmados en el ámbito internacional de las Naciones Unidas, Organización de los Estados Americanos y Mercado Común del Sur, relativos a la no discriminación de las personas por razones de género.El Plan deberá contemplar entre otros aspectos el respeto y la vigilancia de los derechos humanos de las mujeres conceptualizados como derechos políticos y económicos. La Ley menciona también el trato igualitario en el trabajo productivo.

Policy: Regional Law No. 268-OZ “On ecological education”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes principles and particulars of organization and promotion of ecological education with a view implementation of state policy in the sphere of environmental protection and ensuring ecological safety. The scope of ecological education shall be as follows: (a) improvement of ecological culture, ecological education level and ecological knowledge of the population; and (b) sustainable development of the region. Basic principles of ecological education shall be as follows: (a) guaranteed universal access to ecological knowledge; (b) mandatory insertion of ecological knowledge in the educational system; (c) systemacity of ecological education; (d) public participation; (e) priority of ecological education; and (f) continuity of ecological education.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Law No. 241 “On state support of agro-industrial sector”.
Policy_Content: This Law defines the legal, organizational and financial basis for support by the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan, local executive bodies of state power of the branches of the agro-industrial complex. The purpose of this Law is to develop the agro-industrial complex, to provide the domestic market with food and raw materials of the processing industry, as well as to increase the export potential of the Republic of Tajikistan. Subsidy (financial support) shall be intended specific and targeted funds aimed at supporting certain sectors of the agro-industrial complex. Users of the subsidy (financial support) shall be natural persons and legal entities, regardless of the forms of ownership, which carry out their activities in the Republic of Tajikistan. Agro-industrial complex is an aggregate of branches of the economy, which includes production, harvesting, storage, transportation, processing and trade of agricultural commodities, including fish products, food industry, other related fields of activity, including providing them with modern technology with technological equipment, informational and other resources, veterinary and sanitary security, and scientific support and training of personnel. Agricultural commodities shall include products of plant growing, livestock breeding, poultry and beekeeping, including products obtained through primary processing. State support to the branches of the agro-industrial complex shall be granted to natural persons and legal entities, regardless of ownership, in the following forms: (a) distribution of subsidies (financial support) from the state budget; and (b) attracting foreign investments and grants for the development of branches of agro-industrial complex. The Government of the Republic of Tajikistan annually, when drafting the Law of the Republic Tajikistan on the state budget for the next fiscal year, taking into account financial opportunity, determines the amount and procedure of allocation of subsidies (financial support) for specific purposes. Attraction of foreign investments and grants for the development of branches of agro-industrial complex is the basis of state support of agro-industrial sector and is carried out in accordance with the procedure established by the Government of the Republic Tajikistan. Subsidy (financial support) depending on the activity of physical and legal persons, irrespective of the forms of ownership, shall be distributed between the following branches of agro-industrial complex: (a) elite and primary seed production, production of seeds of the first and second reproductions, creation of operating fund of agricultural crops; (b) increase of fertility of agricultural land; (c) improvement of the land reclamation state of irrigated arable land; (d) development of new lands and involvement in agricultural production of abandoned land; (e) an increase in the yield and production of cotton, potatoes, vegetables, melons, cereals, legumes and tobacco and the fight against diseases thereof; (f) establishing of orchards and vineyards, the construction of greenhouses for seedlings of fruit crops; (g) purchase and breeding of pedigree animals, birds and fish; (h) development of the veterinary industry and carrying out of anti-epizootic measures; (i) development of the beekeeping industry; (j) purchase of silkworm eggs (cocoons) and the fight against harmful diseases of Spanish broom (Spartium junceum); (k) development and introduction of achievements of science and technology, further creation and strengthening of the national gene pool of agricultural crops, animals, birds and fish, as well as purchase of modern equipment and tools, chemical and biological products for research institutes of branches of agro-industrial complex; and (l) organization of new production, purchase and creation of stock of pesticides and minerals fertilizers.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Agricultural development,Basic legislation,Agricultural commodities,Financial agricultural measures,Apiculture/sericulture,Subsidy/incentive,Special fund,Transport/storage,International trade,Fish products,Processing/handling,Hygiene/sanitary procedures,Food quality control/food safety

Policy: Protocol to the 1979 Convention on Long-range Transboundary Air Pollution to Abate Acidification, Eutrophication and Ground-Level Ozone (Ratification) Law, 2007 (Law No. 14(ΙΙΙ)/2007).
Policy_Content: With the purpose of aligning the Cypriot legislative frame with the European Council Decision 2003/507/EC of 13 June 2003 on the accession of the European Community, to the Protocol to the 1979 Convention on Long-Range Transboundary Air Pollution to Abate Acidification, Eutrophication and Ground-Level Ozone, the present Law ratifies herewith the above mentioned Protocol which was signed on 30 November 1999 in Göteborg, Sweden. The Gothenburg Protocol sets maximum permitted levels of emissions (emission ceilings) for each national Party for the four main precursor pollutants responsible for acidification, eutrophication and ground-level ozone: sulphur dioxyde, oxides of nitrogen, volatile organic compounds and ammonia; these ceilings are to be met by 2010. The competent authority for the implementation of the Protocol is the Ministry of Labour and Social Insurance of the Republic of Cyprus.

Policy: Resolution No. 6/07 implementing the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety within the National territory.
Policy_Content: This Resolution, according to article 88 (letter k) of the Angolan Constitution, approves the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety in order to regulates this sector within the National territory. This Protocol, consisting of 30 articles and 3 Annexes, in accordance with the precautionary approach contained in Principle 15 of the Rio Declaration on Environment and Development, aims at contributing to ensure an adequate level of protection in the field of the safe transfer, handling and use of living modified organisms resulting from modern biotechnology that may have adverse effects on the conservation and sustainable use of biological diversity, taking also into account risks to human health, and specifically focusing on transboundary movements.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Resolution enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement wallon modifiant l'arrêté du Gouvernement wallon du 4 juillet 2002 relatif à la procédure et à diverses mesures d'exécution du décret du 11 mars 1999 relatif au permis d'environnement.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté modifie certains articles de l'arrêté du Gouvernement wallon du 4 juillet 2002 relatif à la procédure et à diverses mesures d'exécution du décret du 11 mars 1999 relatif au permis d'environnement. En particulier, on remplace le deuxième alinéa de l'article 2 de l'arrêté susvisé comme suit: «Si la demande de permis d'environnement est relative à une installation ou une activité visée aux rubriques 01.20 à 01.28 de l'annexe Ire de l'arrêté du Gouvernement wallon du 4 juillet 2002 arrêtant la liste des projets soumis à étude d'incidences et des installations et activités classées, elle comprend, outre les renseignements demandés dans le formulaire visé à l'alinéa 1er de l'article Ier du présent article, les informations reprises à l'annexe IIA du présent arrêté.» En outre, l'annexe II du même arrêté est remplacée par les annexes IIA et IIB du présent arrêté. Le texte comprend 5 articles et 2 annexes.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Ordonnance relative à la protection de l'environnement contre les éventuels effets nocifs et nuisances provoqués par les radiations non ionisantes.
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance concerne la protection de l'environnement contre les éventuels effets nocifs et nuisances provoqués par les radiations non ionisantes.L’article 3 établit que le gouvernement fixe les normes générales de qualité auxquelles tout milieu doit répondre afin d'assurer la protection de l'environnement contre les éventuels effets nocifs et nuisances provoqués par les radiations non ionisantes. Dans toutes les zones accessibles au public, la densité de puissance du rayonnement des radiations non ionisantes ne peut dépasser, à aucun moment, la norme fixée dans cet article. Le texte comprend 13 articles.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Decreto Nº 150 - Crea la Secretaría Nacional del Migrante (SENAMI).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea la Secretaría Nacional del Migrante (SENAMI), la misma que tendrá como objetivo fundamental la definición y ejecución de las políticas migratorias, encaminadas al desarrollo humano de todos sus actores y que servirá de enlace en las acciones de atención, protección y desarrollo del migrante.

Policy: Common Agricultural Policy Single Payment Scheme (Set-aside) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 633 of 2007).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Common Agricultural Policy Single Payment Scheme (Set-aside) (England) Regulations 2004 (S.I. 2004/3385) to incorporate amendments to Community legislation, provide for the incorporation of future amendments to that Community legislation in national law and update the reference to the Compendium of Compendium of UK Organic Standards so as to refer to the most recent edition.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Agricultural development,Subsidy/incentive,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Pesticides,Weeds,Ecological production/organic production

Policy: Crofting Reform etc. Act 2007 (2007 asp 7).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the reform of legislation regarding a Scottisch form of land tenure called crofting and for this purpose amends provisions of the Crofting (Scotland) Act 1993. It also amends the Crofters Holdings (Scotland) Act 1886, the Deer (Scotland) Act 1996, the Land Reform (Scotland) Act 2003, the Succession (Scotland) Act 1964 and the Scottish Land Court Act 1993.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Land tenure,Common property,Lease,Traditional rights/customary rights,Subdivision of land,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings

Policy: Ordonnance nº 07-02 du 1er mars 2007 modifiant et complétant la loi nº 01-10 du 3 juillet 2001 portant loi minière
Policy_Content: Est considérée comme exploitation de carrières et sablières l’activité qui consiste en l’extraction ou en l’enlèvement de substances minérales non métalliques ne contenant aucune substance minérale valorisable et destinées à des fins de construction, d’empierrement et d’amendement des sols. La suspension ou le retrait de l’autorisation d’exploitation des carrières et sablières sont prononcés par le wali territorialement compétent si son titulaire: ne paie pas ses taxes et redevances pendant deux années consécutives; ne satisfait pas aux engagements auxquels il a souscrit; cesse de remplir les conditions et obligations résultant de la présente loi et des textes pris pour son application. L’autorisation d’exploitation de carrières et sablières est délivrée, par voie d’adjudication, par le wali territorialement compétent, après avis des agences minières et des services habilités et concernés de la wilaya.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Subject: Forestry

Policy: Government Decree on the Assessment of Soil Contamination and Remediation Needs (No. 214 of 2007).
Policy_Content: This Decree lays down the provisions for the assessment of soil contamination and the need for remediation measures. It shall not apply to sediment contamination. The assessment  shall concern hazard or harm to health or the environment represented by the harmful substances in the soil. The Decree sets out sets out matters that shall be taken into account in the assessment. The assessment of harmful substances shall be based on standardized methods or methods corresponding to standardized ones with respect to their reliability.
Subject: Land & soil, Waste & hazardous substances
Keyword: Pollution control,Soil pollution/quality,Soil rehabilitation,Waste disposal,Hazardous substances,Inspection,Waste management

Celles-ci comprennent les ouvrages de transport et de distribution établis sous le régime de l'autorisation, de la permission de voierie ou de la concession avec ou sans déclaration d’utilité publique.

Policy: Public Gardens Regulation Act.
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the management of public gardens, i.e. any land vested in the Commissioner of Lands, and designated by him or any entity acting on his behalf for use as public garden. It also prohibits various activities in such gardens and provides for seizure and impounding of stray animals. prohibited activities include: picking of fruits, plants or flowers; destroying of trees; and injuring of animals.

Policy: Décret n° 2007-0043/PR/MHUEAT portant création d'un Comité National du Mécanisme pour un Développement Propre.
Policy_Content: Il est créé un Comité National du Mécanisme pour un Développement Propre (MPD). Le Comité a pour attributions: - l'examen et la sélection des projets potentiels soumis par les acteurs économiques, pour financement dans le cadre du MDP; - la définition et l'approbation des critères nationaux de développement durable pour les projets de MDP; - la mise en place des procédures nationales d'approbation, de suivi et d'évaluation des projets MDP; - l'approbation des guides et manuels d'évaluation, de suivi et de vérification des projets MDP; - l'incitation et la sensibilisation des institutions compétentes à s'engager dans les activités de renforcement des capacités, de conseil, de recherche et de développement au bénéfice des opérateurs économiques; - l'établissement d'un rapport annuel sur les activités MDP à Djibouti.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries, Red Sea  Gulf of Aden

Policy: Décret exécutif nº 07-23 fixant les modalités de rétrocession ou de concession des terrains situés à l’intérieur des zones d’expansion et sites touristique.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret a pour objet de fixer les modalités de rétrocession ou de concession des terrains situés à l’intérieur des zones d’expansion et sites touristiques. Les terrains retenus par le plan d’aménagement touristique sont cédés ou affectés par l’Etat à l’agence nationale de développement du tourisme par accord amiable entre les ministres chargés du tourisme et des finances dans le cadre de la législation et de la réglementation en vigueur en la matière. Les terrains, objet du présent décret, ne peuvent être rétrocédés par l’agence nationale de développement du tourisme ou concédés par l’administration des domaines qu’après leur aménagement définitif dans le respect de leur vocation telle que retenue par le plan d’aménagement touristique.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Le texte comprend 19 articles répartis en 5 sections comme suit: Dispositions générales (1); Nuisances sonores (2); Rayons laser (3); Exécution (4); Dispositions finales (5). Une annexe est jointe intitulée “Méthodes de mesure et de calcul et exigences relatives aux instruments de mesure”.

Policy: Arrêté du 28 février 2007 fixant les conditions et modalités d'application de l'utilisation, à des fins d'alimentation animale, des terres mises en jachère en cas de circonstances naturelles graves.
Policy_Content: En cas de reconnaissance d'un caractère de catastrophe naturelle grave, les terres gelées pourront être utilisées à des fins d'alimentation animale sous forme de pâturage ou de fauchage. Cette utilisation ne doit pas être faite dans un but lucratif et ne doit pas remettre en cause le respect des bonnes conditions agricoles et environnementale.

Policy: Water Pollution Control (Amendment) Law, 2007 (Law No. 22(I)/2007).
Policy_Content: This Law may be cited as the Water Pollution Control (Amendment) Law of 2007 and shall be read as one with the Water Pollution Control Laws of 2002 and 2006 (hereinafter referred to as "the principal Law"). The principal Law and the present Law shall be read as one and will be referred to as the Water Pollution Control Laws of 2002 and 2007. The present law, for a better alignment with Directive 2006/11/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on pollution caused by certain dangerous substances discharged into the aquatic environment, carries forward amendments to article 36 and adds up a new paragraph in Part II of the Second Table to the principal law regarding the issuance of licenses for waste disposal.

Policy: Regional Law No. 795-ZTO “On Objects of cultural heritage”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates legal relations in the sphere of conservation, management, utilization, promotion and also state protection of the objects of cultural heritage. Authorized regional state institution in the sphere of conservation, management and protection of the objects of cultural heritage shall perform the following plenary powers: (a) state control and registration of the objects of cultural heritage; (b) formation of state register of the objects of cultural heritage; (c) state historical and cultural expertise of the objects of cultural heritage; (d) elaboration of land-use planning schemes and establishment of protection areas of localities and site containing objects of cultural heritage; and (e) issuance of orders for suspension of groundwork, drainage and land reclamation that could damage objects of cultural heritage.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil

Policy: Ley Orgánica Nº 1/2007 - Reforma el Estatuto de Autonomía de las Illes Balears. Texto consolidado.
Policy_Content: Mediante el presente Estatuto de Autonomía las Illes Balears pretenden continuar en su proceso colectivo de avanzar hacia su autogobierno en el marco del Estado Español y la Unión Europea, de acuerdo con el valor supremo: el sistema democrático que se inspira en la libertad, la justicia, la paz, la igualdad y la defensa de los derechos humanos, así como la solidaridad entre todos los pueblos. A lo largo de su historia, las Illes Balears han forjado su identidad con las aportaciones y energías de muchas generaciones, tradiciones y culturas, que han convergido en esta tierra de acogida. Así, las Illes Balears, por la confluencia de una multiplicidad de pueblos y de civilizaciones, a lo largo de su historia, se han conformado en una sociedad dinámica, con un patrimonio cultural y social, tangible e intangible, singular entre todas las culturas del Mediterráneo y del mundo; fundamentado, en su más íntima profundidad, en unos valores universales incluyentes y no excluyentes (Preámbulo). El Estatuto ampara la insularidad del territorio de la Comunidad Autónoma como hecho diferencial y merecedor de protección especial. Los poderes públicos, de conformidad con lo que establece la Constitución, garantizan la realización efectiva de todas las medidas necesarias para evitar que del hecho diferencial puedan derivarse desequilibrios económicos o de cualquier otro tipo que vulneren el principio de solidaridad entre todas las comunidades autónomas (Título I, Artículo 3).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Energy, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Fisheries, Land & soil, Sea, Water, General

Policy: Decree No. 12/2007 regulating the Regional Directions for Agriculture and Fisheries of the Ministry for Agriculture, Rural Development and Fisheries.
Policy_Content: This Decree, composed of 14 articles, regulates the five Regional Directions for Agriculture and Fisheries (DRAP) of the Ministry for Agriculture, Rural Development and Fisheries. The Decree defines their mission and competences. In particular, the DRAPs shall support central offices in the formulation of and implementation of policies in the field of agriculture, agri-food, rural development and fisheries. Moreover, the Decree regulates the internal organization, structures and functioning. Finally, it regulates the succession regime.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Política nacional de cambio climático.
Policy_Content: La Política Nacional de Cambio Climático es un documento de alcance nacional cuyo objetivo es gestionar adecuadamente en el ámbito nacional el tema de cambio climático y los efectos que pueda generar sobre la población y el territorio, de conformidad con las disposiciones comprendidas en la Convención Marco de Naciones Unidas sobre Cambio Climático, el Protocolo de Kioto, y la Ley General de Ambiente. El documento contempla los siguientes subprogramas: a) Subprograma de coordinación de políticas y cumplimiento; b) Subprograma de vulnerabilidad y adaptación; 3) Subprograma de mitigación; 4) Subprograma de concienciación y participación ciudadana; 5) Subprograma de fortalecimiento de capacidades. Para cada Subprograma se prevé un Plan de Acción.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Air & atmosphere

Policy: Law No. 22 amending Land Code.
Policy_Content: The title of the Article 9 shall acquire a new wording: “The use of the plots of land for prospecting, exploration and subsoil management”. Article 60 shall be supplemented with Item 3 of the following wording: “Authorization for the occupation of a plot of land for mineral extraction and construction and running of underground works not related to mineral extraction shall be issued by the authorized body within its sphere of competence within the boundaries of the plot of land and for the period of time established by the technical project and licensing agreement.” Article 69 shall be supplemented with Item 2 of the following wording: “In case of termination (cancellation) of the right of subsoil management expropriation of the plot of land shall be carried out by the body that has carried out the allotment of land for temporary use.”
Subject: Land & soil, Mineral resources

Policy: European Communities (Classification, Packaging and Labelling of Dangerous Preparations) (Amendment) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 76 of 2007).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend Schedules 3, 4 and 7 to the European Communities (Classification, Packaging and Labelling of Dangerous Preparations) Regulations, 2004. By implementing Commission Directive 2006/8/EC, they make amendments to requirements for each manufacturer, importer or distributor of a dangerous preparation to classify and label it according to its inherent hazards and to provide safety data sheets. The Regulations concern, among other things, preparations containing substances dangerous to the ozone layer.

Policy: Decree No. 13/07 approving the General Regulation for Urban Buildings.
Policy_Content: This Decree approves the General Regulation for Urban Buildings. The above mentioned Regulation, consisting of 6 Chapters and 1 Annex, establishes the requirements and environmental standards to be satisfied by urban building and regulates all the interventions related to spatial organization for new buildings in urban area of the country. It applies for any civil work, reconstruction, extension, modification, reparation or demolition of existing buildings and infrastructures, as well as for the modification of the local topography, within the urban and rural areas.

Policy: Ordinance on the assessment of land.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Federal Agricultural Soil Act of 4 October 1991. In particular, the Ordinance lays down provisions relating to the valuation of plots of land. Article 1 defines the term “parcel of land” for the purpose of the present Ordinance. The text consists of 15 articles divided into 5 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Organization and competences (II); Number of estimates (III); Proceedings (IV); Final provisions (V).

Article 1 deals with the reorganization and composition of the Bureau of Survey and  Land Registry as follows: (1) Land Survey Department and Topographic Survey Department under the control of the Director-General of Survey; (2) Technical Affairs Department and Registration and Monitoring Department under the control of the Director-General of Land Registry; (3) Structural Planning Department and Department of Urban Planning and Villages under the control of the Director-General of Urban Planning; and, (4) Department of Human and Finance Resources and Data System Department under the control of the Director-General of Resources and Data System. Article 2 decrees the abrogation of all texts which are incompatible with this Decree. Article 3 entrusts the Council of Minister to implement this Decree.

Policy: Resolution No. 16/M.W of 2007 laying down foundations for governing and regulating the establishment or the development and rehabilitation of urban communities.
Policy_Content: The aim of this Resolution is to lay down bases and foudations in order to regulate and arrnge the creation, development and rehabilition of urban communities outside the protection areas and administrative boundaries of cities and provinces. It is composed of 17 articles. Article 1 gives terms and definitions. Article 4 decrees that the establishment and creation of urbn communities shall be carried out by a resolution of the Council of Ministers after the ratification of the High Committee. Articles 5 and 6 define requirements and conditions for the establishment of tourist projects and exclude the destination of forest State lands from those projects. Article 7 entrusts the Minister of Housing and Construction to issue a resolution for the definition of bases and foundations for the purchase of lands by housing cooperatives. Article 8 decrees the establishment of the High Committee for the implementaion of this Resolution. Article 9 decrees the establishment of the Consultative Technical Committee to express its opinion on proposed sites for tourism projects and the initial approval of them. Article 10 decrees the establishment of the Urban Development Department at the Ministry of Local Administration and Environment for the preparation of guidelines  studies and initial maps to define areas and zones intented to urban communities. Article 11 defines requirements and procedures for the approval  of projects. Article 12 deals with the classification of project lands. Articles 13 to 17 contain general provisions.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Mediterranean, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Western Asia

Policy_Content: This Law may be cited as the Air Quality (Amendment) Law of 2007 and shall be read as one with the Air Quality Law of 2002-2005 (hereinafter referred to as “the principal Law”). The principal Law and the present Law shall be read as one and will be referred to as the Air Quality Laws, 2002-2007. The law carries forward amendments to paragraph (i), subsection (2) of article 8 of the principal law by adding a new paragraph (ia).
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Pollution control,Hazardous substances,Data collection/reporting,Access-to-information,Monitoring,Environmental standards

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 227 validating the Regulation on the sale by auction of the right to lease land.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree regulates the sale by auction of the right to lease land and the modalities for transferring the land post-auction. Land lease auctions shall be held by local self-government authorities or authorized state land institutions. Plots of land proposed for transfer by lease shall be registered in the unified state register of immovable property. Auctions shall be open to legal and natural persons and individual entrepreneurs. Local administration bodies shall conclude the lease contracts following the auction. Lease contracts shall be subject to mandatory registration in the local branch of the state institution responsible for the registration of immovable property.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Law No. 302-Z on the safety of chemicals.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates chemical manufacturing to ensure its safety for human health and life and the environment. Chemicals shall be classified by degree of hazard. The Law shall not apply to: (a) mineral deposits; (b) pharmaceuticals; (c) radioactive substances or radioactive waste; (d) foodstuffs; or (e) commodities that conserve chemical compositions and aggregate states and do not emit concentrated hazardous chemical substances. Chemicals shall be classified as posing a risk of: (a) fire; (b) explosion; (c) corrosion; or (d) toxicity. The Act consists of five sections: (1) general provisions; (2) state regulation; (3) rights and obligations of manufacturers, suppliers and importers of chemicals; (4) safety requirements for chemicals; and (5) final and transitional provisions. Chemicals must pass state registration, and the sale of unregistered chemicals shall be prohibited. The safety of chemicals shall be ensured by means of: (a) requiring their compliance with safety requirements; (b) inspection; and (c) ecological, sanitary, epidemiological and toxicological certification.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on 1 January 2008.

Policy: Law No. 3 of 2007 on the exploitation of natural resources.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law, consisting of 27 articles, is to provide for concession rights to exploit state-owned natural resources (with the exception of petrol, soil, sand, mare material and its substances that are used in activities of construction, road construction and filling). It establishes that exploitation rights shall be granted through a decision issued by the Minister and approved by the Council of Ministers and royalties shall only be granted for a limited period. All the rights on the oil belong to Qatar Petroleum, while licenses to explore, transport or exploit soil, sand, mare materials and its substances that are used in building construction, road construction and filling shall be granted by the Ministry of Municipal Affairs and Agriculture. The Law specifies conditions and fees for obtaining royalties or mining rights, exploration permits or licenses and discovery certificates.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Persian Gulf, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force on the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Order No. 87 of the Federal Ecological, Technological and Nuclear Supervision Service validating the Regulation on the issuance of permits for emissions and discharge of pollutants setting emission and discharge limits.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that permits for emissions and discharge of pollutants setting emission and discharge limits for legal persons carrying out economic and other activities causing excess of the established emission and discharge limits shall be issued on condition of compliance with the requirements established by the environmental legislation of the Russian Federation. The following documentation shall be submitted for obtaining permits setting emission limits: (a) application containing complete data of the applicant; (b) project documentation containing inventory of pollutants and calculation of dispersion of pollutants in the atmospheric air; and (c) plan for the reduction of emission of pollutants to the atmospheric air. The following documentation shall be submitted for obtaining permits setting discharge limits: (a) application containing complete data of the applicant; (b) calculation of maximum allowable pollutant discharge limits; and (c) plan for gradual reduction of discharge of pollutants to environment.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Order No. 87 of the Federal Ecological, Technological and Nuclear Supervision Service validating the Regulation on the modalities of issuing authorization for emission and discharge of pollutants.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the modalities of issuing authorization for emissions and discharge of pollutants. Limits on emissions and discharge of pollutants shall be imposed for the period of environmental protection arrangements. In case of impossibility of meeting rates of emissions and discharge of pollutants restrictions shall be imposed for the period of carrying out environmental protection arrangements specified by the authorization for emissions and discharge of pollutants with a view of gradual meeting the established limits. Authorization for emissions and discharge of pollutants shall be issued to legal persons that are not meeting the established rates of emissions and discharge of pollutants shall be issued on condition of the observance thereby of the national environmental legislation. The applicants must submit: (a) application form; (b) project documentation, including inventory of emissions to the atmospheric air; and (c) plans for the reduction of emissions and discharge of pollutants in order to meet gradually the established emissions and discharge rates.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Resolución Nº 177/07 - Normas operativas para la contratación de seguros previstos por el artículo 22 de la Ley Nº 25.675, Ley de política ambiental nacional.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución fue adoptada para dar implementación al artículo 22 de la Ley Nº 25.675, que establece que toda persona física o jurídica, pública o privada, que realice actividades riesgosas para el ambiente, los ecosistemas y sus elementos constitutivos, deberá contratar un seguro de cobertura con entidad suficiente para garantizar el financiamiento de la recomposición del daño que en su tipo pudiere producir. Las presentes disposiciones tienen por objeto las normas operativas para la contratación de dicho seguro. Asimismo, la Resolución enumera las actividades que deben considerarse riesgosas y las clasifica por categorías, según su nivel de complejidad ambiental.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Resolución Nº 178/07 - Crea la Comisión Asesora en Garantías Financieras Ambientales (CAGFA).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución Conjunta crea la Comisión Asesora en Garantías Financieras Ambientales (CAGFA), con el fin de asesorar a la autoridad de aplicación de la Ley Nº 25.675 sobre política ambiental nacional. La CAGFA se encargará de analizar y formular propuestas relativas a: a) las normas generales reguladoras de las condiciones contractuales de las pólizas de seguro de riesgo por daño ambiental; b) los requisitos mínimos necesarios y la instrumentación de su acreditación para la admisibilidad de los autoseguros; c) la instrumentación de los fondos de restauración a que se refiere el artículo 22 de la Ley Nº 25.675.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Presidential Resolution No. PP-585 “On measures for the prevention of emergency situations related to floods, mudflows, snow avalanches and landslides, and liquidation of the consequences thereof.
Policy_Content: The President, with a view of organizing timely and effective work for the protection of the population and territories against emergency situations associated with floods, mudflows, snow avalanches and landslides, and liquidation of the consequences thereof, decrees to validate the Regulation on organization of work for the prevention of emergency situations related to dangerous hydrometeorological and geological phenomena (Annex 1). Regulation establishes the procedure for timely identification of possible risks originating from dangerous hydrometeorological and geological phenomena, efficient protection of the population and territories against natural disasters, and timely liquidation of the consequences thereof. Special Commission for safe passage of floods and mudflows, reduction of risks of snow avalanches and landslides shall be set up performing the following functions: (a) formation and implementation of unified state policy in the sphere of prevention of natural disasters and liquidation of the consequences thereof; (b) coordination of the activities of public administration for performance of the arrangements related to protection of the population and territories against natural disasters; and (c) inspection of early intervention system.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Disasters,Flood,Risk assessment/management,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Inspection
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
Entry into force notes: This Presidential Resolution enters into force on the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regulation on the establishment of the vessel traffic service.
Policy_Content: This Regulation aims at (i) improving the safety of navigation, life and property of vessels navigating and anchoring in, approaching to and departing from Turkish maritime jurisdiction or port facilities, (ii) protecting marine environment from the adverse impacts of maritime traffic, and (iii) enhancing the efficiency of maritime traffic. This Regulation sets forth provisions on establishment and the structure of the vessel traffic service, inspection, authorities, duties and responsibilities of the Undersecretariat of Maritime Affairs, training of vessel traffic service personnel, reporting, routing and communication systems of vessels, as well as planning and international cooperation.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 29.033 - Reglamento de consulta y participación para actividades hidrocarburíferas de los pueblos indígenas, originarios y comunidades campesinas.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto regula el proceso de consulta y participación de los pueblos indígenas, originarios y comunidades campesinas en los casos en que se pretenda llevar a cabo actividades hidrocarburíferas en sus tierras comunitarias de origen y tierras de ocupación y acceso. Los principios sobre los que se basa el mencionado proceso de consulta son el de garantía de la integridad de las tierras de propiedad de los pueblos indígenas y comunidades campesinas, información previa y oportuna con respecto a las actividades hidrocarburíferas, participación y transparencia. La consulta deberá realizarse previamente a la licitación de las actividades, así como previamente a la aprobación de los estudios de impacto ambiental.
Subject: Land & soil, Mineral resources

Policy: State Environmental Planning Policy (Mining, Petroleum Production and Extractive Industries) 2007.
Policy_Content: The SEPP lays down the discipline concerning Mining, Petroleum Production and Extractive Industries. Under Part 2 it distinguishes developments into permissible without consents, permissible with consents, prohibited developments, coal seam gas developments prohibited in certain exclusion zones, exempt developments of minimal environmental impact and complying developments. Under permissible developments without consent fall for instance (b) rehabilitation, by or on behalf of a public authority, of an abandoned mine site and (e) the construction, maintenance or use (in each case, outside an environmentally sensitive area of State significance) of any pollution control works or pollution control equipment required as a result of the variation of a licence under the Protection of the Environment Operations Act 1997.

Policy: Act No. 9 on ship safety (Ship Safety Act).
Policy_Content: The present Act aims to safeguard life and health, the environment and sea resources, by enabling good ship safety and safety management (including the prevention of marine pollution), ensuring a safe working environment and working conditions on board ships, as well as a proper and timely supervision. The Act applies to Norwegian and foreign vessels, including fishing vessels. Ships of less than 24 meters in length that are not used for commercial activities are exempted from this Act. The Act contains the following Chapters: 1) Introductory provisions; 2) The ship company's duties. Safety management; 3) Technical and operational safety; 4) Woking environment and personal safety; 5) Environmental safety; 6) Security and terrorist preparedness; 7) Supervision; 8) Management measures; 9) Administrative sanctions; 10) Criminal liability; 11) Other provisions.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 2431.02/10/07 establishing a new type of international oil pollution prevention Certificate (IOPPC Form Certificate and Supplements).
Policy_Content: The present Decree establishes a new form for the international oil pollution prevention Certificate and its Supplements. The Certificate is issued under the provisions of the international Convention for the prevention of pollution from ships, 1973, as modified by the Protocol of 1978 relating thereto, as amended. This is to certify that at the annual and intermediate surveys required by the provisions of the Convention, the ships and oil tankers are found to comply with the relevant provisions of the Convention (structure, equipment systems, fittings, material of the ship and the condition thereof are in all respects satisfactory). With this Certificate will be provided obligatorily the oil-tankers of 150 tons gross tonnage and above and those ships (not carrying oil) of 400 tons gross tonnage and above, which sail international navigation routes.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.

Policy: Regional Law No. N 21-5820 “On timber extraction in accordance with purchase and sale contracts of forest species”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens shall carry out timber extraction for individual personal needs in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species. The period of timber extraction shall not exceed 12 months from the date of conclusion of the contract. Timber extraction shall be carried out in compliance with forest fire safety and sanitary safety requirements. Individual personal needs shall be considered timber extraction for heating and construction. This Regional Law establishes rates and amount of timber extraction.

Policy: Estonian Environmental Strategy 2030
Policy_Content: The Estonian Environmental Strategy 2030 is a national cross-sectoral strategy of Estonia for the period 2007-2030. Its main objective is to ensure the preservation and improvement of the Estonian living and natural environment in the areas of reduction of waste, disused hazardous sites and the pollution load; sustainable use of water and mineral resources; energy; transport; forestry; fisheries; hunting; and preservation of the diversity of nature and landscapes.

Policy: Regional Law No. 430-Z N 875-III “On state ecological supervision.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations regarding the performance of state ecological supervision. State ecological supervision shall include: (a) industrial environmental control (supervision) - a system of measures, carried out by subjects of economic and other activities, aimed at ensuring the implementation, in the process of economic and other activities, of measures for environmental protection, rational use and restoration of natural resources carried out in in order to comply with the requirements in the field of environmental protection, established by federal and regional legislation; and (b) public environmental control (supervision) - a system of measures, carried out by public and other non-profit associations in accordance with their statutes, as well as by citizens in accordance with federal and regional legislation with a view of guaranteeing the right of everyone to a favorable environment and prevention of violation of legislation in the field of environmental protection. State environmental supervision is an activity of the authorized federal executive bodies and regional executive bodies, aimed at prevention, detection and suppression of violations by state authorities, local authorities, as well as legal entities, their heads and other officials, individual entrepreneurs, their authorized representatives and citizens of requirements related to environmental protection. This Regional Law delimits powers of state institutions in the field of application of state ecological supervision. In the event of emergency environmental pollution (disasters) on the regional territory the authorized executive body provides for a period of up to the end of the liquidation of the consequences of an emergency continuous state environmental supervision, together with other authorized bodies, collects and analyzes information on the development of emergency situation, sufficiency and timeliness of application of measures for  elimination thereof, the state of the environment, and if the culprit of environmental pollution is identified, undertakes measures in accordance with to ensure compensation for environmental damage.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy_Content: The present Ordinance implements the Federal Environment Protection Act of 7 October 1983. The text consists of 8 articles divided into 4 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Arrangement of measures to be taken (II); Repeal of measures (III); Implementation (IV).

Policy: Regional Law No. 15-OZ “On ecological education and formation of ecological culture of the population”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal, organizational and economic grounds for ecological education and setting forth conditions for the formation of ecological culture of the population. Ecological education shall be based upon the following principles: (a) integration of ecological education and information;(b) consistency, complexity and continuity of ecological education; (c) openness and accessibility to ecological education; (d) regional orientation of ecological education; and (e) generality of ecological education ensuring involvement of all social and age groups of the regional population. Ecological education can be performed by public bodies, public authorities, local government, non-governmental entities, mass media and environmental institutions.
