Policy: Stratégie commerciale de la Mauritanie 2007-2015.
Policy_Content: La Stratégie commerciale de la Mauritanie a pour objectifs: améliorer l’environnement réglementaire (stimuler l’investissement et la concurrence par la poursuite de politiques de réforme et de coordination de l’environnement réglementaire pour élargir et approfondir les marchés internes, régionaux et internationaux de la Mauritanie, améliorer les aptitudes du secteur public à concevoir et à appliquer une réglementation orientée vers le marché, transparente, effective et neutre, promouvoir l’attention sur les principes concurrentiels en clarifiant le rôle de l’intervention du gouvernement et en ciblant les excès du marché); réduire la vulnérabilité aux chocs exogènes en diversifiant les exportations (ouvrir de nouveaux marchés, enclencher une dynamique de croissance et de diversification des échanges, changer la composition des exportations); réussir les négociations sur l’Accord de Partenariat Economique UE-CDEAO+Mauritanie; dynamiser l’environnement portuaire; Renforcer les institutions du commerce et de l’investissement (adoption d’un cadre juridique, réactivation du Comité Secteur privé-Administration, création d’une agence de promotion de l’investissement, mise en place de l’infrastructure institutionnelle du Cadre Intégré Renforcé, démultiplication de l’aide internationale; lancer un programme de renforcement des capacités (développement d’un centre d’analyse stratégique, renforcer l’information commerciale, soutien au Centre d’arbitrage des conflits commerciaux, audit institutionnel des douanes en parallèle avec la migration vers SYDONIA).

Policy_Content: This Executive Programme (2007-2009) has been prepared in a participatory approach of all ministries and governmental institutions involved in the various sectors in order to translate into actions the principles and initiatives of the reform process Kulluna al Urdun (We are all Jordan) launched in July 2006 with the aim of finding common consensus on national priorities and challenges facing Jordan. The Executive Programme focuses on specific projects and programs, with related budget allocations and measurable performance indicators. Policy: Normes d'Exploitation Forestière a Impact Réduit, 2007.
Policy_Content: Le présent document fait partie d’un ensemble de guides opérationnels élaborés en vue de compléter et de faciliter le mécanisme d’application de l’arrêté ministériel fixant les procédures d’élaboration, d’approbation, de suivi et de contrôle de la mise en œuvre des plans d’aménagement des concessions forestières.  Ces guides viennent à point nommé et constituent, en réalité, les mesures d’application de la loi n° 011/2002 du 29 août 2002 portant code forestier.  En effet, chaque guide décrit les procédures techniques à mettre en œuvre dans le cadre de l’aménagement des forêts de production permanentes de la RDC. Ils expliquent le mode de fixation des paramètres d’aménagement et les modèles de dynamique forestière à employer en aménagement. En définitive, ils constituent un système normatif pour régler, de manière durable, la gestion et l’exploitation forestière des ressources forestières de la République Démocratique du Congo.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Normes d'affectation des terres, 2007.

Ces guides viennent à point nommé et constituent, en réalité, les mesures d’application de la loi n° 011/2002 du 29 août 2002 portant code forestier. Il présente le modèle à utiliser pour l’affectation des terres dans les zones prioritairement allouées à la production ligneuse. Les principales activités pour l’affectation des terres sont outre la production ligneuse, la conservation et la recréation ainsi que la protection. Policy: Code of Good Agricultural Practices of Georgia (2007)
Policy_Content: The Code of Good Agricultural Practices of Georgia is a legally non-binding document aimed to provide information on environment friendly agricultural production rules and to increase public awareness of the importance of adhering to them. Specifically, it aims to reduce the negative influence of farming on the environment to prevent the irrational use and impoverishment of the main natural resources (soil, water and air) and to promote environmentally friendly practices in Georgia. The Code compiles obligations prescribed by law, recommendations, and practical advice noteworthy for small farms alike large agricultural enterprises, providers of agricultural service and extension – i.e. for everyone related to agricultural production and environment protection. The Code states that its adoption represents a step forward towards harmonizing with the environment friendly agricultural practices introduced in the EU and other developed countries. Georgia is willing to support further development of agricultural sector and as well as take care of environment protection and sustainable utilization of natural resources.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Air & atmosphere, Land & soil, Water

Policy: Política de Conservación, Protección y Mejoramiento del Ambiente y los Recursos.
Policy_Content: El presente documento contiene la Política de Conservación, Protección y Mejoramiento del Ambiente y los Recursos, la cual es de carácter multisectorial y de alcance nacional, con una proyección de 20 años. Su objetivo general es armonizar, definir y dar las directrices a los diferentes sectores para el mejoramiento del ambiente y la calidad de vida de los habitantes del país; el mantenimiento del equilibrio ecológico; y el uso sostenible de los recursos naturales. Sus objetivos específicos son: 1. Conservar y proteger el ambiente y los recursos naturales, con énfasis en la generación de conocimiento y prevención del deterioro; 2. Mejorar la calidad ambiental; 3. Promover el uso y el manejo sostenible de los recursos naturales; y 4. Promover la restauración ambiental.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Energy, Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems, Waste & hazardous substances, General

Policy: Pharmacy Act 2007.
Policy_Content: This Act is aimed to make new provision for the regulation of pharmacy, including provision for the dissolution of the pharmaceutical society of Ireland and the setting up of a new pharmaceutical society of Ireland, for the establishment, constitution and functions of the new society’s council, for a new system of registration of qualified pharmacists, druggists and pharmaceutical assistants and of pharmacies, for the creation of certain offences relating to pharmacy and for the setting up of new procedures to ensure that pharmacists are and continue to be fit to practise and to prevent pharmacists, pharmacy owners and medical practitioners from entering into certain inappropriate relationships; and to provide for related matters. These provisions are meant for both human and veterinary drugs, as for their related affairs and procedures.

Policy: Política Nacional de Igualdad y Equidad de Género (PIEG) 2007-2017.
Policy_Content: La Política Nacional de Igualdad y Equidad de Género (PIEG) 2007-2017, se sustenta en tres grandes núcleos de acción estratégica: autonomía económica, participación política y cambio cultural; pilares fundamentales para mover las barreras de la desigualdad, que afectan a las mujeres; así como también, aspectos transversales que atacan nudos estructurales expresados en brechas por razones de género, los cuales han dado como resultado la desigualdad y la afectación de importantes colectivos de mujeres, incrementado los niveles de pobreza, el desempleo y prácticas sociales y culturales excluyentes, convirtiéndose en grandes obstáculos para el adelanto de las mujeres y, en esta medida, se constituyen en asuntos que requieren especial atención en el próximo decenio.

Policy: Warehouse Receipt Act, No. 13 of 2007
Policy_Content: The warehouse receipt is an acknowledgment in writing by a warehouseperson of the receipt for storage in a warehouse of an agricultural commodity belonging to a depositor. The Act provides for the office of the Registrar and other subsidiary officers who assist the Registrar in registering warehouses and cancelling their registration, inspecting registered warehouses, licensing warehousepersons, issuing to warehousepersons books of warehouse receipts, among others. The Act provides for the registration of warehouse operators and provides extensively for the issuance of registration certificates, keeping of a register of warehouse operators and warehouses, etc. The Act provides for warehouse receipts to be only issued by warehousepersons in respect of agricultural commodities received by him/her for warehousing or marketing. The receipts are to be in a prescribed form and are negotiable instruments subject to endorsement by the warehouseperson. Negotiation bestows rights to the holder including the title to the receipt, title to the agricultural commodity and the right to dispose the agricultural commodity. The Act further provides for matters relating to the alteration, destruction, replacement or loss of warehouse receipts. There are provisions on storage of agricultural commodities for instance, agricultural commodities are to be stored separately in the warehouse so as to permit identification and delivery. The Act lists coffee, soya beans and sugar beans in its Schedule as agricultural commodities.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries

Policy: National Implementation Plan for the Stockholm Convention on POPs.
Policy_Content: This National Implementation Plan (NIP) is a nationwide sectoral document compiled according to Article 7 of the Stockholm Convention on Persistent Organic Pollutants (POPs) covering the implementation plans. This Plan is also supported by the ratification of two more conventions, namely Basel Convention and the Rotterdam Convention In the overall strategy to reach the objectives and phase-out POPs, Sudan has proposed a combination of measures including (i) Government’s involvement aiming at regulation reforms and law enforcement efforts; (ii) supportive local actions; (iii) market instruments, like subventions and tax-breaks; and (iv) extensive international cooperation including cofunding. National priorities regarding the implementation of the POP management and phase-out actions are (i) tackling the stocks of the obsolete POP pesticides, the contaminated containers and the contaminated soil around the pesticide stores; (ii) tackling the uncontrolled waste burning and all the subsequent waste management activities to reduce the dioxin and furan emissions in the densely populated areas; (iii) reduce and eliminate the risks related to the PCB containing electrical equipment; and (iv) preventing DDT use for malaria and vector control through extensive regional cooperation with WHO.

Policy: Regulation on Volzhsko-Kamsk tree nursery state natural biosphere reserve.
Policy_Content: Volzhsko-Kamsk tree nursery state natural biosphere reserve is formed in order to preserve, study and enrich gene pool of natural and cultural flora and perform environmental education activities. Tree nursery is of cultural and historical value, is an object of national patrimony. The main tasks of the tree nursery are: (a) creation and preservation of collections of living plants (including rare and endangered species) of scientific, economic and cultural importance; (b) development of scientific foundations and methods for preserving the gene pool of natural plants and cultural flora; (c) research work; and (d) environmental education in the field of botany and nature protection, ecology, plant breeding, ornamental gardening. The territory of the tree nursery is subdivided into the following zones: (a) exposition - visit is allowed only in the presence of employees of the reserve; (b) research and production (nurseries, schools, plantations, greenhouses) – the right of access shall be granted by employees of the reserve, as well as specialists of other specialized institutions by the permission of the person in charge of the tree nursery; and (c) access for economic activities shall be granted to employees and pensioners of the reserve. It is prohibited on the territory of the tree nursery: (a) stay of unauthorized persons without the permission of the administration of the reserve; and (b) any activity not related to the performance of the tasks assigned to the tree nursery and putting at risk conservation of collections.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Ley Nº 18.100 - Crea el Fondo de Financiamiento y Desarrollo Sustentable de la Actividad Lechera.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley crea el Fondo de Financiamiento y Desarrollo Sustentable de la Actividad Lechera, como persona jurídica de derecho público no estatal. Objetivo principal del Fondo es el de financiar la actividad lechera de los productores con el fin de aumentar la producción láctea, extender la actividad lechera y diversificar la obtención de productos lácteos. Asimismo, los recursos del Fondo estarán destinados a: cancelar deudas contraídas por el Fondo de Financiamiento de la Actividad Lechera (creado por la Ley Nº 17.582 de 2002); contribuir al tratamiento especial para los pequeños productores de leche y las inversiones destinadas al buen manejo de los efluentes y al control de la contaminación de las fuentes de agua en los predios explotados por dichos productores.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 33 on the establishment of the “Hellenic Gas Transmission System Operator” and approval of its Statute.
Policy_Content: In execution of the provisions of Law No. 3428/2005, this Law establishes the legal entity who shall be the designated authority for carrying out the function of transmission of natural gas and is responsible for operating, ensuring the maintenance of, and if necessary, developing the transmission system in a given area and, where applicable, its interconnections with other systems, and for ensuring the long-term ability of the system to meet reasonable demands for the transportation of gas, with due regard to the environment. It is named “Hellenic Gas Transmission System Operator” or briefly “Hellenic G.T.S.O” or “ DESFA”. The Decree establishes the tasks and Statute of the Operator.

Policy: Reglamento del Libro Segundo del Código para la Biodiversidad del Estado de México.
Policy_Content: El presente Reglamento establece disposiciones para la aplicación del Libro Segundo del Código para la Biodiversidad del Estado de México, relativo a la conservación ecológica y protección al ambiente para el desarrollo sustentable. En primer lugar se establecen normas sobre el marco institucional y las competencias y atribuciones de las autoridades estatales en esta materia, con especial atención a la organización y funcionamiento del Consejo Consultivo de Protección a la Biodiversidad y Desarrollo Sostenible del Estado de México. En tema de información pública ambiental, el Reglamento establece disposiciones sobre el Sistema Estatal de Información Ambiental y el Centro Geomático Ambiental. Asimismo el Reglamento introduce normas detalladas sobre la política ambiental (principios, instrumentos, programas de ordenamiento ecológico). Además se establecen normas en tema de Evaluación de Impacto Ambiental, áreas protegidas y ecoturismo.

Policy: Reglamento del Libro Cuarto del Código para la Biodiversidad del Estado de México.
Policy_Content: Las presentes disposiciones reglamentan el Libro Cuarto (Prevención y Gestión Integral de Residuos) del Código para la Biodiversidad del Estado de México, en lo que se refiere a residuos sólidos urbanos y de manejo especial. Se establecen disposiciones sobre las competencias municipales en materia de recolección, almacenamiento, tratamiento, transporte y disposición final de residuos sólidos, en zonas urbanas y subordinadas. Asimismo se establecen normas para la remediación de sitios contaminados. Se dispone que quienes por cualquiera que sea la causa contaminen o deterioren el suelo, subsuelo, mantos acuíferos y demás elementos y recursos naturales, están obligados a restaurarlos, tal y como lo señala el artículo 2.133 del Código para la Biodiversidad.

Policy: Decreto Legislativo Nº 237 - Disposiciones transitorias sobre tratamiento integral de los desechos sólidos.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley concede un plazo de hasta seis meses, contados a partir de la vigencia de la misma, a efecto de que las Municipalidades del país cumplan con los requisitos establecidos en el artículo 107 de la Ley de Medio Ambiente, el cual se refiere a la presentación de diagnósticos ambientales para aquellas actividades, obras o proyectos que se encuentren funcionando al entrar en vigencia la mencionada Ley de Medio Ambiente. Transcurrido el plazo concedido, queda prohibido a toda persona natural o jurídica, pública o privada, incluyendo el Estado y las Municipalidades, el depósito de desechos sólidos en botaderos a cielo abierto, ni en ningún otro lugar que no estuviere legalmente autorizado.

Policy: Loi sur l’agriculture et le développement rural (Loi sur l’agriculture; LcADR).
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour but d’améliorer la performance globale de l’agriculture et de l’économie rurale valaisanne. La loi s’applique à toutes les activités socio-économiques réalisées dans l’espace rural et contribuant à atteindre les objectifs fixés. Le texte comprend 118 articles répartis en 10 titres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Organisation (2); Promotion de la qualité et des ventes (3); Viti-viniculture (4); Surveillance, entretien des cultures et zones de protection (5); Amélioration de structures (6); Formation, vulgarisation, recherche et développement (7); Dispositions diverses (8); Voies de droit, mesures administratives et dispositions pénales (9); Dispositions finales (10).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Agricultural development,Ecological production/organic production,Agricultural land,Agricultural commodities,Crops/grasses,Research,Zoning,Court/tribunal,Dispute settlement,Agroecology,Offences/penalties,Basic legislation,Plant production
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: La présente loi entre en vigueur le 1er juillet 2007.

Policy: Arrêté du 8 février 2007 fixant la composition du comité national des vins, eaux-de-vie et autres boissons alcoolisées de l'Institut national de l'origine et de la qualité.
Policy_Content: Le comité national des vins, eaux-de-vie et autres boissons alcoolisées prévu à l'article R. 642-11 du code rural comprend: 1° Quatre représentants des autres comités nationaux et du conseil chargé des agréments et contrôles de l'Institut national de l'origine et de la qualité désignés parmi les personnes proposées par ces instances lors de leur première réunion; 2° Quarante représentants des professionnels des secteurs de la production, de la transformation ou du négoce des produits relevant de sa compétence; 3° Six représentants de l'administration; 4° Au maximum dix personnalités qualifiées, notamment en matière d'exportation et de distribution ou par leurs capacités d'expertise, et au titre desquelles figurent des représentants des consommateurs.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto constituye el Fondo de crédito directo para el pequeño productor agropecuario (CREDIAGRO) en el Banco Agropecuario, destinado a la adquisición de fertilizantes y agroquímicos, así como a la creación de fondos de garantía para la cobertura de los riesgos crediticios.

Policy: Decreto Nº 330 - Reglamenta las audiencias públicas ambientales.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto reglamenta las audiencias públicas ambientales que tienen por objeto dar a conocer a las organizaciones sociales, comunidad en general, entidades públicas y privadas la solicitud de licencias permisos o concesiones ambientales, o la existencia de un proyecto, obra o actividad, los impactos que este pueda generar o genere y las medidas de manejo propuestas o implementadas para prevenir, mitigar, corregir y compensar dichos impactos, así como recibir opiniones, informaciones y documentos que aporte la comunidad y demás entidades públicas o privadas.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Decree No. 6.041 regulating biotechnology policy and creating the National Committee of Biotechnology.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 4 articles and one Annex, regulates innovative biotechnology activity by establishing the Policy of Biotechnology Development. The Policy contained in the Annex aims to establish the adequate environment for developing innovative biotechnological procedures, promoting and strengthening the national productive structure and improving exports. Priority areas are human health and livestock. This Decree also creates the National Committee of Biotechnology (specifying its composition) entitled to coordinate the implementation of the aforementioned Policy and perform any needed activity concerning development and use of biotechnology.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the day of its publication.

Policy: Decree No. 6.040 instituting National policy on Sustainable Development of Peoples and Traditional Communities.
Policy_Content: This Decree, composed of four articles and one Annex, establishes the National Policy on Sustainable Development of Peoples and Traditional Communities (PNPCT), with the aim of promoting their sustainable development strengthening, at the same time, their rights in terms of land, environment, culture and economy.  The Plan, structured in six main articles, regulates the set-up of sustainable development plans.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Decreto Nº 5.171 - Plan de desarrollo económico y social para la construcción y mantenimiento de la vialidad agrícola, de los sistemas de riego, el saneamiento de tierras y la construcción de servicios básicos en el sector rural.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba el Plan excepcional de desarrollo económico y social para la construcción, rehabilitación, consolidación y mantenimiento de la vialidad agrícola, de los grandes, medianos y pequeños sistemas de riego, el saneamiento de tierras y la construcción de servicios básicos e infraestructura de apoyo en el sector rural.

Policy: Act amending the Offshore Safety Act (No. 107 of 2007).
Policy_Content: The Act makes amendments regarding the limitation of penalties applied to staff, as well as the increasing of accommodation facilities on commercial vessels destined to the transportation of hydrocarbons.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Order No. 56 of the Federal Ecological, Technological and Nuclear Supervision Service validating the form of authorization for emission of pollutants to the atmospheric air.
Policy_Content: This authorization for emission of pollutants to the atmospheric air shall be valid legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. It establishes the list of pollutants and the amount thereof authorized for emission by stationary sources. The pollutants shall be specified by classes of hazardness.

Policy: Regional Law No. 263-OZ “On delimitation of plenary powers between institutions in the sphere of forest management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that regional administration shall have plenary powers in the following fields: (a) ownership, management and governance of forest parcels pertaining to public property; and (b) conclusion of contracts for purchase and sale of forest species.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decreto Nº 33697-MINAE ─ Reglamento para el acceso a los elementos y recursos genéticos y bioquímicos de la biodiversidad en condiciones ex situ.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto, en cumplimiento del artículo 15 del Convenio sobre la Diversidad Biológica, aprueba el Reglamento para el acceso a los elementos y recursos genéticos y bioquímicos de la biodiversidad en condiciones ex situ, que se aplicará sobre los componentes de la biodiversidad, ya sean silvestres o domesticados, terrestres, marinos, de agua dulce o aéreos, ya sea en colecciones de personas físicas o jurídicas, públicas o privadas; asimismo, tutela y regula la protección del conocimiento tradicional asociado y la distribución justa y equitativa de los beneficios derivados del uso de dichos elementos y recursos y/o del conocimiento tradicional.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Legislative Decree No. 52 implementing Directive 2003/122/Euratom on the control of high-activity sealed radioactive sources and orphan sources.
Policy_Content: This Legislative Decree lays down control measures applicable to high-activity sealed radioactive sources and orphan sources. All operations and practices involving such sources shall be subjected to prior issue of an authorization. Further provisions concern the transfer within the European Community as well as the importation and exportation of sources. A national register on sources and keepers is set up (art. 9).
Subject: Energy

Policy: Regulation on the manner of implementation of stimulating production.
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the manner and conditions necessary for the correct implementation of the prescribed mechanisms for supporting various agricultural sectors: crops, seedlings and perennial seedlings, processing of olives and olive oil, livestock and livestock related products, organic production, and fisheries.

Policy: Decree No. 97 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on request and release of information contained in the State register of immovable property.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes the amount of information to be released by the State register of immovable property, and the modalities of request and release thereof the period of updating of information on immovable property for taxation purposes. Cadastre information shall be considered of general public access except for restrictions related to identification data of the objects of immovable property owned by natural persons. Information data related to the objects of immovable property shall include cadastre identification number of plots of land and delimitation of the boundaries thereof on maps.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Arrêté n° 0038/PR/PM/MEP/SG/06 portant application du Système General Harmonise de classification et d'etiquetaqe des produits chimiques (SGH).
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté porte application du Système General Harmonisé de classification et d'étiquetaqe des produits chimiques (SGH), système international d'étiquetage des matières dangereuses destiné à unifier les différents systèmes nationaux en vigueur. Il comprend un ensemble de pictogrammes de danger qui remplace les pictogrammes de danger européens de couleur orange et leurs équivalents américains.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Decree-Law No. 6/07 approving the Statute of the Institution for Urban Land Planning of Luanda (IPGUL).
Policy_Content: This Decree approves the Statute of the Institution for Urban Land Planning of Luanda (IPGUL). This Statute, consisting of 5 Chapters and 1 Annex, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned governmental institution, entitled to: coordinate the designing process in general of the Territorial Land Use Planning (POT) within the Province of Luanda and its municipalities, in particular for rural and urban planning, according to the enforcing legislation on this topic established by Law No. 3/04; guaranteeing, in general the sustainable development of the socio-economic activities. Annex lists composition and duties of the above mentioned institution.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on 10 February 2007.

Policy: Regional Law No. 18-OZ “On protected areas”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of organization, protection and functioning of protected areas. Regional protected areas shall be classified as follows: (a) natural parks; (b) state nature reserves; (c) nature monuments; (d) dendrological parks and botanical gardens; and (e) spas and healthcare areas (art. 3). Regional protected areas shall pertain to public property and shall be governed by the authorized regional institution (art. 7). Regional protected areas shall be recorded in the regional register of protected areas (art. 11). Regional administration shall reserve land for the proclamation of protected areas (art. 12).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Resolution No 21 of 2007 of Georgian Government on Charter for Rules for Licencing export of fir cones, as well as snowdrop bulbs and/or cyclamen tubers that are listed in the Appendices to the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora (CITES)
Policy_Content: The Resolution regulates exporting fir cones, as well as snowdrop bulbs and/or cyclamen tubers. It consists of 12 articles: Purpose (1); Licencing agency (2); Rules for issuing the licence (3); List of documents to be furnished for issuing a licence (4); Terms and rules for participating in auctions (5); Grounds of denial of a licence (6); Initial bidding price of an auction (7); Effective period of licences (8); Control of compliance with licence terms (8-1); Exporting fir cones (9); Revocation of licence (9-1); and Transitional provisions (10). The Natural Resources Agency of Georgia issues the licences.
Subject: Forestry, Cultivated plants
Keyword: Authorization/permit,Planting material/seeds,International trade,International agreement-text,International agreement-implementation,Plant production

Policy: Order No. 26 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on the State Committee on Geology and Mineral Resources.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that the State Committee on Geology and Mineral Resources shall be governmental body subordinated to the Cabinet of Ministers. The State Committee on Geology and Mineral Resources shall carry out the following tasks: (a) implementation of the state policy in the sphere of geological exploration, management and protection of subsoil; (b) elaboration and validation of geological programmes; and (c) carrying out within its competence of state control over exploration, management and protection of subsoil, and also realization of geological exploration work. The State Committee shall carry out the following functions: (a) introduction of new technologies and new methods and geological exploration and mining activity; (b) coordination and monitoring of geological study and exploration; (c) state registration of the plots of subsoil conceded for subsoil management; (d) mapping of subsoil; and (e) keeping state geological fund.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Law on the Long-Term National Development Plan of 2005-2025.
Policy_Content: The Long-Term National Development Plan, referred to as the National RPJP in the Law, is the national development planning document for the period of twenty years from 2005 through 2025. The National RPJM is the specification of the goals for establishing the Government of Indonesia as contained in the Preamble of the 1945 Constitution of the Republic of Indonesia, namely to protect the entire people and whole nation of Indonesia, advancing public prosperity, enhancing the education of the people, and participating in the implementation of maintaining world order on the basis of freedom, lasting peace, and social justice, through the empowerment of women and children in the form of the formulation of the vision, mission and direction of National Development.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Mineral resources, Sea, Water, General

Policy: National Biosafety Framework for Guyana.
Policy_Content: The Guyana policy on biotechnology, biosafety and biosecurity aims to strengthen Guyanaís capability to take advantage of the opportunities offered by biotechnology, for the benefit of the individual, industry and the environment. The biotechnology policy aims to promote the accumulation and use of knowledge in the sector, to facilitate the conversion of the results of research projects to practical applications, under ethically acceptable conditions, with the risks overcome and protection to the traditional sectors from the negative effects of some aspects of biotechnology. The policy encourages public-private sector partnerships and foreign direct investment to do business in the country due to its richness of biodiversity and indigenous resources.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States, South America

Policy: Regional Law No. 12-ZS “On plenary powers of regional state bodies related to land tenure and management of land parcels”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes plenary powers of regional state bodies as regards land tenure and management of public land parcels or land with unidentified ownership. Authorized state regional institution in the sphere of land management shall carry out the following plenary powers: (a) preparation of documentation for delimitation of land ownership; (b) tenancy and management of public land; and (c) shall be a Party on behalf of the regional administration to purchase and sale, and also lease or land tenancy contracts on behalf of the regional administration.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy_Content: En application des dispositions de l’article 12 de la loi n° 04-03, relative à la protection des zones de montagnes dans le cadre du développement durable, le présent décret a pour objet de modifier la composition du conseil national de la montagne, en ajoutant les réprésentants des ministère de l'énergie et des mines.

Policy: Act on biocide products.
Policy_Content: This Act consists of the following Sections: General provisions (sec. 1); Trade in and use of biocide products (sec. 2); Marketing of biocide products (sec. 3); Active substances (sec. 4); Using data of another mover (sec. 5); Package, classification and marking of biocide products (sec. 6); Advertising of biocide products (sec. 7); Research and development examination (sec. 8); Inspection (sec. 9); Inspection of poisoning (sec. 9a); Principles of acceptance of permissions and registration between member states of the European Union (sec. 10); Criminal liability (sec. 11); Final provisions (sec. 12). The Act establishes: (a) conditions of placing on the market and use of biocide products on the territory of the Republic of Poland; (b) principles of acceptance of mutual recognition of permissions for marketing and registration of biocide products of low risk between Poland and other member states of the European Union. The aim of the Act is to prevent human and animal health as well as danger of the environment from results of biocide products. A biocide product is defined as an active substance or preparation containing at least one active substance, in forms as provided to the user, intended for destroying, deterring, neutralizing, preventing or controlling of dangerous organisms by chemical or biological effect.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries

Policy: Regional Law No. 3-ZS “On environmental protection”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal basis for ensuring environmental protection and ecological safety, conservation of favourable environment, biological diversity and natural resources. Environmental protection shall be based upon the following principles: (a) acknowledgement of ecological interests of the society and observance thereof; (b) prevention of negative environmental impact (ecological security); (c) environmental standards; and (d) public access to environmental information. Long-term environmental planning and policy shall be conducted by the regional administration and by the authorized state regional environmental institution. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) economic activities within area of potable water supply sources; (b) economic activities causing negative environmental impact within urban forests, amenity forests and green belts; (c) projecting and realization of projects causing damages to natural ecosystems; (d) excess of authorized emission limits; (e) burning of weeds on agricultural land and in protected areas, nearby lakes and rivers; and (f) burning of waste and garbage without treatment of emissions.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Environmental security,Environmental planning,Emissions,Environmental standards,Access-to-information,Sustainable development,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Decree No. 9 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection validating the Instruction on the modalities of performance of local environmental monitoring by legal persons performing economic and other activities causing negative environmental impact, including ecologically hazardous activities.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes the modalities of performance of local environmental monitoring by legal persons performing economic and other activities causing negative environmental impact, including ecologically hazardous activities. Local environmental monitoring shall be integral part of the National environmental monitoring system. Local environmental monitoring shall include: (a) emissions to the atmospheric air by stationary sources; (b) effluent waste water discharge to surface waterbodies; (c) groundwater in areas of potential pollution; and (d) soil in areas of potential pollution.

Policy: Ley de gestión integral de los residuos del Estado de Jalisco.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley, reconociendo el derecho de toda persona a gozar de un medio ambiente adecuado, establece el marco normativo que rige la gestión de los residuos en el Estado de Jalisco. En particular se promueve el establecimiento de medidas que prevengan el deterioro de los ecosistemas en el manejo y disposición final de residuos, reconociendo la responsabilidad compartida de todos los actores involucrados. La Ley regula la competencia concurrente entre la Federación y el Estado, al mismo tiempo que prevé las bases para la participación ciudadana en la reutilización y manejo de residuos. A efecto de la aplicación de estas disposiciones, la Ley clasifica los residuos en : a) residuos sólidos urbanos, y b) residuos de manejo especial considerados como no peligrosos.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Décret n° 2007-135 précisant les critères de définition et de délimitation des zones humides figurant à l'article L. 211-1 du code de l'environnement
Policy_Content: Les critères à retenir pour la définition des zones humides mentionnées au 1° du I de l'article L. 211-1 du code de l'environnement sont relatifs à la morphologie des sols liée à la présence prolongée d'eau d'origine naturelle et à la présence éventuelle de plantes hygrophiles. Celles-ci sont définies à partir de listes établies par région biogéographique. La délimitation des zones humides est effectuée à l'aide des cotes de crue ou de niveau phréatique, ou des fréquences et amplitudes des marées, pertinentes au regard des critères relatifs à la morphologie des sols et à la végétation.

This document is composed of the following parts: application; the part which is applicable for issuing of the permit by the competent authority of the country of destination and country or countries of transit for import or transit, respectively, of spent nuclear fuel foreseen for reprocessing or storage; the part which is applicable in case of issuing by the President of the NAEA of the permit for import into territory of Poland, export from the territory of Poland or transit through this territory of spent fuel, or in case of issuing by the competent authority of the country of holder of permit for export of spent fuel; shipment specification; acknowledgement of receipt of spent nuclear fuel.

Policy: Resolución Nº 1.01/2007 - Reglamento del Programa de Incentivos Forestales.
Policy_Content: Por la presente Resolución se aprueba el Reglamento del Programa de Incentivos Forestales, cuyos objetivos son los siguientes: a) mantener y mejorar la producción forestal sostenible, incorporando los bosques naturales a la actividad económica productiva; b) incorporar tierras de vocación forestal desprovistas de bosque a la actividad forestal, a través del establecimiento y mantenimiento de plantaciones forestales o regeneración natural; c) generar una masa crítica de bosques productores de materia prima para el desarrollo de la industria forestal; d) incentivar el mantenimiento de bosques naturales para la generación de servicios ambientales.

Policy: Environmental Offences (Fixed Penalties) (Miscellaneous Provisions) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 175 of 2007).
Policy_Content: These Regulations prescribe the parameters and method of calculation of fixed penalties that may be specified by competent authorities under  environment protection legislation, including: the Environmental Protection Act 1990, the Clean Neighbourhoods and Environment Act 2005, the Noise Act 1996 and the Control of Pollution (Amendment) Act 1989. These penalties shall be imposed in place of the amount prescribed in the relevant Statute. The Regulations also prescribe the minimum amount of fixed penalty that a local authority may treat as full payment of the fixed penalty where a lesser amount than the full-prescribed amount is paid within a specified period. The Regulations also prescribe the condition that must be satisfied before a person may be an authorized officer of a parish council for the purposes of giving a notice of a fixed penalty.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Legislative Decree No. 11 of 27 January 2007 defining competencies of the Ministry of Agriculture and Agrarian Reform.
Policy_Content: The aim of this Legislative Decree is to define competencies of the Ministry of Agriculture and Agrarian Reform. It is composed of 5 Sections divided into 15 articles. Section I gives terms and definitions. Section 2 defines competencies of the Ministry which are to: prepares general objectives and scientific strategy for the development of the agriculture sector; lays down productive and investment plans and projects; regulate and organize plant and animal production; protect and maintain natural resources; take necessary measures in order to guarantee food security; protect of environment; create protected areas; fight plant and animal diseases and epidemics; contribute in the development of scientific researches related to agriculture; reinforce the agricultural guidance; lays down training and qualification programmes and plans; lays down programmes and plans for the activation and reinforcement of women roles in rural development; contribute in the development and encouragement of agricultural productions and marketing; implement the Agrarian Reform Law; cooperate with Arab Countries and international and regional organization in scientific researches related to agricultural sectors; prepare incentive methods and systems; prepare necessary legislations concerning agricultural sectors; reform and exploit mountainous lands; enlarge the industrial afforestation; protect and develop forests; regulate the exploitation of deserts (Albadeya); lays down plans and programmes for the protection of plants and animals and their products; develop and improve local races; and, improve and develop agrarian financing and credit. Section III deals with the structure, management and internal organization of the Ministry as well as defines competencies of the Minister and departments of the Ministry. Sections IV and V contain financing and general provisions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural development,Basic legislation,Financial agricultural measures,Mountain area,Policy/planning,Research,Gender
Geographical_area: Mediterranean, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Western Asia

Policy: Resolución Nº 013/07/MTC - Programa de adecuación y manejo ambiental en proyectos portuarios.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba los lineamientos para elaborar un Programa de adecuación y manejo ambiental en proyectos portuarios, con la finalidad de adecuar ambientalmente los impactos que genera la operación de la actual infraestructura portuaria, así como mitigar y prevenir el deterioro ambiental que podrían causar las operaciones futuras del puerto.
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 47 on the preparation and conclusion of contracts for the lease of national parkland.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree stipulates that national parkland may be leased for recreational activities in accordance with land legislation, legislation on protected areas and this Regulation. The following plots of land located within the boundaries of any national park may be leased: (a) areas of tourism; (b) areas of ecological education; and (c) recreational areas. Lease contracts must contain terms and conditions, location, purpose of use and authorized activities, and also a prohibition on subleasing the land. Lease contracts shall be concluded by Federal Agency on Management of State Property and the leaseholder.
Subject: Forestry, Land & soil

Policy_Content: This Act, which is composed of 60 articles, lays down: (1) tasks and competences of authorities concerning direct support, supplement support, sugar support and support to tomatoes, specified in the appropriate European Community provisions; (2) principles of granting direct support, control of this support and mode of payments within direct support scheme established by the Council Regulation (EC) No. 1782/2003 establishing common rules for direct support schemes under the common agricultural policy and establishing certain support schemes for farmers and amending Regulations (EEC) No. 2019/93, (EC) No. 1452/2001, (EC) No. 1453/2001, (EC) No. 1454/2001, (EC) No. 1868/94, (EC) No. 1251/1999, (EC) No. 1254/1999, (EC) No. 1673/2000, (EEC) No. 2358/71 and (EC) No. 2529/2001; (3) principles of granting support to colza and control of this support.

Policy: Regulation on the monitoring of radioactivity.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister for the Environment and Spatial Planning, Minister for Health and Minister for Agriculture, Forestry and Food, establishes the manner and extent of environmental radioactivity monitoring and operational monitoring of radioactivity, types of measurements and methods of sampling and measurement of radioactivity, the quality of radioactivity measuring equipment, the way of publishing results of measurements of radioactivity, and the content and method of preparation and adoption of programs concerning monitoring of radioactivity. Regulation also relates to emergency monitoring of radioactivity in case of increased radioactive contamination of air, drinking water, water, soil, food, feed and individual products or materials and manner of reporting and informing the public about the results of the emergency monitoring.

Policy: Hydrocarbons (Prospection, Exploration and Exploitation) Regulations, 2007 (P.I. 51/2007).
Policy_Content: With the purpose of harmonizing the Cypriot legislative framework with EU Directive 94/22/EC, The Council of Ministers, in the exercise of the powers vested in it by section 30 of the Hydrocarbons (Prospection, Exploration and Exploitation) Law, hereby makes the present Regulations. Section 3 establishes that the Minister shall keep a register of hydrocarbons, in such form as he may determine with an Order. All applications, executions, grants, modifications, transfers, assignments, relinquishments, renewals, extensions, terminations, cancellations and any other related information regarding authorizations and related hydrocarbon contracts shall be entered in the register of hydrocarbons by dates. The Council of Ministers may determine the areas within the territory to be made available for the intended exercise of the activities of prospecting, exploring for and exploiting hydrocarbons (section 4). The conditions and requirements contained in the authorization for exploration and in the authorization for exploitation shall be stated explicitly in a Contract concluded between the Government of the Republic and the holder of an authorization (section 5). Applications submitted for an authorization for prospection, pursuant to section 5 of the Law, must contain the required general information established under section 6. Regarding the grant of an authorization, the Minister shall negotiate the terms and provisions of the contract with the selected applicant (section 7). The duration of an authorization for prospection shall be granted for a period not exceeding one year (section 8). An authorization for exploration shall be granted for an initial period not exceeding three years and may be renewed for up to two terms (section 9). Upon each renewal of the authorization for exploration, the holder of an authorization is obliged to proceed to the relinquishment of the area (section 10); The duration of an authorization for exploitation for each exploitation area shall not exceed twenty-five years and may be renewed for a period up to ten years, subject to the terms of the Contract (section 11). The transfer of an authorization and assignment of rights arising from an authorization is dealt with in section 12. Every holder of an authorization shall carry out hydrocarbons operations in a proper, safe and workmanlike manner and in accordance with good oilfield practices (section 13); the directions of the Minister to holders of an authorization in case of contravention of Regulation 13 is laid down in section 14. The holder of an authorization shall ensure that hydrocarbons operations are conducted in an environmentally acceptable and safe manner (section 15). Unless the Minister deems otherwise, on expiry of the time-period or termination of an authorization, the holder of an authorization is bound to remove all equipment, installations, etc. and to perform all necessary site restoration activities (section 16). Any drilling operations must be done in conformity with generally accepted international petroleum industry practice (section 17); Prior to the abandonment of any well, the holders of an authorization are bound to inform the Minister in writing of their intention to do so (section 18); Rules for construction and maintenance of installations, pipelines and related equipment are set forth in section 19; An obligation for measurement of hydrocarbons is set forth in section 20. Every operator is bound to keep records of his activities. The general information required is specified in sections 22 and for hydrocarbons production, in section 24. Also, The holders of an authorization are bound to inform the Minister of all major developments in relation to the course of hydrocarbons operations (section 23). The obligations in case of termination of an authorization are set out in section 25. Subject to the provisions of section 20 of the Law, all returns, reports, plans, data and other information submitted to the Minister pursuant to these Regulations shall be treated as confidential (section 26).
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia

Policy: Hydrocarbons (Prospection, Exploration and Exploitation) Law, 2007 (Law No. 4(I)/2007).
Policy_Content: With the purpose of harmonizing the Cypriot legislative framework with EU Directive 94/22/EC, the present Law provides for the prospection, exploration and exploitation of hydrocarbons in the republic of Cyprus. Article 3 establishes that the ownership of hydrocarbons wherever they are found in Cyprus, including the territorial waters, the continental shelf and the Exclusive Economic Zone of the Republic, shall be deemed to be and always to have been vested in the Republic. The law consists of 35 articles as follows: Short title (art.1); Interpretation (art. 2); Ownership of hydrocarbons (art. 3); Determination of the areas for the exercise of the activities and refusal to allow access to the activities on grounds of national security (art. 4); Grant of authorizations and conditions under which they are granted (art. 5); Establishment of an Advisory Committee (art. 6); Meetings of the Advisory Committee and procedure to be followed (art. 7); Functions of the Advisory Committee (art. 8); Powers and obligations of the Advisory Committee (art. 9); Procedure for examining the application by the Advisory Committee (art. 10); Environmental impact study (art. 11); Criteria for the evaluation of the applications (art. 12); requirements for granting authorizations (art. 13); Grant of rights to the holders of authorizations (art. 14); Duration of validity of an authorization (art. 15); State’s participation in the activities of prospecting, exploring for and exploiting hydrocarbons (art. 16); Information that has to be provided by the holders of an authorization (art. 17); Report to the Commission (art. 18); Authorized officers (art. 19); Confidential information and confidentiality of the received information (art. 20); Criminal offences in contravention of the provisions of section 19 (art. 21); Prospection, exploration or exploitation of hydrocarbons without an authorization or in contravention of the terms of an authorization (art. 22); Revocation, suspension and cancellation of an authorization (art. 23); Exemption from the provisions of section 22 (art. 24); Criminal liability of officials of legal persons (art. 25); Powers of the Court for seizure and confiscation (art. 26); Transfer of an authorization or assignment of rights arising from an authorization (art. 27); Control of a holder of authorization by a third country or a national of a third country (art. 28); Refusal for granting an authorization to an entity controlled by a third country or a national of a third country (art. 29); Power to make Regulations and Orders (art. 30); Administrative fine (art. 31); Jurisdiction of the President of the District Court (art. 32); Transfer of powers and/or duty of the Minister to an authorized person (art. 33); Repeal of Law No. 99(I) of 2004 (art. 34); Transitional provision (art. 35).
Subject: Mineral resources
Keyword: Basic legislation,Access right,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Authorization/permit,Continental shelf,EEZ-Exclusive Economic Zone,EIA,Exploration,Institution,Liability/compensation,Minerals,Offences/penalties,Mining
Geographical_area: EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia

Policy: Persistent Pollutants Control Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to protect citizens' health and the environment from hazards posed by persistent organic pollutants and to promote international cooperation by prescribing matters necessary for the control of persistent organic pollutants, such as dioxin, which are prescribed by the Stockholm Convention on Persistent Organic Pollutants for the implementation thereof. For the purpose of the present Act the term "persistent organic pollutants" means chemical substances that pose hazards to people and ecosystems, having the characteristics of toxicity, persistence, bioaccumulation, long-range transportability, which are prescribed by the Stockholm Convention on Persistent Organic Pollutants.  The text consists of 37 articles divided into 7 Chapters as follows: General provisions (I); Prohibition of or restriction on manufacture, exportation, importation or use of persistent organic pollutants (II); Regulation on discharge of persistent organic pollutants (III); Disposal of wastes containing persistent organic pollutants (IV); Control of instruments containing persistent organic pollutants (V); Supplementary provisions (VI); Penalty provisions (VII).
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Pollution control,Public health,Hazardous substances,Inspection,Ecosystem preservation,Offences/penalties,PIC-prior informed consent
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Eastern Asia, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Local Government (Amendment) Act No. 6 of 2006.
Policy_Content: This Act inserts the definition of adjacent waters to Section 2 as defined under the Marine Zones Declaration Act. Moreover, this Act amends several sections regarding the qualifications and disqualifications for election as a member of councils; elected and nominated members of councils; the appointment of president of councils; expiration of term of Council; meetings and proceedings of councils; functions of councils; bylaws having the force of law in the area of authority of the council; financial instructions of the Minister; powers and duties of Director of Audit; penalties relating to collection of rates; the appointment and accountability of officers and staff of councils; transfer of powers of public officers to councils; general penalties; and regulations applying within area of authority of any council. Finally, this Act inserts Section 126 on jurisdiction of Magistrates Court to try offences under this Act.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Least Developed Countries, Micronesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Environment Law.
Policy_Content: This Law provides for the protection and rehabilitation of the environment and the conservation and sustainable use of natural resources, living organisms and non-living organisms. it covers a wide range of matters regarding the environment, protected areas, biodiversity, rangeland management and access to and management of genetic resources. It gives effect to Article 15 of the Constitution of Afghanistan. That Article requires the state to adopt necessary measures to protect and improve forests as well as the living environment. The Law consist of 78 articles, which divided into 9 Chapters: General Provisions (I); Functions and Powers (II); Management of Activities Affecting the Environment (III); Integrated Pollution Control (IV); Environmental Considerations Relevant to Water Resource Conservation and Management (V); Biodiversity and Natural Resource Conservation and Management (VI); Environmental Information, Education and Training, and Research (VII); Compliance and Enforcement (VIII); Miscellaneous Orders (IX). The primary purposes of this Law are to: (1) improve livelihoods and protect the health of humans, fauna and flora; (2) maintain ecological functions and evolutionary processes; (3) secure the needs and interests of present and future generations; (4) conserve natural and cultural heritage; (5) facilitate the reconstruction and sustainable development of the national economy. Planning for sustainable use, rehabilitation and conservation of biological diversity, forests, rangeland and other natural resources, prevention and control of pollution, and conservation and rehabilitation of the environment from adverse effects shall be an obligatory element of all national and local land use plans and natural resource management plans developed by all relevant ministries and national institutions.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry, Water, Wild species & ecosystems, Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Notification prohibiting fish farming in enclosed bays and gulf areas.
Policy_Content: This Notification sets forth principles for defining the areas where fish farming is prohibited. Criteria for defining an area as an enclosed bay and gulf are listed as well. The Notification also prohibits fish farming in natural and archaeological sites, as specified by the Ministry of Culture and Tourism. Existing fish farms must report to the Ministry of Environment and Forestry within 1 May 2007 in order to verify the status of their areas as per the criteria established. Fish farms meeting the criteria must stop their activities, whereas those operating in the permitted areas must be subjected to a eutrofication assessment within one year after promulgation of this Notification. Measurements and analysis will be conducted by the authorized public or private laboratories. The same assessment procedure will apply to new fish farms before they commence operations in the permitted areas. Areas with high risk of eutrofication are considered as enclosed bays and gulf areas where fish farming will not be allowed.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea
Keyword: Marine pollution,Coastal zone management,Mariculture,Pollution control,Protected area
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia

The species are the following: Combretum imberbe (Mondzo), Swartzia madagascariensis (Pau Ferro), integrated in the Classification List of precious wood production, Pericopsis angolensis (Muanga) and Colophospermum mopane (Chanato), classified as 3rd and 4th class respectively. Policy: Décret n°000166/PR/MEFEPPN du 24 janvier 2007, portant réglementation de la commercialisation des grumes à l’exportation.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret, pris en application des dispositions des articles 227, 237 et 238 de, la loi 016/01 du 31 décembre 2001 portant Code Forestier en République Gabonaise, porte réglementation de la commercialisation des grumes à l'exportation en République Gabonaise. La vente de grumes à l'exportation est contingentée au niveau de chaque permis selon les modalités fixées ci-après : En début de chaque année civile, des quotas de grumes seront attribués aux opérateurs de la filière bois par l'administration des Eaux et Forêts. Ces quotas correspondent aux quantités à vendre en priorité sur le marché local pour l'approvisionnement des unités de transformation du pays, le surplus étant destiné à l'exportation.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 4-p validating the Regulation on state nature complex reserve of regional significance “Solgonsky ridge”.
Policy_Content: The scope of constituting protected area - state nature biological reserve of regional significance “Solgonsky ridge” shall be protection and reproduction of game subject to commercial hunting, conservation and restoration of the population of rare and endangered wild fauna species, including birds, valuable from economic, scientific and aesthetic point of view. The reserve shall perform the following functions: (a) conservation of the biodiversity of a unique natural landscape of southern taiga, including mountainous area Solgonsky ridge; (b) maintaining optimal conditions for reproduction and migration of wild fauna species, including species listed in the national and regional Red Books of protected and endangered species; (c) monitoring of the natural environment, wildlife, performance of scientific research; and (d) ecological education of the population. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature complex reserve: (a) hunting and hunting management; (b) clear cutting and selective cutting with a view of timber extraction, except for timber extraction by local residents for individual personal needs; (c) procurement of soft resin; (d) blasting operations; (e) hydro amelioration, irrigation, exploration of subsoil and mining; (f) blasting operations; (g) water logging; (h) procurement of edible and non-edible non-timber forest products and medicinal plants, except for procurement thereof for individual personal needs by local residents; (i) burning of vegetation; (j) storage and application of toxic chemicals and other hazardous substances; (l) movement and parking of motor vehicles outside roads of common access (except for service vehicles); (m) littering with household waste and garbage; and (n) destruction or damaging of barriers, boards and other information displays and indication signs.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Mountain area,Protection of habitats,Education,Research,Management/conservation,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Biodiversity,Endangered species,Birds,Monitoring,Protection of species

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 75 implementing Law No. 93-Z on hydrometeorological activity.
Policy_Content: For the timely prediction and identification of natural disasters, this Ministerial Decree requires producers of hydrometeorological data to provide the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection with assessments of hydrometeorological conditions at the regional level and to provide users with hydrometeorological data from the state hydrometeorological database. The Ministry shall keep a state register of producers of hydrometeorological data and shall control the accuracy of their data. Producers of hydrometeorological data recorded in the state register shall be issued a state registration certificate.

The list, specified in the Annex, contains substances harmful for health of animals, quality of foodstuffs of animal origin, and the environment.

Policy: Removal of Sand Regulations, No. 1 of 2007.
Policy_Content: These Regulations, consisting of nine sections and four Schedules, regulate sand removal. They specify the following provisions: no person shall mine and remove sand to be used for the construction industry, from any location specified in the Schedule I, except if licensed. The Geological Surveys and Mines Bureau established under the Mines and Minerals Act, No. 33 of 1992, shall submit proposals based on the National Sand Policy to the Director-General of the Department of Wild Life Conservation, setting out clearly, the specifications, quantities and other details relating to any sand which is sought to be removed from any one of the specified locations. If allowed by competent authority they shall submit together with such proposal an environmental impact assessment or an initial environmental examination report. Licence shall be issued by the Geological Surveys and Mines Bureau to applicants using form specified in Schedule III. The Department of Wild Life Conservation shall charge a royalty in respect of all sand mined and extracted from any authorized site. The royalty shall be paid to the Wild Life Preservation Fund maintained and operated by the Director General of the Department of Wild Life Conservation.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Forest Resources and Timber Utilisation (Timber Licensing and Tree Felling) Regulations (S.I. No. 21 of 2007).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made under section 44 of the Forest Resources and Timber Utilisation Act, concern (members of) the Solomon Forest Association and specify the conditions under which a licence pursuant to section 5 of the Act shall be granted. One of the conditions is that a licensee shall allow only association members (as defined by these Regulations) to conduct and manage tree felling and related operations. An agreement to such extent shall be approved by the Commissioner of Forest Resources and no licences shall be granted if this condition is not observed.

Policy: Regulation of the Minister of Trade No. 02/M-DAG/PER/1/2007 on prohibition of export of sand, soil and top soil (including humus).
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Regulation is to prohibit the export of sand, soil and top soil (including humus) in order to avoid environmental damage as a result of uncontrollable mining of these types of soil.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Indian Ocean, South-Eastern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force on 23 January 2007.

Policy: Regulation of the Minister of Trade of the Republic of Indonesia No. 03/M-DAG/PER/1/2007 on verification or technical examination of export of excavated materials category C other than sand, soil and top soil (including humus).
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Regulation is to prevent the illegal export of excavated materials category C by conducting verification or technical examination into the export of these materials before the loading of the goods. Verification or technical examination shall be preformed by a surveyor who shall have specific qualifications. Excavated materials category C are listed in the attachment to this Regulation.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, Indian Ocean, South-Eastern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force on 6 February 2007.

Policy: Decreto Nº 15 - Grupo de trabajo para la prevención de situaciones de riesgo.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea el Grupo de trabajo para la prevención, mitigación, preparación y gestión de situaciones de riesgos (desastres o emergencias), cuyo propósito es coordinar con otros Estados e instituciones gubernamentales y no gubernamentales la preparación y puesta en operación de planes y acciones que permitan responder a las emergencias o desastres.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Central America, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Law No. 05/VII/2007 on land tenure.
Policy_Content: This Law is composed of four articles. It authorizes the Government to rule on land legal order and to review the basic legislation on public expropriation provided by Law No. 2030 of 1948.  To this end, the Law lists the fields of application of the above mentioned authorization.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Atlantic Ocean Islands, North Atlantic, Sahel, Small Island Developing States, Western Africa
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force the day after its publication.

Policy: Orden ITC/71/2007 - Modifica la Orden de 28 de julio de 1980, sobre normas para la homologacion de los paneles solares.
Policy_Content: La presente Orden modifica la que aprueba las normas e instrucciones tecnicas complementarias para la homologacion de los paneles solares, respecto a la calidad aplicable a captadores solares, las condiciones aplicables a sistemas solares prefabricados y a las condiciones que deberán cumplir los laboratorios acreditados y los organismos de certificación en este ámbito.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Regulations concerning trial programme of legal mediation for land consolidation courts.
Policy_Content: These Regulations introduce a trial programme for mediation in disputes that have been made subject to decisions of Land Consolidation Courts in accordance with sections 88 and 88a of the Land Consolidation Act.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Décret n° 2007-039/PRES/PM/MAHRH/ MFB/MCPEA portant modification des statuts juridiques de l’Office National de l’Eau et de l’Assainissement (ONEA).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret modifie les dispositions des articles 6 et 13 des statuts juridiques de l’Office National de l’Eau et de l’Assainissement (ONEA).
Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy: Law relating to the introduction of the Federal Act on environment protection (Introductory Law relating to the Environment Protection Act).
Policy_Content: The present Law implements the federal legislation on environment protection. Furthermore, the Law establishes complementary provisions on the subject. Part B deals with special provisions, in particular: assessment of environmental impact, protection against disasters, air pollution, radiation, noise pollution, protection against ozone layers, waste, electrical and electronic machines, packaging of beverages, biological safety, plant protection and fertilizers, hazardous substances, chemicals. The text consists of 39 articles divided into 3 Parts as follows: General provisions (A); Special provisions (B); Final and transitional provisions.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Protection of environment,Basic legislation,Pollution control,Polluter pays principle,Precautionary principle,EIA,Environmental fees/charges,Air quality/air pollution,Noise pollution,Hazardous substances,Fertilizers/nutrients
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Décret n°07-023 du 22 janvier 2007 portant réglementation de l’importation, de la  commercialisation, de l’utilisation et de la réexportation des substances qui appauvrissent  la couche d’ozone(SAO) et des équipements les contenant.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret porte réglementation de l’importation, de la commercialisation, de l’utilisation et de la réexportation des substances qui appauvrissent  la couche d’ozone(SAO) et des équipements les contenant. Diverses structures sont chargées de la gestion de la couche d’ozone, notamment la direction Générale des Douanes et le Bureau d’Ozone. Les contrevenants aux dispositions du présent décret s’exposent aux sanctions prévues par la loi relative aux pollutions et aux nuisances, sans préjudice des sanctions prévues par le Code des Douanes. Au total, le présent décret comporte trois annexes: l'annexe I relative au Règlement N° 04/2005 /CM/UEMOA du 4 juillet 2005 portant liste des substances réglementées par le protocole de Montréal à l’importation; l'annexe II relative au règlement N° 04 /2005/CM/ UEMOA du 4 juillet 2005 portant liste des équipements contenant les substances réglementées par le protocole de Montréal et l'annexe III relative aux équipements ou produits contenant des substances réglementées
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Decreto Nº 003/07/EM - Simplificación de procedimientos administrativos para la venta al público de gas natural vehicular (GNV).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo dicta disposiciones para la simplificación de procedimientos administrativos para la obtención de autorizaciones de instalación y operación de establecimientos de venta al público de gas natural vehicular (GNV).

Policy: Ley Nº 1124 - Ejercicio de la profesión de administrador ambiental.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley reglamenta el ejercicio de la profesión de administrador ambiental, carrera profesional a nivel universitario, que tiene como objeto gestionar, supervisar, controlar, ejercer autoridad, ejercer mando e influenciar en el sistema global constituido por elementos naturales y artificiales de naturaleza física, química, biológica, sociocultural y de sus interrelaciones.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Amazonia, Americas, East Pacific, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North-East Pacific, South America, South-Eastern Pacific

Policy: Renewable Energy Standard Regulations (N.S. Reg. 35/2007).
Policy_Content: The present Regulations enact the Electricity Act. The Regulations lay down provisions relating to standards concerning renewable energy. At the outset the Regulations contain a definition clause relating to various terms therein employed, such as, for example, “independent power producer”, “renewable energy generator”, “renewable energy generation facility”, “renewable energy standard”, “renewable low impact electricity”. The text - consisting of 14 sections -  deals with the following aspects: renewable energy standard 2010, renewable energy generation facility certification, administrator’s powers, reporting requirements, review by Board, appeals to the Board, Board powers, standard shortfall and penalties and enforcement.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Americas, Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Pacific, North America, North Atlantic
Entry into force notes: The present Regulations enter into force on 1 February 2007.

Policy: Regulation on quality requirements for liquid biofuels used in selected vehicles and produced by farmers for their own use.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Economy, which is composed of three articles and four Annexes, lays down quality requirements for liquid biofuels: (1) used in selected vehicles equipped with engines with spark ignition adapted to the combustion of liquid biofuel (specified in Annex 1); (2) used in selected vehicles equipped with engines with spontaneous ignition adapted to the combustion of liquid biofuel (specified in Annex 2 and 3); (3) produced by farmers for their own use (specified in Annex 4).
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: The Regulation enters into force seven days after publication in the Journal of Laws.

Policy: Décret n° 2007-032/PRES/PM/MATD du 22 janvier 2007 portant organisation, composition et fonctionnement des Conseils Villageois de Développement (CVD).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe les règles d’organisation, de composition et de fonctionnement des Conseils Villageois de Développement (CVD) institués dans les villages des communes rurales et dans les villages rattachés aux communes urbaines. Le conseil municipal supervise la mise en place des conseils villageois de développement (CVD) dans les villages.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Land & soil
