Policy: Decree No. 4 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on formation and keeping carbon register.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes the modalities of formation and keeping carbon register, putting in circulation, storage, transfer, trade, cancellation, removal from circulation and bringing forward to subsequent period of carbon units. National carbon register shall be considered national information system administered scientific research unitary enterprise “Belorussian scientific research institution Ecology”.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Resolution No. 8/T of 21 January 2007 considering forests, woodlands and timberlands as a private properties of the State.
Policy_Content: This Resolution is composed of 5 articles. Article 1 joints forests, woodlands and timberlands to private properties of the State. Article 2 defines service allowances and fees offered by the Ministry of Agriculture and Agrarian Reform. Cutting or uprooting of trees in the aforementioned lands shall be carried out in accordance with Forest Law (art. 3). Article 4 entrusts a committee which shoul be established by the Minister of Agriculture and Agrarian Reform to value and define service allowances and fees for cutting, uprooting and sale of trees and forest products.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Access right,Expropriation,Forest management/forest conservation,Forestry protection measures,Protection forest,Public forest,Right of use,Authorization/permit

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 47/2007 - Procedimiento para la certificación de eficiencia energética de edificios de nueva construcción.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto aprueba el procedimiento básico para la certificación de eficiencia energética de edificios, determinando la metodología de cálculo de la calificación de eficiencia energética que considere los factores que más incidencia tienen en el consumo de energía de los edificios de nueva construcción o que se modifiquen o rehabiliten, aprobando un distintivo común denominado etiqueta de eficiencia energética.

Policy: Interim Measures for the Administration of the Surveying and Mapping Conducted by Foreign Organizations or Individuals in China (2011).
Policy_Content: These Interim Measures, consisting of 22 Articles, are formulated in accordance with the Surveying and Mapping Law of the People's Republic of China, for the purpose of strengthening the administration of the surveying and mapping activities conducted by foreign organizations or individuals within the territory of the People's Republic of China and other sea areas under its jurisdiction, safeguarding national security and interests, and promoting the economic, scientific and technological exchange and cooperation between China and foreign countries.
Subject: Land & soil, Sea

Policy: Interim Measures for the Administration of the Surveying and Mapping Conducted by Foreign Organizations or Individuals in China.
Policy_Content: These Interim Measures, consisting of 23 Articles, are formulated in accordance with the Surveying and Mapping Law of the People's Republic of China, for the purpose of strengthening the administration of the surveying and mapping activities conducted by foreign organizations or individuals within the territory of the People's Republic of China and other sea areas under its jurisdiction, safeguarding national security and interests, and promoting the economic, scientific and technological exchange and cooperation between China and foreign countries.
Subject: Land & soil, Sea

Policy: Regional Decree No. 4-p validating the Regulation on state nature complex reserve of regional significance “Arga”.
Policy_Content: The scope of constituting protected area - state nature biological reserve of regional significance “Arga” shall be protection and reproduction of game subject to commercial hunting, conservation and restoration of the population of rare and endangered wild fauna species, including birds, valuable from economic, scientific and aesthetic point of view. The reserve shall perform the following functions: (a) conservation of the biodiversity of a unique natural complex in conditions of intensive anthropogenic change in the natural environment; (b) maintaining optimal conditions for reproduction and migration of wild fauna species, including species listed in the national and regional Red Books of protected and endangered species; (c) monitoring of the natural environment, wildlife, performance of scientific research; and (d) ecological education of the population. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature complex reserve: (a) hunting and hunting management; (b) clear cutting and selective cutting with a view of timber extraction, except for timber extraction by local residents for individual personal; needs; (c) blasting operations; (d) hydro amelioration, irrigation, exploration of subsoil and mining; (f) blasting operations; (g) water logging; (h) procurement of edible and non-edible non-timber forest products and medicinal plants, except for procurement thereof for individual personal needs by local residents; (i) burning of vegetation; (j) industrial fisheries; (k) storage and application of toxic chemicals, radioactive and other hazardous substances; (l ) washing of any vehicle in coastal water protection areas of waterbodies; (m) littering with household, construction, industrial and other waste and garbage; (n) movement and parking of motor vehicles outside roads of common access (except for service vehicles); and (o) destruction or damaging of barriers, boards and other information displays and indication signs.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protected area,Ecosystem preservation,Protection of habitats,Education,Research,Management/conservation,Wild fauna,Wild flora,Biodiversity,Endangered species,Birds,Monitoring,Protection of species
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Decree enters into force 10 days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Electricity Supply Act, 2006 (No. 21 of 1996).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision for matters related to the generation, transmission and distribution of electricity including hydropower and for a rural electrification programme. It establishes the Independent Regulatory Commission.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Regional Law No. 5-OZ “On delimitation of plenary powers between state bodies in the sphere of environmental protection”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes delimitation of plenary powers between state bodies in the sphere of environmental protection. Regional Administration shall carry out the following plenary powers in the sphere of environmental protection: (a) applies use restrictions to the movement of motor vehicles in inhabited areas, recreational and protected areas with a view of reduction of emissions; (b) establishes environmental standards; (c) institutes and keeps Red Book of protected and endangered animal and plant species; (d) establishes authorized regional state institution in the sphere of environmental protection; and (e) restricts use of petroleum products, which burning causes atmospheric air pollution, and stimulates production of ecofriendly fuel.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Institution,Air quality/air pollution,Protected area,Ecofriendly products/ecofriendly processes,Environmental standards,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force a day after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 6-OZ “On delimitation of plenary powers between state bodies in the sphere of subsoil management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law delimits plenary powers between state bodies in the sphere of subsoil management. Regional Administration shall carry out the following plenary powers: (a) validates regional programs for the development and management of mineral deposits; (b) establishes the modalities of extraction of common widespread minerals by owners of land plots to the depth of 5 metres; (c) establishes the modalities of state registration and issuance of mining licences; and (d) establishes the authorized state regional subsoil management body and its sphere of competence.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force a day after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regulation amending the Regulation on technical inspection of organic production.
Policy_Content: This Regulation changes certain provisions prescribed by the Regulation on technical inspection of organic production (Official Gazette 13/2002).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Regulation enters into force eight days after its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Green Fund Regulations, 2007 (Chapter 77:01).
Policy_Content: The Green Fund is established by section 65 of the Miscellaneous Taxes Act. The Green Fund Regulations set forth provisions on the application procedures for the certification of activities related to remediation, reforestation and environmental protection for the purposes of receipt of public money to be disbursed from the Green Fund. The applicants may request for review of the decision in case of refusal after the application evaluation. The Minister of Finance shall specify the amount that should be withdrawn from the Green Fund to meet the expenditure of the certified activity and may authorize the disbursement of money from the Green Fund in accordance with the Memorandum of Agreement entered into between the community group or organization and the Minister. All certified activities in receipt of disbursements from the Green Fund shall be registered and monitored to ascertain whether the certified activity is being delivered as agreed by the Memorandum of Agreement. The community group or organization shall submit report to the Minister within two months after the end of the Government's financial year. The Minister of Finance may cancel disbursements from the Green Fund due to the failure by a community group or organization to comply with a condition of a disbursement from the Green Fund as specified in the Memorandum of Agreement or these Regulations.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry
Keyword: Authorization/permit,Certification,Community management,Subsidy/incentive,Inspection,Institution,Monitoring,Procedural matters,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Special fund,Afforestation/reforestation,Protection of environment,Forest management/forest conservation
Geographical_area: Americas, Caribbean, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, North Atlantic, Small Island Developing States

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement wallon relatif à l'octroi de subventions aux pouvoirs publics subordonnés pour l'établissement de dispositifs destinés à la protection contre l'érosion des terres agricoles et à la lutte contre les inondations et coulées boueuses dues au ruissellement (M.B. 12.02.2007).
Policy_Content: Le présente arrêté regule l'octroi de subventions aux pouvoirs publics subordonnés pour l'établissement de dispositifs destinés à la protection contre l'érosion des terres agricoles et à la lutte contre les inondations et coulées boueuses dues au ruissellement. Au sens du présent arrêté, il faut entendre par allocataire le pouvoir public subordonné bénéficiaire de la subvention et maître de l'ouvrage. Les projets introduits par l'allocataire pour l'obtention de subventions en vue de la réalisation d'ouvrages ou d'aménagements visés par le présent arrêté doivent comprendre l'avis du gestionnaire du cours d'eau et les documents suivants : - une étude agronomique et hydrologique permettant d'identifier l'origine des problèmes d'érosion, d'inondation ou de coulées boueuses et d'envisager globalement des mesures correctrices, comprenant des dispositifs visés par le présent arrêté; - les notes de calculs se référant à ces dispositifs; - la copie de la délibération par laquelle l'allocataire approuve le projet et choisit le mode de passation du marché, en fixe les conditions et sollicite les subventions; - le cahier spécial des charges des travaux conforme au cahier des charges-type RW 99 de la Région wallonne, les métrés descriptif et récapitulatif, le modèle de soumission et les plans d'exécution; - le devis estimatif des travaux comprenant, le cas échéant, le coût des essais préalables; - une note explicative du mode de détermination des prix unitaires; - l'attestation de l'allocataire établissant qu'il dispose de tous les terrains nécessaires à la réalisation des travaux; - en cas d'acquisition de biens immobiliers non bâtis, un dossier d'emprise avec une estimation de leur valeur établie par le Comité d'Acquisition d'Immeubles; - en cas de servitude d'immersion temporaire, un dossier d'indemnisation unique et les conditions d'exercice de cette servitude; - le permis d'urbanisme et d'environnement, s'il échet.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Land & soil, Water
Keyword: Agricultural land,Erosion,Disasters,Flood,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Soil rehabilitation,Zoning,Inland waters,Risk assessment/management,Bank,Data collection/reporting,Governance,Institution
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Sulphur Content of Liquid Fuels (England and Wales) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 79 of 2007).
Policy_Content: These Regulations prescribe sulphur content in heavy fuel oils and gas oil and prohibit the use of heavy fuel oil or gas oil containing sulphur in excess of prescribed limits. Schedule 1 provides for a local authority to grant permits to enable an operator of a combustion plant (who would not otherwise require a permit to operate the plant) to be exempt from the restriction on the use of heavy fuel oil. Schedule 2 sets out technical requirements for the analysis of samples taken under these Regulations.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Resolution No. 134 of 17 January 2007 issuing the general regulations for the protection from radiation and for the security and safety of its sources.
Policy_Content: The aim of this Resolution is to lay down regulations for the protection from radiation and for the security and safety of its sources. It is composed of 16 Chapters divided into 89 articles and 2 Annexes. Chapter I gives terms and definitions. Chapter II deals with the following matters: objectives; scope of application; exceptions; exemptions; clearance levels; and, sources originators of grave damages. Chapter III define rules and requirements for licensing activities related to radiation. Chapter IV pertains to the protection from radiation in particular: justification of practices and activities; respect of dose limits; and, improvement and perfecting of the protection and prevention against radiation. Chapters V and VI provide for the security and safety of radiation sources especially: general responsibilities; requirements and descriptions of sources; projecting and realization of installations; immediate communication about any defect; inventory of sources; radiation storage; and, utilization and driving advantages from experiences. Chapter VII addresses the verification and control of radiation protection and sources. Chapter VIII refers to the management responsibilities in particular: security and safety culture; warranty and security of high quality; human factors; and, liabilities. Chapters IX to XIII deal with the following matters: radiation protection officers; protection against radiation in occupational, medical, public exposure; and, protection against natural radioactive materials. Chapter XIV lays down requirements and conditions for the safety and security of radioactive waste disposal. Chapter XV defines requirements and measures for the intervention in cases of emergency. Chapter XVI contains general provisions. Annex I contains the classification of sealed sources. Annex II defines dose limits.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Mediterranean, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Western Asia

Policy: Presidential Decree No. PP-568 concerning the arrangements related to improvement of functioning of State Committee on Geological Exploration and State Committee on Geology and Mineral Resources.
Policy_Content: The President, for the purpose of geological activity and increase of stock of mineral deposits, decrees to define the main task of geological institutions improvement of the efficiency of geological exploration and prospecting of hydrocarbons, precious and nonferrous metals, uranium, and also ground fresh water and ground mineral water.  State Committee on Geological Exploration and State Committee on Geology and Mineral Resources shall set up within their structure scientific and production centres with the function of assessment of geological potential of the territory and introduction of new methods and technologies for geological exploration.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Decree No. 2/2007 regulating the Regional Forestry Plan of Nordeste (PROF NE).
Policy_Content: This Decree, composed of four articles and one Annex, approves the Regional Forestry Plan of Nordeste (PROF NE). The annexed Plan is composed of four titles divided in 38 articles and several annexes. It defines the legal nature and scope of application for the Forestry Plan, with the aim of granting a sustainable and multifunctional use and management of forest resources. Particular attention is devoted to forest fire prevention measures and to the regulation of forest use according to homogeneous sub-areas listed in the Plan. Moreover, the Plan provides agro-forestry models and indicates intervention measures. Finally, it rules on monitoring procedures and tools.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the day after its publication.

Policy: Decree No. 3/2007 regulating the Regional Forestry Plan of Barroso and Pradela (PROF BeP).
Policy_Content: This Decree is composed of four Chapters and one Annex. It approves the Regional Forestry Plan of Barroso and Pradela (PROF BeP). The annexed Regional Forestry Plan is structured in three Titles divided in five Chapters and several annexes. It defines the legal nature and scope for application of the planning measures, with the aim of achieving a sustainable and multifunctional use of forest resources. Particular attention is devoted to the regulation of forest use according to homogeneous sub-areas listed in the Plan. Moreover, the Plan provides agro-forestry models and indicates intervention measures. Finally, it rules on monitoring procedures and tools.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force the day after its publication.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 9/2007 approving the General Regulation on Noise.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, composed of seven articles and one Annex, approves the General Regulation on Noise. The annexed Regulation is composed of five Chapters divided in 24 articles and two annexes. It rules on the regime of prevention and control of noise pollution, with the primary aim of protecting human health. The Regulation applies to both permanent and temporary noisy activities as well as other noise sources. The Regulation identifies the basic principles, the protection and planning competences at central and local levels. Particular attention is paid to municipal plans of noise reduction and control. The Regulation provides limit values to noise exposure and licensing procedures. Moreover, it regulates monitoring and control procedures.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Decree-Law enters into force on the day after its publication.

Policy: Nepal Law Commission Act, 2063 (2007).
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 4 Chapters and 1 Schedule, may be called "Nepal Law Commission Act, 2063 (2007). The Nepal Law Commission has hereby been established for the drafting and codification of laws, amendment, unification and review of prevailing laws as well as to conduct study and research on law and justice. The Commission shall be competent for any administrative and legal issue, and in particular: to make and cause to be made study and research on enactment of new laws or amendment of existing laws or the contemporary issues relating to law and justice; to prepare necessary draft for codification of laws, and submit the same to the Government of Nepal; to unify or review the prevailing laws, and to provide necessary suggestion in this regard to the Government of Nepal, to submit a draft along with explanatory notes, in regard to enactment of new laws and amendment of prevailing laws as per necessity, etc.

Policy_Content: The aim of this Act is the implementation of the Directive 2004/8/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the promotion of cogeneration based on a useful heat demand in the internal energy market, and thereby the growth of energy efficiency and the improvement of energy supply. The Act establishes provisions relating to the cogeneration defined as the simultaneous generation of heat and electrical or mechanical energy during the same technological process.

Policy: Regional Law No. 1551-OZ “On modalities and rates of timber extraction, collection and harvesting of edible and non-edible non-timber products and medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens shall have the right to timber extraction for individual personal needs in accordance with timber purchase and sale contracts without allotment of forest parcels for heating, housing construction and maintenance of housing facilities. Rates of timber extraction for individual personal needs shall be as follows: (a) for housing construction – 200 cubic metres once-only per family; (b) maintenance and reconstruction of residential housing facilities – 25 cubic metres once in 10 years; (c) for construction and repairs of household outbuildings – 25 cubic metres once in 10 years; and (d) fuelwood for heating – 25 cubic metres per farmstead annually. Timber extraction shall be carried out in the form of clear cutting. Citizens shall have the right freely and free of charge collect and harvest edible and non-edible non-timber forest products and medicinal plants.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force ten days after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Regional Law No. 21-OZ “On protection of the atmospheric air”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of protection of the atmospheric air with a view of prevention and reduction of negative and hazardous impact on human beings and environment, and reduction of damages originating as a result of atmospheric pollution. Regional state bodies shall perform the following duties: (a) law-making and law enforcement; (b) implementation of the regional programs in the sphere of protection of the atmospheric air; (c) organization and performance of state atmospheric monitoring; (d) prevention of emergencies and disasters caused by the atmospheric pollution; (e) performance of state environmental audit; (f) arrangements for reduction of emissions to the atmospheric air from mobile sources, motor vehicles, particularly in protected areas; and (g) legal proceedings for the infringement of the legislation on protection of the atmospheric air.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Emissions,Monitoring,Environmental audit,Offences/penalties,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Basic legislation,Pollution control
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 1551-OZ “On timber extraction, procurement of non-timber products and collection of medicinal plants by citizens for individual personal needs”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that citizens shall be granted the right of timber extraction for individual personal needs (residential housing construction and heating) in accordance with purchase and sale contract of forest species without allotment of forest parcel. Citizens shall be granted the right to procure non-timber (edible and non-edible) non-timber products free of charge. Edible fruits, nuts, berries and mushrooms shall be collected exclusively within time period established by the authorized regional forest institution. Collection and harvesting of protected, rare and endangered species of non-timber (edible and non-edible) forest products shall be prohibited.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Timber,Timber extraction/logging,Fuelwood,Non-timber products,Forest species,Contract/agreement,Forest management/forest conservation

Policy: Regional Law No. 6-RZ “On state support of private subsidiary farms”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations regarding state support of private subsidiary farms. Its establishes as follows: (a) private subsidiary farming shall be conducted by a citizen and his family members on land parcel allotted or purchased for such purpose; (b) agricultural commodities produced or processed in the process of conducting private subsidiary farming shall be property of the holder of private subsidiary farm; and (c) agricultural land parcel allotted for private subsidiary farming shall be used exclusively for agricultural commodities production with the prohibition of building and construction thereon. State support shall be granted in the form of financing out of regional budget in the form of subsidies, incentives and subventions, and partial compensation of interests on agricultural credits.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Commonwealth Comprehensive Infrastructure Plan Act of 2006 (P. L. 15-42).
Policy_Content: This Act creates the Commonwealth Comprehensive Infrastructure Plan Task Force and defines its composition, duties and organization. Policy: Law No. 214 on licensing.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates relations regarding licensing of some activities. It shall not be applicable to the issuance of licences related to licensing agreement between natural and legal persons. The Act consists of seven Chapters divided into 52 Articles: (1) general provisions; (2) the state licensing system; (3) types of activity; (4) licensing of import and export; (5) licensing terms and conditions; (6) renewal, cancellation and suspension of licences; and (7) final provisions. Licensing terms and conditions shall be equal for all persons complying with the established requirements. Special licensing terms and conditions shall be established for some activities for the purpose of the protection of environment and human health. Licences shall be valid on all the national territory except for cases envisaged by the national legislation. Licences shall be classified by the subject (national natural and legal persons on one hand and foreigners, stateless persons, foreign legal persons and international organizations on the other), by the amount of activity (general licences issued for unlimited period and once-only licences issued for a limited period, amount and quantity). The following activities shall be subject to compulsory licensing: (a) industry (energy production, oil and gas exploration, extraction, storage and transportation); (b) nuclear energy; (c) turnover of firearms; (d) outer space; (e) agriculture and land use planning; (f) veterinary (animal drugs manufacturing and veterinary certification of animal products); and (g) viticulture and tobacco. The request for issuing licence shall include: (a) application; (b) notarized copy of the Statute; (c) copy of identity card (for natural persons); (d) notarized copy of the state registration of the applicant as individual entrepreneur; (e) notarized copy of the registration at the state tax inspection; (f) a copy of payment order of licensing fee; and (g) documents attesting compliance with the qualification requirements.
Subject: Livestock, Energy, Food & nutrition, Land & soil
Keyword: Energy conservation/energy production,Nuclear energy,Oil,Natural gas,Viticulture/oenological practices,Authorization/permit,Agricultural land,Land-use planning,Drugs,Certification,Animal health

Policy: National Adaptation Program of Action (NAPA).
Policy_Content: The National Adaptation Program of Action (NAPA) is Kiribati’s response to its commitments under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change. It is a cross-sectoral plan with national coverage which entered into force in 2007 for a 3-year plan for urgent and immediate actions in Kiribati to being work in adapting to climate change. NAPA identifies prioritized adaptation projects to be implemented. One of the adaptation projects under NAPA will seek to maintain and conserve available good ground water lenses; to gain users confidence in the reliability of the distribution system and promote their willingness to pay, based on consumed quantity; to increase water storage and water resources to meet current demands and at times of serious droughts; to manage risks to water resources throughout the atolls; and to assess impacts of urban water supplies on other natural resources, systems and subsistence activities. And another adaptation project under the NAPA will reduce the burden of diarrhea and other water related diseases and problems particularly among very young and old people in Kiribati.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Genetic resources,Climate change,Disasters,Water shortage/drought,Erosion,Marine protected areas,Research,Sustainable development,Protected area,Pests/diseases,Stock enhancement/repopulation,Animal health

Policy: ANGOLA 2025 Long-term Development Strategy for Angola (2025).
Policy_Content: The Long-term Development Strategy for Angola (2025) is divided by Strategies: the expected results of the General Strategy for the Mega-Population System are ambitious and imply that other systems give contributions to its implementation. Some measures for the jump that Angola can give in a period of 25 years, in terms of human development and the main demographic determinants are: advance at least 30 points in the Human Development Index (UNDP), moving to the level currently occupied by the medium developing countries (0.691) and by South Africa (0.695), and surpassing the average observed in 2025 for SADC, which currently stands at 0.465; Reduce by 50% the gross rate of general mortality; Reduce the Poverty Index (HDI-UNDP) by 75%, placing Angola in 2025 in a situation more favourable than the current level of the Medium Development Countries (20.5). This result will presuppose the eradication of poverty (extreme poverty) and the substantial reduction of relative poverty (by 2/3) and hunger, etc. (pag. 3)

Policy_Content: China’s "No. 1 Central Document" is the first policy document jointly released every year by the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Council, for the most important policy theme. Policy: National Strategy of sustainable development of Montenegro (2007).
Policy_Content: This publication brought the National Strategy of sustainable development of Montenegro. This Strategy is based on the globally accepted principles of sustainable development, defined through the Rio Declaration and Agenda 21, Johannesburg Declaration and Implementation Plan, as well as on the principles of the UN Millennium Declaration. In the document Visions of Sustainable Development of Montenegro, these principles are summarized as follows: integration of environmental concerns into development policies; internalization of environmental costs (conversion of external costs of environmental degradation into internal costs of polluters/users) through the implementation of polluter/user pays principles; participation of all the stakeholders in the decision making, consultations, dialogue and partnerships; access to information and justice; equity among generations and equity within the same generation (including gender equality); the precautionary principle.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Air & atmosphere, Energy, Environment gen., Forestry, Sea, Water, General
Keyword: Gender,Equity,Tourism,Biodiversity,Cultural heritage,Sustainable development,Policy/planning,Rural employment,Disasters,Precautionary principle,Polluter pays principle,Coastal zone management
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Strategy enters into force on the day of its adoption.

Policy: Resolution No. 4 of 2007 of Georgian Government on Monetization of Social Concessions
Policy_Content: This Resolution regulates monetization of social concessions. It consists of nine articles: Scope and object of regulation (1); Domestic subsidy (2); Administration component agency (3); Domestic subsidy amount and scope of recipients (4); Restriction of the right to receive of domestic subsidy and legalization of excessively received amounts (4-1); Granting and issuing the domestic subsidy (5); Authority of the competent body (6); Source of financing (7); and Transitional provisions (8). These rules determine the amount of domestic subsidy through monetization of social concessions, the categories of its recipients, the competent authority for its administration, and regulates the matters related to granting-issuing domestic subsidy. Domestic subsidy is defined as cash assistance for certain categories of people for domestic-utility expenses.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, General
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy: Strategy for long-term economic development of southern Serbia, municipalities of Presevo, Bujanovac and Medvedja.
Policy_Content: The Economic Team for Kosovo and Metohija and Southern Serbia has developed a Strategy for Long-Term Economic Development of Southern Serbia in the municipalities of Presevo, Bujanovac and Medvedja, which will represent program support for the realization of priority goals in all areas of economy and economy. Given that these are environments that are in very unfavorable socio-economic conditions, the importance of drafting the Strategy is to provide support for activating all development potentials and overcoming the features of underdevelopment and help businesses to prepare for business in modern market conditions. The strategy was prepared with the aim of accelerated economic development of the municipalities that are part of the Pčinja and Jablanica districts, which are among the least developed districts in the Republic of Serbia. After a detailed and comprehensive review of the current economic level of development and development opportunities of these municipalities, the basic economic potentials and strategic directions of their valorization have been identified. This Strategy is harmonized with the strategies of economic development, the Strategy of Accession of the Republic of Serbia to the EU and other strategies. The implementation of the Strategy will ensure the economic stability and prosperity of these municipalities and the improvement of the living standard of the citizens, which are the basic preconditions for the improvement of stability in the south of Serbia. Main goals of the Strategy are: 1) Creating a stimulating economic environment, as a precondition for attracting domestic and foreign direct investments, given that there is no financial potential of local companies to launch a significant investment cycle. 2) Strengthening the capacity of local governments to provide services to existing companies and companies starting operations in these municipalities. Special attention is paid to their connection with the competent institutions of the Republic of Serbia and the Republic Agencies in charge of economic development. 3) Valorization of the use of local resources, given that in these municipalities there are significant natural potentials (forests, mineral deposits, agricultural land, thermal spring). A special contribution to the realization of this goal will be provided by the completion of the part of the highway of the pan-European corridor 10, whose route intersects the territories of these municipalities. The realization and realization of these goals is based on improvements within 6 development priorities: 1) infrastructure; 2) agriculture and rural development; 3) industry, services and SME development; 4) tourism; 5) development of human potential and social issues; 6) attracting foreign direct investment. The strategy also contains an Action Plan within which projects for defined priority areas are given, by municipalities. The Action Plan also defines the holders and deadlines for the implementation of the listed projects. The responsible work of local self-governments, as well as their full cooperation with the institutions of the Republic of Serbia on the realization of projects that are within their competence, will especially contribute to the implementation of this strategy.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, General
Keyword: Agricultural development,Policy/planning,Local government,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Tourism,Business/industry/corporations,International relations/cooperation,Education,Rural employment,Rural youth

Policy: Regional Law No. 1539-OZ “On delimitation of plenary powers of state bodies in the sphere of forest management”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that regional Legislative Assembly shall have the following competence: (a) validation of the modalities and rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs; (b) collection and harvesting of non-timber edible and non-edible resources by citizens for individual personal needs; and (c) forest management for hunting purposes. Regional executive bodies shall have the following competence: (a) ownership and management of public forest parcels owned by the regional administration; (b) validation of regional forest management plans; (c) afforestation and reforestation arrangements; (d) issuance of timber extraction permits; (e) concession of public forest plots to natural and legal persons on lease for timber extraction and processing; and (e) conclusion of forest lease contracts.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 143 validating the Regulation on the Agency for state financial control and anti-corruption of the Republic of Tajikistan.
Policy_Content: Agency for state financial control and anti-corruption of the Republic of Tajikistan is authorized financial control and law enforcement agency exercising state control over the effectiveness of the use of public funds and property for organization of the economic security of the state, by prevention, detection, suppression, disclosure and investigation of crimes and offenses of corruption and economic character. The competence of the Agency shall include: (a) organization and implementation of audits and performance of checks related to revenue and expenditure of the national and local budgets, state funds in terms of volume, structure and purpose, and also the efficiency of public spending and use of state property; (b) analysis of the feasibility of the income and expenditure part of the draft state budget and state funds; (c) control over timely and complete financing of state investment and social programs, targeted use of funds allocated by the national budget for elimination of the consequences of natural disasters, as well as the distribution of humanitarian and technical assistance received by the Government of Republic of Tajikistan; (d) checking the legality and timeliness of the movement of funds of state budget and state funds in state banks and other financial and credit organizations; (e) control over the targeted use of credit resources and foreign investments attracted by the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan, the National Bank of Tajikistan in agreement with the President of the Republic of Tajikistan; (f) verification and analysis of the activities of the bodies performing the functions of intradepartmental financial control; (g) - control over the financial and economic activities of state economic entities, as well as ensuring the storage of state funds and property related thereto; (h) implementation of state financial control and combating corruption in all branches of government, in local authorities, government and local government, banks, public organizations, political parties, enterprises, institutions and other organizations, regardless of the accountability of forms of ownership and types of property in accordance with the legislation of the Republic of Tajikistan; (i) determination of priority areas in combating corruption; (j) prevention, exposure and elimination of corrupt practices; (k) ensuring the rule of law in the process of implementing the fight against corruption; (l) development and implementation of programs and action plans to combat corruption; and (m) implementation of operational-search activities, inquiries and preliminary investigation within the framework established by law of the Republic of Tajikistan.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Ecological Code (Law No. 212-Z).
Policy_Content: This Ecological Code shall regulate relations in the sphere of protection, reproduction and conservation of environment, management and reproduction of natural resources in the process of economic and other activities related to the management of natural resources and environmental impact on the national territory. Protection against destruction, degradation, damage, pollution and other harmful impact shall be subject land (soil), subsoil, surface water and groundwater; atmospheric air; forests and other vegetation; wild fauna, genetic resources of living organisms; natural ecological systems, climate and the Earth's ozone layer. The Government implements the state policy on the implementation of obligations under international treaties of the Republic of Kazakhstan in the field of climate change. The basic principles of the environmental legislation shall be: (a) sustainable development; (b) environmental security; (c) ecosystem approach; (d) state regulation in the sphere of environmental protection and state management of natural resources; (e) prevention of environmental pollution; (f) liability; (g) compensation of environmental damages; (h) environmental fees application and issuance of environmental permits; (i) interaction, coordination and transparency in the functioning of the authorized state environmental institutions; (j) incentives for the prevention of environmental pollution and waste; (k) availability of environmental information; and (l) assumption of environmental risks of the projected activity for environment and population. State regulation in the field of environmental protection includes: (a) licensing of activities in the field of environmental protection; (b) environmental standardization; (c) technical regulation in the field of environmental protection; (d) state environmental audit; (e) issuance of environmental permits; (f) state environmental supervision; (g) system of economic regulation of environmental protection, encouraging the introduction of the best environmentally friendly technologies, the system of financing of environmental protection measures; (h) quotas for greenhouse gas emissions; (i) inventory of greenhouse gases; (j) establishment of market mechanisms for emission reduction and absorption of greenhouse gases; (k) system for monitoring of actual emissions and absorption of greenhouse gases; (l) state environmental monitoring; (m) state registration of natural resource users, sources and sites of environmental pollution; and (n) environmental education and awareness. The Act consists of nine Sections divided into 326 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) licensing; (3) economic regulation of environmental protection and nature management; (4) ecological inspection; (5) ecological monitoring and registration; (6) environmental disasters; (7) ecological education and research; (8) ecological requirements for the projected economic activity; and (9) liability and dispute settlement. The state regulation in the sphere of environmental protection shall include: (a) licensing; (b) rate setting; (c) technical regulation; (d) state environmental audit; (e) issuance of environmental permits; (f) state ecological inspection; (g) economic regulation; (h) state environmental monitoring; (i) state registration of nature managers, sources and areas of pollution; and (k) ecological education.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Framework law,Environmental audit,Environmental security,Climate change,Ozone layer,Emissions,Pollution control,Disasters,Environmental fees/charges,Waste prevention,Liability/compensation,Authorization/permit,Monitoring,Education,Access-to-information
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Decreto Nº 2.232 - Estrategia Nacional de Biodiversidad 2001–2010.
Policy_Content: La Política y Estrategia Nacional de Biodiversidad del Ecuador es un instrumento de carácter multisectorial y alcance nacional, relativo al período 2001-2010, que fue adoptado en el marco del Convenio sobre la Diversidad Biológica, ratificado por el Ecuador en febrero de 1993. A través de este documento, el Ecuador, como signatario del Convenio, busca concretar sus tres objetivos: a) conservar la diversidad biológica; b) usar sustentablemente los recursos biológicos; y c) asegurar la distribución justa y equitativa de los beneficios derivados del uso de los recursos genéticos. El documento está articulado en torno a cuatro líneas estratégicas, a saber: 1) consolidar y potenciar la sustentabilidad de las actividades productivas basadas en la biodiversidad nativa; 2) asegurar la existencia, integridad y funcionalidad de los componentes de la biodiversidad: ecosistemas, especies y genes; 3) equilibrar presiones para la conservación y uso sustentable de la biodiversidad; 4) garantizar el respeto y ejercicio de los derechos individuales y colectivos de la ciudadanía para participar en las decisiones relativas al acceso y control de los recursos, y asegurar que los beneficios de la conservación y uso de la biodiversidad y de los conocimientos, innovaciones y prácticas de las comunidades y poblaciones locales sean justa y equitativamente distribuidos.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Genetic resources,Food security,Poverty,Agricultural development,Agricultural land,Agro-forestry,Biodiversity,Biosecurity,Community management,Ex-situ conservation,Governance,Indigenous peoples,Public participation,Smallholders/peasants,Sustainable development,Sustainable use,Access and benefit-sharing,Management/conservation,Protected area,Biosphere reserves,PIC-prior informed consent

Policy: Rural Development (Enforcement) (England) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 75 of 2007).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement Community legislation that requires member states to adopt legislative and administrative provisions to ensure that the Community’s financial interests in relation to expenditure on rural development are effectively protected. They, among other things, give powers of entry and inspection to persons authorized by the Secretary of State, the Forestry Commission, Natural England or a Regional Development Agency, for purposes relating to rural development commitments. They also provide for continuation of commitments in case of transfer of land to which the commitment relates.

Policy: Directive No. 9 of 2007 of President of Estonia on Rules of Procedure of Roundtable on Local Government and Regional Development
Policy_Content: This Directive approves the rules of procedure of the Roundtable on Local Government and Regional Development which is an advisory body to the President of Estonia. The functions of the roundtable are: to promote opportunities for cooperation between state and local government in strengthening statehood, developing democracy and supporting civic society; and to develop recommendations to the President in matters pertaining to local government and regional development through the exchange of views between representatives of local government units. Participants in the roundtable shall include representatives from county local government associations, the Association of Rural Municipalities of Estonia and the Association of Estonian Cities. The representatives shall be appointed by the association for each roundtable, as well as other persons invited to take part in the President’s roundtable.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Decreto Nº 1/07 - Reglamento de Áreas Protegidas de Nicaragua.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto reglamenta la Ley General del medio ambiente y los recursos naturales en lo que respecta al manejo de las áreas protegidas del país. En primer lugar, el Decreto define las atribuciones de las distintas autoridades competentes. Asimismo, define el procedimiento para la declaración de nuevas áreas protegidas, según las diferentes categorías existentes, a saber: a) reserva biológica; b) parque nacional; c) monumento nacional; d) monumento histórico; e) refugio de vida silvestre; f) reserva de recursos genéticos; g) reserva natural; h) paisaje terrestre y/o marino protegido; i) reservas de la biosfera. Las restantes disposiciones se refieren al otorgamiento de permisos ambientales y autorizaciones de actividades en áreas protegidas. El Decreto prohíbe la titulación de tierras de dominio público dentro de las áreas protegidas (art. 68). Por último, establece las sanciones aplicables en caso de infracción (arts. 77-85).
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Ley Nº 6.841 - Conservación y uso múltiple de las áreas forestales de la Provincia de Santiago del Estero.

Están contemplados por el régimen establecido en estas disposiciones todos los bosques existentes en el territorio provincial, naturales o implantados, así como las áreas forestales de propiedad privada o pública, sus frutos, productos y servicios ambientales. A efectos de esta Ley, las áreas forestales se clasifican en : a) especiales; b) protectoras; c) permanentes ; d) experimentales; e) de uso múltiple.

Policy: Décret nº 2007-18 pris pour l’application de l’ordonnance n° 2005-1527 relative au permis de construire et aux autorisations d'urbanisme.
Policy_Content: Le régime des autorisations d'urbanisme organisé par le code de l'urbanisme fait l'objet d’une réforme qui vise: à clarifier le droit de l'urbanisme, en réduisant le nombre des autorisations et en précisant leur champ d'application; à simplifier les procédures et à améliorer la sécurité juridique pour les collectivités et les citoyens. Les principales mesures envisagées prévoient: un regroupement des multiples régimes d'autorisation existants, en trois permis (permis de construire, permis d'aménager et permis de démolir) et une déclaration préalable; une définition précise du champ d'application de chaque procédure; une amélioration de la sécurité juridique, des conditions d'instruction des demandes et la garantie du respect des délais; une simplification du contrôle de la conformité des travaux et une meilleure prise en compte de la qualité de l'urbanisme et de l'architecture. Le présent décret modifie la partie réglementaire du code de l'urbanisme.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Décret n° 2007-30 relatif à la valorisation des produits agricoles, forestiers ou alimentaires et des produits de la mer.
Policy_Content: L'article 73 de la loi n° 2006-11 du 5 janvier 2006 d'orientation agricole a posé les principes de la réorganisation du dispositif français de valorisation des produits agricoles, forestiers ou alimentaires. En particulier, la loi sépare en trois catégories distinctes les modes officiels de valorisation de ces produits: - les signes d'identification de la qualité et de l'origine (label rouge, appellation d'origine, indication géographique protégée, spécialité traditionnelle garantie, agriculture biologique); - les mentions valorisantes (« montagne », « fermier », « produits pays », « vin de pays »); - la démarche de certification des produits. La loi met également en place un nouvel établissement public administratif, l'Institut national de l'origine et de la qualité (INAO), chargé de la gestion de l'ensemble des signes d'identification de la qualité et de l'origine.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Keyword: Agricultural commodities,Agricultural development,Certification,Classification/declassification,Institution,Food quality control/food safety,Viticulture/oenological practices

Policy: Law No.ZRU-76 regulating non-governmental organizations.
Policy_Content: The Act regulates the activity of non-governmental non-commercial organizations, ensures legal protection and state support thereof. It consists of five Chapters divided into 18 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) basic guarantees; (3) protection of legal interests; (4) state support; (5) conclusive provisions. Non-governmental non-commercial shall be applicable to all non-governmental entities carrying out the activities authorized by law in accordance with their statute. The state shall ensure the right of access to, study, distribution and storage of information and to submit request of information to the governmental bodies. The officials must provide non-governmental non-commercial organizations with legislative information, official documentation and decisions pertaining to the sphere of activity thereof. Intellectual rights of the non-governmental non-commercial organizations shall be protected by law. The state can support non-governmental non-commercial organizations by subsidies.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Decreto Nº 2187 - Delimita la Zona Intangible Tagaeri Taromenane (ZITT).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto delimita la Zona Intangible de Conservación Tagaeri Taromenane (ZITT) en las tierra de habitación y desarrollo de los grupos Huaorani, conocidos como Tagaeri Taromenane, y otros eventuales que permanecen sin contacto, ubicadas hacia el sur del Parque Nacional Yasuní (PNY). Dentro de la Zona Intangible Tagaeri Taromenane se garantizará y respetará el derecho del pueblo Huaorani y de los pueblos ancestrales en aislamiento voluntario a realizar sus tradicionales actividades de caza y pesca, así como el uso habitual de los recursos de la biodiversidad con propósitos de subsistencia; así como actividades de turismo moderado y controlado, bajo un sistema de restricción y de bajo impacto.

Policy: National Disaster Management Act (Cap. 20.38).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for an effective mechanism to prevent disasters and to respond to the occurrence of disasters in Tuvalu. It establishes the National Disaster Committee, the National Disaster Management Office and, for each Island, an Island Disaster Committee. It also assigns functions to the Minister responsible to the Cabinet for all disaster-related matters. The Committee shall, among other things, advise the Government and coordinate activities of government and non-government agencies. The Office shall be the executive agency of the Committee. It shall draw up a National Disaster Plan which shall be submitted to the Cabinet for approval. A state of emergency must be declared by the Head of State.

Policy: Decision of the State Council on Amending the Interim Regulations of the People's Republic of China on City and Town Land Use Tax.
Policy_Content: The State Council decided to amend the Interim Regulations of the People's Republic of China on Urban and Township Land Use Tax. The main amendments include: 1. Add one paragraph in Article 2 : The units and individuals using land within the scope of cities, county seats, administrative towns, industrial and mining areas shall be payers of urban and town land use tax (hereinafter referred to as land use tax) and shall pay land use tax in accordance with the provisions of these Regulations. The term "units" mentioned in the preceding paragraph includes State-owned enterprises, collective enterprises, private enterprises, joint-stock enterprises, foreign- invested enterprises, foreign enterprises and other enterprises, as well as institutions, public organizations, State organs, military forces and other units; and the term "individuals" mentioned in the preceding paragraph includes individual industrial and commercial households and other individuals.

Policy: Loi nº 2006-1772 du 30 décembre 2006 sur l'eau et les milieux aquatiques.
Policy_Content: La directive cadre européenne du 23 octobre 2000 établit un cadre pour une politique communautaire dans le domaine de l’eau. L’information et la participation du public doivent être assurées à toutes les étapes de mise en oeuvre des dispositions de la directive. Afin d'améliorer la gestion de l'eau et d'atteindre l'objectif de bon état écologique des eaux fixé par la directive pour 2015, la loi propose des réformes réparties en 102 articles et divisées en cinq titres respectivement consacrés: - à la préservation des ressources en eau et des milieux aquatiques (Ier); - à l'alimentation en eau et à l'assainissement (II); - à la préservation du domaine public fluvial (III) ; - à la planification et à la gouvernance (IV); - à des dispositions finales et transitoires (V). Les objectifs principaux de la loi sont de: donner les outils à l’administration, aux collectivités territoriales et aux acteurs de l’eau en général pour reconquérir la qualité des eaux et retrouver une meilleure adéquation entre ressources en eau et besoins dans une perspective de développement durable des activités économiques utilisatrices d’eau et en favorisant le dialogue au plus près du terrain; donner aux collectivités territoriales les moyens d’adapter les services publics d’eau potable et d’assainissement aux nouveaux enjeux en terme de transparence vis à vis des usagers, de solidarité en faveur des plus démunis et d’efficacité environnementale. Parallèlement cette loi permet d’atteindre d’autres objectifs et notamment moderniser l’organisation des structures fédératives de la pêche en eau douce.
Subject: Land & soil, Water

Policy: Microfinance Act (Cap. 493D).
Policy_Content: This Act regulates “microfinance business” i.e. the business of: (a) receiving money, by way of deposits or interest on deposits, which is lent to others or used to finance the business; or (b) providing loans or other facilities to micro or small enterprises and low income households. In particular the Act: defines the qualifications for carrying out deposit-taking microfinance business; provides for inspection of microfinance business by the Central Bank; provides rules of governance for microfinance businesses; and provides for protection of deposits.  A deposit-taking microfinance institution licensed under this Act shall not purchase or otherwise acquire any land except as may be reasonably necessary for the purpose of expanding the deposit-taking business.

Policy: Arrêté du 29 décembre 2006 relatif au système national d’inventaires des émissions de polluants atmosphériques.
Policy_Content: Le ministre chargé de l’environnement (direction de la prévention des pollutions et des risques) assure la mise en place et le suivi d’un système national d’inventaires des émissions de polluants atmosphériques (SNIEPA). Ce système national d’inventaires permet à la France d’estimer les émissions des principaux polluants atmosphériques par les différents secteurs d’activité, et en particulier les émissions anthropiques de gaz à effet de serre par les sources et l’absorption de dioxyde de carbone par les puits en application du protocole de Kyoto à la convention-cadre des Nations unies sur les changements climatiques. Le système national d’inventaires est organisé en vue d’assurer la cohérence des résultats vis-à-vis de toutes les applications susceptibles d’utiliser ces données, en particulier celles permettant de répondre aux obligations résultant des directives et décisions européennes ainsi que des conventions internationales et de leurs protocoles.

Policy: Act on Support for Rural Development.
Policy_Content: This Act provides for support granted for rural development that is funded by the Community and corresponding national funds or entirely by national funds. Its objectives are to enhance diversity the economic activities in the rural areas, to improve the operating conditions and competitiveness of rural enterprises, to promote the competitiveness of agricultural products and to improve the quality of life of rural residents, in compliance with the principles of sustainable development. The Act does not apply to support or compensation granted to an operator engaged in agriculture for agricultural production activity, giving up agriculture or improving the structure of agriculture or to support funded under the structural funds of the European Community or the European Fisheries Fund. The Act, among other things: sets out the general conditions for granting the support; provides with respect to support for enterprises and projects; provides for follow-up on support. Support is related in certain circumstances to protection of the environment.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Keyword: Agricultural development,Subsidy/incentive,Less favoured areas,Ecological production/organic production,Basic legislation

Policy: Federal Law No. 264-FZ on agricultural development.
Policy_Content: The Federal Law governs relations between the agricultural producers on the one hand and natural and legal persons, and also the state executive bodies on the other hand in the sphere of agricultural development. Agricultural development shall be intended economic activity for the purpose of agricultural production with the aim of supply of the national foodstuffs, agricultural raw materials and the development of rural settlements. The following categories shall be recognized agricultural producers: (a) producers and traders of agricultural commodities with the annual revenue of the aforesaid commodities in the total turnover of no less that 70 percent; (b) natural persons engaged in subsidiary small-holding; (c) agricultural consumer cooperatives; (d) peasant farms. The main guidelines of the state support policy shall be: (a) access to credits; (b) pedigree stockbreeding; (c) high quality seed growing; (d) animal production; (f) soil fertility. The state shall ensure equal access of the agricultural producers to credits given by the Russian lending agencies and agricultural consumer lending cooperatives.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Regional Law No. 104-RZ “On Civic Chamber”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that Civic Chamber must ensure coordination between citizens, social associations, state bodies and local government, promotion of civil society institutions, and consideration of the interests of the population in the process of elaboration and realization of state policy, protection of rights and freedoms of citizens. Civic Chamber shall be set up to ensure open and transparent discussion of the most important problems of social development, promotion of civil society institutions and democratic principles of the functioning of state bodies. Civic Chamber shall perform the following tasks: (a) involvement of citizens and associations thereof into formation and implementation of state policy; (b) support of civil initiatives aimed at realization of the constitutional rights of citizens; (c) performance of public expertise of federal legislation of joint competence (federal and regional); (d) exercise of public control over local government bodies; (e) advancement of civil initiatives and elaboration of programs for the development of civil society.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen., Land & soil, Water

Policy: Regional Law No. 148-OZ “On regulation of some forest and water issues”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes plenary powers of the regional administration in relation to water management, protection of waterbodies, application of water charges, monitoring of waterbodies, navigation and reservation of potable water sources. It also establishes exceptional cases of timber extraction as a result of forest fires, windfall and damages of forests by pests and diseases, and also in cases of natural and technological disasters. This Regional Law establishes modalities and rates of timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs for housing construction, repairs of housing facilities and heating of residential facilities.

Policy: Drainage and Irrigation Act (Cap. 64:03).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment of the National Drainage and Irrigation Authority as a body corporate, defines its powers and prescribes its duties with regard to matters of water resources management and policy in Guyana. The Authority shall be responsible for, among other things, managing and operating irrigation and drainage systems and shall develop irrigation and drainage and environmental norms and standards. The Board of the Authority shall, among other things, keep under review the national drainage and irrigation policy, encourage and support the establishment of water users' associations and farmers' associations, develop institutional capacity, encourage private sector participation, ensure coordination between plans and programmes. The Act also provides for delegation by the Authority of functions to water users' associations and farmers' association and participation by such associations in planning, design, operation etc. of irrigation and drainage systems.

Policy: Order No. D1-624 of the Minister of Environment validating environmental monitoring provisions.
Policy_Content: The Minister orders that State Environmental Monitoring Instruction shall regulate the content of the state environmental monitoring program, the procedure for its preparation, coordination, implementation, progress of state environmental monitoring, data storage and release thereof. It shall be mandatory for all state environmental monitoring and control entities supplying environmental monitoring information and data to legal and natural persons. The objectives of state environmental monitoring program shall be as follows: (a) quality assessment of natural environment for the formulation of common environmental strategy and environmental policy; (b) overall evaluation of environmental situation; (c) orientation towards the National Strategy for Sustainable Development; and (d) implementation of the international obligations of Lithuania related to environmental observations, analysis and forecast. Time period of the program shall be 3-6 years. State environmental monitoring data and information shall be stored in state environmental institutions information systems or databases.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Loi n° 2006/012 du 29 décembre 2006 fixant le régime général des contrats de partenariat.
Policy_Content: La présente loi fixe le régime général des contrats de partenariat. En effet, le contrat de partenariat est un contrat par lequel l’Etat ou l’un de ses démembrements confie à un tiers, pour une période déterminée, en fonction de la durée d’amortissement des investissements ou des modalités de financements retenues, la responsabilité de tout ou partie des phases suivantes d’un projet d’investissement: la conception des ouvrages ou équipements nécessaires au service public; le financement; la construction; la transformation des ouvrages ou équipements; l’entretien ou la maintenance; l’exploitation ou la gestion.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 756 on some issues related to the competence of the Ministry of Emergency Situations.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree establishes that the Ministry of Emergency Situations is the national state governing body that regulates and manages prevention and mitigation of the consequences of natural and man-made emergency situations and civil defense, fire, industrial, nuclear and radiation safety, liquidation of the consequences of the Chernobyl disaster, creation and maintenance of state and mobilization material reserves, as well as safety of navigation of small-size vessels in the internal waterways. The Ministry of Emergency Situations shall perform the following functions: (a) state control (supervision), issuance of authorization (permits) and other special functions in the field of protection of the population and territory against natural and man-made (technological) disasters; (b) coordination of national state governing bodies, local government, executive bodies and organization in the field of protection of the population and territory against natural and man-made (technological) disasters; (c) organization  of measures and arrangements in the field of mitigation of the consequences of natural and man-made (technological) disasters; and (d) ensuring the functioning of early warning and emergency intervention system.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Institution,Disasters,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Radiation,Navigation,Local government
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Order No. 114 of 2006 of Minister of Energy of Georgia on Natural Gas Market Rules
Policy_Content: The Natural Gas Market Rules (the Rules) determine technical, commercial and financial relations in the purchase and sale and transmission of natural gas, including reliability standards and the rules for preparing and implementing natural gas balances. The Rules shall be binding for all persons who purchase, sell, transport, supply, distribute and/or consume natural gas according to the Rules established in the territory of Georgia. The Rules regulate relations between natural gas suppliers, transmission and distribution licensees and direct consumers of natural gas. These Rules and contracts concluded in compliance with them shall be the basic legal documents for licensees, suppliers and direct consumers which establish their rights and obligations. The relations between natural gas suppliers, transmission and/or distribution licensees and direct consumers shall be regulated according to these Rules and the principles of equality and expression of free will prescribed by the legislation of Georgia (except where the suppliers and/or the licensees dominate the market). Unless otherwise provided for by legislation, suppliers and/or licensees shall be prohibited from terminating or reducing natural gas supply, except for the cases provided for by these Rules. Suppliers, licensees and direct consumers in the natural gas sector shall be obliged to comply with the provisions set forth in these Rules. The imposition of obligations that do not comply with these Rules shall be prohibited. In order to improve the balancing of natural gas supply and consumption, reliability standards, determination of representative powers, safety of purchase and sale transactions, payment and other types of relationships, the participants of the purchase and sale and transmission of natural gas may conclude (bilateral or multilateral) agreements. Anyone may join these agreements to undertake and enjoy the rights and obligations provided therein. Any person may, if his/her rights are infringed, request from the infringer compensation for damages incurred by violation of the rights guaranteed by these Rules or by non-performance of the obligations imposed under these Rules. The terms used in these Rules shall have the same meaning as in the Law of Georgia on Electric Energy and Natural Gas.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy: Law of Georgia on Social Assistance (No. 4289-RS of 2006)
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law is to provide fair, targeted and effective assistance to people by developing a regulated system of social assistance. This Law regulates relations related to social assistance, defines administrative bodies authorised in the field of social assistance and determines types and fundamental principles for the allocation of social assistance on the territory of Georgia. This Law applies to persons who are in need of special care and are lawful residents of Georgia, and to deprived families and homeless persons, unless otherwise provided for by this Law. Basic principles of this Law are: (a) recognition of social assistance as state support based on a needs assessment, rather than an unconditional right ensured by law; (b) targeted distribution of appropriate resources through a system of social assistance to persons in need of special care, deprived families and homeless persons ; and (c) facilitation of the development of alternative types of social service. The types of social assistance are: (a) a living allowance; (b) a reintegration allowance; (c) an allowance for foster care; (d) an allowance for family care of a person of full legal age; (e) non-monetary social assistance; and (f) a social package.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition, General
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, Eastern Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Western Asia

Policy: Ley Nº 496/06 - Crea la Secretaría de Estado de Economía, Planificación y Desarrollo.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley crea la Secretaría de Estado de Economía, Planificación y Desarrollo, que tiene la finalidad de conducir y coordinar el proceso de formulación, gestión, seguimiento y evaluación de las políticas macroeconómicas y de desarrollo sostenible. La Secretaria de Estado de Economía, Planificación y Desarrollo podra crear dependencias desconcentradas territorialmente para el cumplimiento de sus objetivos. La Direccion General de Ordenamiento y Desarrollo Territorial es responsable de la ordenación y la formulación de políticas públicas de desarrollo sostenible en el territorio, como expresión espacial de la política económica, social, ambiental y cultural de la sociedad. Tiene la responsabilidad de la coordinación intersectorial e interinstitucional, entre los diferentes niveles de administración pública y los entes privados a nivel municipal, provincial, regional y sectorial que inciden en el diseño, formulación, implementación, gestión y evaluación, de la ordenación urbana, rural y calificación de usos de suelo.
