Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1736 implementing Presidential Decree No. 671 on certain aspects of expropriation and allotment of land.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree sets forth the procedure for carrying out tenders for land lease contracts for construction following a local decision authorizing the expropriation and allotment of land. Any legal person, individual entrepreneur or foreign legal person shall be authorized to participate in the tender. Damages resulting from the expropriation of land shall be compensated; amounts shall be based on: (a) the value of removed buildings and constructions; (b) removal cost; (c) losses due to the restriction of landowners’ and tenants’ rights; and (d) lost profits.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Ministerial Decree enters into force on 1 January 2007.

Policy: Resolution No. 316 of 28 December 2006 laying down requirements and conditions for the importation, exportation, circulation and production of chemical, biological and organic materials and preparations for agricultural sectors.
Policy_Content: The aim of this Resolution is to regulate the importation, exportation, circulation and production of chemical, biological and organic materials and preparations for agricultural sectors. It is composed of 28 articles. Article 1 imposes on exporters, importers and producers of chemical, biological and organic materials and preparations for the use in agricultural sectors to obtain previous licences from the Ministry of Agriculture and Agrarian Reform. Article 2 limits licences to veterinarians and agrarian engineers. Article 3 prohibits the sale of chemical and biological preparations and materials intended to animal, poultry, fish and aquatic livings in shops and places authorized to sell pesticides, insecticides and the like. Articles 4 to 27 deal with the following matters: requirements and conditions for the obtainment of licences; applications and necessary documents and certificates; obligations of applicants; technical labels; renew and revocation of licences; registers; control and inspection on these activities; liabilities; and, technical requirements and conditions for the establishment of installations and industries producers of pesticides and insecticides.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Decree No. 79 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on registration of plant species.
Policy_Content: This Decree sets forth the procedure for registration of plant species growing on agricultural land of horticulture and gardening cooperatives, protected areas, healthcare, recreational areas, land of historical and cultural heritage and land of public water fund. In particular it shall be applicable to floriculture, greenery, wild flora species (trees and shrubbery), recreational forest (forest species and shrubbery). The scope of Decree shall be sanitary trees trimming and keeping vegetation with a view of extension, development and reforestation of land areas. Registration of plant species shall pertain to the competence of local government.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 589 validating the Statute of the Ministry of Economic Development and Trade.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes that the Ministry of Economic Development and Trade is a central executive body participation in the implementation of state policy in all socio-economic sectors, concepts, short-term, medium-term and long-term strategies, programs and forecasts of socio-economic development and poverty reduction.  The Ministry shall perform the following functions: (a) analysis and assessment of current economic situation; (b) improvement of statistical data collection and reporting; (c) drafts and prepares proposals for organization of trade; and (e) conducts marketing research with a view of promoting national commodities on internal and external markets.

Policy: Ley Nº 26.190 - Régimen de fomento nacional para el uso de fuentes renovables de energía destinada a la producción de energía eléctrica.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley introduce el régimen de fomento nacional para el uso de fuentes renovables de energía para la producción de energía eléctrica y su respectivo régimen de inversiones. Establece como objetivo lograr una contribución de las fuentes de energía renovables hasta alcanzar el ocho por ciento del  consumo de energía eléctrica nacional, en el plazo de diez años a partir de la puesta en vigencia del régimen. El Poder Ejecutivo Nacional se encargará de elaborar, en coordinación con las jurisdicciones provinciales, un Programa Federal para el Desarrollo de las Energías Renovables.

Policy: Guideline No. 6 approving the methodology of the Environmental Impact Assessment.

According to it, persons concerned must transmit an official communication relating to the project to the competent environmental bodies and the local government. The Regional Environmental Agency shall make available this Guideline and its annexes and shall assist the applicant in their completion. Upon examination of the submitted information, the Agency decides whether the proposed activities are eligible for EIA or not.

Policy: Regional Law No. 136-RZ “On regulation of forest relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes plenary powers of regional state bodies in the sphere of forest relations.  State Council shall have the following plenary powers: (a) adoption of laws and bylaws in the sphere of forest relations; and (b) other plenary powers assigned to regional legislative bodies. Governor shall have the authority to validate regional forest plans. Regional Government shall have plenary powers in the following spheres: (a) ownership and management of public forest parcels; (b) validation of rates of payment for forest resources and taxes for forest parcels; (c) timber extraction fees applicable to public forest; (d) application of forest use restrictions; and (e) conclusion of purchase and sale contracts of forest species located in public forests.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Law No. 13.916 creating the State Fund to Fight and Eradicate Poverty (FECEP/SC).
Policy_Content: This Law creates the State Fund to Fight and Eradicate Poverty (FECEP/SC). This FECEP/SC, according to art. 82 of the Transitional Constitutional Provisions Act of the Federal Constitution, aims at making all the Santa Catarina State population accessible to decent levels of subsistence. The resources of FECEP/SC will be applied through: carrying out supplementary actions of nutrition, housing, education and health; strengthening family income; and other programmes of relevant social interest, aimed at improving the quality of life; maintenance and financing of the Fund itself, including the payment of personnel expenses and social charges. These resources may also be used for financing projects carried out in partnership with the Union, other states or municipalities, private entities and other institutions, provided that they are directed towards the said purposes.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Regional Decree No. 338 validating Model Regulations on protected natural areas of regional significance.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree validates regulations on regional ethno-natural parks, nature monuments, forest genetic reserves and natural heritage monuments. Ethno-natural parks shall be considered protected natural areas of regional significance, having a special environmental, scientific, cultural, aesthetic, recreational and healthcare value created with the aim of preserving natural complex sites, spiritual and material culture of local population and intended for environmental, historical and cultural education of the people and tourism. Nature monuments shall be considered protected natural areas of regional significance, within the borders of which there are unique natural complexes and objects, including separate natural objects (single trees, groves, forests, rivers, swamps, springs, islands, geological sections, caverns, cult natural sites, places of sacrifice), which are of scientific, cultural and aesthetic value. Forest genetic reserves shall be considered protected natural areas of regional significance consisting of areas of natural forests or forest plantations, unique or typical by their phytocenotic, silvicultural and forest growth indicators for a given natural and climatic region, on which the valuable in genetic and selection relation part of populations of forest species. Natural heritage monuments shall be considered protected natural areas of regional significance with unique natural formations of various historical epochs and periods, of great scientific interest, as well as natural areas (localities) associated with historical events and personalities.
Subject: Environment gen., Forestry
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

En virtud de lo establecido por esta nueva disposición, queda además prohibido recibir caña de azúcar quemada y cosechada con máquinas integrales.

Policy: Decision No. 8 of the Supreme Court on the application by courts of the legislation on expropriation of land for public purposes.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Decision is to provide for the uniform application of legislation on the expropriation, including acquisition, of land from landowners and tenants for public purposes. The Supreme Court holds that local executive bodies shall bring lawsuits related to land expropriation for public purposes only in cases where the landowner or tenant dispute a decision on land expropriation, or dispute the price in cases of compulsory land acquisition.

Policy: Anti-corruption Law No.39 of 2006.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 48 articles divided in V Chapters aims to  (i) establish an independent National Authority with legal Anti-Corruption authorization; (ii) prevent and combat to corruption, ward off its risks, pursue its committers, seize and retrieve proceeds yielded corruption; (iii) promote the concept of cooperation and partnership with other countries and international organizations to prevent corruption; (iv) promote honesty and transparency in economic, financial and administrative dealings so that to achieve good governance and best use of public property and resources; (v) enforce accountability basis, enhance the controlling role of organizations concerned, and facilitate the access by community members to information; (vi) encourage civil society organizations to effectively participate in preventing and combating corruption, and raising awareness of community about how to prevent it, and expanding the knowledge of Anti-Corruption practices. Article 5 establishes the National Supreme Anti-Corruption Authority, responsible for developing and approving Anti-Corruption policies, plans and programs, and clarifying its regulations. Other main tasks of the Authority are (i) taking measures necessary to involve local communities and civil society organizations in campaigning against corruption’s risks and impacts on community; (ii) evaluating regulations relating to combating corruption, and suggesting amendments to make them in line with international conventions to which Yemen is a signatory; (iii) receiving reports and complaints about corruption crimes and studying, investigating and dealing with them; (iv) receiving financial disclosure documents; (v) investigations with corruption committers; (vi) coordinating and cooperating with other countries and international organizations relating to combating corruption, and participating in international Anti-Corruption programs; (vii) coordinating with media organizations in raising awareness of community against corruption’s risks and impacts, and about how to prevent it; (viii) establishing databases and info systems, and exchanging info with organizations concerned with corruption issues, local and international; (ix) taking measures to retrieve funds and proceeds yielded by corruption crimes; (x) taking legal actions and measures to invalidate any contracts in which the country is part of, or revocation of concessions or any other relation if proven to be violating prevailing laws or causing disadvantages to the public; and (xi) quarterly reporting to the parliament and President. The Authority will be run through an 11-member Board of Trustees. The Authority will have an Executive body responsible for technical, administrative and financial system whose divisions and tasks will be defined by the Authority’s Constitution.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Law No. 62 of 24 December 2006 considering desert lands (Albadeya) as a private State property.
Policy_Content: This Law is composed of 13 articles. Article 1 decrees desert lands a private State property. Article 2 deals with the following matters: appropriation of desert lands before the issuance of this Law shall not considered an acquired rights of disposal or decision nor compensation either real rights on these lands; all tribunals, judicial committees and cadastre judges shall abstain from examination, decision, valuation and judgment in complaints and denunciations related to desert lands (Albadeya); and, stopping registration of desert lands. Articles 3 and 4 deal with exceptions from provisions provided for in article 1. Article 5 prohibits the cultivation of un-irrigated lands of Albadeya, which its exploitation shall be intended, only to irrigation projects, afforestation and animal breeding. Article 6 allows the establishment farmer cooperatives for animal breeding and development of grasses. Article 8 contains offences and penalties.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Access right,Less favoured areas,Expropriation,Land tenure,Offences/penalties,Ownership,Public land,Right of use
Geographical_area: Mediterranean, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Western Asia

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 338 of 2006 concerning land offices, the Institute of Geodesy, Cartography and Remote Sensing, the Geographical Names Committee and detailed rules of real estate registration proceedings.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes that the competent authority for real estate issues is the countrywide network system of land offices (territorial and local offices). They are responsible for registration of legal transactions, cadastral mapping changes and dealing with land and other real estate property-related activities. The Hungarian Land Register is owned and maintained by the Ministry of Rural Development. This Decree establishes also the Institute of Geodesy, Cartography and Remote Sensing as the institutional body for land surveying and geo-information. The duties of land offices and the Institute of Geodesy, Cartography and Remote Sensing are of a multipurpose nature. They include: reference framing and mapping, and land and real estate property-related activities, in close correlation with the unified land registry; registration of legal changes to rights in land and real estate properties; maintenance of the digital land registry; maintenance of digital cadastral maps, quality control of cadastral mapping, a data service of legal and mapping information on properties at land offices, and supplying this data via to the electronic network; land lease registration; protection of agricultural land; digital elevation model services; maintenance of the geographical database; topographic mapping and services for referencing spatial data; maintenance of administrative boundaries (including the permanent state boundary); IT and mapping support of the EU agricultural subsidy system in Hungary, and so on. Land offices provide legal and cadastral mapping information, data and other services to external users and citizens generally for a fee. Annex 1 to this Decree determines the territorial competence of land offices.
Subject: Land & soil
Keyword: Access-to-information,Agricultural land,Cadastre/land registration,Institution,Legal proceedings/administrative proceedings,Survey/mapping,Urban land,Land tenure,Lease,Ownership,Registration,Right of use,Servitude
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries

Policy: Decree No. 347 of 2006 (XII. 23.) of the Government regarding the appointment of authorities responsible for environment protection, nature conservation and water management  activities.
Policy_Content: This Decree sets out the competences of state administration bodies with regard to environment protection, nature conservation and water management. The Minister of Rural Development supervises the National Inspectorate for Environmental and Nature Protection and Water Management and its local offices, the National Institute of Environmental Affairs and the National Park Directorate. The Minsiter of Interior controls the National Water Authority and its local offices. It appoints also the administrative authorities competent in each matter.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 28.984 - Régimen de incentivos a la producción de hidrocarburos.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto reglamenta el artículo 64 de la Ley de Hidrocarburos, el cual prevé el régimen de incentivos a la producción de hidrocarburos provenientes de campos marginales y pequeños. El Reglamento define los criterios y factores para determinar dichos incentivos, así como los procedimientos de pago de los mismos. Podrán beneficiar de los incentivos las personas naturales o jurídicas que suscriban contratos de operación con Yacimientos Petrolíferos Fiscales Bolivianos.

Policy: Promotion and Encouragement of Renewable Sources of Energy Use and Saving of Energy (Amendment) Law, 2006 (Law No. 162(Ι)/2006).
Policy_Content: This Law may be cited as the Promotion and Encouragement of Renewable Sources of Energy Use and Saving of Energy (Amendment) Law of 2006 and shall be read as one with the Promotion and Encouragement of Renewable Sources of Energy Use and Saving of Energy Laws of 2003-2005 (hereinafter referred to as “the principal Law”). The principal Law and the present Law shall be read as one and will be referred to as the Promotion and Encouragement of Renewable Sources of Energy Use and Saving of Energy Laws of 2003-2006. The present Law, carries forward amendments to the definitions contained in article 2 of the principal law. Moreover, a new article (No. 13) is being added, concerning the guaranteed access to transmission and distribution of electricity from renewable energy sources.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Ley Orgánica del Ambiente.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley Orgánica del Ambiente tiene por objeto establecer las disposiciones y los principios rectores para la gestión del ambiente, en el marco del desarrollo sustentable como derecho y deber fundamental del Estado y de la sociedad, para contribuir a la seguridad y al logro del máximo bienestar de la población y al sostenimiento del planeta, en interés de la humanidad. De igual forma, establece las normas que desarrollan las garantías y derechos constitucionales a un ambiente seguro, sano y ecológicamente equilibrado. A los efectos de la presente Ley, se entiende por gestión del ambiente el proceso constituido por un conjunto de acciones o medidas orientadas a diagnosticar, inventariar, restablecer, restaurar, mejorar, preservar, proteger, controlar, vigilar y aprovechar los ecosistemas, la diversidad biológica y demás recursos naturales y elementos del ambiente, en garantía del desarrollo sustentable.
Subject: Environment gen., Water, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Protection of environment,Framework law,Right to clean/healthy environment,Institution,Environmental planning,Ecosystem preservation,Soil conservation/soil improvement,Protected area,Pollution control,Protection of habitats,Monitoring,Education,EIA,Biosphere reserves,Air quality/air pollution,Research,Access-to-information,Soil pollution/quality,Environmental audit,Subsidy/incentive,Indigenous peoples,Human rights,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Sustainable development,Biodiversity

Policy: Décret concernant la protection des eaux contre la pollution par les nitrates à partir de sources agricoles (1).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret a pour objectif de protéger l'environnement en réduisant la pollution de l'eau provoquée par ou découlant de nitrates ou de phosphates de sources agricoles, en prévenant les pollutions de ce type, en contribuant à la mise en place d'un bon système d'écoulement des eaux et à la limitation de la pollution de l'air comme conséquence de la production et de l'utilisation d'engrais. Cet objectif est notamment visé par des dispositions concernant la production, la manipulation, l'utilisation, le traitement et la transformation des engrais, aussi bien dans le cadre des bonnes pratiques agricoles que dans un souci de qualité de l'eau et du sol. Le texte comprend 88 articles répartis en 13 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (I); La constatation d'eaux polluées et potentiellement polluées et la présence de zones vulnérables «eaux» (II); Mesures de l'annexe II et de l'annexe III de la directive sur les nitrates (III); La déclaration et le calcul de la production d'effluents d'élevage (IV), Le traitement du lisier (V); Possibilités de développement des entreprises (VI); Politiques par région (VII); Politique d'encadrement (VIII); Rapport de réalisation (IX) Groupe de travail technique éléments nutritionnels (X); Vente et transport des engrais (XI); Exécution (XII); Dispositions finales (XIII).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil, Water
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Décret portant création d'une identification commune d'agriculteurs, d'exploitations et de terres agricoles dans le cadre de la politique relative aux engrais et de la politique de l'agriculture.
Policy_Content: L’article 3 du décret susvisé établit que le gouvernement flamand est compétent pour l'identification et l'enregistrement dans le Système intégré de Gestion et de Contrôle (SIGC) des agriculteurs et pour l'identification et l'enregistrement des terres agricoles que l'agriculteur utilise par exploitation. Le Gouvernement flamand désigne au sein du domaine politique de l'Agriculture et de la Pêche marine l'instance compétente pour cette identification et cet enregistrement dans le SIGC des agriculteurs et des terres agricoles. Policy: Law No. 11.428 on the use and protection of Atlantic Forest Biome.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 51 articles divided into six Titles, regulates the use and protection of Atlantic Forest Biome. It aims at achieving the sustainable development and the protection of biodiversity, human health, landscape, water resources and social stability. Particular attention is paid to the following principles: socio-environmental function of the property, inter-generational equity, prevention, precaution and polluter-pays. The Law regulates the legal regime of Atlantic Forest Biome, providing a classification of the existing vegetation. Moreover, it creates a Fund for the Restoration of the Atlantic Forest Biome and regulates economic incentives for forest protection measures. The protection and use of the Atlantic Forest Biome will be carried out under conditions that ensure: the maintenance and recovery of the biodiversity, vegetation, fauna and water regime of the Atlantic Forest Biome for present and future generations; the stimulation of research, the diffusion of technologies for sustainable management of vegetation and a public awareness about the need for ecosystem preservation; promotion of public and private activities compatible with maintaining the ecological balance; control of rural and urban areas in order to harmonize economic growth with ecological balance.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Basic legislation,Policy/planning,Plant protection,Protection forest,Public forest,Classification/declassification,Special fund,Biodiversity

Policy: Environment Protection Act (No. 1189 of 2016).
Policy_Content: The purpose of the Act is to help protect the environment and to preserve animal and plant life. It applies to all activities in relation to pollution, such as deployment of solid, liquid or gaseous substances; air, water, noise, soil and subsoil pollution; husbandry, pests and other factors causing hygienic problems to the environment. The Administration of the Act must be focused on achievable and available techniques, processes and systems with the goal of preventing pollution through the implementation of cleaner technology.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Regulation No. 157 on conservation of Veikulåsen nature reserve, Gol Municipality, Buskerud.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Regulation is to preserve a virtually untouched nature area with its biological diversity in terms of habitats, ecosystems, species and natural ecological processes. The site has a special importance as a regional large wooded area with large topographical variations and has particular significance for fungal species associated with dead wood, with rich and distinctive lichen flora. The forest will eventually be able to develop large dimensions of dead wood.
